original: @84a # // rgya gar skad du /üîΩmadhy'a lam k'a ra panytsi k'a /
analyzed: @84a # // rgya gar skad du / madhy'a lam k'a ra panytsi k'a /
translated: In Sanskrit:üîΩMadhyamakalamkarapa√±jika

original: bod skad du dbu ma'i rgyan gyi dka' 'grel /
analyzed: bod skad du dbu ma'i rgyan gyi dka' 'grel /
translated: In Tibetan: dbu ma‚Äôi rgyan gyi dka‚Äô ‚Äôgrel

original: bam po dang po /
analyzed: bam po dang po /
translated: Volume One

original: 'jam dpa' gzhon nur gyur pa la phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: 'jam dpa' gzhon nur gyur pa la phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: Homage to the youthful Manjushri

original: gang zhig brtson 'grus mtshungs med pas //
analyzed: gang zhig brtson 'grus mtshungs med pas //
translated: He who, through incomparable diligence,

original: bdag gzhan phan pa phun sum tshogs //
analyzed: bdag gzhan phan pa phun sum tshogs //
translated: Has perfected the benefit of self and other,

original: mtha' dag pha rol phyin de la //
analyzed: mtha' dag pha rol phyin de la //
translated: To him, the one who has perfected the perfections,

original: phyag byas dbu ma'i rgyan dbye bya //
analyzed: phyag byas dbu ma'i rgyan dbye bya //
translated: I pay homage and open the ornament of the middle way.

original: yul yon tan dang ldan pa la dang ba ni legs pa thams cad thob par byed pa'i dang po'i rgyu yin pas yon tan phul du dbyung du med pa dpag tu med pa rin po che'i 'byung gnas bcom ldan 'das rnams la gzhan dag dang ba bskyed pa'i
analyzed: yul yon tan dang ldan pa la dang ba ni legs pa thams cad thob par byed pa'i dang po'i rgyu yin pas yon tan phul du dbyung du med pa dpag tu med pa rin po che'i 'byung gnas bcom ldan 'das rnams la gzhan dag dang ba bskyed pa'i
translated: Faith in the objects that possess good qualities is the primary cause for attaining all that is good. Therefore, in order to generate faith in others toward the Bhagavans, who are the inexhaustible source of precious, unsurpassed good qualities,

original: phyir re zhig dang po nyid du de dag la ji lta ba bzhin gyi yon tan brjod pa sngon du 'gro ba'i phyag 'tshal ba /
analyzed: phyir re zhig dang po nyid du de dag la ji lta ba bzhin gyi yon tan brjod pa sngon du 'gro ba'i phyag 'tshal ba /
translated: I first offer homage to them, preceded by an expression of their true good qualities.

original: gang dag ces bya ba smos te /
analyzed: gang dag ces bya ba smos te /
translated: I say ‚Äúthose who‚Äù and so on.

original: 'di ltar tshigs su bcad pa 'dis ni bcom ldan 'das kyi che ba'i yon tan bdag nyid phul du byung ba dang ldan pa ston par byed do //
analyzed: 'di ltar tshigs su bcad pa 'dis ni bcom ldan 'das kyi che ba'i yon tan bdag nyid phul du byung ba dang ldan pa ston par byed do //
translated: Thus, this verse shows that the Lord has the highest excellence of great qualities.

original: de thos nas kyang re zhig dad pas rjes su 'brang ba rnams ni de dag la the tshom med par dang ba myur du skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de thos nas kyang re zhig dad pas rjes su 'brang ba rnams ni de dag la the tshom med par dang ba myur du skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Having heard this, those who are followers through faith will quickly and without doubt generate clarity.

original: gang dag chos kyi rjes su 'brang ba de dag kyang de lta bu dag la gnod pa ma mthong zhing /
analyzed: gang dag chos kyi rjes su 'brang ba de dag kyang de lta bu dag la gnod pa ma mthong zhing /
translated: And those who are followers of reality will not see any harm in such a teaching.

original: shes rab la sogs pa yon tan rnams goms pas bye brag tu 'phags pa yang rtogs nas de lta bu'i mkhas pa dag ni gdon mi za bar srid do zhes nges par bzung nas de dag la dang ba skyed par byed pa nyid do //
analyzed: shes rab la sogs pa yon tan rnams goms pas bye brag tu 'phags pa yang rtogs nas de lta bu'i mkhas pa dag ni gdon mi za bar srid do zhes nges par bzung nas de dag la dang ba skyed par byed pa nyid do //
translated: Having understood that such wise people are certainly exalted due to their cultivation of such qualities as wisdom, they will generate clarity in such teachings.

original: de dag la dang ba'i phyir de dag gi yon tan 'dod pa rnams de dag gi gsung rab rnams dang / gsung rab dag la brten pa'i bstan bcos la gzung ba la sogs pa'i don du thog mar brtag pa sngon du 'gro ba'i gus pa byed do //
analyzed: de dag la dang ba'i phyir de dag gi yon tan 'dod pa rnams de dag gi gsung rab rnams dang / gsung rab dag la brten pa'i bstan bcos la gzung ba la sogs pa'i don du thog mar brtag pa sngon du 'gro ba'i gus pa byed do //
translated: Because of their faith in those qualities, those who desire those qualities first have respect for the scriptures of those teachers and for the treatises that depend on those scriptures, in order to grasp their meaning.

original: de'i 'og tu thos pa las byung ba la sogs pa'i shes rab skye ba'i rim gyis legs pa dam pa thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu thos pa las byung ba la sogs pa'i shes rab skye ba'i rim gyis legs pa dam pa thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: Then, in sequence, they generate the wisdom that arises from listening and so on and they attain the highest good.

original: de'i phyir yon tan dang ldan pa rnams la dang ba ni legs pa thams cad kyi gtso bo'i rgyu yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir yon tan dang ldan pa rnams la dang ba ni legs pa thams cad kyi gtso bo'i rgyu yin no //
translated: Therefore, faith in those who possess good qualities is the primary cause of all that is good.

original: de nyid kyi phyir de ni de la 'jug pa la yang yan lag yin pa'i phyir bstan bcos byed pa phal cher bstan bcos kyi dang por ston pa la mchod pa byed do //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir de ni de la 'jug pa la yang yan lag yin pa'i phyir bstan bcos byed pa phal cher bstan bcos kyi dang por ston pa la mchod pa byed do //
translated: For that very reason, since it is also a factor in engaging that path, most treatise authors pay homage to the Teacher at the beginning of their treatises.

original: de nyid kyi phyir bstan bcos byed par 'dod pas rang gi ston pa'i che ba'i bdag nyid shes @84b par bya ba'i phyir de la phyag 'tshal ba rtsom mo zhes bshad do //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir bstan bcos byed par 'dod pas rang gi ston pa'i che ba'i bdag nyid shes @84b par bya ba'i phyir de la phyag 'tshal ba rtsom mo zhes bshad do //
translated: Therefore, one who wishes to compose a treatise begins with a salutation in order to understand the greatness of his teacher.

original: de la gang dag su rnams sa la bzhugs pa de dag rnams la phyag 'tshal lo zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: de la gang dag su rnams sa la bzhugs pa de dag rnams la phyag 'tshal lo zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: Here, one should connect ‚ÄúI pay homage to those who dwell on the stages.‚Äù

original: 'di spyir smos pa yin du zin kyang sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kho na yin par mngon te /
analyzed: 'di spyir smos pa yin du zin kyang sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kho na yin par mngon te /
translated: Even though this is a general statement, it is clear that it refers to the Buddhas, the Blessed Ones,

original: gzhan dag la ni ji skad smos pa'i yon tan med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan dag la ni ji skad smos pa'i yon tan med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because others do not have the qualities mentioned.

original: de'i phyir bcom ldan 'das rnams la phyag 'tshal bar 'os pa nyid du bsgrub pa'i phyir ji lta ba bzhin gyi yon tan rjod par byed do //
analyzed: de'i phyir bcom ldan 'das rnams la phyag 'tshal bar 'os pa nyid du bsgrub pa'i phyir ji lta ba bzhin gyi yon tan rjod par byed do //
translated: Therefore, in order to establish that the Blessed Ones are worthy of homage, he mentions their qualities as they are.

original: yon tan de dag kyang rang dang gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa'i bye brag gis 'dir rnam pa gnyis su bstan to //
analyzed: yon tan de dag kyang rang dang gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa'i bye brag gis 'dir rnam pa gnyis su bstan to //
translated: Those qualities are taught here in two ways, according to the distinctions of the perfection of one‚Äôs own and others‚Äô goals.

original: rang gi don phun sum tshogs pa yang rgyu dang 'bras bu phun sum tshogs pa'i bye brag gis rnam pa gnyis so //
analyzed: rang gi don phun sum tshogs pa yang rgyu dang 'bras bu phun sum tshogs pa'i bye brag gis rnam pa gnyis so //
translated: The perfection of one's own aim is twofold, according to the distinction of cause and effect.

original: rgyu phun sum tshogs pa de yang nye ba dang ring ba'i rgyu'i bye brag gis rnam pa gnyis so //
analyzed: rgyu phun sum tshogs pa de yang nye ba dang ring ba'i rgyu'i bye brag gis rnam pa gnyis so //
translated: The perfection of the cause is twofold, according to the distinction of proximate and remote causes.

original: 'bras bu phun sum tshogs pa de yang ye shes dang spang ba phun sum tshogs pa'i bye brag gis rnam pa gnyis so //
analyzed: 'bras bu phun sum tshogs pa de yang ye shes dang spang ba phun sum tshogs pa'i bye brag gis rnam pa gnyis so //
translated: The perfection of the effect is twofold, according to the distinction of the perfection of intuition and the perfection of abandonment.

original: gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa yang gzhan dag nges par legs pa dang mngon par mtho ba 'thob pa'i bye brag gis rnam pa gnyis su gnas te /
analyzed: gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa yang gzhan dag nges par legs pa dang mngon par mtho ba 'thob pa'i bye brag gis rnam pa gnyis su gnas te /
translated: The perfection of the aim of others is twofold, according to the distinction of the attainment of definite goodness and of the high states.

original: 'di ni yan lag rnam par bshad pa nas sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ni yan lag rnam par bshad pa nas sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: This should be applied to the analysis of the members.

original: yon tan phun sum tshogs pa 'di mtha' dag ni bcom ldan 'das rnams phyi rol pa dang slob pa dang mi slob pa chen po rnams kyi bla na bzhugs pa nyid kyi gtan tshigs yin no //
analyzed: yon tan phun sum tshogs pa 'di mtha' dag ni bcom ldan 'das rnams phyi rol pa dang slob pa dang mi slob pa chen po rnams kyi bla na bzhugs pa nyid kyi gtan tshigs yin no //
translated: This entire perfection of virtue is the reason for the supremacy of the Transcendent Lords over the outsiders, the trainees, and the non-trainees.

original: de'i phyir de dag kho na dngos su phyag bya bar 'os pa yin gyi //
analyzed: de'i phyir de dag kho na dngos su phyag bya bar 'os pa yin gyi //
translated: Therefore, only they are worthy of actual homage.

original: gzhan dag ni ma yin no zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: gzhan dag ni ma yin no zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: Others are not.

original: yan lag gi don brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: yan lag gi don brjod par bya ste /
translated: The meaning of the component parts should be stated.

original: gang dag la dag brtan blo mnga' ba de dag la de skad ces bya ste /
analyzed: gang dag la dag brtan blo mnga' ba de dag la de skad ces bya ste /
translated: Those who possess pure minds are called that.

original: de la dag pa ni 'dod chags la sogs pa'i dri ma thams cad dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la dag pa ni 'dod chags la sogs pa'i dri ma thams cad dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Here, pure means free from all defilements such as attachment.

original: 'dis ni phyi rol pa'i 'dod chags dang bral ba rnams dang slob pa rnams las khyad par du ston par byed de /
analyzed: 'dis ni phyi rol pa'i 'dod chags dang bral ba rnams dang slob pa rnams las khyad par du ston par byed de /
translated: This shows the difference from nonBuddhists who are free from attachment and from those in training.

original: 'di ltar phyi rol pa kun nas nyon mongs pa'i rtsa ba'i bdag nyid phyin ci log mtha' dag dang ldan pa'i yid can 'dod chags la sogs pa'i 'ching ba mtha' dag nyams par ma byas pa thams cad ni dri ma med pa'i blo can dag tu ji ltar
analyzed: 'di ltar phyi rol pa kun nas nyon mongs pa'i rtsa ba'i bdag nyid phyin ci log mtha' dag dang ldan pa'i yid can 'dod chags la sogs pa'i 'ching ba mtha' dag nyams par ma byas pa thams cad ni dri ma med pa'i blo can dag tu ji ltar
translated: Thus, nonBuddhists have minds that possess all errors that are the root of defilement and they have not destroyed all bonds such as attachment. How can they be called those who possess pure minds?

original: 'gyur / slob pa bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i dri ma ma lus pas dri ma can du byas pa'i yid can @85a * //
analyzed: 'gyur / slob pa bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i dri ma ma lus pas dri ma can du byas pa'i yid can @85a * //
translated: The mind of a learner is stained by all the stains to be abandoned by the path of meditation.üîΩ

original: rnams kyang / dag pa'i blo can dag tu ji ltar rung //
analyzed: rnams kyang / dag pa'i blo can dag tu ji ltar rung //
translated: How can those whose minds are stained by all the impurities to be abandoned by the path of cultivation be called pure-minded?

original: brtan pa ni lus dang ngag dang blo'i mi mthun pa nyid kyi rgyu kun nas nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i bag chags kyi rlung gis mi bskyod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: brtan pa ni lus dang ngag dang blo'i mi mthun pa nyid kyi rgyu kun nas nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i bag chags kyi rlung gis mi bskyod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The steadfast are not shaken by the winds of the asravas, because they are not defiled by the latent impressions of the causes of the discordances of body, speech, and mind.

original: 'dis ni mi slob pa rnams las khyad par du ston par byed de /
analyzed: 'dis ni mi slob pa rnams las khyad par du ston par byed de /
translated: This shows their superiority over those who are not steadfast.

original: de dag gis de ma spangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag gis de ma spangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they have not abandoned those.

original: 'dis ni spangs pa phun sum tshogs pa yongs su bstan to //
analyzed: 'dis ni spangs pa phun sum tshogs pa yongs su bstan to //
translated: This shows the perfection of abandonment.

original: sa la bzhugs zhes bya ba ni 'gro ba'i don du zhes bya bar shugs kyis go bas na ma bshad do //
analyzed: sa la bzhugs zhes bya ba ni 'gro ba'i don du zhes bya bar shugs kyis go bas na ma bshad do //
translated: They dwell on the stages, but this is not mentioned because it is understood by implication that it is for the sake of the benefit of beings.

original: de lta ma yin na phun sum tshogs pa mtha' dag yang dag par thob pa bzhugs par mi rigs so //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na phun sum tshogs pa mtha' dag yang dag par thob pa bzhugs par mi rigs so //
translated: Otherwise, it would not be reasonable that they have attained all perfections.

original: 'dis ni gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa rnam pa gnyis ji skad du bshad pa bstan to //
analyzed: 'dis ni gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa rnam pa gnyis ji skad du bshad pa bstan to //
translated: This shows the two kinds of perfection of the aims of others, as previously explained.

original: ji ltar na de dag brtan blo mnga' bar 'gyur ce na /
analyzed: ji ltar na de dag brtan blo mnga' bar 'gyur ce na /
translated: How do they have firm intellects?

original: chos tshul zab mo zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: chos tshul zab mo zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: He says, ‚Äúin the profound way of the Dharma,‚Äù etc.

original: chos ni gzugs la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: chos ni gzugs la sogs pa'o //
translated: The Dharma is form, etc.

original: de dag gi tshul ni ji lta ba bzhin gnas pa'i ngo bo'o //
analyzed: de dag gi tshul ni ji lta ba bzhin gnas pa'i ngo bo'o //
translated: Its way is the nature of things as they are.

original: de yang dngos po'i rigs mthun pa dang mi mthun pa dpag tu med pa ldog pa la ltos pas bskyed pa tha dad pa nyid kyis tshad mar gzung bar mi nus pa'i phyir rgya mtsho dang 'dra ba yin no //
analyzed: de yang dngos po'i rigs mthun pa dang mi mthun pa dpag tu med pa ldog pa la ltos pas bskyed pa tha dad pa nyid kyis tshad mar gzung bar mi nus pa'i phyir rgya mtsho dang 'dra ba yin no //
translated: And that is like the ocean, because it is not possible to grasp it by means of a valid cognition that is generated by a different exclusion in regard to the infinite homogeneous and heterogeneous entities.

original: 'di ni nyan thos la sogs pas gting dpag dka' bas zab mo yang yin la chos tshul rgya mtsho lta bu yang yin pas zhes tshig rnam par sbyar te /
analyzed: 'di ni nyan thos la sogs pas gting dpag dka' bas zab mo yang yin la chos tshul rgya mtsho lta bu yang yin pas zhes tshig rnam par sbyar te /
translated: This is profound because it is difficult for the Sravakas, etc. to fathom its depth. It is also like an ocean, the way of the Dharma. Thus the words are to be combined.

original: gang dag gis de'i pha rol mtha' mthong ba de dag la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: gang dag gis de'i pha rol mtha' mthong ba de dag la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: Those who see its other shore are called ‚Äúthose who have seen the other shore.‚Äù

original: 'dis ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid kyi ye shes phun sum tshogs pa bstan to //
analyzed: 'dis ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid kyi ye shes phun sum tshogs pa bstan to //
translated: This shows the perfection of the knowledge which has the characteristic of omniscience.

original: de nyid nyon mongs pa bag chags dang bcas pa ma lus pa thams cad rtsa nas 'byin pa'i rgyu yin te /
analyzed: de nyid nyon mongs pa bag chags dang bcas pa ma lus pa thams cad rtsa nas 'byin pa'i rgyu yin te /
translated: That itself is the cause of the complete uprooting of all the afflictions along with their traces,

original: de med pas nyan thos la sogs pas bag chags ma spangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de med pas nyan thos la sogs pas bag chags ma spangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because without it, the Sravakas, etc., do not eliminate the traces.

original: ye shes phun sum tshogs pa yang yang dag pa'i kun rdzob kyi ngo bor bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi thams cad mkhyen pa nyid yin gyi /
analyzed: ye shes phun sum tshogs pa yang yang dag pa'i kun rdzob kyi ngo bor bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi thams cad mkhyen pa nyid yin gyi /
translated: The perfection of knowledge is the omniscience of the Lord in the nature of the correct conventional,

original: don dam pa'i ngo bo nyid du ni ma yin te /
analyzed: don dam pa'i ngo bo nyid du ni ma yin te /
translated: but not in the nature of the ultimate,

original: de lta bur thams cad ma skyes pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de lta bur thams cad ma skyes pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because in that way, everything is non-arisen.

original: thams cad mkhyen pa dag gi ye shes kyang ji ltar skye snyam pa la 'di la 'di'i rgyu bstan pa'i phyir lhag par mos pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa dag gi ye shes kyang ji ltar skye snyam pa la 'di la 'di'i rgyu bstan pa'i phyir lhag par mos pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: As for the knowledge of the omniscient ones, how does it arise? In order to show the cause of that here, he says, ‚Äúthe special resolve,‚Äù etc.

original: lhag par mos pa zhes bya ba'i sgra ni mos pas spyod pa'i sa nas bzung ste /
analyzed: lhag par mos pa zhes bya ba'i sgra ni mos pas spyod pa'i sa nas bzung ste /
translated: The term ‚Äúespecially‚Äù indicates that the bodhisattva grounds are the principal context for the perfection of wisdom.üîΩ

original: sa bcu ba'i bar yin par @85b 'dod de /
analyzed: sa bcu ba'i bar yin par @85b 'dod de /
translated: The word ‚Äúespecially‚Äù means that the stage of devoted engagement is the stage of devoted engagement, and so on up to the tenth stage.üîΩBecause it is distinguished by the superiority of devoted engagement, which is characterized by the certainty of the non-substantiality of all things in every way.üîΩOr else, it is called ‚Äúdevoted engagement‚Äù because it is the cause of all the stages, since it is the stage of devoted engagement, and so on up to the tenth stage.

original: thams cad du chos thams cad ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du nges par 'dzin pa'i mtshan nyid kyi mos pa lhag pa nyid kyis rab tu phye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thams cad du chos thams cad ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du nges par 'dzin pa'i mtshan nyid kyi mos pa lhag pa nyid kyis rab tu phye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Or else, it is called ‚Äúdevoted engagement‚Äù because it is the cause of all the stages, since it is the stage of devoted engagement, and so on up to the tenth stage.

original: yang na lhan cig spyod pa'i phyir rgyu'i gnas skabs thams cad rjod par byed do //
analyzed: yang na lhan cig spyod pa'i phyir rgyu'i gnas skabs thams cad rjod par byed do //
translated: Or else, it is called ‚Äúdevoted engagement‚Äù because it is the cause of all the stages, since it is the stage of devoted engagement, and so on up to the tenth stage.üîΩOr else, it is called ‚Äúdevoted engagement‚Äù because it is the cause of all the stages, since it is the stage of devoted engagement, and so on up to the tenth stage.üîΩOr else, it is called ‚Äúdevoted engagement‚Äù because it is the cause of all the stages, since it is the stage of devoted engagement, and so on up to the tenth stage.üîΩOr else, it is called ‚Äúdevoted engagement‚Äù because it is the cause of all the stages, since it is the stage of devoted engagement, and so on up to the tenth stage.

original: gang dag gis lhag par mos pa de la thos pa la sogs pa las byung ba'i shes rab skye ba'i rim gyis rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid nye bar bskyed pa'i phyir gong nas gong du 'du byed khyad par can bskyed pas yongs su bsgoms pa'i thugsüîΩmnga' ba de dag la de skad ces bya ste /
analyzed: gang dag gis lhag par mos pa de la thos pa la sogs pa las byung ba'i shes rab skye ba'i rim gyis rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid nye bar bskyed pa'i phyir gong nas gong du 'du byed khyad par can bskyed pas yongs su bsgoms pa'i thugs mnga' ba de dag la de skad ces bya ste /
translated: Or else, it is called ‚Äúdevoted engagement‚Äù because it is the cause of all the stages, since it is the stage of devoted engagement, and so on up to the tenth stage.

original: 'dis ni rgyu phun sum tshogs pa rnam pa gnyis ji skad du bshad pa bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dis ni rgyu phun sum tshogs pa rnam pa gnyis ji skad du bshad pa bstan pa yin no //
translated: Or else, it is called ‚Äúdevoted engagement‚Äù because it is the cause of all the stages, since it is the stage of devoted engagement, and so on up to the tenth stage.üîΩOr else, it is called ‚Äúdevoted engagement‚Äù because it is the cause of all the stages, since it is the stage of devoted engagement, and so on up to the tenth stage.üîΩOr else, it is called ‚Äúdevoted engagement‚Äù because it is the cause of all the stages, since it is the stage of devoted engagement, and so on up to the tenth stage.üîΩOr else, it is called ‚Äúdevoted engagement‚Äù because it is the cause of all the stages, since it is the stage of devoted engagement, and so on up to the tenth stage.

original: de yang thams cad mkhyen pa nyid skye ba'i rgyu yin pa 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi /
analyzed: de yang thams cad mkhyen pa nyid skye ba'i rgyu yin pa 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi /
translated: Moreover, the ten perfections are not only the cause of omniscience,

original: sgrub pa'i rgyu yang yin te sgrub pa phyin ci ma log par nan tan byed pa rnams de'i 'bras bu 'thob par nges pa'i phyir nad med par bsgrub pa nan tan byas pas nad med pa 'thob pa bzhin no //
analyzed: sgrub pa'i rgyu yang yin te sgrub pa phyin ci ma log par nan tan byed pa rnams de'i 'bras bu 'thob par nges pa'i phyir nad med par bsgrub pa nan tan byas pas nad med pa 'thob pa bzhin no //
translated: they are also the cause of its attainment, because those who practice the unmistaken means of attainment are certain to obtain its result, just as one who practices the means of attaining good health will obtain good health.

original: gang gi phyir de ltar de dag nyid rang dang gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa phul dbyung du med pa dang ldan pa de'i phyir de dag ni phyi rol pa dang slob pa dang mi slob pa chen po rnams kyi bla na bzhugs pa yin te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir de ltar de dag nyid rang dang gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa phul dbyung du med pa dang ldan pa de'i phyir de dag ni phyi rol pa dang slob pa dang mi slob pa chen po rnams kyi bla na bzhugs pa yin te /
translated: Because they alone possess the unsurpassed perfection of benefit for self and others, they are superior to the outsiders, the great trainees and the great adepts.

original: 'gro ba mtha' dag gi gtsug gi nor bu yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: 'gro ba mtha' dag gi gtsug gi nor bu yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: They are the crest jewels of all beings.

original: de'i phyir de dag kho na la phyag bya bar 'os pa yin gyi /
analyzed: de'i phyir de dag kho na la phyag bya bar 'os pa yin gyi /
translated: Therefore, they alone are worthy of homage.

original: gzhan dag la ni ma yin no zhes bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: gzhan dag la ni ma yin no zhes bshad pa yin no //
translated: Others are not.

original: rnam pa gcig tu 'jig rten na chen po nyid du 'dod pa ser skya dang gzegs zan la sogs pa'i yang bla na bzhugs pa nyid kyis khyad par du 'phags pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rnam pa gcig tu 'jig rten na chen po nyid du 'dod pa ser skya dang gzegs zan la sogs pa'i yang bla na bzhugs pa nyid kyis khyad par du 'phags pa'i phyir /
translated: In one sense, he is superior to even the great ones of the world, such as Kapila and Kanada, because he is superior to them.üîΩ

original: nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas dang / sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams la yang phyag 'tshal bar ston to //
analyzed: nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas dang / sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams la yang phyag 'tshal bar ston to //
translated: In one way, he pays homage to the ≈õrƒÅvakas, pratyekabuddhas, and bodhisattvas because he is superior to them by his exalted state, since he is considered the greatest in the world, and he is also the guru of Kapila, Ka·πáƒÅda, and so on.

original: de la dag brtan blo mnga' ba zhes bya ba 'dis ni nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas dang sangs rgyas rnams bstan te /
analyzed: de la dag brtan blo mnga' ba zhes bya ba 'dis ni nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas dang sangs rgyas rnams bstan te /
translated: Here, those who possess stable intelligence refers to the ≈õrƒÅvakas, pratyekabuddhas, and buddhas.

original: blo brtan pa nyid ni yongs su nyams pa'i rlung gis mi bskyod pa'i phyir te ;
analyzed: blo brtan pa nyid ni yongs su nyams pa'i rlung gis mi bskyod pa'i phyir te ;
translated: They have stable intelligence because they are not moved by the wind of complete degeneration.

original: dge slong dag 'phags pa'i shes rab kyis spangs pa gang yin pa de ni spangs pa yin no zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dge slong dag 'phags pa'i shes rab kyis spangs pa gang yin pa de ni spangs pa yin no zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Monks, that which is abandoned by the ƒÅrya‚Äôs wisdom is abandoned.

original: chos tshul zab mo rgya mtsho lta bu'i pha rol gzigs zhes bya ba 'dis ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams bstan te /
analyzed: chos tshul zab mo rgya mtsho lta bu'i pha rol gzigs zhes bya ba 'dis ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams bstan te /
translated: He sees the other shore of the profound Dharma way, which is like an ocean refers to the lord buddhas.

original: spyir bstan kyang gtso bo yin pa'i phyir @86a * //
analyzed: spyir bstan kyang gtso bo yin pa'i phyir @86a * //
translated: Although this is taught in general, it is the main point.üîΩ

original: logs shig tu bstan to //
analyzed: logs shig tu bstan to //
translated: Although it is taught in general, it is taught separately because it is the principal one.

original: gang dag ces bya ba ni re re la yang sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: gang dag ces bya ba ni re re la yang sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: Those who is to be applied to each one.

original: yang zhes bya ba zhig ni 'dir don gyis mngon pa'i phyir ma smos so //
analyzed: yang zhes bya ba zhig ni 'dir don gyis mngon pa'i phyir ma smos so //
translated: The word also is not mentioned here because it is understood by the meaning.

original: des na don ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: des na don ni 'di yin te /
translated: Therefore, this is the meaning:

original: gang dag su rnams chos tshul zab mo rgya mtsho lta bu'i pha rol gzigs pas la bzhugs pa de rnams la yang phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: gang dag su rnams chos tshul zab mo rgya mtsho lta bu'i pha rol gzigs pas la bzhugs pa de rnams la yang phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: I pay homage to those who, whoever they are, abide on the other shore of the ocean-like profound Dharma way.

original: de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' lhag par mos pa yongs su bsgoms pa'i thugs mnga' ba rnams la phyag 'tshal lo zhes bya bar sbyar ba yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' lhag par mos pa yongs su bsgoms pa'i thugs mnga' ba rnams la phyag 'tshal lo zhes bya bar sbyar ba yin te /
translated: Similarly, I pay homage to the bodhisattvas who have minds fully cultivated with superior aspiration.

original: 'dir yang yang gi don blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'dir yang yang gi don blta bar bya'o //
translated: Here, the meaning of also should be understood.

original: ci'i phyir 'di dag kho na la phyag bya bar brjod ce na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir 'di dag kho na la phyag bya bar brjod ce na /
translated: Why are only these ones said to be worthy of homage?

original: cher rnams kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: cher rnams kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: He says the great ones, etc.

original: gang gi phyir 'di dag kho na yon tan phun sum tshogs pa ji ltar bshad pa dang ldan pas phyi rol pa chen po nyid du 'dod pa rnams kyi bla na bzhugs pa de'i phyir 'di dag kho na la phyag 'tshal bar brjod do //
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'di dag kho na yon tan phun sum tshogs pa ji ltar bshad pa dang ldan pas phyi rol pa chen po nyid du 'dod pa rnams kyi bla na bzhugs pa de'i phyir 'di dag kho na la phyag 'tshal bar brjod do //
translated: Because they alone possess the perfection of virtue as explained, they are superior to the great outsiders who are considered to be great. Therefore, they alone are praised.

original: de la ma zhugs pa'i snga rol na bstan bcos kyi don ni shin tu lkog tu gyur pa'i phyir tshig ma rtogs pa ste rtogs pa'i thabs gzhan med la /
analyzed: de la ma zhugs pa'i snga rol na bstan bcos kyi don ni shin tu lkog tu gyur pa'i phyir tshig ma rtogs pa ste rtogs pa'i thabs gzhan med la /
translated: Before one enters the treatise, the meaning of the treatise is extremely obscure, so there is no other means of understanding the words.

original: rtog pa dang ldan zhing don du gnyer yang sgrub pa'i dgos pa ma rtogs pa rnams so sor nges pa'i sgrub pa mi len pas de'i phyir nyan pa po'i skye bo gzud ba'i don du re zhig dang por rab tu byed pa 'di'i brjod par bya ba dang
analyzed: rtog pa dang ldan zhing don du gnyer yang sgrub pa'i dgos pa ma rtogs pa rnams so sor nges pa'i sgrub pa mi len pas de'i phyir nyan pa po'i skye bo gzud ba'i don du re zhig dang por rab tu byed pa 'di'i brjod par bya ba dang
translated: Even though one has understanding and seeks the meaning, if one does not understand the purpose of the practice, one will not undertake the practice with certainty. Therefore, in order to attract the audience, first, in this chapter, the subject matter and

original: / dgos pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: / dgos pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: purpose of the treatise are taught.

original: gzugs brnyan la sogs pa lta bur zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: gzugs brnyan la sogs pa lta bur zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúlike a reflection, etc.‚Äù is stated.

original: 'dir brjod par bya ba ni chos thams cad rang bzhin med pa nyid do //
analyzed: 'dir brjod par bya ba ni chos thams cad rang bzhin med pa nyid do //
translated: Here, the subject matter is the absence of intrinsic nature of all phenomena.

original: de rtogs pa ni dngos su dgos pa yin no //
analyzed: de rtogs pa ni dngos su dgos pa yin no //
translated: The realization of that is the direct purpose.

original: de'i yang dgos pa ni nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa mtha' dag spong ba yin no //
analyzed: de'i yang dgos pa ni nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa mtha' dag spong ba yin no //
translated: The purpose of that is the elimination of all afflictive obstructions and obstructions to omniscience.

original: de phan chad ni re ba rnam par chad pa'i phyir dgos pa gzhan med do //
analyzed: de phan chad ni re ba rnam par chad pa'i phyir dgos pa gzhan med do //
translated: There is no other purpose beyond that, because hope is cut off.

original: 'brel pa ni rab tu byed pa dang dgos pa dag gi bsgrub par bya ba dang sgrub pa'i dngos po'i mtshan nyid yin par bstan par bya ste /
analyzed: 'brel pa ni rab tu byed pa dang dgos pa dag gi bsgrub par bya ba dang sgrub pa'i dngos po'i mtshan nyid yin par bstan par bya ste /
translated: The relation is the characteristic of the relation of probandum and probans between the chapters and the purpose, which should be shown.

original: gzhan gyi don du gnyer bar 'jug pa la yan lag ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan gyi don du gnyer bar 'jug pa la yan lag ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is not a limb in the engagement of striving for the benefit of others.

original: de yang 'brel pa can kho nas bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: de yang 'brel pa can kho nas bstan pa yin te /
translated: Moreover, it is shown only by the related,

original: de'i bdag nyid ni bstan du med pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir ro /
analyzed: de'i bdag nyid ni bstan du med pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir ro /
translated: because its nature is not shown.

original: de'i phyir 'brel pa logs shig tu bstan par mi bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'brel pa logs shig tu bstan par mi bya'o //
translated: Therefore, the relation should not be shown separately.

original: gzugs brnyan la sogs pa lta bur zhes bya ba la sogs @86b pas ni chos thams cad rang bzhin med pa nyid du rtogs pa nyon mongs pa la sogs pa'i sgrib pa spong ba'i thabs nyid du ston par byed de /
analyzed: gzugs brnyan la sogs pa lta bur zhes bya ba la sogs @86b pas ni chos thams cad rang bzhin med pa nyid du rtogs pa nyon mongs pa la sogs pa'i sgrib pa spong ba'i thabs nyid du ston par byed de /
translated: The passage beginning ‚ÄúLike a reflection, etc.‚Äù shows that the realization of the essencelessness of all phenomena is the very means for eliminating the obscurations such as the afflictions.

original: 'di ltar 'dod chags la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa thams cad ni phyin ci log gis kun nas bslang ba dag kho na yin la /üîΩphyin ci log de yang rang bzhin med pa la log par dmigs pa'i rnam pa yin pas dngos po la sogs par mngon par zhen pa'i mtshan nyid yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'dod chags la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa thams cad ni phyin ci log gis kun nas bslang ba dag kho na yin la / phyin ci log de yang rang bzhin med pa la log par dmigs pa'i rnam pa yin pas dngos po la sogs par mngon par zhen pa'i mtshan nyid yin te /
translated: Thus all the afflictions such as desire are only motivated by error.üîΩAnd that error is characterized by the misapprehension of essencelessness.

original: phyin ci log dang 'gal ba rang bzhin med pa nyid shes pas spong bar 'gyur ba kho na'o //
analyzed: phyin ci log dang 'gal ba rang bzhin med pa nyid shes pas spong bar 'gyur ba kho na'o //
translated: Therefore, it is only by knowing essencelessness, which is the opposite of error, that one can eliminate it.

original: phyin ci log spangs na phyin ci log gi rtsa ba can nyon mongs pa'i tshogs dang shes bya'i sgrib pa mtha' dag phyin ci log gi bdag nyid du ji ltar gnas par 'gyur /
analyzed: phyin ci log spangs na phyin ci log gi rtsa ba can nyon mongs pa'i tshogs dang shes bya'i sgrib pa mtha' dag phyin ci log gi bdag nyid du ji ltar gnas par 'gyur /
translated: And if error is eliminated, how could the mass of afflictions, which is rooted in error, and all the cognitive obscurations, which are of the nature of error, remain?

original: 'di skad du /üîΩchos la bdag med mkhas pa ni //
analyzed: 'di skad du / chos la bdag med mkhas pa ni //
translated: This is stated:

original: rang bzhin med pa goms byas pas //üîΩphyin ci log las byung ba yi //
analyzed: rang bzhin med pa goms byas pas // phyin ci log las byung ba yi //
translated: The wise one who is skilled in the selflessness of phenomenaüîΩeliminates the obscurations of affliction

original: nyon mongs sgrib pa med par spong //
analyzed: nyon mongs sgrib pa med par spong //
translated: that arise from errorüîΩthrough cultivating the absence of intrinsic reality.

original: zhes bya bas 'chad par 'gyur te /
analyzed: zhes bya bas 'chad par 'gyur te /
translated: This will be explained.

original: dngos po la sogs pa mngon par zhen pa phyin ci log nyid yin par rgyas par ni 'chad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dngos po la sogs pa mngon par zhen pa phyin ci log nyid yin par rgyas par ni 'chad par 'gyur ro //
translated: The misapprehension of things and so on is error, as will be explained in detail.

original: rnam pa zhes bya ba'i sgra ni tshogs kyi don to //
analyzed: rnam pa zhes bya ba'i sgra ni tshogs kyi don to //
translated: The word ‚Äúaspect‚Äù means a collection.

original: brtags pa ni dngos po'i de kho na yang dag par so sor rtog pa'o //
analyzed: brtags pa ni dngos po'i de kho na yang dag par so sor rtog pa'o //
translated: Examination is the thorough analysis of the reality of things.

original: de gnag rdzi la sogs pa'i shes pa gang la med pa de ni ma brtags pa'o //
analyzed: de gnag rdzi la sogs pa'i shes pa gang la med pa de ni ma brtags pa'o //
translated: That which does not exist in the consciousness of a cowherd and so on is unexamined.

original: 'dis dga' bas na dga' ba ste /
analyzed: 'dis dga' bas na dga' ba ste /
translated: It is delight because it delights.

original: gang la ma brtags gcig pu na dga' ba kho na yod pa zhes tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
analyzed: gang la ma brtags gcig pu na dga' ba kho na yod pa zhes tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúonly when unexamined‚Äù is to be connected with ‚Äúdelight alone exists.‚Äù

original: 'dis ni kun rdzob kyi shes pa la snang ba rnams mi bsal lo zhes bya bar ston par byed do //
analyzed: 'dis ni kun rdzob kyi shes pa la snang ba rnams mi bsal lo zhes bya bar ston par byed do //
translated: This shows that the appearances in conventional consciousness are not eliminated.

original: 'o na ji ltar rang bzhin med pa nyid yin snyam pa la /
analyzed: 'o na ji ltar rang bzhin med pa nyid yin snyam pa la /
translated: Now, how is it that there is no intrinsic reality?

original: yang dag par na zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: yang dag par na zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: It is said, ‚Äúin reality.‚Äù

original: yang dag zhes bya ba'i sgras ni dngos po'i stobs kyis zhugs pa'i rjes su dpag pas rtogs par bya ba de kho na nyid kyi ngo bo la bya ste /
analyzed: yang dag zhes bya ba'i sgras ni dngos po'i stobs kyis zhugs pa'i rjes su dpag pas rtogs par bya ba de kho na nyid kyi ngo bo la bya ste /
translated: The word ‚Äúreality‚Äù refers to the nature of reality that is to be understood by means of inference based on facts.

original: de kho na nyid kyis rnam par dpyad na stong ngo zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de kho na nyid kyis rnam par dpyad na stong ngo zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It is said that when reality is analyzed, it is empty.

original: 'dis ni de kho na nyid du dang don dam pa kho na zhes bya ba la sogs pa rnam par bshad do //
analyzed: 'dis ni de kho na nyid du dang don dam pa kho na zhes bya ba la sogs pa rnam par bshad do //
translated: This explains such phrases as ‚Äúin reality‚Äù and ‚Äúin the ultimate alone.‚Äù

original: yang na yang dag pa'i shes pa kho na yang dag pa la sogs pa'i sgrar brjod de /
analyzed: yang na yang dag pa'i shes pa kho na yang dag pa la sogs pa'i sgrar brjod de /
translated: Or else, correct consciousness alone is referred to by the words ‚Äúreality,‚Äù etc.

original: de'i dmigs pa yin pa'i phyir ro //üîΩyang dag pa'i shes pa'i bsam pa'i dbang gis rang bzhin med pa yin gyi /üîΩkun rdzob kyi shes pa'i dbang gis ni ma yin no zhes bya @87a * //
analyzed: de'i dmigs pa yin pa'i phyir ro // yang dag pa'i shes pa'i bsam pa'i dbang gis rang bzhin med pa yin gyi / kun rdzob kyi shes pa'i dbang gis ni ma yin no zhes bya @87a * //
translated: because it is the object of that.üîΩIt is said that there is no intrinsic reality by the power of the thought of correct consciousness,

original: ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: but not by the power of conventional consciousness.

original: spong bar gyur pa de su zhig yin snyam pa la /
analyzed: spong bar gyur pa de su zhig yin snyam pa la /
translated: Who is it that abandons?

original: bdag dang gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /üîΩgang gis bdag dang gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa bsgrub pa'i phyir /
analyzed: bdag dang gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te / gang gis bdag dang gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa bsgrub pa'i phyir /
translated: He says, ‚Äúthe one who is endowed with the perfect good of self and other,‚Äù and so on.

original: ci la ma rag par sbyin pa la sogs pa bsod nams dang ye shes kyi bdag nyid chas ba brtsams pa de la de skad ces bya ste /üîΩnyan thos la sogs pa ni rten mi brtan pa'i phyir dang / snying rje dang brtson 'grus chung ba'i phyir /
analyzed: ci la ma rag par sbyin pa la sogs pa bsod nams dang ye shes kyi bdag nyid chas ba brtsams pa de la de skad ces bya ste / nyan thos la sogs pa ni rten mi brtan pa'i phyir dang / snying rje dang brtson 'grus chung ba'i phyir /
translated: He is so called because he undertakes the practice of the perfections of generosity and so on, which are the means of accomplishing the perfect good of self and other.

original: shes bya'i sgrib pa mtha' dag spang ba bskal pa mi nyung bar goms par byas pas yang dag par bsgrub par bya ba sgrub par mi nus so snyam du bsams pa'o //
analyzed: shes bya'i sgrib pa mtha' dag spang ba bskal pa mi nyung bar goms par byas pas yang dag par bsgrub par bya ba sgrub par mi nus so snyam du bsams pa'o //
translated: The ≈õrƒÅvakas and so on are not able to accomplish the abandonment of all the cognitive obscurations, thinking that it is to be accomplished through familiarization over many eons, because their support is unstable and their compassion and perseverance are weak.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi ci la ma rag pa thams cad ni gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa bsgrub pa'i ched kho na nyid yin mod kyi /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi ci la ma rag pa thams cad ni gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa bsgrub pa'i ched kho na nyid yin mod kyi /
translated: Indeed, all that is not obtained by bodhisattvas is only for the sake of accomplishing the perfection of others' aims.

original: rang gi don phun sum tshogs pa bsgrub pa'i ched kyang med na med pa yin pas gnyi ga'i don brjod de /
analyzed: rang gi don phun sum tshogs pa bsgrub pa'i ched kyang med na med pa yin pas gnyi ga'i don brjod de /
translated: But it is also for the sake of accomplishing one's own perfection, so both are stated.

original: rab tu 'bad do zhes bya ba 'dis ni rab tu 'bad pa'i mchog ston par byed cing 'di'i zlos pa nyid yongs su spong bar byed do //
analyzed: rab tu 'bad do zhes bya ba 'dis ni rab tu 'bad pa'i mchog ston par byed cing 'di'i zlos pa nyid yongs su spong bar byed do //
translated: This shows the supreme effort and eliminates its redundancy.

original: des na 'di skad du /
analyzed: des na 'di skad du /
translated: Therefore, it is said:

original: sngon gyi slob dpon rnams kyis chos thams cad rang bzhin med pa nyid du bstan mod kyi /
analyzed: sngon gyi slob dpon rnams kyis chos thams cad rang bzhin med pa nyid du bstan mod kyi /
translated: Although the former masters taught that all phenomena are essenceless,

original: klan ka ngan pa'i dri ma mtha' dag bsal ba'i phyir 'bad pa mchog dang ldan pas ston par byed do zhes bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: klan ka ngan pa'i dri ma mtha' dag bsal ba'i phyir 'bad pa mchog dang ldan pas ston par byed do zhes bshad pa yin no //
translated: in order to remove all stains of bad objections, they taught with supreme effort.

original: de'i phyir 'bad pa don med pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'bad pa don med pa ma yin no //
translated: Thus, the effort is not pointless.

original: de nyid kyi phyir klan ka ngan pa'i dri ma bsal bas 'di dbu ma'i rgyan zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir klan ka ngan pa'i dri ma bsal bas 'di dbu ma'i rgyan zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, this is called the Ornament of the Middle Way because it clears away the stains of bad objections.

original: de la re zhig dang por rigs pa kho nas bsgrub par bya ba yin pas 'dir 'thad pa /
analyzed: de la re zhig dang por rigs pa kho nas bsgrub par bya ba yin pas 'dir 'thad pa /
translated: Here, first, because it is to be established by reasoning alone, he states the reasonings.

original: de la lung zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de la lung zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: In this regard, he says, ‚ÄúThe scriptures, etc.‚Äù

original: tshad mas brtan por ma byas pa'i lung ni gzhan du yang drang bar nus pa'i phyir /
analyzed: tshad mas brtan por ma byas pa'i lung ni gzhan du yang drang bar nus pa'i phyir /
translated: Because a scripture that is not firmly established by valid cognition can be interpreted otherwise,

original: dad pas rjes su 'brang ba rnams kyang nges pa mi skye bas yongs su tshim par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dad pas rjes su 'brang ba rnams kyang nges pa mi skye bas yongs su tshim par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: those who follow out of faith will not generate certainty and therefore will not be satisfied.

original: kyang zhes bya ba'i sgras ni sems log pa rnams lta smos kyang ci dgos zhes ston par byed do //
analyzed: kyang zhes bya ba'i sgras ni sems log pa rnams lta smos kyang ci dgos zhes ston par byed do //
translated: The word ‚Äúalso‚Äù indicates that there is no need to mention those whose minds are turned away from this teaching.

original: dngos po'i stobs kyis zhugs pa smos pa ni lung las grags pa'i rjes su dpag pa bsal ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: dngos po'i stobs kyis zhugs pa smos pa ni lung las grags pa'i rjes su dpag pa bsal ba'i phyir te /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthat engages by the power of fact‚Äù is stated in order to eliminate inferences based on what is renowned in the scriptures,

original: de yang lung dang 'dra bas de dang bcas te de yang nges par mi byed pa'i phyir tshim par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de yang lung dang 'dra bas de dang bcas te de yang nges par mi byed pa'i phyir tshim par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: because those are similar to scriptures and, like them, do not bring about certainty and therefore do not satisfy.

original: rigs pa ni nges pa @87b skyed par byed pas yongs su tshim par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: rigs pa ni nges pa @87b skyed par byed pas yongs su tshim par byed pa yin no //
translated: Reasoning is the satisfaction that arises from the generation of certainty.

original: ji ste gal te de lta na go rigs pa kho nas chog mod /
analyzed: ji ste gal te de lta na go rigs pa kho nas chog mod /
translated: If it is argued that since reasoning alone is sufficient,

original: lung gis ci zhig bya zhe na /
analyzed: lung gis ci zhig bya zhe na /
translated: what need is there for scripture?

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: It is not so,

original: lung ni rigs pa'i rgyan yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lung ni rigs pa'i rgyan yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because scripture is the ornament of reasoning.

original: de lta ma yin na 'di ni rtog ge pa skam pos brtags pa yin no zhes mi mkhas pa kha cig gis brnyas par yang 'gyur ro //üîΩrang bzhin dang bral ba'am /
analyzed: de lta ma yin na 'di ni rtog ge pa skam pos brtags pa yin no zhes mi mkhas pa kha cig gis brnyas par yang 'gyur ro // rang bzhin dang bral ba'am /
translated: Otherwise, some unwise people might disparage it, saying that it is a mere fabrication of dry logicians.üîΩThey are devoid of intrinsic reality,

original: gang dag la rang bzhin dang bral ba yod pas zhes tshig rnam par sbyar te /
analyzed: gang dag la rang bzhin dang bral ba yod pas zhes tshig rnam par sbyar te /
translated: or, they have intrinsic realitylessness,

original: 'di ni tshad ma'i 'bras bu yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni tshad ma'i 'bras bu yin no //
translated: this is the result of valid cognition.

original: sbyor ba ni 'di lta bu yin te /
analyzed: sbyor ba ni 'di lta bu yin te /
translated: The syllogism is as follows:

original: gang zag gcig dang du ma'i rang bzhin ma yin pa de dag ni don dam par na rang bzhin med de /
analyzed: gang zag gcig dang du ma'i rang bzhin ma yin pa de dag ni don dam par na rang bzhin med de /
translated: Those things that are neither singular nor manifold in nature are ultimately without intrinsic reality,

original: dper na gzugs brnyan bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na gzugs brnyan bzhin no //
translated: like a reflection.

original: bdag dang gzhan gyis smras pa'i dngos po rnams kyang gcig dang du ma'i rang bzhin ma yin pas zhes bya ba ni khyab par byed pa mi dmigs pa yin te /
analyzed: bdag dang gzhan gyis smras pa'i dngos po rnams kyang gcig dang du ma'i rang bzhin ma yin pas zhes bya ba ni khyab par byed pa mi dmigs pa yin te /
translated: And also, the things spoken of by ourselves and others are not of the nature of one or many. This is a non-observation of the pervader.

original: gcig pa nyid dang du ma nyid dag gis rang bzhin la khyab pa'i phyir ro //üîΩkhyab pa de nyid bstan pa'i phyir //
analyzed: gcig pa nyid dang du ma nyid dag gis rang bzhin la khyab pa'i phyir ro // khyab pa de nyid bstan pa'i phyir //
translated: This is because oneness and manyness pervade nature.üîΩIn order to demonstrate that pervasion, he says:

original: rang bzhin zhig yod par gyur na ni zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: rang bzhin zhig yod par gyur na ni zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: If a nature existed.

original: gcig pa zhes bya ba ni cha med pa nyid do //
analyzed: gcig pa zhes bya ba ni cha med pa nyid do //
translated: One means partless.

original: cig shos zhes bya ba ni du ma nyid de tha dad pa nyid ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: cig shos zhes bya ba ni du ma nyid de tha dad pa nyid ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The other means many, which is to say, different.

original: gang gi ngo bo rnam par gcad pa med na yongs su gcod pa med pa gang yin pa de ni de spangs te gnas pa'i mtshan nyid yin te /
analyzed: gang gi ngo bo rnam par gcad pa med na yongs su gcod pa med pa gang yin pa de ni de spangs te gnas pa'i mtshan nyid yin te /
translated: That which cannot be eliminated without eliminating its nature is characterized by abiding in the exclusion of that.

original: dper na dngos po med pa rnam par gcad pa med na yongs su gcod pa med pa ltar gcig pa nyid dang du ma nyid gnyis kyang phan tshun gyi ngo bo rnam par gcad pa med na yongs su gcod pa med pa dag yin te /
analyzed: dper na dngos po med pa rnam par gcad pa med na yongs su gcod pa med pa ltar gcig pa nyid dang du ma nyid gnyis kyang phan tshun gyi ngo bo rnam par gcad pa med na yongs su gcod pa med pa dag yin te /
translated: For example, if the exclusion of non-entity is not, then the determination of entity is not. Likewise, if the exclusion of the identity of the two, singularity and multiplicity, is not, then the determination of the two is not.

original: tha snyad kyis nges par byed do //
analyzed: tha snyad kyis nges par byed do //
translated: One should understand this by way of convention.

original: de lta bas na phan tshun spangs te gnas pa'i mtshan nyid dag yin no //
analyzed: de lta bas na phan tshun spangs te gnas pa'i mtshan nyid dag yin no //
translated: Therefore, they are characterized by mutual exclusion.

original: 'dis ni rtag pa dang mi rtag pa dang rim dang rim pa ma yin pa la sogs pa yang rnam par bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dis ni rtag pa dang mi rtag pa dang rim dang rim pa ma yin pa la sogs pa yang rnam par bshad pa yin no //
translated: This also explains permanence and impermanence, sequence and non-sequence, and so on.

original: phan tshun spangs te gnas pa'i mtshan nyid gang dag yin pa de dag kyang gcig yod pa dang dgag pa ni gzhan dgag pa dang yod pa med na med pa nyid yin pa'i phyir phung po gzhan med par rtogs par byed de /
analyzed: phan tshun spangs te gnas pa'i mtshan nyid gang dag yin pa de dag kyang gcig yod pa dang dgag pa ni gzhan dgag pa dang yod pa med na med pa nyid yin pa'i phyir phung po gzhan med par rtogs par byed de /
translated: And those that are characterized by mutual exclusion are understood to be without a third alternative because the negation of one is the negation of the other, and if one exists the other does not exist.

original: dper na dngos po dang dngos po med pa lta bur gcig pa nyid dang du ma nyid kyang phan tshun spangs te gnas pa'i mtshan nyid dag yin no //üîΩde lta bas na phung po gzhan med pa'i phyir rang bzhin ni gcig pa nyid @88a * //
analyzed: dper na dngos po dang dngos po med pa lta bur gcig pa nyid dang du ma nyid kyang phan tshun spangs te gnas pa'i mtshan nyid dag yin no // de lta bas na phung po gzhan med pa'i phyir rang bzhin ni gcig pa nyid @88a * //
translated: For example, being one and being many are mutually exclusive and contradictory, like being a thing and not being a thing.

original: dang du ma nyid dag gis bsdus pas khyab pa grub bo //
analyzed: dang du ma nyid dag gis bsdus pas khyab pa grub bo //
translated: Therefore, since there is no other alternative, the pervasion is established by the inclusion of oneness and manyness.

original: rang gi sde pa dang phyi rol pa dag gis smras pa'i phung po dang gtso bo la sogs pa la de dag yang dag par na med de zhes bya ba ni phyogs kyi chos sdud pa yin no //
analyzed: rang gi sde pa dang phyi rol pa dag gis smras pa'i phung po dang gtso bo la sogs pa la de dag yang dag par na med de zhes bya ba ni phyogs kyi chos sdud pa yin no //
translated: The inclusion of the property of the position is stated in the words ‚ÄúTherefore, the aggregates, the primary elements, and so on, which are spoken of by our own and other schools, do not exist in reality.‚Äù

original: yang dag par na zhes bya ba ni mngon sum la sogs pa dang 'gal ba med par ston to //
analyzed: yang dag par na zhes bya ba ni mngon sum la sogs pa dang 'gal ba med par ston to //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúin reality‚Äù shows that this is not contradicted by perception and so on.

original: 'o na 'di ci thal bar 'gyur bar sgrub pa yin nam /
analyzed: 'o na 'di ci thal bar 'gyur bar sgrub pa yin nam /
translated: Is this a consequence that proves the opposite of the opponent‚Äôs position?

original: 'on te rang gi rgyud kyis sgrub pa yin /
analyzed: 'on te rang gi rgyud kyis sgrub pa yin /
translated: Or is it a consequence that proves the opposite of one‚Äôs own position?

original: gal te dang po yin par rtog na ni de'i tshe gtan tshigs ma grub pa yin te /
analyzed: gal te dang po yin par rtog na ni de'i tshe gtan tshigs ma grub pa yin te /
translated: If it is the first, then the reason is not established.

original: gzhan dag dngos po thams cad la gcig dang du ma dang bral ba khas mi len pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan dag dngos po thams cad la gcig dang du ma dang bral ba khas mi len pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because others do not accept that all things are devoid of unity and multiplicity.

original: ji ste gnyis pa yin no zhe na ni /
analyzed: ji ste gnyis pa yin no zhe na ni /
translated: If the second,

original: de lta na yang shin tu ma grub pa yin te /
analyzed: de lta na yang shin tu ma grub pa yin te /
translated: then it is still not established,üîΩbecause you do not accept the basis of the self, and because the opponent has not established its nature.

original: bdag nyid gzhi khas mi len pa'i phyir dang / phyir rgol ba la yang rang gi ngo bo ma grub pa'i phyir ro snyam du dogs pa la gtan tshigs 'di ma grub bo snyam du ma sems shig ces bya ba smos so //
analyzed: bdag nyid gzhi khas mi len pa'i phyir dang / phyir rgol ba la yang rang gi ngo bo ma grub pa'i phyir ro snyam du dogs pa la gtan tshigs 'di ma grub bo snyam du ma sems shig ces bya ba smos so //
translated: Thinking this, he says, ‚ÄúDo not think that this reason is not established.‚Äù

original: ji ltar snyam pa la /üîΩ'bras bu rim can nyer sbyor bas //
analyzed: ji ltar snyam pa la / 'bras bu rim can nyer sbyor bas //
translated: How is it?

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: He says, ‚ÄúThe application of the effect in succession,‚Äù and so on.

original: 'di snyam du sems te /üîΩre zhig gzhan dag gis brtags pa nam mkha' la sogs pa'i dngos po ma grags pa'i rang gi ngo bo gang dag yin pa de la ni thal bar bsgrub pa kho na yin la /
analyzed: 'di snyam du sems te / re zhig gzhan dag gis brtags pa nam mkha' la sogs pa'i dngos po ma grags pa'i rang gi ngo bo gang dag yin pa de la ni thal bar bsgrub pa kho na yin la /
translated: He thinks this:üîΩThose things whose nature is not renowned, such as space, are established as absurd consequences.

original: grags pa'i rang gi ngo bo rnams la ni gnyi ga ltar yang nyes pa med de /
analyzed: grags pa'i rang gi ngo bo rnams la ni gnyi ga ltar yang nyes pa med de /
translated: But in the case of those things whose nature is renowned, there is no fault in either case.

original: 'di ltar gzhan dag gis dngos po thams cad ni rtag pa dang mi rtag pa nyid kyis phung po gnyis su khas blangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar gzhan dag gis dngos po thams cad ni rtag pa dang mi rtag pa nyid kyis phung po gnyis su khas blangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Thus, because others accept that all things are included in the two groups of permanent and impermanent,

original: de la re zhig bdag la sogs pa ma grags pa'i rang gi ngo bo rnams kyang rang bzhin gcig pa nyid du khas blangs mod kyi /
analyzed: de la re zhig bdag la sogs pa ma grags pa'i rang gi ngo bo rnams kyang rang bzhin gcig pa nyid du khas blangs mod kyi /
translated: and because they accept that even such things as the self, which are not well known, are of one nature,

original: de dag ni 'bras bu rim can rnam par shes pa la sogs pa la nye bar sbyor bar khas len te /
analyzed: de dag ni 'bras bu rim can rnam par shes pa la sogs pa la nye bar sbyor bar khas len te /
translated: they accept that they are related to the effect, consciousness, etc., in a series.

original: shugs kyis rang bzhin gcig pa nyid med pa 'dren par byed pas re zhig gcig pa nyid dang bral bar grub pa kho na yin no //
analyzed: shugs kyis rang bzhin gcig pa nyid med pa 'dren par byed pas re zhig gcig pa nyid dang bral bar grub pa kho na yin no //
translated: Since they implicitly draw out the absence of one nature, they are already established as devoid of oneness.

original: rtag pa nyid du khas blangs pa'i phyir du ma dang bral ba yang shin tu grub pa yin te mdor bsdus pa'i don yin no //
analyzed: rtag pa nyid du khas blangs pa'i phyir du ma dang bral ba yang shin tu grub pa yin te mdor bsdus pa'i don yin no //
translated: And because they are accepted as permanent, they are also established as devoid of plurality. This is the meaning in brief.

original: de dag ces bya ba ni rtag pa rnams so //
analyzed: de dag ces bya ba ni rtag pa rnams so //
translated: ‚Äú Those‚Äù refers to the permanent things.

original: rang gi sde pa dang gzhan gyi sde pas khas blangs pa'i dngos po de dag ni zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni tshig le'ur byas pa'i phyed rnam par 'grel bar byed do //
analyzed: rang gi sde pa dang gzhan gyi sde pas khas blangs pa'i dngos po de dag ni zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni tshig le'ur byas pa'i phyed rnam par 'grel bar byed do //
translated: The words those things accepted by our own and other schools and so on comment on half of the verse.

original: dang po zhes bya ba ni rtag pa @88b rnams so //
analyzed: dang po zhes bya ba ni rtag pa @88b rnams so //
translated: The word first refers to the permanent things.

original: dga' ba dang gdung ba la sogs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa zhes bya ba'i sgras ni bde ba yang ma yin /üîΩsdug bsngal ba yang ma yin zhes bya ba la sogs pa bsdu'o //
analyzed: dga' ba dang gdung ba la sogs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa zhes bya ba'i sgras ni bde ba yang ma yin / sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin zhes bya ba la sogs pa bsdu'o //
translated: The words such as pleasure and pain and so on include neither pleasure nor pain and so on.

original: de dag gis 'bras bu rnams kyang cig car du 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni rgyu mtshang ba med pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: de dag gis 'bras bu rnams kyang cig car du 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni rgyu mtshang ba med pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because their effects would arise simultaneously, means that the cause would be without fault,

original: 'bras bu myu gu la sogs pa du ma cig car skye ba bzhin no //
analyzed: 'bras bu myu gu la sogs pa du ma cig car skye ba bzhin no //
translated: just as many effects such as sprouts arise simultaneously.

original: 'bras bu rnams ni rgyu ma tshang na shol gyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni 'dir cig car gyis khyab par ston par byed de /
analyzed: 'bras bu rnams ni rgyu ma tshang na shol gyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni 'dir cig car gyis khyab par ston par byed de /
translated: Because effects do not arise when their causes are incomplete, and so on, shows that the simultaneous arising of effects is pervaded by the fault that the cause would be without fault.

original: gang dag la rgyu'i nus pa thogs pa med pa yod pa de dag la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: gang dag la rgyu'i nus pa thogs pa med pa yod pa de dag la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: Those that have the unimpeded power of a cause are said to be like that.

original: shol ba ni sdod pa'o //
analyzed: shol ba ni sdod pa'o //
translated: ‚Äú Delay‚Äù means to stop.

original: gal te 'bras bu rgyu'i chos thams cad kyi rjes su byed par gyur na /
analyzed: gal te 'bras bu rgyu'i chos thams cad kyi rjes su byed par gyur na /
translated: If the effect were to conform to all the qualities of the cause,

original: der 'gyur ba ma yin nam /
analyzed: der 'gyur ba ma yin nam /
translated: wouldn‚Äôt that be the case?

original: ji tsam du rgyu dang 'bras bu gnyis gcig pa kho nar 'gyur du 'ong bas /
analyzed: ji tsam du rgyu dang 'bras bu gnyis gcig pa kho nar 'gyur du 'ong bas /
translated: To the extent that the two, cause and effect, would be exactly the same,

original: ji ltar 'bras bu chos thams cad kyi rjes su byed par mi 'dod pa bzhin du rim ma yin pa'i rjes su byed pa nyid 'di yang de ltar 'gyur du 'ong ngo snyam pa la /
analyzed: ji ltar 'bras bu chos thams cad kyi rjes su byed par mi 'dod pa bzhin du rim ma yin pa'i rjes su byed pa nyid 'di yang de ltar 'gyur du 'ong ngo snyam pa la /
translated: just as you do not assert that the effect conforms to all the qualities, this conformity to the nonsequential would also be like that.

original: shol na ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: shol na ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: ‚Äú If there were delay‚Äù and so on.

original: de la gal te 'bras bu la rgyu'i chos mtha' dag gi rjes su byed pa nyid med mod kyi /
analyzed: de la gal te 'bras bu la rgyu'i chos mtha' dag gi rjes su byed pa nyid med mod kyi /
translated: In that regard, if the effect does not conform to all the qualities of the cause,

original: 'on kyang 'dis gdon mi za bar de la yod pa'i rdzas su 'gro ba dang ldog pa'i rjes su byed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'on kyang 'dis gdon mi za bar de la yod pa'i rdzas su 'gro ba dang ldog pa'i rjes su byed par 'gyur ro //
translated: then it would be necessary that it conform to the substance that exists in it, to the going and returning.

original: de lta ma yin na ji ltar de'i 'bras bu zhes bya /
analyzed: de lta ma yin na ji ltar de'i 'bras bu zhes bya /
translated: If it were not so, how could it be called the effect of that?

original: de lta na ni thams cad kyang thams cad kyi 'bras bur thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta na ni thams cad kyang thams cad kyi 'bras bur thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If it were so, then it would follow that everything would be the effect of everything.

original: gal te lhan cig byed pa'i rgyu la ltos pa'i phyir rgyu ma tshang ba med pa nyid ma grub bo snyam pa la /
analyzed: gal te lhan cig byed pa'i rgyu la ltos pa'i phyir rgyu ma tshang ba med pa nyid ma grub bo snyam pa la /
translated: If you think that the non-deficiency of the cause is not established because it depends on the co-operating cause,

original: bye brag tu bsgyur du mi rung ba rnams la ni lhan cig byed pa'i rgyu la ltos par mi 'thad ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: bye brag tu bsgyur du mi rung ba rnams la ni lhan cig byed pa'i rgyu la ltos par mi 'thad ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: then the text says, ‚ÄúIt is not tenable that those that cannot be transformed in particular depend on the co-operating cause,‚Äù and so forth.

original: gal te de dag bdag nyid kyis nus na ni ci'i phyir lhan cig byed pa phan pa med pa de dag la ltos par 'gyur /
analyzed: gal te de dag bdag nyid kyis nus na ni ci'i phyir lhan cig byed pa phan pa med pa de dag la ltos par 'gyur /
translated: If they are able by themselves, then why would they depend on the co-operating causes that are not helpful?

original: ji ste mi nus na ni de lta na yang ltos par rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: ji ste mi nus na ni de lta na yang ltos par rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: But if they are not able, then in that case it is not tenable that they depend on them.

original: de dag gis de dag las phan pa cung zad kyang mi 'thob pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag gis de dag las phan pa cung zad kyang mi 'thob pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they do not obtain any benefit from them at all.

original: 'on te thob na ni rtag pa nyid nyams par thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'on te thob na ni rtag pa nyid nyams par thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: But if they do obtain it, then it follows that they would lose their permanence.

original: gzhan yang 'bras bu byed pa'i dus na zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni lhan cig byed pa la ltos pa yin du chug na yang lhan cig byed pa'i rgyu nye ba'i dus na yod pa dang rang bzhin khyad par med pa'i phyir de dang 'brel pa'i rang
analyzed: gzhan yang 'bras bu byed pa'i dus na zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni lhan cig byed pa la ltos pa yin du chug na yang lhan cig byed pa'i rgyu nye ba'i dus na yod pa dang rang bzhin khyad par med pa'i phyir de dang 'brel pa'i rang
translated: Moreover, the line ‚ÄúIf it produces an effect, etc.‚Äù shows that even if it is accepted that it depends on its cooperative conditions, since the cooperative conditions exist at the time of the effect and the essence is not different, the essence that is related to the conditions

original: bzhin gyi rjes su 'jug @89a * //
analyzed: bzhin gyi rjes su 'jug @89a * //
translated: would be engaged in the conditions.

original: pas na mi 'dod bzhin du mgul nas btags pa bzhin du stobs kyis drangs pa'i phyir lhan cig byed pa rnams rtag tu gnas pa kho na yin pas rgyu ma tshang ba med pa nyid kyis 'bras bu dang mi 'bral bar thal bar bzlog dka'o zhes ston par
analyzed: pas na mi 'dod bzhin du mgul nas btags pa bzhin du stobs kyis drangs pa'i phyir lhan cig byed pa rnams rtag tu gnas pa kho na yin pas rgyu ma tshang ba med pa nyid kyis 'bras bu dang mi 'bral bar thal bar bzlog dka'o zhes ston par
translated: Since it is drawn by force, like a noose around the neck, even though it is not desired, it is difficult to reverse the consequence that the effect would not be disassociated from the complete assemblage of causes, since the cooperative conditions would always be present.

original: byed de / gang la lhan cig byed pa'i rkyen mtha' dag dang 'dug pa yod pa zhes tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
analyzed: byed de / gang la lhan cig byed pa'i rkyen mtha' dag dang 'dug pa yod pa zhes tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
translated: The line ‚ÄúIf it produces an effect, etc.‚Äù is to be applied to the statement ‚ÄúIf it exists together with all the cooperative conditions.‚Äù

original: 'dis ni gang dag lhan cig byed pa'i rgyu de nyid nus pa'i sgrar brjod de zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni dus la sogs par smra ba gang dag dus la sogs pa'i dngos po rnams rang bzhin gcig pa yod mod kyi /
analyzed: 'dis ni gang dag lhan cig byed pa'i rgyu de nyid nus pa'i sgrar brjod de zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni dus la sogs par smra ba gang dag dus la sogs pa'i dngos po rnams rang bzhin gcig pa yod mod kyi /
translated: This shows that those who say that the very cause that is a collection is called the power, and so on, and who say that although things such as time have a single nature,

original: rim gyis 'jug pa can gyi mthu rnams la ltos nas 'bras bu dag skyed par byed do zhes zer ba de dag kyang 'dis bsal lo zhes ston par byed do //
analyzed: rim gyis 'jug pa can gyi mthu rnams la ltos nas 'bras bu dag skyed par byed do zhes zer ba de dag kyang 'dis bsal lo zhes ston par byed do //
translated: they generate effects in dependence on the powers that engage in sequence, are also refuted by this argument.

original: 'di ltar gal te mthu de dag don gzhan yin par 'gyur ba khas len na ni de'i tshe lhan cig byed pa'i rgyu de kho na la de skad du brjod par zad pas bye brag med do //
analyzed: 'di ltar gal te mthu de dag don gzhan yin par 'gyur ba khas len na ni de'i tshe lhan cig byed pa'i rgyu de kho na la de skad du brjod par zad pas bye brag med do //
translated: Thus, if one accepts that those powers are different objects, then it is just the cause that is a collection that is called that, so there is no difference.

original: de'i phyir sun dbyung ba yang de kho na yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir sun dbyung ba yang de kho na yin no //
translated: Therefore, the refutation is just that.

original: ji ste don gzhan du gyur pa ma yin na ni /
analyzed: ji ste don gzhan du gyur pa ma yin na ni /
translated: But if they are not different objects,üîΩthen how could they be powers?

original: de'i tshe de dag de'i rang bzhin las tha mi dad pa'i phyir de'i rang bzhin rjes su 'brang ba bzhin du rtag tu nye ba'i rang bzhin yin pas ji ltar na 'bras bu 'jig par 'gyur /
analyzed: de'i tshe de dag de'i rang bzhin las tha mi dad pa'i phyir de'i rang bzhin rjes su 'brang ba bzhin du rtag tu nye ba'i rang bzhin yin pas ji ltar na 'bras bu 'jig par 'gyur /
translated: At that time, since they are not different from its intrinsic nature, they are always of the nature of the intrinsic nature, just like its intrinsic nature. How then could the effect be destroyed?üîΩThe second half of the verse is analyzed by the phrase ‚Äúif this error were to arise.

original: ji ste nyes pa 'dir 'gyur du 'ong zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni tshigs su bcad pa'i phyed 'og ma rnam par 'byed de /
analyzed: ji ste nyes pa 'dir 'gyur du 'ong zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni tshigs su bcad pa'i phyed 'og ma rnam par 'byed de /
translated: The second half of the verse is analyzed by ‚ÄúIf this error were to arise.‚Äù

original: rtag par 'dod pa zhes bya ba ni rtag pa nyid du sems pa'o //
analyzed: rtag par 'dod pa zhes bya ba ni rtag pa nyid du sems pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúDesiring permanence‚Äù means thinking of permanence.

original: de dag la zhes bya ba ni rtag par 'dod pa dag la'o //
analyzed: de dag la zhes bya ba ni rtag par 'dod pa dag la'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIn them‚Äù means in those who desire permanence.

original: rang bzhin snga ma ni 'jig par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rang bzhin snga ma ni 'jig par 'gyur ro //
translated: The former intrinsic nature is destroyed.

original: phyi ma ni 'byung bar 'gyur ro //üîΩrang gi sde pa gang dag ces bya ba la sogs pas ni bye brag tu smra ba'i gzhung gis ma grub pa nyid rjod par byed do //
analyzed: phyi ma ni 'byung bar 'gyur ro // rang gi sde pa gang dag ces bya ba la sogs pas ni bye brag tu smra ba'i gzhung gis ma grub pa nyid rjod par byed do //
translated: The latter intrinsic nature arises.üîΩThe phrase ‚Äúthose of our own schools‚Äù and so on expresses the fact that the position of the VaibhƒÅ·π£ikas is not established.

original: de dag ni so sor brtags pa la sogs pa 'dus ma byas /
analyzed: de dag ni so sor brtags pa la sogs pa 'dus ma byas /
translated: They assert that the unconditioned, such as analytical cessations,

original: 'dus byas kyi 'jug pa thams cad dang mi mthun pa rdzas su yod pa tha na rang gi yul can yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i 'bras bu la yang dgos pa med pa'i phyir nus pa thams cad kyis stong par 'dod de /
analyzed: 'dus byas kyi 'jug pa thams cad dang mi mthun pa rdzas su yod pa tha na rang gi yul can yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i 'bras bu la yang dgos pa med pa'i phyir nus pa thams cad kyis stong par 'dod de /
translated: Because it is incompatible with all conditioned processes and because it has no purpose even in terms of the result of the mental consciousness that perceives it, it is asserted to be empty of all potential.

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu dag ni 'dus byas kyi yin gyi /
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu dag ni 'dus byas kyi yin gyi /
translated: Because it is said, ‚ÄúCause and effect are conditioned phenomena,

original: de dag 'dus ma byas kyi ni ma yin no zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag 'dus ma byas kyi ni ma yin no zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: but they are not unconditioned phenomena.‚Äù

original: de yang rnal 'byor pa'i shes pa dam pa'i yul yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de yang rnal 'byor pa'i shes pa dam pa'i yul yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Moreover, because it is the object of the holy consciousness of yogins,

original: don @89b dam par yod pa'o zhes bya'o //
analyzed: don @89b dam par yod pa'o zhes bya'o //
translated: it is said to exist in the ultimate.

original: de'i phyir de dag gi lugs ltar na 'bras bu rim can la nye bar sbyor ba med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de'i phyir de dag gi lugs ltar na 'bras bu rim can la nye bar sbyor ba med pa'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, according to their system, because it is not applied to a sequential result,

original: ji ltar na gcig dang du ma'i rang bzhin gyi 'gal ba can du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ji ltar na gcig dang du ma'i rang bzhin gyi 'gal ba can du 'gyur ro //
translated: how could it be contradictory to be both one and many?

original: 'gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni lan 'debs te /
analyzed: 'gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni lan 'debs te /
translated: The response to that is ‚ÄúIf it is contradictory . . . ‚Äù and so on.

original: shes pa gang la bsgoms pa las byung ba yod pa des shes par bya ba'i 'dus ma byas gang yin pa de smra ba'i ngang tshul can gang dag yin pa zhes tshig rnam par sbyar ba'i don to //
analyzed: shes pa gang la bsgoms pa las byung ba yod pa des shes par bya ba'i 'dus ma byas gang yin pa de smra ba'i ngang tshul can gang dag yin pa zhes tshig rnam par sbyar ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of the expression is this: whatever unconditioned object is known by a cognition in which there is a result of meditation, that is the object of those who are inclined to speak.

original: de dag ni zhes bya ba ni 'dus ma byas pa dag go //
analyzed: de dag ni zhes bya ba ni 'dus ma byas pa dag go //
translated: ‚ÄúThose‚Äù refers to the unconditioned objects.

original: yul dang yul can yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni pha rol gyi lan du dogs par byed pa ste /üîΩpha rol gyi bsam pa ni gang dag gis na gcig pa nyid nyams par 'gyur ba rgya skyegs dang shing bzhin du shes pa rim can dang de dag 'brel par ni khas mi len gyi yul dang yul can nyid du'o //
analyzed: yul dang yul can yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni pha rol gyi lan du dogs par byed pa ste / pha rol gyi bsam pa ni gang dag gis na gcig pa nyid nyams par 'gyur ba rgya skyegs dang shing bzhin du shes pa rim can dang de dag 'brel par ni khas mi len gyi yul dang yul can nyid du'o //
translated: ‚ÄúBecause of being object and subject‚Äù and so on are the objections raised by the opponent.üîΩThe opponent‚Äôs idea is this: Just as lacquer and wood are not accepted as being sequential and related, so too object and subject are not accepted as being sequential and related.

original: yul dang yul can nyid ni gcig pa nyid du yang mi 'gal ba kho na ste /
analyzed: yul dang yul can nyid ni gcig pa nyid du yang mi 'gal ba kho na ste /
translated: But it is not contradictory for object and subject to be identical.

original: don dam par na shes pa'i rang gi ngo bo la mi reg pa kho nar yul tsam nyid du gnas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don dam par na shes pa'i rang gi ngo bo la mi reg pa kho nar yul tsam nyid du gnas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because ultimately, without touching the nature of cognition itself, the object exists as mere object.

original: yul ni gdon mi za bar rgyu'i ngo bo kho nar 'gyur ba yang ma yin no snyam pa yin no //
analyzed: yul ni gdon mi za bar rgyu'i ngo bo kho nar 'gyur ba yang ma yin no snyam pa yin no //
translated: And the object is not necessarily just the nature of the cause.

original: mi 'gyur te zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni lan 'debs so //
analyzed: mi 'gyur te zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni lan 'debs so //
translated: The response to that is ‚ÄúNo, because . . . ‚Äù and so on.

original: 'di la phyogs gnyis te /üîΩres 'ga' rnam par shes pa snga ma la sogs pas shes par bya ba gang yin pa de'i rang bzhin de rnam par shes pa phyi ma la sogs pa skye ba'i dus na yang rjes su 'brang ngam /
analyzed: 'di la phyogs gnyis te / res 'ga' rnam par shes pa snga ma la sogs pas shes par bya ba gang yin pa de'i rang bzhin de rnam par shes pa phyi ma la sogs pa skye ba'i dus na yang rjes su 'brang ngam /
translated: There are two positions here.

original: yang na mi 'brang ba zhig yin grang /
analyzed: yang na mi 'brang ba zhig yin grang /
translated: Sometimes, whatever is known by a previous consciousness, is its nature, and that follows along even at the time of the arising of a later consciousness, or does it not follow?

original: gal te rjes su 'brang ba yin na ni de'i tshe rnam par shes pa snga ma la sogs pa dus gcig pa nyid du 'gyur te /
analyzed: gal te rjes su 'brang ba yin na ni de'i tshe rnam par shes pa snga ma la sogs pa dus gcig pa nyid du 'gyur te /
translated: If it follows, then at that time the previous consciousness and so on would be simultaneous,

original: rnam par shes pa rnams kyis shes par bya ba'i rang bzhin rjes su 'brang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa rnams kyis shes par bya ba'i rang bzhin rjes su 'brang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because the nature that is known by the consciousnesses follows along.

original: sbyor ba ni gang gi tshe gang zhig rnam par shes pa gang gis shes par bya ba'i rang bzhin rjes su 'brang ba de ni de'i tshe rnam par shes pa de'i rjes su 'brang ba'i rang bzhin yin no //
analyzed: sbyor ba ni gang gi tshe gang zhig rnam par shes pa gang gis shes par bya ba'i rang bzhin rjes su 'brang ba de ni de'i tshe rnam par shes pa de'i rjes su 'brang ba'i rang bzhin yin no //
translated: The application is that when something is the nature that is to be cognized by a certain consciousness, then at that time it is the nature that is concomitant with that consciousness.

original: dper na rang gi rnam par shes pa skye ba'i gnas skabs na 'dus ma byas de nyid lta bu ste /
analyzed: dper na rang gi rnam par shes pa skye ba'i gnas skabs na 'dus ma byas de nyid lta bu ste /
