translated: For example, it is like that unconditioned phenomenon itself in the context of the arising of one‚Äôs own consciousness.üîΩThe opponent‚Äôs assertion is that unconditioned phenomena are always concomitant with the nature that is to be cognized by previous and subsequent consciousnesses.

original: pha rol pos 'dod pa 'dus ma byas rnam par shes pa snga ma dang / phyi mas shes par bya ba'i rang bzhin rnams kyang rtag tu rjes su 'brang bas zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs yin no //
analyzed: pha rol pos 'dod pa 'dus ma byas rnam par shes pa snga ma dang / phyi mas shes par bya ba'i rang bzhin rnams kyang rtag tu rjes su 'brang bas zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs yin no //
translated: This is a logical argument from nature.

original: de lta ma yin na zhes bya ba la sogs pa @90a * //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na zhes bya ba la sogs pa @90a * //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúif it were not so‚Äù and so on

original: ni gtan tshigs 'di'i ma nges pa nyid yongs su spong bar byed de /
analyzed: ni gtan tshigs 'di'i ma nges pa nyid yongs su spong bar byed de /
translated: eliminates the uncertainty of this logical argument.

original: rnam par shes pa med na rnam par shes pa'i shes bya'i rang bzhin nyid rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa med na rnam par shes pa'i shes bya'i rang bzhin nyid rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: If there were no consciousness, it would not be logical for the nature of the object of consciousness to exist.

original: ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it would lead to absurd consequences.

original: de'i phyir gcig la dus gcig tu yod pa dang med pa phan tshun 'gal ba yod par khas blangs par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de'i phyir gcig la dus gcig tu yod pa dang med pa phan tshun 'gal ba yod par khas blangs par 'gyur te /
translated: Therefore, you would have to accept that one thing exists and does not exist at the same time, which is mutually contradictory.

original: de'i phyir ma nges pa nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir ma nges pa nyid ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is not the case that the reason is not established.

original: phyogs gnyis pa la yang rang bzhin gzhan dang gzhan skye ba'i phyir dang / snga ma snga ma yang 'jig pa'i phyir rnam par shes pa de dang 'dra bar skad cig pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ro//üîΩde nyid ji ste shes pa snga ma dang phyi mas shes par bya ba zhes bya ba la sogs pas dogs par byas nas gal te de lta na ni /
analyzed: phyogs gnyis pa la yang rang bzhin gzhan dang gzhan skye ba'i phyir dang / snga ma snga ma yang 'jig pa'i phyir rnam par shes pa de dang 'dra bar skad cig pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ro// de nyid ji ste shes pa snga ma dang phyi mas shes par bya ba zhes bya ba la sogs pas dogs par byas nas gal te de lta na ni /
translated: In the second case, because of the arising of one intrinsic nature after another, and because of the destruction of the previous one, consciousness would be momentary, like the cognition.üîΩHe anticipates the objection that this is the case in the statement, ‚ÄúIf the previous and subsequent cognitions are the object of one cognition,‚Äù and so on.

original: sngon dang phyi ma'i gnas rnams su zhes bya ba la sogs pas ston par byed de /
analyzed: sngon dang phyi ma'i gnas rnams su zhes bya ba la sogs pas ston par byed de /
translated: If that is so, then in the statement, ‚ÄúIn the previous and subsequent states,‚Äù and so on, he teaches that the previous and subsequent cognitions are not the object of one cognition.

original: bsam gtan nyid thur ma yin la gang dag la des blo gros kyi mig phye ba yod pa zhes tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
analyzed: bsam gtan nyid thur ma yin la gang dag la des blo gros kyi mig phye ba yod pa zhes tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
translated: The meditative absorptions are the spoon, and those for whom the eye of the mind is opened by that are called ‚Äúthose who have the eye of the mind opened.‚Äù This is how the sentence is to be analyzed.

original: gzhan gyi dus na med ces bya ba ni res 'ga' yod ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: gzhan gyi dus na med ces bya ba ni res 'ga' yod ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúit does not exist at other times‚Äù means that it exists at some times.

original: de yang zhes bya ba ni 'dus ma byas nyid kyi don to //
analyzed: de yang zhes bya ba ni 'dus ma byas nyid kyi don to //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthat also‚Äù means the meaning of unconditioned.

original: mi 'da' bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni yul gyi rim gyis yul can gyi rim pa la khyab pas yul can gyi rim pa ni yul gyis byas pa'i phyir khyab pa nyid ston par byed do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: mi 'da' bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni yul gyi rim gyis yul can gyi rim pa la khyab pas yul can gyi rim pa ni yul gyis byas pa'i phyir khyab pa nyid ston par byed do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúit does not pass beyond‚Äù means that the order of the object is pervaded by the order of the subject. The order of the subject is made by the order of the object. This is what is being shown.

original: des na rgyu dang rkyen rnams kyis byas pa nyid kyi phyir 'dus ma byas su ston pa yang mi rung ste /
analyzed: des na rgyu dang rkyen rnams kyis byas pa nyid kyi phyir 'dus ma byas su ston pa yang mi rung ste /
translated: Therefore, because it is produced by causes and conditions, it is not suitable to be unconditioned.

original: skad cig snga ma snga mas phyi ma phyi ma rnams byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skad cig snga ma snga mas phyi ma phyi ma rnams byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because the earlier moments produce the later moments.

original: de lta ma yin na skad cig ma rnams rgyu med pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na skad cig ma rnams rgyu med pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: If that were not so, the moments would be without a cause.

original: de'i phyir res 'ga' ba nyid du'ang mi 'thad do //
analyzed: de'i phyir res 'ga' ba nyid du'ang mi 'thad do //
translated: Therefore, it is not tenable that it exists at some times.

original: yod pa dang med pa'i dus gnyis bye brag med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yod pa dang med pa'i dus gnyis bye brag med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because the two times of existence and nonexistence are not distinct.

original: 'di dag thams cad ni bdag gis rloms te smras su zad kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni sun dbyung ba gzhan yang ston te /
analyzed: 'di dag thams cad ni bdag gis rloms te smras su zad kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni sun dbyung ba gzhan yang ston te /
translated: All of these are just my own presumptuous statements.

original: bsdus pa'i don ni gang gis na phyogs kyi chos nyid du mi 'gyur ba don byed pas stong pa de lta bu phyogs kyi khongs su 'dus par yod pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: bsdus pa'i don ni gang gis na phyogs kyi chos nyid du mi 'gyur ba don byed pas stong pa de lta bu phyogs kyi khongs su 'dus par yod pa ni ma yin te /
translated: The summarized meaning is this: That which is empty of performing a function is not included within the category of the subject, because of which it would be a property of the subject.

original: don byed pas stong pa ni rtog pa dang ldan pa rnams kyis btang snyoms su bya ba nyid du gnas pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba yin no //üîΩ'dis ni gang dag mi rtag pa nyid la sogs par @90b sgrub pa yod pa la sogs pa la /
analyzed: don byed pas stong pa ni rtog pa dang ldan pa rnams kyis btang snyoms su bya ba nyid du gnas pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba yin no // 'dis ni gang dag mi rtag pa nyid la sogs par @90b sgrub pa yod pa la sogs pa la /
translated: That which is empty of performing a function is something that those who possess intelligence should ignore.üîΩThis also completely eliminates those who say that the proof of impermanence and so on is not established with respect to existence and so on.

original: de lta bus ma nges pa nyid du rjod par byed pa de dag kyang bsal ba kho nar khong du chud par bya ste /
analyzed: de lta bus ma nges pa nyid du rjod par byed pa de dag kyang bsal ba kho nar khong du chud par bya ste /
translated: They say that in that case, it is not ascertained.

original: rtog pa dang ldan pa'i tha snyad kyi yul don byed nus pa'i mtshan nyid kyi yod pa gtan tshigs nyid du brjod par 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtog pa dang ldan pa'i tha snyad kyi yul don byed nus pa'i mtshan nyid kyi yod pa gtan tshigs nyid du brjod par 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is the existence characterized by causal efficiency that is the object of conceptual cognition, and it is that which is asserted to be the logical reason.

original: de lta bu ni med pa rnams las logs shig tu ni bstan par yang mi nus te /
analyzed: de lta bu ni med pa rnams las logs shig tu ni bstan par yang mi nus te /
translated: And such an existence cannot be shown to be different from non-existent things,

original: med pa ni nus pa thams cad dang bral ba tsam gyi mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: med pa ni nus pa thams cad dang bral ba tsam gyi mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the definition of non-existent is that it is devoid of all causal efficiency.

original: rloms pa ni nga'o snyam pa'i nga rgyal lo //üîΩgzhan du na zhes bya ba ni gal te don byed par rung ba'i yul dpyad par mi 'dod na de'i tshe don byed pa don du gnyer ba'i skyes bu rnams la /
analyzed: rloms pa ni nga'o snyam pa'i nga rgyal lo // gzhan du na zhes bya ba ni gal te don byed par rung ba'i yul dpyad par mi 'dod na de'i tshe don byed pa don du gnyer ba'i skyes bu rnams la /
translated: ‚ÄúConceit‚Äù is the pride of thinking ‚ÄúI am.‚Äù

original: dngos po don med par dpyad pa dag ci dgos zhes brjod par bya ba ste /
analyzed: dngos po don med par dpyad pa dag ci dgos zhes brjod par bya ba ste /
translated: ‚ÄúOtherwise,‚Äù if one does not wish to analyze the object that is suitable for causal efficiency, then at that time one should say, ‚ÄúWhat is the use of analyzing the useless thing for persons who seek causal efficiency?‚Äù

original: rtog pa dang ldan pa'i 'jug pa ni dgos pa dang ldan pas khyab pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtog pa dang ldan pa'i 'jug pa ni dgos pa dang ldan pas khyab pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the engagement of conceptual cognition is necessarily purposeful.

original: gal te de ltar gang zag dang gzugs la sogs pa chos rnams gtan med na /
analyzed: gal te de ltar gang zag dang gzugs la sogs pa chos rnams gtan med na /
translated: If persons and forms and so on, all things, do not exist at all,üîΩthen how could there be the four noble truths?

original: ji ltar bdag med pa bsgrub par bya snyam pa la /
analyzed: ji ltar bdag med pa bsgrub par bya snyam pa la /
translated: How is selflessness to be established?

original: dngos po'i rnam pa de lta bu la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa ste /
analyzed: dngos po'i rnam pa de lta bu la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa ste /
translated: In response, it is said, ‚ÄúIn regard to such an aspect of an entity . . .‚Äù

original: 'di skad du don byed nus par grags pa gang yin pa de kho na la sgro btags pa las bzlog pa yod pa'i sgo nas ni gang zag la sogs pa bdag med par sgrub par byed la /
analyzed: 'di skad du don byed nus par grags pa gang yin pa de kho na la sgro btags pa las bzlog pa yod pa'i sgo nas ni gang zag la sogs pa bdag med par sgrub par byed la /
translated: This is to say, that which is renowned as being able to perform a function is only that which is imputed to exist. In regard to that, the person and so on are established as selfless.

original: dgag pa'i sgo nas ni gzugs la sogs pa la phyin ci log tu sgro btags pa'i ngo bo 'gog par byed kyi /
analyzed: dgag pa'i sgo nas ni gzugs la sogs pa la phyin ci log tu sgro btags pa'i ngo bo 'gog par byed kyi /
translated: In regard to form and so on, the essence that is imputed in a distorted way is refuted.

original: gang zag la sogs pa nus pa dang bral ba la gzhi med par 'gog par byed pa ni ma yin no zhes bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: gang zag la sogs pa nus pa dang bral ba la gzhi med par 'gog par byed pa ni ma yin no zhes bshad pa yin no //
translated: However, the person and so on, which are devoid of the ability to perform a function, are not refuted without a basis.

original: 'o na gzhan la ji lta ji ltar bsgrub snyam pa la /
analyzed: 'o na gzhan la ji lta ji ltar bsgrub snyam pa la /
translated: Well then, how is the other to be established?

original: gzhan ni bsgrub pa yang med dgag pa yang med ces bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: gzhan ni bsgrub pa yang med dgag pa yang med ces bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: In response, it is said, ‚ÄúThe other is neither an affirmation nor a negation . . .‚Äù

original: 'o na gang dag gang zag ces bya ba rtag pa la sogs pa'i rnam par brjod du med pa nyid dngos por 'dod pa de dag la ji ltar rang bzhin med pa nyid 'grub par 'gyur /
analyzed: 'o na gang dag gang zag ces bya ba rtag pa la sogs pa'i rnam par brjod du med pa nyid dngos por 'dod pa de dag la ji ltar rang bzhin med pa nyid 'grub par 'gyur /
translated: Well then, how can the nonexistence of intrinsic reality be established for those who assert that the so-called person is inexpressible in terms of permanence and so on, but is a thing?

original: ji ltar 'di la gtan tshigs 'grub par 'gyur snyam pa la /üîΩde lta bas na don byed nus pa ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: ji ltar 'di la gtan tshigs 'grub par 'gyur snyam pa la / de lta bas na don byed nus pa ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: How can the reason be established for them?üîΩTo respond to this, he says, ‚ÄúTherefore, only that which is able to perform a function‚Ä¶‚Äù

original: de nyid kyi phyir 'di ltar mkhas pa rnams ni don byed nus pa la dngos po'i mtshan nyid du rjod par byed la /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir 'di ltar mkhas pa rnams ni don byed nus pa la dngos po'i mtshan nyid du rjod par byed la /
translated: For this very reason, the learned state that the definition of a thing is that which is able to perform a function.

original: don byed nus pa la yang skad cig pa nyid kyis khyab pa yin no //üîΩgzhan ni rim dang cig shos kyis don @91a * //
analyzed: don byed nus pa la yang skad cig pa nyid kyis khyab pa yin no // gzhan ni rim dang cig shos kyis don @91a * //
translated: And that which is able to perform a function is necessarily momentary.

original: byed par 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: byed par 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is contradictory for anything else to perform a function either sequentially or simultaneously.

original: chos can gang zag la yang skad cig pa nyid log na /
analyzed: chos can gang zag la yang skad cig pa nyid log na /
translated: If momentariness is refuted in the person, the subject,

original: skad cig pas khyab pa ji skad smras pa'i yod pa ldog pa yang sgrim mi dgos par grub pa nyid do //
analyzed: skad cig pas khyab pa ji skad smras pa'i yod pa ldog pa yang sgrim mi dgos par grub pa nyid do //
translated: then the existence of the person as it is described is necessarily established without effort, since it is pervaded by momentariness.

original: gzhan yang skad cig skad cig ma yin par zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni gtan tshigs grub par ston par byed de /
analyzed: gzhan yang skad cig skad cig ma yin par zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni gtan tshigs grub par ston par byed de /
translated: Moreover, the statement ‚ÄúIf it were momentary, it would be multiple‚Äù and so on demonstrates the establishment of the reason.

original: skad cig pa yin par gyur na ni rang bzhin gzhan dang gzhan 'byung ba'i phyir du ma'i rang bzhin nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: skad cig pa yin par gyur na ni rang bzhin gzhan dang gzhan 'byung ba'i phyir du ma'i rang bzhin nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: If it were momentary, it would be multiple because of the arising of a different nature.

original: skad cig pa ma yin na ni rang bzhin phyi ma gzhan mi skye ba'i phyir dang / snga ma yang ma zhig pa'i phyir gcig pu nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: skad cig pa ma yin na ni rang bzhin phyi ma gzhan mi skye ba'i phyir dang / snga ma yang ma zhig pa'i phyir gcig pu nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: If it were not momentary, it would be singular because a later different nature would not arise and the former would not disintegrate.

original: gnyi ga'i ngo bo yang mi srid na ni gcig dang du ma'i rang bzhin dang bral bar ji ltar mi 'gyur khyab par byed pa log na khyab par bya ba gnas pa ni med de /
analyzed: gnyi ga'i ngo bo yang mi srid na ni gcig dang du ma'i rang bzhin dang bral bar ji ltar mi 'gyur khyab par byed pa log na khyab par bya ba gnas pa ni med de /
translated: If it were impossible to have the nature of both, how could it not be free from the nature of singularity and multiplicity? When the pervader is stopped, the pervaded does not remain,

original: khyab par byed pas ma khyab pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: khyab par byed pas ma khyab pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it follows that the pervader would not pervade.

original: de'i phyir gang zag la gtan tshigs grub pa kho na yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir gang zag la gtan tshigs grub pa kho na yin no //
translated: Therefore, the reason is only established for the person.

original: re zhig de ltar rtag pa'i phung po gnas pa rnams la gcig dang du ma'i rang bzhin dang bral bar bsgrubs pa yin no //üîΩyang de lta ma yin par phung po gnyis su gzhag nas /
analyzed: re zhig de ltar rtag pa'i phung po gnas pa rnams la gcig dang du ma'i rang bzhin dang bral bar bsgrubs pa yin no // yang de lta ma yin par phung po gnyis su gzhag nas /
translated: Thus, for the time being, it has been established that the enduring aggregates, which are permanent, are devoid of the nature of being one or many.

original: dngos po thams cad las gcig dang du ma'i rang bzhin dang bral bar rab tu bsgrub pa'i phyir gzhan yang gzhan dag gis zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: dngos po thams cad las gcig dang du ma'i rang bzhin dang bral bar rab tu bsgrub pa'i phyir gzhan yang gzhan dag gis zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: Now, in order to establish that all entities are devoid of the nature of being one or many, he says, ‚ÄúMoreover, others have claimed, etc.‚Äù

original: khyab pa zhes bya ba ni thams cad na yod pa ste /
analyzed: khyab pa zhes bya ba ni thams cad na yod pa ste /
translated: ‚ÄúPervasive‚Äù means that which exists everywhere,

original: dper na bdag dang nam mkha' la sogs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na bdag dang nam mkha' la sogs pa lta bu'o //
translated: like the self, space, etc.

original: bzlog pa ni ma khyab pa yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: bzlog pa ni ma khyab pa yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: The opposite of that is known as ‚Äúnon-pervasive.‚Äù

original: rags pa ni yan lag can rnams so //
analyzed: rags pa ni yan lag can rnams so //
translated: The gross are the wholes.

original: rdul phra rab la sogs pa ni phra mo rnams so //
analyzed: rdul phra rab la sogs pa ni phra mo rnams so //
translated: The subtle are the atoms, etc.

original: phung po snga ma bstan pa la mi rtag pa rnams ni ma khyab pa'i phung po'i nang du 'dus par khong du chud par byas te /
analyzed: phung po snga ma bstan pa la mi rtag pa rnams ni ma khyab pa'i phung po'i nang du 'dus par khong du chud par byas te /
translated: The impermanent are included in the category of non-pervasive.

original: des na de dag logs shig tu gcig dang du ma'i rang bzhin dang bral bar rab tu mi bsgrub po //
analyzed: des na de dag logs shig tu gcig dang du ma'i rang bzhin dang bral bar rab tu mi bsgrub po //
translated: Therefore, they are not established separately as being devoid of the nature of unity and multiplicity.

original: bum pa la sogs pa gang dag la tha dad pa'i phyogs yod pa de dag la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: bum pa la sogs pa gang dag la tha dad pa'i phyogs yod pa de dag la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: Those things such as pots that have different parts are said to be such.

original: bsgribs pa dang ma bsgribs pa ni bsgribs pa dang ma bsgribs pa dag go //
analyzed: bsgribs pa dang ma bsgribs pa ni bsgribs pa dang ma bsgribs pa dag go //
translated: The obscured and the non-obscured are the obscured and the non-obscured.

original: de gnyis kyi dngos po ni bsgribs pa nyid la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: de gnyis kyi dngos po ni bsgribs pa nyid la sogs pa ste /
translated: The state of those two is being obscured, etc.

original: sogs pa'i sgras ni g-yo ba dang mi g-yo ba nyid la sogs pa bsdu'o //
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgras ni g-yo ba dang mi g-yo ba nyid la sogs pa bsdu'o //
translated: The word ‚Äúetc.‚Äù includes being mobile and immobile, etc.

original: sbyor ba ni gang dag bum pa la sogs pa phyogs tha dad pa can @91b dag dang ldan pa de dag ni nges par rang bzhin gcig pa ma yin te /
analyzed: sbyor ba ni gang dag bum pa la sogs pa phyogs tha dad pa can @91b dag dang ldan pa de dag ni nges par rang bzhin gcig pa ma yin te /
translated: The syllogism is: Whatever is endowed with different parts, such as a pot, is certainly not of one nature,

original: dper na gzhong bu sna tshogs na 'dug pa'i rgya shug lta bu ste /
analyzed: dper na gzhong bu sna tshogs na 'dug pa'i rgya shug lta bu ste /
translated: like the various kinds of fruit in a basket.

original: nam mkha' la sogs pa'i dngos po rnams kyang phyogs tha dad pa can dang ldan pas khyab par byed pa 'gal ba dmigs pa yin te /
analyzed: nam mkha' la sogs pa'i dngos po rnams kyang phyogs tha dad pa can dang ldan pas khyab par byed pa 'gal ba dmigs pa yin te /
translated: Since things such as space are also endowed with different parts, the observation of an incompatible pervader is as follows.

original: 'di ni thal bar 'gyur bar bsgrub pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni thal bar 'gyur bar bsgrub pa yin no //
translated: This is the proof of the reductio.

original: gtan tshigs kyi khyab pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gtan tshigs kyi khyab pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate the pervasion of the reason,

original: nam mkha' la sogs pa phyogs tha dad pa'i shing la sogs pa dang 'brel pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: nam mkha' la sogs pa phyogs tha dad pa'i shing la sogs pa dang 'brel pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: he says, ‚ÄúIf it is related to trees, etc., in different directions, such as the east, etc.,‚Äù and so on.

original: gal te rang bzhin tha dad pa nyid du khas mi len na ni /
analyzed: gal te rang bzhin tha dad pa nyid du khas mi len na ni /
translated: If one does not accept that they are different in nature,

original: de'i tshe nam mkha' la sogs pa dang 'brel pa'i rang bzhin gsal ba thams cad phyogs gcig par thal bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de'i tshe nam mkha' la sogs pa dang 'brel pa'i rang bzhin gsal ba thams cad phyogs gcig par thal bar 'gyur te /
translated: then it follows, absurdly, that all the manifestations related to space, etc., would be in one place,

original: spyi la sogs pa dngos po gcig dang 'brel pa'i rang gi ngo bo yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: spyi la sogs pa dngos po gcig dang 'brel pa'i rang gi ngo bo yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the nature of universals, etc., is to be related to a single entity.

original: de lta ma yin te //
analyzed: de lta ma yin te //
translated: If that is not the case,

original: phyogs tha dad pa yin na ni spyi la sogs pa de nyid gzhan na gnas par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: phyogs tha dad pa yin na ni spyi la sogs pa de nyid gzhan na gnas par mi 'gyur te /
translated: then, being in different directions, those universals, etc., would not exist in another place,

original: de gsal ba gcig gis bsdus pa'i rang gi ngo bo yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de gsal ba gcig gis bsdus pa'i rang gi ngo bo yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because their nature is to be subsumed under a single manifestation.

original: rang bzhin tha dad pa gzhan yang med pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: rang bzhin tha dad pa gzhan yang med pa'i phyir te /
translated: There would be no other different nature.

original: rang bzhin med na 'brel pa mi rung bsam nges pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: rang bzhin med na 'brel pa mi rung bsam nges pa nyid yin no //
translated: If they are essenceless, it is impossible for them to be related.

original: rags pa rnams kyang bsgribs pa dang ma bsgribs pa nyid la sogs pa phan tshun 'gal ba'i chos gnas pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rags pa rnams kyang bsgribs pa dang ma bsgribs pa nyid la sogs pa phan tshun 'gal ba'i chos gnas pa'i phyir /
translated: It is not tenable for the coarse to be essentially one, because mutually contradictory phenomena, such as being obscured and being unobscured, are observed in them.

original: lus can dang lus can ma yin pa bzhin du rang bzhin gcig pa nyid du rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: lus can dang lus can ma yin pa bzhin du rang bzhin gcig pa nyid du rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: It is not tenable for the coarse to be essentially one, just as it is not tenable for the embodied and the nonembodied to be essentially one.

original: gal te bsgribs pa la sogs pa yan lag rnams kyi yin gyi zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni pha rol pos ma grub pa nyid du brjod pa'i dogs pa bsal ba ste /
analyzed: gal te bsgribs pa la sogs pa yan lag rnams kyi yin gyi zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni pha rol pos ma grub pa nyid du brjod pa'i dogs pa bsal ba ste /
translated: If you say that the obscurations and so on are the properties of the parts,

original: pha rol gyi bsam pa ni rten dngos po gcig la bsgribs pa nyid la sogs pa 'gal gyi /
analyzed: pha rol gyi bsam pa ni rten dngos po gcig la bsgribs pa nyid la sogs pa 'gal gyi /
translated: the opponent‚Äôs position is as follows: The obscurations and so on are contradictory in the sense that they are mutually exclusive properties of a single thing.

original: rten tha dad pa la ni ma yin te /
analyzed: rten tha dad pa la ni ma yin te /
translated: They are not contradictory in the sense that they are mutually exclusive properties of different things.

original: yan lag gcig la ni bsgribs pa dang ma bsgribs pa nyid la sogs pa ma grub bo //
analyzed: yan lag gcig la ni bsgribs pa dang ma bsgribs pa nyid la sogs pa ma grub bo //
translated: The obscurations and the unobscured are not established as the properties of a single part.

original: 'o na ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: If that is so, then what are they?

original: yan lag rnams la ste de'i phyir gtan tshigs ma grub po snyam pa yin no //
analyzed: yan lag rnams la ste de'i phyir gtan tshigs ma grub po snyam pa yin no //
translated: They are the properties of the parts. Therefore, the reason is not established.

original: ci yan lag can 'di dag ces bya ba la sogs pas ni lan 'debs par byed do //
analyzed: ci yan lag can 'di dag ces bya ba la sogs pas ni lan 'debs par byed do //
translated: ‚ÄúHow are they members?‚Äù He replies:

original: de la yan lag can dag ji ste na yan lag rnams dang ldan nam mi ldan zhes bya ba phyogs gnyis te /
analyzed: de la yan lag can dag ji ste na yan lag rnams dang ldan nam mi ldan zhes bya ba phyogs gnyis te /
translated: ‚ÄúAre members connected to the whole or not?‚Äù This is the twofold position.

original: re zhig gal te mi ldan zhes bya ba'i phyogs yin na ni de'i tshe bsgribs pa la sogs pa dag yan lag rnams kyi yin gyi /
analyzed: re zhig gal te mi ldan zhes bya ba'i phyogs yin na ni de'i tshe bsgribs pa la sogs pa dag yan lag rnams kyi yin gyi /
translated: If the position is that they are not connected, then it is true that the obscured and so on are of the members,

original: @92a * // yan lag can gyi ma yin no zhes gang smras pa de ni bden na /
analyzed: @92a * // yan lag can gyi ma yin no zhes gang smras pa de ni bden na /
translated: but not of the whole.

original: 'on kyang yul phan tshun rnam par chad pas bsgribs pa dang ma bsgribs pa la sogs pa chos mi mthun par gnas pa dmigs pa'i rig byar gyur pa lus de dang rkang pa la sogs pa yul tha dad pa na gnas pa'i phyir so so so sor ci'i
analyzed: 'on kyang yul phan tshun rnam par chad pas bsgribs pa dang ma bsgribs pa la sogs pa chos mi mthun par gnas pa dmigs pa'i rig byar gyur pa lus de dang rkang pa la sogs pa yul tha dad pa na gnas pa'i phyir so so so sor ci'i
translated: However, the body is observed as a perceptible object, with the obscured and the unobscured, and so on, existing in different places, in different locations. The feet and so on are in different places.

original: phyir mig gi spyod yul du mi 'gyur ba brjod par bya dgos so //
analyzed: phyir mig gi spyod yul du mi 'gyur ba brjod par bya dgos so //
translated: Therefore, it must be explained why they are not the objects of the eye.

original: 'on te ldan pa zhes bya ba'i phyogs yin no zhe na ni de'i tshe nges par chos 'gal ba gnas par thal bar 'gyur ro zhes ston par byed do //
analyzed: 'on te ldan pa zhes bya ba'i phyogs yin no zhe na ni de'i tshe nges par chos 'gal ba gnas par thal bar 'gyur ro zhes ston par byed do //
translated: But if you maintain the position that they are possessed, then at that time, it would follow that contradictory attributes would be present.üîΩIf you say that they are that,

original: gal te de dag kyang de yin no zhe na zhes bya ba la pha rol gyi bsam pa ni /
analyzed: gal te de dag kyang de yin no zhe na zhes bya ba la pha rol gyi bsam pa ni /
translated: the opponent‚Äôs idea is this:

original: gang gi phyir yan lag can de dang yan lag de dag 'du ba'i mtshan nyid kyi 'brel pa can yin pa de'i phyir logs shig tu dmigs par mi 'gyur ro snyam pa yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir yan lag can de dang yan lag de dag 'du ba'i mtshan nyid kyi 'brel pa can yin pa de'i phyir logs shig tu dmigs par mi 'gyur ro snyam pa yin no //
translated: because the whole and its parts are related by the characteristic of aggregation, they are not perceived separately.

original: de nyid do zhes bya ba ni dris na de nyid do zhes pha rol khas len pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid do zhes bya ba ni dris na de nyid do zhes pha rol khas len pa'o //
translated: If you say that they are that,

original: gal te de nyid do zhes khyod khas mi len na ni de'i tshe nyes pa cir 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: gal te de nyid do zhes khyod khas mi len na ni de'i tshe nyes pa cir 'gyur zhe na /
translated: if you do not accept that they are that, then what is the error?

original: gzhan du na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: gzhan du na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: He says, ‚ÄúOtherwise, etc.‚Äù

original: rags pa ni du ma tshogs pa tsam kho na yin par 'gyur gyi gcig pu ni ma yin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rags pa ni du ma tshogs pa tsam kho na yin par 'gyur gyi gcig pu ni ma yin par 'gyur ro //
translated: The gross would be a mere collection of many, but it would not be a single unit.

original: 'di ni de bas kyang ches rags te zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni chos 'gal ba gnas par sgrub par byed de /
analyzed: 'di ni de bas kyang ches rags te zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni chos 'gal ba gnas par sgrub par byed de /
translated: Thus, he proves that contradictory properties are present in the same thing.

original: 'di ltar rags pa gang zhig yan lag dmigs pa dang ldan par kun tu dmigs pa de nyid yan lag bsgribs pa la yang yod pas /
analyzed: 'di ltar rags pa gang zhig yan lag dmigs pa dang ldan par kun tu dmigs pa de nyid yan lag bsgribs pa la yang yod pas /
translated: For, that which is gross and is perceived as having parts is also present in that which has obscured parts.

original: yan lag bsgribs pa la yang de kho na bzhin du dmigs par 'gyur ba zhig na ni mi dmigs te /üîΩde lta bas na bsgribs pa dang ma bsgribs pa nyid la sogs pa chos 'gal ba gnas par grub pa nyid do //
analyzed: yan lag bsgribs pa la yang de kho na bzhin du dmigs par 'gyur ba zhig na ni mi dmigs te / de lta bas na bsgribs pa dang ma bsgribs pa nyid la sogs pa chos 'gal ba gnas par grub pa nyid do //
translated: But, it is not perceived in that which has obscured parts, just as it is in that which has unobstructed parts.üîΩTherefore, it is established that contradictory properties such as being obstructed and unobstructed, etc., are present in the same thing.

original: re zhig de ltar rags pa rnams la rang bzhin gcig pa nyid bsal ba yin no //
analyzed: re zhig de ltar rags pa rnams la rang bzhin gcig pa nyid bsal ba yin no //
translated: Thus, the identity of nature of gross things is refuted.

original: da ni rdul phra rab rnams la yang bsal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: da ni rdul phra rab rnams la yang bsal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Now, in order to refute the identity of nature of atoms, he says,

original: 'on kyang gang thog mar de rtsom pa'am zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: 'on kyang gang thog mar de rtsom pa'am zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: But, at the very beginning, when it is commenced, etc.

original: thog mar de rtsom pa zhes bya ba ni ji ltar bye brag pa rnams kyis yongs su brtags pa lta bu ston par byed pa ste /
analyzed: thog mar de rtsom pa zhes bya ba ni ji ltar bye brag pa rnams kyis yongs su brtags pa lta bu ston par byed pa ste /
translated: First, the composition of the world is like the way the Vai≈õe·π£ikas imagine it.

original: de dag ni rdul phra rab gnyis pa la sogs pa rags pa'i rdzas dang po rtsom par byed pa ni rdul phra rab rnams kho na yin par 'dod do //
analyzed: de dag ni rdul phra rab gnyis pa la sogs pa rags pa'i rdzas dang po rtsom par byed pa ni rdul phra rab rnams kho na yin par 'dod do //
translated: They assert that the cause of the composition of gross substances such as a dyad is the subtle particles themselves.

original: rags pa gdags pa'i rgyu zhes bya ba ni mdo sde pa'i lugs su bshad pa ste /
analyzed: rags pa gdags pa'i rgyu zhes bya ba ni mdo sde pa'i lugs su bshad pa ste /
translated: The cause of the imputation of gross objects is the system of the SautrƒÅntikas.

original: de dag ni rags pa gdags @92b pa'i rgyu rdul phra rab rnams de ltar gnas pa 'ba' zhig tu zad kyi rdzas gzhan ni med do zhes brjod do //
analyzed: de dag ni rags pa gdags @92b pa'i rgyu rdul phra rab rnams de ltar gnas pa 'ba' zhig tu zad kyi rdzas gzhan ni med do zhes brjod do //
translated: They say that the cause of the imputation of gross objects is subtle particles that exist in that way alone and there is no other substance.

original: de la kha cig na re rdul phra rab rnams la phra rab phan tshun reg go zhes zer ro //
analyzed: de la kha cig na re rdul phra rab rnams la phra rab phan tshun reg go zhes zer ro //
translated: Some say that subtle particles touch each other.

original: gzhan dag na re rigs mthun pa mang pos bskor ba rnams ni bar dang bcas pa kho na yin la /
analyzed: gzhan dag na re rigs mthun pa mang pos bskor ba rnams ni bar dang bcas pa kho na yin la /
translated: Others say that those surrounded by many of the same type have interstice.

original: rags par 'khrul pa'i rgyu mtshan yin no zhes zer te /
analyzed: rags par 'khrul pa'i rgyu mtshan yin no zhes zer te /
translated: They are the cause of the error of gross objects.

original: dper na slob dpon dge bsrungs kyis /
analyzed: dper na slob dpon dge bsrungs kyis /
translated: For example, the master Vasubandhu,üîΩwith the intention of refuting the statement,

original: gang la phyogs cha tha dad yod //
analyzed: gang la phyogs cha tha dad yod //
translated: Whatever has directional parts

original: de ni gcig pu mi rung ngo //
analyzed: de ni gcig pu mi rung ngo //
translated: cannot be a single unit,

original: zhes bya ba 'di sun dbyung ba'i bsam pas /
analyzed: zhes bya ba 'di sun dbyung ba'i bsam pas /
translated: said,üîΩMany things surround a single thing

original: tha dad phyogs nas mang po dag /'ga' la kun nas bskor tsam du //üîΩbrjod par zad kyi rdul de ni //
analyzed: tha dad phyogs nas mang po dag /'ga' la kun nas bskor tsam du // brjod par zad kyi rdul de ni //
translated: from various directions,üîΩbut the atom does not have

original: cha shas bcas pa'i bdag nyid min //üîΩzhes bshad pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: cha shas bcas pa'i bdag nyid min // zhes bshad pa lta bu'o //
translated: a nature of parts.

original: 'di'i don ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: 'di'i don ni 'di yin te /
translated: The meaning of this is as follows.

original: tha dad phyogs nas zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs 'dis ni rdul phra rab mang po rnams kyis yongs su bskor ba tsam du brjod par 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: tha dad phyogs nas zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs 'dis ni rdul phra rab mang po rnams kyis yongs su bskor ba tsam du brjod par 'gyur gyi /
translated: The reason, ‚Äúfrom various directions,‚Äù indicates that many atoms merely surround a single atom.

original: yan lag dang bcas pa ni ma yin no zhes bya bar zad de /
analyzed: yan lag dang bcas pa ni ma yin no zhes bya bar zad de /
translated: It does not indicate that they have parts.

original: 'dir yang bar dang bcas pa dag kho nar gnas so zhes de snyam du bsams nas smras pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dir yang bar dang bcas pa dag kho nar gnas so zhes de snyam du bsams nas smras pa yin no //
translated: Here also, they merely exist with interstice.

original: gzhan dag na re reg pa yang ma yin la bar dang bcas pa dag kyang ma yin mod kyi /
analyzed: gzhan dag na re reg pa yang ma yin la bar dang bcas pa dag kyang ma yin mod kyi /
translated: Others say: They do not touch and they do not have interstice.

original: 'dab chags pa kho nar gnas so zhes zer te /
analyzed: 'dab chags pa kho nar gnas so zhes zer te /
translated: They are in mutual contact, but not in mutual conjunction.

original: ji skad du btsun pa na re rdul rnams mi reg kyang bar med pas reg par 'du shes so zhes zer ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: ji skad du btsun pa na re rdul rnams mi reg kyang bar med pas reg par 'du shes so zhes zer ba lta bu'o //
translated: Just as the Bhadanta says, ‚ÄúThe atoms do not touch one another, but they are conceived to do so because there is no space between them.‚Äù

original: de la phyogs dang po ltar na bdag nyid thams cad kyis 'byar na ni thams cad kyi rang bzhin phan tshun rjes su zhugs pa'i phyir gong bu rdul phra rab gcig tsam du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de la phyogs dang po ltar na bdag nyid thams cad kyis 'byar na ni thams cad kyi rang bzhin phan tshun rjes su zhugs pa'i phyir gong bu rdul phra rab gcig tsam du 'gyur ro //
translated: If they are joined in all ways, then the entire nature of each atom enters into the other, and the mass becomes only one atom.

original: bdag nyid thams cad kyis zhes bya ba ni rdul phra rab kyi rang bzhin ci 'dra ba de khyab nas zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: bdag nyid thams cad kyis zhes bya ba ni rdul phra rab kyi rang bzhin ci 'dra ba de khyab nas zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: ‚ÄúIn all ways‚Äù means that the nature of the atom is completely pervaded.

original: phyogs gcig gis zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin ma khyab nas zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: phyogs gcig gis zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin ma khyab nas zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: ‚ÄúIn one way‚Äù means that the nature is not completely pervaded.

original: des ni snang byed kyi rdul phra rab ni rang bzhin gcig pa yin pas thams cad ces bya ba dang phyogs gcig ces bya ba'i sgra mi 'thad de /
analyzed: des ni snang byed kyi rdul phra rab ni rang bzhin gcig pa yin pas thams cad ces bya ba dang phyogs gcig ces bya ba'i sgra mi 'thad de /
translated: In that case, the atom of light is of one nature, and the words ‚Äúall‚Äù and ‚Äúone‚Äù are not tenable.

original: thams cad dang phyogs gcig ni yul tha dad pa'i phyir ro zhes gang smras pa de bsal ba yin no //
analyzed: thams cad dang phyogs gcig ni yul tha dad pa'i phyir ro zhes gang smras pa de bsal ba yin no //
translated: But this is not so, because the object fields are different.

original: phyogs gnyis pa ltar na yang rigs mthun pa rnams dang reg par mi 'dod du chug kyang /
analyzed: phyogs gnyis pa ltar na yang rigs mthun pa rnams dang reg par mi 'dod du chug kyang /
translated: Even if you do not accept that homogeneous particles touch,

original: phrag ni snang ba dang mun pa'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir rigs mi mthun pa snang ba dang / mun pa'i rdul phra rab rnams dang ni reg par 'dod pa nyid @93a * //üîΩdo ; / snang bas ma non pa'i mun pa dang bral ba nyid dam /
analyzed: phrag ni snang ba dang mun pa'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir rigs mi mthun pa snang ba dang / mun pa'i rdul phra rab rnams dang ni reg par 'dod pa nyid @93a * // do ; / snang bas ma non pa'i mun pa dang bral ba nyid dam /
translated: you must accept that heterogeneous particles, such as light and darkness, touch, because the side facing is the nature of light and darkness.

original: mun pas gnas su ma byas pa'i snang ba dang bral ba nyid ni rigs pa dang ldan pa ma yin te /
analyzed: mun pas gnas su ma byas pa'i snang ba dang bral ba nyid ni rigs pa dang ldan pa ma yin te /
translated: It is illogical to say that light is not associated with darkness or that darkness is not associated with light,

original: de gnyis 'byung ba ni yul la sogs pa phan tshun bral ba tsam la rag las pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de gnyis 'byung ba ni yul la sogs pa phan tshun bral ba tsam la rag las pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the occurrence of these two depends on the mere absence of each other.

original: bar med pa'i phyogs kyang phrad pa'i phyogs kho na'i khongs su 'dus te /
analyzed: bar med pa'i phyogs kyang phrad pa'i phyogs kho na'i khongs su 'dus te /
translated: The position of no interstice is included in the position of contact,

original: phrad pa'i rnam grangs yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phrad pa'i rnam grangs yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is a synonym of contact.

original: bar gyi yul dang bral ba rnams la ni 'byar ba ma gtogs pa rnam pa gzhan med do //
analyzed: bar gyi yul dang bral ba rnams la ni 'byar ba ma gtogs pa rnam pa gzhan med do //
translated: But those that are not in the middle have no other aspect except being joined.

original: don de nyid sgra gzhan gyis brjod kyang gzhan du ni mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: don de nyid sgra gzhan gyis brjod kyang gzhan du ni mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Even if the meaning is expressed by other words, it does not become different.

original: phyogs thams cad spyir sun dbyung bar 'byar ba dang ni bskor ba'am zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: phyogs thams cad spyir sun dbyung bar 'byar ba dang ni bskor ba'am zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: In order to refute all positions in general, he says ‚Äúencircling‚Äù and so on.

original: de la dbus na yod pa'i rdul phra rab gang yin pa de rang bzhin gang gis rdul phra rab gcig la bltas te gnas pa de nyid kyis gzhan la bltas sam /
analyzed: de la dbus na yod pa'i rdul phra rab gang yin pa de rang bzhin gang gis rdul phra rab gcig la bltas te gnas pa de nyid kyis gzhan la bltas sam /
translated: In this regard, is the atom in the middle, by virtue of its own nature, facing one atom, or is it facing all atoms?

original: 'on te ma yin zhes bya ba brtag pa gnyis so //
analyzed: 'on te ma yin zhes bya ba brtag pa gnyis so //
translated: These are the two alternatives.

original: de la phyogs dang po ltar na bskor ba'i rdul phra rab thams cad phyogs gcig pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de la phyogs dang po ltar na bskor ba'i rdul phra rab thams cad phyogs gcig pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur te /
translated: In the first case, it follows that all atoms in the encircling periphery would be in one place,

original: de'i rang bzhin la bltas pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i rang bzhin la bltas pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: because they would be facing the same direction.

original: rdul phra mo gang la rang bzhin de gcig yod pa de ni de'i rang bzhin yin la rdul phra mo gang la de'i rang bzhin gyi rdul phra mo la bltas pa yod pa zhes tshig rnam par sbyar te de'i dngos po ni de nyid do //
analyzed: rdul phra mo gang la rang bzhin de gcig yod pa de ni de'i rang bzhin yin la rdul phra mo gang la de'i rang bzhin gyi rdul phra mo la bltas pa yod pa zhes tshig rnam par sbyar te de'i dngos po ni de nyid do //
translated: That subtle particle which has that nature as one is its nature. That subtle particle which has the subtle particle that is its nature as one is called ‚Äúhaving the view of that.‚Äù Its entity is just that.

original: sbyar ba ni rdul phra rab kyi ngo bo gcig la bltas pa'i rang bzhin gang yin pa de ni phyogs gcig pa can yin te /
analyzed: sbyar ba ni rdul phra rab kyi ngo bo gcig la bltas pa'i rang bzhin gang yin pa de ni phyogs gcig pa can yin te /
translated: The application is this: That which is the nature of the view of one entity of a subtle particle is one part.

original: dper na dbus na gnas pa'i rdul phra rab de nyid kyi shar phyogs na gnas pa'i rdul phra rab lta bu'am /
analyzed: dper na dbus na gnas pa'i rdul phra rab de nyid kyi shar phyogs na gnas pa'i rdul phra rab lta bu'am /
translated: For example, it is like the subtle particle that is located in the east of that very subtle particle that is located in the middle,

original: shar phyogs kyi khang pa la khang pa gcig bltas pa lta bu ste /
analyzed: shar phyogs kyi khang pa la khang pa gcig bltas pa lta bu ste /
translated: or like the house that is located in the east that is the view of one house.

original: bskor ba'i rdul phra rab thams cad kyang rdul phra rab gcig la bltas pa'i rang bzhin yin pas zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //
analyzed: bskor ba'i rdul phra rab thams cad kyang rdul phra rab gcig la bltas pa'i rang bzhin yin pas zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //
translated: Since all the surrounding subtle particles are the nature of the view of one subtle particle, this is called a reason of nature.

original: phyogs tha dad pa na gnas pa yin na ni mngon par 'dod pa'i rdul phra rab gcig pu la bltas pa'i rang bzhin dag tu mi 'gyur te ;
analyzed: phyogs tha dad pa na gnas pa yin na ni mngon par 'dod pa'i rdul phra rab gcig pu la bltas pa'i rang bzhin dag tu mi 'gyur te ;
translated: If they were to exist in different directions, then the nature of the single subtle particle that is the object of desire would not be seen,

original: rdul phra rab de la rang bzhin gzhan med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rdul phra rab de la rang bzhin gzhan med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because that subtle particle would not have another nature.

original: rang bzhin med na bltas pa yang mi rung ba'i phyir gtan tshigs ma nges pa nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: rang bzhin med na bltas pa yang mi rung ba'i phyir gtan tshigs ma nges pa nyid ma yin no //
translated: If it did not have a nature, then it would not be suitable to be seen, so the reason is not indeterminate.

original: de'i phyir yang dag par na bskor te gnas pa med pas rdul phra rab rnams rgyas par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir yang dag par na bskor te gnas pa med pas rdul phra rab rnams rgyas par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, since it does not exist in reality, the subtle particles do not expand.

original: phyogs gnyis pa ltar na yang yan @93b lag dang bcas pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur bar gsal bar rab tu bdag gis rnam par ma phye'o //
analyzed: phyogs gnyis pa ltar na yang yan @93b lag dang bcas pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur bar gsal bar rab tu bdag gis rnam par ma phye'o //
translated: If it were the second position, then it is clear that the consequence of having parts would follow, but I have not analyzed this in detail.

original: rdul phra mo rnams rang bzhin med pa nyid du grub pa kho nas rdul phra mo la ltos nas rab tu brtags pa'i bdag nyid du gnas pa'i chos thams cad rang bzhin med pa nyid du 'bad mi dgos par grub pa nyid do zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rdul phra mo rnams rang bzhin med pa nyid du grub pa kho nas rdul phra mo la ltos nas rab tu brtags pa'i bdag nyid du gnas pa'i chos thams cad rang bzhin med pa nyid du 'bad mi dgos par grub pa nyid do zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: It is only by establishing that the subtle particles are devoid of intrinsic existence that one can effortlessly establish that all phenomena, which are imputed in dependence on the subtle particles, are also devoid of intrinsic existence.üîΩ

original: rdul phran rang bzhin med grub pa //
analyzed: rdul phran rang bzhin med grub pa //
translated: Just by establishing that the subtle particles are essenceless, it is not necessary to make an effort to establish that all phenomena that exist in the nature of being imputed in dependence on the subtle particles are essenceless.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: To demonstrate this, he says,üîΩThe establishment of the essencelessness of the subtle particles.

original: 'dir 'thad pa /
analyzed: 'dir 'thad pa /
translated: Here, the argument is

original: de yi rang bzhin des brtsams dag / zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de yi rang bzhin des brtsams dag / zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The nature of that is not composed of that.

original: de la re zhig rang gi sde pa rnams ni gzugs can gyi khams rnams su rnam par gzhag pa gang dag yin pa de dag ni rdul phra rab kyi rang bzhin kho na yin par 'dod do //
analyzed: de la re zhig rang gi sde pa rnams ni gzugs can gyi khams rnams su rnam par gzhag pa gang dag yin pa de dag ni rdul phra rab kyi rang bzhin kho na yin par 'dod do //
translated: First, our own schools assert that those that are posited as the elements with form are only the nature of subtle particles.

original: khams gzhan gang dag yin pa de dag kyang dngos su'am brgyud pas rdul phra rab la brten pa yin pa'i phyir rdul phra rab kyis brtsams pa yin pa kho nar brjod do //üîΩbye brag la sogs pa ni rdul phra mo gnyis po la sogs pa'i bar 'bras bu'i rdzas ni rdul phra rab rnams kyis dngos dang brgyud de brtsams pa kho nar 'dod do //
analyzed: khams gzhan gang dag yin pa de dag kyang dngos su'am brgyud pas rdul phra rab la brten pa yin pa'i phyir rdul phra rab kyis brtsams pa yin pa kho nar brjod do // bye brag la sogs pa ni rdul phra mo gnyis po la sogs pa'i bar 'bras bu'i rdzas ni rdul phra rab rnams kyis dngos dang brgyud de brtsams pa kho nar 'dod do //
translated: The other elements are either directly or indirectly based on the most subtle particles, and therefore they are said to be composed of the most subtle particles.üîΩThe qualities of number, dimension, separateness, conjunction, disjunction, priority, posteriority, and so on are accepted as being either directly or indirectly the qualities of the substances.

original: grangs la sogs pa yon tan rnams kyang phal cher mngon sum mam brgyud pas rdzas rnams kho na yin par khas len te /
analyzed: grangs la sogs pa yon tan rnams kyang phal cher mngon sum mam brgyud pas rdzas rnams kho na yin par khas len te /
translated: The qualities of number and so on are also accepted as being either directly or indirectly the qualities of the substances alone.

original: de'i phyir de dag gi yon tan yin pas de'i yon tan zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir de dag gi yon tan yin pas de'i yon tan zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, they are called the qualities of those.

original: 'degs pa la sogs pa las kyi bye brag rnams kyang phal cher mngon sum mam brgyud pas de'i las kyi rang bzhin dag yin te /
analyzed: 'degs pa la sogs pa las kyi bye brag rnams kyang phal cher mngon sum mam brgyud pas de'i las kyi rang bzhin dag yin te /
translated: The specific actions of lifting and so on are also accepted as being either directly or indirectly the actions of those substances alone.

original: las ni lus can gyi rdzas la brten pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: las ni lus can gyi rdzas la brten pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because action is based on a substantial entity that possesses it.

original: de dag gi las ni de'i las te las kyi bye brag gang dag la de'i rang bzhin de nyid yod pa de dag la de skad ces bya'o//
analyzed: de dag gi las ni de'i las te las kyi bye brag gang dag la de'i rang bzhin de nyid yod pa de dag la de skad ces bya'o//
translated: The action of those is their action. Those specific actions that have that nature are called that.

original: spyi yang rnam pa gnyis yin la /üîΩkhyad par rnams kyang rdzas tha ma la yod pa dag yin pas spyi dang khyad par te /
analyzed: spyi yang rnam pa gnyis yin la / khyad par rnams kyang rdzas tha ma la yod pa dag yin pas spyi dang khyad par te /
translated: Universals are also of two kinds.

original: rdzas rnams kyi spyi dang khyad par zhes bya bar tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
analyzed: rdzas rnams kyi spyi dang khyad par zhes bya bar tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
translated: Particulars are also those that exist in the final substances. Thus, universals and particulars are called the universals and particulars of substances.üîΩThe term is to be analyzed in this way.

original: de 'di ltar spyi yod pa nyid dang ba lang nyid la sogs pa ni rdzas dang yon tan dang las gsum dang ldan pa'i phyir phal cher dngos su'am brgyud pas de dag la brten pa nyid do //
analyzed: de 'di ltar spyi yod pa nyid dang ba lang nyid la sogs pa ni rdzas dang yon tan dang las gsum dang ldan pa'i phyir phal cher dngos su'am brgyud pas de dag la brten pa nyid do //
translated: Thus, universals such as existence and cowness and so on are possessed by the three substances, qualities, and actions, and they are generally directly or indirectly based on them.

original: khyad par rnams kyang phal cher dngos su de dag la brten pa dag kho na yin no //
analyzed: khyad par rnams kyang phal cher dngos su de dag la brten pa dag kho na yin no //
translated: Particulars are generally directly based on them alone.

original: 'bras bu'i rdzas la sogs pa ji skad bshad pa de dag kyang gang gi phyir 'du ba zhes bya ba'i 'brel ba'i stobs kyis de dang 'du ba can du 'dod pa de'i @94a * //
analyzed: 'bras bu'i rdzas la sogs pa ji skad bshad pa de dag kyang gang gi phyir 'du ba zhes bya ba'i 'brel ba'i stobs kyis de dang 'du ba can du 'dod pa de'i @94a * //
translated: The substance of the effect, etc., as they have been explained, are also called ‚Äúcomposites‚Äù by the power of the relation called ‚Äúinherence.‚Äù

original: phyir 'brel pa can rnams med pas 'brel pa can dang 'brel ba'i ngo bo 'du ba yang med pa kho na'o //
analyzed: phyir 'brel pa can rnams med pas 'brel pa can dang 'brel ba'i ngo bo 'du ba yang med pa kho na'o //
translated: Therefore, since the relata do not exist, the nature of the relation called ‚Äúinherence‚Äù in the relata also does not exist.

original: de'i phyir 'di dag thams cad ni rdul phra rab kyi rtsa ba can yin pa'i phyir rdul phra rab kun tu chad na ji ltar gnas thob par 'gyur /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di dag thams cad ni rdul phra rab kyi rtsa ba can yin pa'i phyir rdul phra rab kun tu chad na ji ltar gnas thob par 'gyur /
translated: Therefore, since all of these are rooted in the atom, how can they be established when the atom is refuted?

original: rang gi sde pa dag ni gzugs can gyi khams bcu po dag rdul phra rab bsags pa yin par brjod de zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni tshig le'ur byas pa'i don rnam par 'grel par byed do //
analyzed: rang gi sde pa dag ni gzugs can gyi khams bcu po dag rdul phra rab bsags pa yin par brjod de zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni tshig le'ur byas pa'i don rnam par 'grel par byed do //
translated: The VaibhƒÅ·π£ikas say that the ten physical constituents are aggregations of atoms.

original: 'o na 'dus ma byas la thabs ci yod snyam pa la /
analyzed: 'o na 'dus ma byas la thabs ci yod snyam pa la /
translated: Now, what is the method for the unconditioned?

original: nam mkha' la sogs pa 'dus ma byas mtha' dag kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: nam mkha' la sogs pa 'dus ma byas mtha' dag kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: and also all the unconditioned things such as space, etc.

original: yon tan rnams kyang phal cher zhes bya ba ni sgra la sogs pa rdul phra rab kyi yon tan ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yon tan rnams kyang phal cher zhes bya ba ni sgra la sogs pa rdul phra rab kyi yon tan ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The word ‚Äúmostly‚Äù is used because sound, etc. are not the qualities of the atoms.

original: brten pa rnams ni dngos su 'bras bu'i rdzas la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: brten pa rnams ni dngos su 'bras bu'i rdzas la sogs pa'o //
translated: The ‚Äúsupported‚Äù are the substances, etc. which are the effects.

original: nye bar brten pa rnams ni brten pa la brten pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: nye bar brten pa rnams ni brten pa la brten pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The ‚Äúsupported-upon-the-supported‚Äù are the substances, etc. which are supported upon the supported.

original: nam mkha' la sogs pa rdul phra rab la mi brten pa ji ltar dgag snyam pa la /
analyzed: nam mkha' la sogs pa rdul phra rab la mi brten pa ji ltar dgag snyam pa la /
translated: How can space, etc. be denied as not supported by the atoms?

original: rtag pa'i dngos po nam mkha' dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: rtag pa'i dngos po nam mkha' dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The word ‚Äúpermanent‚Äù is used in the phrase ‚Äúpermanent things such as space,‚Äù etc.

original: lhag ma ni go sla'o //
analyzed: lhag ma ni go sla'o //
translated: The rest is easy to understand.

original: gnyis dang gnyis ma yin pa'i tshul du brjod pa dngos su bstan par bya'o zhes bya ba ni rnam par shes pa'i phung po mtshungs par ldan pa dang bcas pa rang bzhin med pa nyid ces bya ba rnal ma dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: gnyis dang gnyis ma yin pa'i tshul du brjod pa dngos su bstan par bya'o zhes bya ba ni rnam par shes pa'i phung po mtshungs par ldan pa dang bcas pa rang bzhin med pa nyid ces bya ba rnal ma dang sbyar ro //
translated: The expression ‚Äúthe two and not the two‚Äù should be explained as follows: The phrase ‚Äúthe aggregate of consciousness together with its concomitant factors is essenceless‚Äù is the correct one.

original: de la shes pa dang shes bya yod pa nyid kyi tshul ni gnyis kyi tshul lo //
analyzed: de la shes pa dang shes bya yod pa nyid kyi tshul ni gnyis kyi tshul lo //
translated: The mode of the existence of both consciousness and objects of consciousness is the mode of the two.

original: shes pa tsam yod pa nyid kyi tshul ni gnyis ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: shes pa tsam yod pa nyid kyi tshul ni gnyis ma yin pa'o //
translated: The mode of the existence of consciousness only is the non-dual mode.

original: de la gnyis kyi tshul la yang rnam pa gnyis te kha cig na re shes pa rnam pa med pa kho nas yul rtogs par 'gyur ro zhes zer ro //
analyzed: de la gnyis kyi tshul la yang rnam pa gnyis te kha cig na re shes pa rnam pa med pa kho nas yul rtogs par 'gyur ro zhes zer ro //
translated: The mode of the two has two aspects. Some say that consciousness without aspects is the apprehender of objects.

original: gzhan dag na re rnam pa dang bcas pa kho na'o zhes zer ro //
analyzed: gzhan dag na re rnam pa dang bcas pa kho na'o zhes zer ro //
translated: Others say that it has aspects.

original: de la rnam pa med pa'i phyogs ltar na /
analyzed: de la rnam pa med pa'i phyogs ltar na /
translated: In the position of no aspects,

original: shes pas phyi rol gyi don 'dzin par rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: shes pas phyi rol gyi don 'dzin par rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: it is not reasonable that consciousness apprehends external objects

original: 'brel pa'i rgyu med pa'i phyir ro //üîΩrang rig pa la gang gis na rang rig pa kho nar 'dod kyi /
analyzed: 'brel pa'i rgyu med pa'i phyir ro // rang rig pa la gang gis na rang rig pa kho nar 'dod kyi /
translated: because there is no cause for a connection.

original: phyi rol ma yin pa 'brel ba ci zhig yod par ma yin nam /
analyzed: phyi rol ma yin pa 'brel ba ci zhig yod par ma yin nam /
translated: If it is reflexive awareness, what connection is there with external objects that it is asserted to be reflexive awareness?

original: ji ste de ni rang rig pa'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir rang rig par rnam par gzhag go zhe na /
analyzed: ji ste de ni rang rig pa'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir rang rig par rnam par gzhag go zhe na /
translated: If it is said that it is posited as reflexive awareness because it is the nature of reflexive awareness,

original: gal te de lta na ni yul 'dzin pa'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir yang yul rig par ci'i phyir mi gzhag /
analyzed: gal te de lta na ni yul 'dzin pa'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir yang yul rig par ci'i phyir mi gzhag /
translated: If that is so, then why not posit that consciousness is aware of objects because it has the nature of apprehending objects?

original: @94b gal te shes pa'i sul 'dzin pa'i las ni ci 'dra ba zhig yin /
analyzed: @94b gal te shes pa'i sul 'dzin pa'i las ni ci 'dra ba zhig yin /
translated: What is the function of consciousness that apprehends itself?

original: gang gis na yul rig par gzhag par bya zhe na /
analyzed: gang gis na yul rig par gzhag par bya zhe na /
translated: By virtue of what is it posited as being aware of objects?

original: gal te de lta na ni rang rig pa la yang brgal zhing brtag pa mtshungs so snyam pa 'di sems la bsngogs nas rang rig pa la yang rang 'dzin pa'i las ci 'dra ba de nye bar ston cing brgal zhing brtag pa mi mtshungs pa nyid du bsgrub
analyzed: gal te de lta na ni rang rig pa la yang brgal zhing brtag pa mtshungs so snyam pa 'di sems la bsngogs nas rang rig pa la yang rang 'dzin pa'i las ci 'dra ba de nye bar ston cing brgal zhing brtag pa mi mtshungs pa nyid du bsgrub
translated: If you think that the same critique and analysis applies to reflexive awareness, then you should be made to think about this: The function of apprehending itself is demonstrated to be the same as the function of apprehending objects, and it is established that the critique and analysis do not apply equally to reflexive awareness.

original: pa'i phyir / rnam shes bems po'i rang bzhin las zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos to //
analyzed: pa'i phyir / rnam shes bems po'i rang bzhin las zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos to //
translated: To prove this, ≈öƒÅntarak·π£ita‚Äôs Ornament of the Middle Way says, ‚ÄúConsciousness is the opposite of the nature of insentient things,‚Äù and so on.

original: mdor bsdus pa'i don ni rang rig pa'i las ni shing rta dang rtsig pa la sogs pa bems po'i rang bzhin dag las log pa kho na yin te /
analyzed: mdor bsdus pa'i don ni rang rig pa'i las ni shing rta dang rtsig pa la sogs pa bems po'i rang bzhin dag las log pa kho na yin te /
translated: The meaning of this in brief is that the function of reflexive awareness is the opposite of insentient things such as chariots and walls.

original: gsal ba gzhan la mi ltos pa nyid du tha snyad kyi lam la 'jug pa yin no //
analyzed: gsal ba gzhan la mi ltos pa nyid du tha snyad kyi lam la 'jug pa yin no //
translated: The clarity is engaged in the path of conventionality without depending on another.

original: lhag ma ni go sla'o //
analyzed: lhag ma ni go sla'o //
translated: The rest is easy to understand.

original: ji ste bya ba dang byed pa'i dngos por ci'i phyir rnam par mi gzhag snyam pa la /üîΩbya dang byed pa'i dngos por min //
analyzed: ji ste bya ba dang byed pa'i dngos por ci'i phyir rnam par mi gzhag snyam pa la / bya dang byed pa'i dngos por min //
translated: If one thinks, ‚ÄúWhy is it not established as the entity of action and agent?,‚Äù

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: [the root text] states, ‚ÄúIt is not the entity of action and agent,‚Äù and so on.

original: 'di ni nye bar mtshon par zad kyi de bzhin du gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i dngos por yang mi 'dod pa nyid do /
analyzed: 'di ni nye bar mtshon par zad kyi de bzhin du gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i dngos por yang mi 'dod pa nyid do /
translated: This is merely an illustration, but it is also not asserted as the entity of apprehendeds and apprehenders.

original: rnam par 'grel pa las kyang de bzhin nyid du ston to //
analyzed: rnam par 'grel pa las kyang de bzhin nyid du ston to //
translated: It is also taught in the Commentary.

original: gsum gyi rang bzhin mi 'thad phyir //
analyzed: gsum gyi rang bzhin mi 'thad phyir //
translated: Because the nature of the three is not tenable.

original: zhes bya ba ni bskyed par bya ba dang skyed pa po dang bskyed par bya ba'i ngo bo 'am /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni bskyed par bya ba dang skyed pa po dang bskyed par bya ba'i ngo bo 'am /
translated: The nature of the three is not tenable as the entity of the object of generation, the generator, and the generated,

original: rig par bya ba dang rig pa po dang rig pa'i ngo bor ro//
analyzed: rig par bya ba dang rig pa po dang rig pa'i ngo bor ro//
translated: or as the entity of the object of awareness, the knower, and the known.

original: ci'i phyir mi rigs snyam pa la /
analyzed: ci'i phyir mi rigs snyam pa la /
translated: If one thinks, ‚ÄúWhy is it not tenable?,‚Äù

original: 'di ltar skye ba'i snga logs na ni med pas nus pa med ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /üîΩdngos po bdag nyid bskyed pa na ma skyes pa'am /
analyzed: 'di ltar skye ba'i snga logs na ni med pas nus pa med ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te / dngos po bdag nyid bskyed pa na ma skyes pa'am /
translated: As such, since it does not exist prior to arising, it is powerless.üîΩWhen an entity generates itself, does it generate what has not yet arisen,

original: skyes zin pa zhig skyed par 'gyur grang na /
analyzed: skyes zin pa zhig skyed par 'gyur grang na /
translated: or does it generate what has already arisen?

original: re zhig ma skyes pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: re zhig ma skyes pa ni ma yin te /
translated: First, it does not generate what has not yet arisen,

original: skye ba'i snga logs na de med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skye ba'i snga logs na de med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it does not exist prior to arising.

original: med na nus pa thams cad dang bral ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: med na nus pa thams cad dang bral ba'i phyir te /
translated: If it does not exist, it is devoid of all power,

original: med pa'i mtshan nyid ni de tsam du zad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: med pa'i mtshan nyid ni de tsam du zad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because that is the definition of nonexistence.

original: ji ste skyes zin pa zhes bya ba'i phyogs yin na ni de'i tshe skyes zin te nus pa'i tshe bskyed par bya ba yang bdag nyid du grub pa'i phyir bskyed par bya ba nyid du mi 'thad do //
analyzed: ji ste skyes zin pa zhes bya ba'i phyogs yin na ni de'i tshe skyes zin te nus pa'i tshe bskyed par bya ba yang bdag nyid du grub pa'i phyir bskyed par bya ba nyid du mi 'thad do //
translated: But if it is the position that it generates what has already arisen, then at the time it has already arisen and has power, it is not tenable that it is generated, because it already exists by itself.

original: de lta ma yin na 'chol ba dang thug pa med par yang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na 'chol ba dang thug pa med par yang 'gyur ro //
translated: If it were otherwise, there would be chaos and infinite regress.

original: gang zhig gang dang grub pa dang bde ba gcig pa ma yin pa de ni de'i rang bzhin yin par mi rigs te /
analyzed: gang zhig gang dang grub pa dang bde ba gcig pa ma yin pa de ni de'i rang bzhin yin par mi rigs te /
translated: It is not reasonable that what is not the same in existence and happiness is the nature of that.

original: ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because of the absurdity of the consequence.

original: de nyid kyi phyir rig par bya ba dang rig pa po'i dngos po yang bsal ba yin te /üîΩrig par bya ba @95a * //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir rig par bya ba dang rig pa po'i dngos po yang bsal ba yin te / rig par bya ba @95a * //
translated: Therefore, the state of the object of knowledge and the knower is also refuted,üîΩbecause the state of the object of knowledge

original: dang rig pa po'i dngos po ni bskyed par bya ba la sogs pa'i ngo bos rab tu phye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dang rig pa po'i dngos po ni bskyed par bya ba la sogs pa'i ngo bos rab tu phye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: and the knower is distinguished by the nature of the produced, etc.

original: de lta bas na zhes bya ba ni mjug sdud do //
analyzed: de lta bas na zhes bya ba ni mjug sdud do //
translated: Therefore is a conclusion.

original: phyi rol rig pa'i bya ba mi rung bar bstan pa'i phyir /üîΩde'i phyir 'di ni shes pa yi //
analyzed: phyi rol rig pa'i bya ba mi rung bar bstan pa'i phyir / de'i phyir 'di ni shes pa yi //
translated: In order to demonstrate the impossibility of the activity of external knowledge,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so ;
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so ;
translated: he says, Therefore, this is not knowledge.

original: / ji ste zhes bya ba ni pha rol gyi lugs kyi dogs pa bsu ba'o //
analyzed: / ji ste zhes bya ba ni pha rol gyi lugs kyi dogs pa bsu ba'o //
translated: If, etc. is a hypothetical supposition of the opponent‚Äôs system.

original: yul so sor rnam par rig pa yin pas zhes bya ba ni yul la dmigs pa'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: yul so sor rnam par rig pa yin pas zhes bya ba ni yul la dmigs pa'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Because of the awareness of individual objects means because of the nature of the object-support.

original: rnam par shes pas ji ltar bdag nyid rig pa ltar yul la dmigs pa'i rang bzhin de nyid ma grub par /
analyzed: rnam par shes pas ji ltar bdag nyid rig pa ltar yul la dmigs pa'i rang bzhin de nyid ma grub par /
translated: Just as consciousness is aware of itself, it is not established that the nature of the object is observed.

original: de'i rang bzhin gzhan la med //üîΩces bya ba la sogs pas ston te /
analyzed: de'i rang bzhin gzhan la med // ces bya ba la sogs pas ston te /
translated: That nature does not exist in another.üîΩThis is taught by the passage beginning with ‚ÄúIf it is accepted that consciousness and the object of consciousness are the same . . .‚Äù

original: gal te shes pa dang shes bya gnyis gcig pa nyid du khas blangs par gyur na ni de'i tshe rang rig pa'i mtshan nyid ni gsal ba'i ngo bo tsam yin pa'i phyir rang rig pa bzhin du don yang rig par 'gyur ba zhig na rnam pa gnyis su
analyzed: gal te shes pa dang shes bya gnyis gcig pa nyid du khas blangs par gyur na ni de'i tshe rang rig pa'i mtshan nyid ni gsal ba'i ngo bo tsam yin pa'i phyir rang rig pa bzhin du don yang rig par 'gyur ba zhig na rnam pa gnyis su
translated: If it is accepted that consciousness and the object of consciousness are the same, then, because the characteristic of reflexive awareness is merely the nature of clarity, just as reflexive awareness, the object would also be aware.

original: smra ba nyams par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir khyod de ltar yang mi 'dod do //üîΩyongs su gcod pa zhes bya ba'i ngo bo de ni zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni rnam par 'grel par byed do //
analyzed: smra ba nyams par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir khyod de ltar yang mi 'dod do // yongs su gcod pa zhes bya ba'i ngo bo de ni zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni rnam par 'grel par byed do //
translated: But you do not accept that, because it would follow that the assertion of two parts would be undermined.üîΩThe passage beginning with ‚ÄúThe nature called ‚Äòdetermining‚Äô . . .‚Äù explains this.

original: de ni zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de ni zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: ‚Äú That‚Äù means ‚Äúthe nature called ‚Äòdetermining.‚Äô‚Äù

original: shes pa don dang lhan cig de'i bdag nyid du gyur ba ma yin du zin kyang rnam par shes pa don rig par byed par go ci'i phyir mi 'gyur snyam pa la /
analyzed: shes pa don dang lhan cig de'i bdag nyid du gyur ba ma yin du zin kyang rnam par shes pa don rig par byed par go ci'i phyir mi 'gyur snyam pa la /
translated: Even if consciousness were not to become the nature of the object simultaneously with it, why would consciousness not be the knower of the object?

original: 'brel pa gang gis na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: 'brel pa gang gis na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: In response to this, it is said, ‚ÄúBy what connection?‚Äù

original: 'o na de las skyes pa'i phyir 'brel bar 'gyur ro snyam pa la /
analyzed: 'o na de las skyes pa'i phyir 'brel bar 'gyur ro snyam pa la /
translated: If you think that they are connected because it arises from that,

original: de las byung ba tsam gyis ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: de las byung ba tsam gyis ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: it is said, ‚ÄúIt is not the case that it is the knower of the object merely because it arises from that.‚Äù

original: de nyid kyi phyir tshogs pa gcig la rag las pas kyang 'brel par bstan par rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir tshogs pa gcig la rag las pas kyang 'brel par bstan par rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: For that very reason, it is also unreasonable to teach that they are connected because they depend on the same collection,

original: mig la sogs pa dus mnyam pa dag la yang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mig la sogs pa dus mnyam pa dag la yang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it would follow that the eye and so on would be connected, even though they are simultaneous.

original: shes pa'i rang bzhin nyid de 'dra ste /üîΩdes na yul kho na rig par 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: shes pa'i rang bzhin nyid de 'dra ste / des na yul kho na rig par 'gyur gyi /
translated: The nature of consciousness is like that.üîΩTherefore the object alone is known, but the eye and so on are not.

original: mig la sogs pa ni ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: mig la sogs pa ni ma yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say this,

original: de yang lan du mi rung ste /
analyzed: de yang lan du mi rung ste /
translated: that also is not a suitable response,

original: brtag par brtsams pa'i rang gi ngo bo nyid ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: brtag par brtsams pa'i rang gi ngo bo nyid ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the nature that you proposed is not established.

original: nam zhig na don rang rig par byar rung snyam pa la /
analyzed: nam zhig na don rang rig par byar rung snyam pa la /
translated: At some point, he thinks that the object is suitable to be known by reflexive awareness.

original: gal te don kyang yongs su gcod pa'i bdag nyid du gyur la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: gal te don kyang yongs su gcod pa'i bdag nyid du gyur la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: [The root text] states, ‚ÄúIf the object also becomes the nature of ascertainment,‚Äù and so on.

original: bdag nyid du gyur ces bya ba ni rang @95b bzhin du gyur ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: bdag nyid du gyur ces bya ba ni rang @95b bzhin du gyur ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: ‚Äú Becomes the nature‚Äù means ‚Äúbecomes the essence.‚Äù

original: de'i bdag nyid ces bya ba ni yongs su gcod pa'i bdag nyid do //
analyzed: de'i bdag nyid ces bya ba ni yongs su gcod pa'i bdag nyid do //
translated: ‚Äú Its nature‚Äù means the nature of ascertainment.

original: shes pa'i don yongs su gcod pa'i ngo bo yin pas zhes bya ba ni yin pas na zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: shes pa'i don yongs su gcod pa'i ngo bo yin pas zhes bya ba ni yin pas na zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: ‚Äú Because the object of consciousness is the nature of ascertainment‚Äù means ‚Äúbecause.‚Äù

original: de lta yin no snyam pa la phyi rol gyi don la mngon par zhen pa'i dug gis zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de lta yin no snyam pa la phyi rol gyi don la mngon par zhen pa'i dug gis zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Thinking that this is so, [the root text] states, ‚ÄúThe poison of clinging to external objects,‚Äù and so on.

original: phyi rol gyi don la mngon par zhen pa nyid dug bzhin du gdug pa yin la gang la des ma rung bar byas pa'i bsam pa yod pa zhes bya bar rnam par sbyar ro //
analyzed: phyi rol gyi don la mngon par zhen pa nyid dug bzhin du gdug pa yin la gang la des ma rung bar byas pa'i bsam pa yod pa zhes bya bar rnam par sbyar ro //
translated: Clinging to external objects is poisonous like poison. The thought that is ruined by that is what is being applied.

original: gang zhes bya ba ni dpyod pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: gang zhes bya ba ni dpyod pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: ‚Äú That‚Äù refers to analysis and so on.

original: de ni 'di skad du rnam par shes pa rnam pa dang bcas pa ma yin pa 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi /
analyzed: de ni 'di skad du rnam par shes pa rnam pa dang bcas pa ma yin pa 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi /
translated: This is what is being said: Not only is consciousness not associated with aspects,

original: rang rig pa yang ma yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: rang rig pa yang ma yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: it is also not self-knowing.

original: de ltar na 'di ni don yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na 'di ni don yin no //
translated: This is the meaning.

original: 'di ni shes pa'o //üîΩdon dang shes pa de dag kyang bdag la grub bo zhes bya ba'i grags pa 'dir yang mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'di ni shes pa'o // don dang shes pa de dag kyang bdag la grub bo zhes bya ba'i grags pa 'dir yang mi 'gyur te /
translated: This is the consciousness.

original: shes pa rab tu ma grub na don thams cad rab tu mi 'grub par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shes pa rab tu ma grub na don thams cad rab tu mi 'grub par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: And it is not the case that these objects and consciousnesses are established for the self, because it would follow that if consciousness were not established, all objects would not be established.

original: gal te shes pa 'di ma grub tu zin kyang re zhig don ni mngon sum kho nar grub bo //
analyzed: gal te shes pa 'di ma grub tu zin kyang re zhig don ni mngon sum kho nar grub bo //
translated: Even though this consciousness is not established, at least the object is directly perceived and established.

original: don de las ni shes pa yang don gyis go bas 'grub par 'gyur te /
analyzed: don de las ni shes pa yang don gyis go bas 'grub par 'gyur te /
translated: And from that object, consciousness is also established by implication,üîΩbecause it is not tenable that objects of knowledge exist without consciousness.

original: shes pa med pas shes bya nyid mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro snyam pa'i dogs pa bsu nas shes pa ni gsal ba yin na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: shes pa med pas shes bya nyid mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro snyam pa'i dogs pa bsu nas shes pa ni gsal ba yin na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: In response to this qualm, ≈öƒÅntarak·π£ita says, ‚ÄúIf consciousness is clarity,‚Äù and so on.

original: don gyi gsal ba ni shes pa las gzhan ma yin gyi shes pa kho na yin no //
analyzed: don gyi gsal ba ni shes pa las gzhan ma yin gyi shes pa kho na yin no //
translated: The clarity of the object is not other than consciousness; it is consciousness itself.

original: gsal ba yang gsal ba ma yin na ni gsal ba gsal ba ma yin pa'i phyir mi gzhan gyi mngon sum bzhin du mdun na rnam par gnas pa'i don kyang mngon sum du mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gsal ba yang gsal ba ma yin na ni gsal ba gsal ba ma yin pa'i phyir mi gzhan gyi mngon sum bzhin du mdun na rnam par gnas pa'i don kyang mngon sum du mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If the clarity is not clarity, then, because of the nonclarity of clarity, the object that is present in front would not be directly perceived, like the direct perception of another person.

original: de lta ma yin na ni ha cang thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na ni ha cang thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If it were otherwise, there would be an absurd consequence.

original: shes pa gsal ba yin du chug na yang shes pa rnam pa med par smra ba'i ltar na /
analyzed: shes pa gsal ba yin du chug na yang shes pa rnam pa med par smra ba'i ltar na /
