translated: Even if consciousness is clarity, according to those who advocate that consciousness is devoid of aspects,

original: don rnam pa thams cad du mngon sum du mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: don rnam pa thams cad du mngon sum du mi 'gyur te /
translated: the object is not directly perceived in any way.

original: don rig pa 'di yin no zhes bya ba 'brel ba'i rgyu yang med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don rig pa 'di yin no zhes bya ba 'brel ba'i rgyu yang med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because there is no causal relation, such as, ‚ÄúThis is the awareness of the object.‚Äù

original: 'di ni sngar bshad pa kho na yin te /
analyzed: 'di ni sngar bshad pa kho na yin te /
translated: This has already been explained earlier.

original: de ltar na shes pa rnam pa med pa'i phyogs la don dngos su rig pa med do //
analyzed: de ltar na shes pa rnam pa med pa'i phyogs la don dngos su rig pa med do //
translated: Thus, in the position that consciousness is devoid of aspects, there is no direct awareness of the object.

original: gzhan yang shes pa rnam pa med pa'i phyogs 'di ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni ji ltar shes pa rnam pa dang bcas par smra ba rnams kyis brjod pa lta bu @96a * //
analyzed: gzhan yang shes pa rnam pa med pa'i phyogs 'di ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni ji ltar shes pa rnam pa dang bcas par smra ba rnams kyis brjod pa lta bu @96a * //
translated: Moreover, ‚ÄúIn this system of the Proponents of Features, consciousness and its objects are of the same substance, and the object is the feature of the consciousness.‚ÄùüîΩ

original: btags pa gang yin pa de yang med do zhes ston par byed pa'o //
analyzed: btags pa gang yin pa de yang med do zhes ston par byed pa'o //
translated: Moreover, ‚ÄúThis view that cognition is without aspects‚Äù and so on shows that even the imputation does not exist.

original: gzugs brnyan zhes bya ba ni don gyi rnam par shes pa la yod pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs brnyan zhes bya ba ni don gyi rnam par shes pa la yod pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúReflection‚Äù exists in the cognition of the object.

original: gdags pa zhes bya ba ni nye bar btags pa'o //üîΩdes gzhag pa shes pa'i bdag nyid du gyur pa'i gzugs brnyan zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni rnam par 'grel par byed do //
analyzed: gdags pa zhes bya ba ni nye bar btags pa'o // des gzhag pa shes pa'i bdag nyid du gyur pa'i gzugs brnyan zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni rnam par 'grel par byed do //
translated: ‚ÄúImputation‚Äù is the designation.üîΩ‚ÄúThat which is posited‚Äù is the reflection that has the nature of cognition.

original: gzhag pa ni shes pa'i bdag nyid la yod pa ste /
analyzed: gzhag pa ni shes pa'i bdag nyid la yod pa ste /
translated: ‚ÄúPositing‚Äù exists in the nature of cognition.

original: shes pa'i bdag nyid du gyur pa'i gzugs brnyan gang yin pa de rig pa nyid don rig pa yin te /
analyzed: shes pa'i bdag nyid du gyur pa'i gzugs brnyan gang yin pa de rig pa nyid don rig pa yin te /
translated: That reflection which has the nature of cognition is the awareness itself, and the awareness of the object is the awareness of the object.

original: rgyu la 'bras bu'i chos nye bar btags pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu la 'bras bu'i chos nye bar btags pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because the attribute of the effect is imputed to the cause.

original: su zhig mi 'dod pa zhes bya ba ni shes pa rnam pa med par smra ba'o //
analyzed: su zhig mi 'dod pa zhes bya ba ni shes pa rnam pa med par smra ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúWho does not accept this?‚Äù refers to those who advocate that consciousness is devoid of aspects.

original: 'di yang zhes bya ba ni nye bar btags pa'o /üîΩ// / bam po gnyis pa /
analyzed: 'di yang zhes bya ba ni nye bar btags pa'o / // / bam po gnyis pa /
translated: ‚ÄúThis‚Äù refers to the object that is imputed.

original: re zhig de ltar shes pa rnam pa med pa'i phyogs mi 'thad par bsgrubs nas shes pa rnam pa dang bcas pa'i phyogs kyang rigs pa ma yin pa nyid du bsgrub par 'dod nas /
analyzed: re zhig de ltar shes pa rnam pa med pa'i phyogs mi 'thad par bsgrubs nas shes pa rnam pa dang bcas pa'i phyogs kyang rigs pa ma yin pa nyid du bsgrub par 'dod nas /
translated: Having thus established that the position of consciousness devoid of aspects is untenable, to establish that the position of consciousness with aspects is also illogical, he says:

original: gal te de lta na shes pa rnam pa dang bcas pa nyid ni mi rung ngo zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: gal te de lta na shes pa rnam pa dang bcas pa nyid ni mi rung ngo zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: ‚ÄúIn that case, it is not tenable that consciousness has aspects.‚Äù

original: 'di la yang rnam pa rnams bden par 'gyur ba'am yang na brdzun par 'gyur grang na zhes bya ba phyogs gnyis te /
analyzed: 'di la yang rnam pa rnams bden par 'gyur ba'am yang na brdzun par 'gyur grang na zhes bya ba phyogs gnyis te /
translated: Here, too, there are two possibilities: the aspects would be real or they would be unreal.

original: de la phyogs dang po ltar na shes pa gcig dang tha mi dad pa'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir shes pa gcig gi rang gi ngo bo bzhin du rnam pa sna tshogs pa nyid du mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de la phyogs dang po ltar na shes pa gcig dang tha mi dad pa'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir shes pa gcig gi rang gi ngo bo bzhin du rnam pa sna tshogs pa nyid du mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If the first position is true, then because they would have the same nature as the single consciousness, the aspects would not be various, just like the nature of the single consciousness.

original: de'i phyir ri mo brkyang ba la sogs pa rnam pa'i stobs kyis phyi rol gyi don mi 'grub ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir ri mo brkyang ba la sogs pa rnam pa'i stobs kyis phyi rol gyi don mi 'grub ste /
translated: Therefore, external objects are not established by the power of aspects, such as the extended image, etc.

original: ri mo'i rnam pa dang 'dra ba nyid med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ri mo'i rnam pa dang 'dra ba nyid med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they do not have the same aspect as the image.

original: ji ste nyams su myong bas grub pa'i phyir rnam pa rnams brtsal ba ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: ji ste nyams su myong bas grub pa'i phyir rnam pa rnams brtsal ba ma yin no zhe na /
translated: But if you say that the aspects are not sought because they are established by experience,

original: de'i tshe rnam pa rnams las shes pa tha mi dad pa'i phyir rnam pa bzhin du du ma nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i tshe rnam pa rnams las shes pa tha mi dad pa'i phyir rnam pa bzhin du du ma nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: then, because consciousness is not different from the aspects, it would be as multiple as the aspects.

original: de lta ma yin na chos 'gal ba gnas pa'i phyir tha dad pa ma yin par khas mi blang bar bya'o //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na chos 'gal ba gnas pa'i phyir tha dad pa ma yin par khas mi blang bar bya'o //
translated: Otherwise, because of the presence of contradictory properties, they cannot be accepted as non-different.üîΩAs to the statement ‚ÄúIf you think like this . . . ,‚Äù etc., it is a question that anticipates the opponent‚Äôs position:

original: 'di ltar 'dod de zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gang zhig du ma nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba mi 'dod pa nyid du sgrub par byed pa ma yin te du ma nyid du 'dod pa'i phyir ro snyam du sems pa de'i lugs kyi dogs pa bsuüîΩbar byed pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar 'dod de zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gang zhig du ma nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba mi 'dod pa nyid du sgrub par byed pa ma yin te du ma nyid du 'dod pa'i phyir ro snyam du sems pa de'i lugs kyi dogs pa bsuüîΩbar byed pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúYou do not establish that the consequence of multiplicity is unacceptable, because you accept multiplicity.‚Äù

original: mgyogs par 'byung phyir zhes bya ba ni myur bar 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mgyogs par 'byung phyir zhes bya ba ni myur bar 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it arises quickly means because it arises rapidly.

original: me tog autpala'i 'dab ma zhes bya ba la sogs @96b pas ni rnam par 'grel bar byed do //
analyzed: me tog autpala'i 'dab ma zhes bya ba la sogs @96b pas ni rnam par 'grel bar byed do //
translated: The words a lotus petal, etc. explain that.

original: shin tu myur ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni shin tu myur bar 'byung ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: shin tu myur ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni shin tu myur bar 'byung ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Because it is very rapid means because it arises very rapidly; that is the meaning.

original: mthong ba de ni zhes bya ba ni cig car du mthong ba'o //
analyzed: mthong ba de ni zhes bya ba ni cig car du mthong ba'o //
translated: That seeing means seeing simultaneously.

original: gal te de lta na /
analyzed: gal te de lta na /
translated: If that is so,

original: lcug ma'i sgra la sogs pa'i blo //
analyzed: lcug ma'i sgra la sogs pa'i blo //
translated: then the cognition of the sound of a flute, etc.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni ha cang thal bar 'gyur bar byed pas myur du 'byung ba cig car du shes pa'i rgyu ma yin pa nyid du bstan te /üîΩlcug ma'i sgra la sogs pa dag la blo rnams zhes tshig rnam par sbyar nas bsdu'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni ha cang thal bar 'gyur bar byed pas myur du 'byung ba cig car du shes pa'i rgyu ma yin pa nyid du bstan te / lcug ma'i sgra la sogs pa dag la blo rnams zhes tshig rnam par sbyar nas bsdu'o //
translated: The words, etc. indicate that it is taught that rapid arising is not the cause of the cognition of simultaneity, because it is an extreme absurdity.üîΩThe words the cognitions of the sound of a flute, etc. are to be connected with the words in the above verse.

original: sogs pa zhes bya ba'i sgras ni ta la dang mtsho dang ro bro ba la sogs pa'i sgra rnams bsdu ste /
analyzed: sogs pa zhes bya ba'i sgras ni ta la dang mtsho dang ro bro ba la sogs pa'i sgra rnams bsdu ste /
translated: The words, etc. include the sounds of a palm tree, a lake, a taste, etc.

original: lcug ma la sogs pa'i sgra la yang rgyu mtshungs pa'i phyir cig car yin par 'dzin pa'i mngon pa'i nga rgyal du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lcug ma la sogs pa'i sgra la yang rgyu mtshungs pa'i phyir cig car yin par 'dzin pa'i mngon pa'i nga rgyal du 'gyur ro //
translated: In the case of the word ‚Äúbamboo,‚Äù etc., there is a similar cause, so that there would be the manifest pride of grasping them as simultaneous.

original: de'i phyir lcug ma ta la zhes thos pa tha dad par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: de'i phyir lcug ma ta la zhes thos pa tha dad par mi 'gyur te /
translated: Therefore, the hearing of ‚Äúbamboo‚Äù and ‚ÄútƒÅla‚Äù would not be different,

original: thos pa tha dad pa ni rim gyis 'dzin pas byas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thos pa tha dad pa ni rim gyis 'dzin pas byas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the difference in hearing is made by the grasping of the sequence.

original: rgyu rnams 'bras bu dang ldan pa 'dis ni gdon mi za bar 'gyur ba ma yin no //
analyzed: rgyu rnams 'bras bu dang ldan pa 'dis ni gdon mi za bar 'gyur ba ma yin no //
translated: This possession of the effect by the cause does not necessarily occur.

original: des na dngos po cig car rtogs pa'i rgyu yod pa'ang 'ga' kho na la 'gyur ro snyam pa la /
analyzed: des na dngos po cig car rtogs pa'i rgyu yod pa'ang 'ga' kho na la 'gyur ro snyam pa la /
translated: Therefore, it is thought that there is a cause for the simultaneous understanding of a thing, but it occurs in some cases only.

original: rgyu 'dra ba'i rgyu rkyen ni tha dad par mi rigs te zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: rgyu 'dra ba'i rgyu rkyen ni tha dad par mi rigs te zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: In response to that, it is said that ‚Äúit is not reasonable for the similar cause to be different,‚Äù and so on.

original: 'di snyam du sems te gang rgyu'i dngos po yin pa de ni gdon mi za bar 'bras bu skyed par byed pa kho na'o //
analyzed: 'di snyam du sems te gang rgyu'i dngos po yin pa de ni gdon mi za bar 'bras bu skyed par byed pa kho na'o //
translated: It is thought like this: That which is the nature of a cause necessarily produces the effect.

original: rgyu rnams ni gdon mi za bar 'bras bu dang ldan pa ma yin no zhes gang smras pa de ni rgyu tsam la bsams nas dngos su btags par zad do //üîΩkhyod rim gyis 'jug pa rnams la cig car yin par 'dzin pa'i mngon pa'i nga rgyal byed pa'i rgyu myur du 'byung ba las gzhan khas mi len la rgyu de yang thams cad du mtshungs te cig car gyi dngos por mngon par zhen pa'i nga rgyal byed pa
analyzed: rgyu rnams ni gdon mi za bar 'bras bu dang ldan pa ma yin no zhes gang smras pa de ni rgyu tsam la bsams nas dngos su btags par zad do // khyod rim gyis 'jug pa rnams la cig car yin par 'dzin pa'i mngon pa'i nga rgyal byed pa'i rgyu myur du 'byung ba las gzhan khas mi len la rgyu de yang thams cad du mtshungs te cig car gyi dngos por mngon par zhen pa'i nga rgyal byed pa
translated: But you say that causes do not necessarily possess effects, and you explicitly impute this to mere causes.

original: ni myur du 'byung ba tsam la rag las te /
analyzed: ni myur du 'byung ba tsam la rag las te /
translated: You do not accept any cause other than the swift arising of the cause of the manifest pride that things that arise in sequence are simultaneous. That cause is the same in all cases, because the cause of the manifest pride that things that arise in sequence are simultaneous depends only on the swift arising of the cause.

original: 'byung bar zad pas thams cad du 'byung ba kho nar 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'byung bar zad pas thams cad du 'byung ba kho nar 'gyur te /
translated: Since it is merely swift arising, it must arise in all cases.

original: rgyu ma tshang ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu ma tshang ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the cause is complete.

original: myur du 'byung ba ma tshang ba med kyang gang mi 'byung ba de ni de'i rgyur rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: myur du 'byung ba ma tshang ba med kyang gang mi 'byung ba de ni de'i rgyur rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: Even though swift arising is complete, it is not reasonable that what does not arise is its cause.

original: ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it would follow that it is absurd.

original: de'i phyir rgyu myur du 'byung ba'i mtshan nyid 'dra yang rgyu can 'bras bu cig car gyi dngos por mngon pa'i nga rgyal byed pa yod pa dang med pa tha dad par byas pa gang yin pa de ni mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: de'i phyir rgyu myur du 'byung ba'i mtshan nyid 'dra yang rgyu can 'bras bu cig car gyi dngos por mngon pa'i nga rgyal byed pa yod pa dang med pa tha dad par byas pa gang yin pa de ni mi 'gyur te /
translated: Therefore, although the characteristics of the cause and effect are similar in that they occur quickly, the effect that is the possessor of the cause is not different in that it is sometimes an entity that is simultaneous with the cause and sometimes not.

original: 'bras bu tha dad pa ni rgyu'i bye brag gis byas pa'i phyir ro //üîΩde'i @97a * //
analyzed: 'bras bu tha dad pa ni rgyu'i bye brag gis byas pa'i phyir ro // de'i @97a * //
translated: The difference in the effect is due to the difference in the cause.

original: phyir de rgyu la yod pa'i rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa'i rjes su mi byed pa'i phyir rgyu'i 'bras bu nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: phyir de rgyu la yod pa'i rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa'i rjes su mi byed pa'i phyir rgyu'i 'bras bu nyid ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, the effect does not have the nature of a cause because it does not follow the presence and absence of the cause.

original: rgyu gzhan yang khas mi len pas rgyu med pa nyid kho nar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rgyu gzhan yang khas mi len pas rgyu med pa nyid kho nar 'gyur ro //
translated: Since another cause is not accepted, it would be causeless.

original: sun dbyung ba gzhan yang /
analyzed: sun dbyung ba gzhan yang /
translated: Another refutation:

original: yid kyi rtog pa 'ba' zhig la'ang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: yid kyi rtog pa 'ba' zhig la'ang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: ‚ÄúEven in mere mental conception, etc.‚Äù

original: rtog pa zhes bya ba ni rnam par rtog pa'o //
analyzed: rtog pa zhes bya ba ni rnam par rtog pa'o //
translated: Conception means conception.

original: 'ba' zhig ces bya ba ni shes par rigs mi mthun pa gzhan dang ma 'dres pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'ba' zhig ces bya ba ni shes par rigs mi mthun pa gzhan dang ma 'dres pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Mere means not mixed with other incompatible types of cognition.

original: ring du gnas pa ma yin pas zhes bya ba ni skad cig pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ring du gnas pa ma yin pas zhes bya ba ni skad cig pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it does not endure long means because it is momentary.

original: blo rnams kun zhes bya ba ni mig la sogs pa'i blo rnams so ;
analyzed: blo rnams kun zhes bya ba ni mig la sogs pa'i blo rnams so ;
translated: All cognitions means the cognitions of eye, etc.

original: / sems pa ni 'phral gyi bya ba la sogs pa dpyod pa'o //
analyzed: / sems pa ni 'phral gyi bya ba la sogs pa dpyod pa'o //
translated: Reflection is the examination of immediate action, etc.

original: dpyod pa ni sngon ma byung ba'i dngos po'i rang gi ngo bo la mngon par rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: dpyod pa ni sngon ma byung ba'i dngos po'i rang gi ngo bo la mngon par rtogs pa'o //
translated: Discernment is the realization of the intrinsic reality of a previously unrealized entity.

original: sogs pa zhes bya ba'i sgras ni blo sbyong ba'i yid la sems pa la sogs pa gzung ngo //
analyzed: sogs pa zhes bya ba'i sgras ni blo sbyong ba'i yid la sems pa la sogs pa gzung ngo //
translated: The word ‚Äúetc.‚Äù includes mental reflection that trains the mind, and so on.

original: sems pa dang dpyod pa la sogs pa nyid kyi dus de gnas skabs yin no //
analyzed: sems pa dang dpyod pa la sogs pa nyid kyi dus de gnas skabs yin no //
translated: The time of reflection, discernment, and so on is its occasion.üîΩThat occasion is the state of origination.

original: gnas skabs de ni 'byung ba'i ngang tshul can gang yin pa zhes tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
analyzed: gnas skabs de ni 'byung ba'i ngang tshul can gang yin pa zhes tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
translated: The phrase is to be construed in this way.

original: gcig tu na zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni 'og ma'i phyed rnam par 'grel to //
analyzed: gcig tu na zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni 'og ma'i phyed rnam par 'grel to //
translated: The word ‚Äúalone‚Äù in the verse is explained by the phrase ‚Äúbecause it is not the case that the other is not.‚Äù

original: 'di'i phyir zhes bya bas ni 'og nas 'byung bas so //
analyzed: 'di'i phyir zhes bya bas ni 'og nas 'byung bas so //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúfor this reason‚Äù refers to what follows.

original: pha rol gyi lugs las kyang zhes bya ba ni thams cad kyis myur du 'jig par khas blangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: pha rol gyi lugs las kyang zhes bya ba ni thams cad kyis myur du 'jig par khas blangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: And from the other system means because it is accepted that everything is quickly destroyed.

original: rim gyis 'dzin pa med na cir 'gyur snyam pa la /üîΩrnam pa dag ni tha dad ltar //
analyzed: rim gyis 'dzin pa med na cir 'gyur snyam pa la / rnam pa dag ni tha dad ltar //
translated: If there is no gradual apprehension, what would happen?

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: It is said, If the aspects are different, and so on.

original: dpe mgal me'i 'khor lo yang ma grub po zhes bstan pa'i phyir /üîΩmgal me la yang cig car du //
analyzed: dpe mgal me'i 'khor lo yang ma grub po zhes bstan pa'i phyir / mgal me la yang cig car du //
translated: In order to show that the example of the fire wheel is also not established, it is said, Even in the case of the fire wheel, and so on.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: It is said, Even in the case of the fire wheel, and so on.

original: rung ba ma yin te zhes bya ba ni rigs pa ma yin pa ste /
analyzed: rung ba ma yin te zhes bya ba ni rigs pa ma yin pa ste /
translated: It is said, It is not reasonable, meaning it is not logical.

original: mgal me'i 'khor lo la ni mthong ba rim gyis 'byung ba can rnams cig car 'dzin par mngon pa'i nga rgyal byed pas mgal me la 'khor lo'i rnam par 'khrul pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: mgal me'i 'khor lo la ni mthong ba rim gyis 'byung ba can rnams cig car 'dzin par mngon pa'i nga rgyal byed pas mgal me la 'khor lo'i rnam par 'khrul pa ma yin gyi /
translated: Because those who have gradual arising of seeing take pride in apprehending it all at once, the error of a wheel in the firebrand is not that the aspects are different.

original: myur bar 'khor bar zhugs pa'i rjes su song bas mi 'khrugs par bskyed pa 'khor lo'i rnam par 'khrul pa skyed de gsal bar snang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: myur bar 'khor bar zhugs pa'i rjes su song bas mi 'khrugs par bskyed pa 'khor lo'i rnam par 'khrul pa skyed de gsal bar snang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The wheel-like confusion is generated by the non-disturbance of the mind, which is in accord with the quick entry into cyclic existence, because it appears clearly.

original: de ltar ma yin na gsal bar snang ba nyid du mi 'thad de /
analyzed: de ltar ma yin na gsal bar snang ba nyid du mi 'thad de /
translated: If it were not so, it would not be tenable that it appears clearly,

original: dran pa kho nas mtshams sbyor ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dran pa kho nas mtshams sbyor ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is connected only by memory.

original: mthong bas ni ma yin te /
analyzed: mthong bas ni ma yin te /
translated: It is not by seeing,

original: mthong ba'i yul @97b 'das pa ma yin pa'i phyir dang / rnam par rtog pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mthong ba'i yul @97b 'das pa ma yin pa'i phyir dang / rnam par rtog pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the object of seeing is not past, and because it is non-conceptual.

original: dran pa ni dngos po myong zin pa'i yul yin pas rnam pa mi gsal ba nyid yin te /
analyzed: dran pa ni dngos po myong zin pa'i yul yin pas rnam pa mi gsal ba nyid yin te /
translated: Memory is the object of the experience of an entity, and so it is not clear,

original: myong zin pa med pa'i phyir dang / dran pa'i tshe rtogs pa yang mi gsal ba'i phyir ro zhes bsdus pa'i don yin no //
analyzed: myong zin pa med pa'i phyir dang / dran pa'i tshe rtogs pa yang mi gsal ba'i phyir ro zhes bsdus pa'i don yin no //
translated: because the experience is not present, and because the understanding at the time of memory is not clear. This is the summarized meaning.

original: 'gal lam zhes dris pa dang / lan du 'gal te zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: 'gal lam zhes dris pa dang / lan du 'gal te zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: The question is asked, ‚ÄúIs there a contradiction?‚Äù The answer is, ‚ÄúThere is a contradiction.‚Äù

original: des cir 'gyur zhes dris pa dang / smras pa zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: des cir 'gyur zhes dris pa dang / smras pa zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: The question is asked, ‚ÄúWhat is the consequence?‚Äù The answer is, ‚ÄúIt follows that‚Ä¶‚Äù

original: de'i zhes bya ba ni dran pa'o //
analyzed: de'i zhes bya ba ni dran pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThat‚Äù refers to memory.

original: de ni gsal ma yin zhes bya bar sbyar te /
analyzed: de ni gsal ma yin zhes bya bar sbyar te /
translated: It is not clear, that is, it is not connected to the present.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: zhig pas so //
analyzed: zhig pas so //
translated: Because it is destroyed.

original: mdun na 'dug pa zhes bya ba ni da ltar zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
analyzed: mdun na 'dug pa zhes bya ba ni da ltar zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
translated: ‚ÄúIn front‚Äù means in the present.

original: dran pa'i yul ni 'dus pa yin no snyam du bsams pa'o //
analyzed: dran pa'i yul ni 'dus pa yin no snyam du bsams pa'o //
translated: The object of memory is a collection.

original: de'i bdag nyid du gyur pa zhes bya ba ni dran pa'i yul gyi bdag nyid du gyur pa'o //
analyzed: de'i bdag nyid du gyur pa zhes bya ba ni dran pa'i yul gyi bdag nyid du gyur pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIn the nature of that‚Äù means in the nature of the object of memory.

original: de bzhin du gyur pa'i rigs zhes bya ba ni yongs su mi gsal ba'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du gyur pa'i rigs zhes bya ba ni yongs su mi gsal ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThe same kind‚Äù means not clear.

original: autpala'i 'dab ma brgya 'bigs pa dper bstan pa gang yin pa de yang chos mi mthun pa yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: autpala'i 'dab ma brgya 'bigs pa dper bstan pa gang yin pa de yang chos mi mthun pa yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: The example of the piercing of a hundred petals of an utpala flower is not similar.

original: autpala'i 'dab ma brgya cig car phigs pa'i shes pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: autpala'i 'dab ma brgya cig car phigs pa'i shes pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: To demonstrate this, he says, ‚ÄúThe cognition that pierces a hundred petals of an utpala flower simultaneously . . .‚Äù

original: autpala'i 'dab ma 'bigs pa la ni ji ltar mgal me'i 'khor lo la sogs pa mthong ba ltar cig car du 'dzin par shes pa shin tu gsal ba ma yin no //
analyzed: autpala'i 'dab ma 'bigs pa la ni ji ltar mgal me'i 'khor lo la sogs pa mthong ba ltar cig car du 'dzin par shes pa shin tu gsal ba ma yin no //
translated: But when one pierces the petals of the lotus, the cognition that apprehends them simultaneously is not very clear, as when one sees the circle of a whirling firebrand, etc.

original: autpala'i 'dab ma brgya phigs pa la ni rim pa yang tshad ma gzhan gyis grub kyi /
analyzed: autpala'i 'dab ma brgya phigs pa la ni rim pa yang tshad ma gzhan gyis grub kyi /
translated: And when one pierces a hundred lotus petals, the order is established by another means of valid knowledge.

original: 'di la ni tshad ma yang ci yang med do //
analyzed: 'di la ni tshad ma yang ci yang med do //
translated: But here there is no means of valid knowledge at all.

original: autpala'i 'dab ma brgya 'bigs pa la ni myur du 'gro ba tsam gyis cig car 'dzin pa shes pa 'byung ba med de /
analyzed: autpala'i 'dab ma brgya 'bigs pa la ni myur du 'gro ba tsam gyis cig car 'dzin pa shes pa 'byung ba med de /
translated: And when one pierces a hundred lotus petals, the cognition that apprehends them simultaneously does not arise merely from their rapid occurrence,üîΩbecause there is no single focus.

original: rtse gcig pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar nges par byed do zhes bya bas ston par byed do //
analyzed: rtse gcig pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar nges par byed do zhes bya bas ston par byed do //
translated: This is what is being shown.

original: rjes su dpog pa ni rim gyis zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: rjes su dpog pa ni rim gyis zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: The inference is supplied by the word ‚Äúgradually.‚Äù

original: 'dir rjes su dpag pa gang yin snyam pa la mang po dag la byed pa gcig gis 'bigs pa gang yin pa de ni zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: 'dir rjes su dpag pa gang yin snyam pa la mang po dag la byed pa gcig gis 'bigs pa gang yin pa de ni zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Here, what is the inference? It is supplied by the words ‚Äúthat which pierces many with a single action.‚Äù

original: 'di ni don brjod pa tsam du zad do //
analyzed: 'di ni don brjod pa tsam du zad do //
translated: This is merely an expression of the meaning.

original: sbyor ba ni 'di lta bu yin te /
analyzed: sbyor ba ni 'di lta bu yin te /
translated: The argument is as follows:

original: rim can bla 'og rim par gnas pa rnams mi gcig gi byed pas lus can gyis phug pa gang yin pa de ni rim gyis 'gyur ba kho na yin te /
analyzed: rim can bla 'og rim par gnas pa rnams mi gcig gi byed pas lus can gyis phug pa gang yin pa de ni rim gyis 'gyur ba kho na yin te /
translated: The order of the upper and lower parts of a body is due to the action of a single agent, and that body is only gradually formed,

original: dper na zangs kyi glegs ma la sogs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na zangs kyi glegs ma la sogs pa lta bu'o //
translated: like a copper plate, etc.

original: autpala'i 'dab ma la sogs pa bla 'og gi rim par gnas pa rnams kyang mi gcig gi byed pas lus @98a * //
analyzed: autpala'i 'dab ma la sogs pa bla 'og gi rim par gnas pa rnams kyang mi gcig gi byed pas lus @98a * //
translated: The order of the upper and lower parts of an utpala flower, etc. is due to the action of a single agent,

original: can gyis phug pa yin zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs yin no //üîΩde lta ma yin na ni gal te lus can gcig gis cig car du khyab par gyur na ni rim can nyid du mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: can gyis phug pa yin zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs yin no // de lta ma yin na ni gal te lus can gcig gis cig car du khyab par gyur na ni rim can nyid du mi 'gyur te /
translated: This is a natural inference.üîΩOtherwise, if a single body were to pervade all at once, it would not be gradual.

original: lus can la gang gis na dngos po gcig la khyab par gyur pa ni de'i tshe gzhan la yang khyab par mi 'gyur ba rang bzhin gzhan ni med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lus can la gang gis na dngos po gcig la khyab par gyur pa ni de'i tshe gzhan la yang khyab par mi 'gyur ba rang bzhin gzhan ni med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If a body pervades one thing, it would not pervade another, because there is no other nature.

original: de'i tshe rang bzhin mi nye bas kyang gzhan mi phigs mi srid pas ma nges pa nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i tshe rang bzhin mi nye bas kyang gzhan mi phigs mi srid pas ma nges pa nyid ma yin no //
translated: At that time, since they are not similar in nature, it is impossible that one cannot be damaged by the other. Therefore, it is not the case that it is not ascertained.

original: gang dag ces bya ba ni phyi rol gyi don yod par smra ba kha cig kho na ste /
analyzed: gang dag ces bya ba ni phyi rol gyi don yod par smra ba kha cig kho na ste /
translated: ‚Äú Some‚Äù refers to some who assert that external objects exist.

original: de dag gi lugs kyis shes pa rnam pa dang bcas pa yin yang ri mo brkyang ba la sogs pa la cig car du snang ba mi 'gal ba kho na'o //
analyzed: de dag gi lugs kyis shes pa rnam pa dang bcas pa yin yang ri mo brkyang ba la sogs pa la cig car du snang ba mi 'gal ba kho na'o //
translated: According to their system, even though consciousness has aspects, it is not contradictory that it appears all at once in such things as an extended painting.

original: gal te de lta na zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni sun dbyung bar bshad do //
analyzed: gal te de lta na zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni sun dbyung bar bshad do //
translated: ‚Äú If that is so‚Äù and so forth explains the refutation.

original: rnam pa sna gcig ces bya ba ni kha dog gi rigs mi mthun pa dang ma 'dres pa ste /
analyzed: rnam pa sna gcig ces bya ba ni kha dog gi rigs mi mthun pa dang ma 'dres pa ste /
translated: ‚Äú One aspect‚Äù is a type of color that is not mixed with a different type.

original: rnam pa sna gcig la yang sngon po dang ser po la sogs pa'i rnam pa 'dzin pas sna tshogs su snang ba'i blo mi 'byung bar shar dang byang dang dma' ba nyid la sogs pa'i char snang ba'i phyir sna tshogs nyid yod pa kho na'o //
analyzed: rnam pa sna gcig la yang sngon po dang ser po la sogs pa'i rnam pa 'dzin pas sna tshogs su snang ba'i blo mi 'byung bar shar dang byang dang dma' ba nyid la sogs pa'i char snang ba'i phyir sna tshogs nyid yod pa kho na'o //
translated: Since it apprehends aspects such as blue and yellow, the cognition that appears as a variety does not occur. Since it appears as a part such as the east, the north, and the south, a variety certainly exists.

original: du mar 'dod do zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni pha rol gyi gzhung gi dogs pa bsu bar byed do //
analyzed: du mar 'dod do zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni pha rol gyi gzhung gi dogs pa bsu bar byed do //
translated: The phrase some assert that and so on anticipates the opponent's position.

original: 'o na gcig tu 'gyur ba gang yin zhes dris pa dang pha rol pos gang yan lag med pa'i rdul gyi yul 'dzin pa ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: 'o na gcig tu 'gyur ba gang yin zhes dris pa dang pha rol pos gang yan lag med pa'i rdul gyi yul 'dzin pa ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: The question What is the one? is answered by the opponent with the statement that which apprehends the object of a partless particle and so on.

original: cha med pa zhes bya ba ni cha shas med pa ste /
analyzed: cha med pa zhes bya ba ni cha shas med pa ste /
translated: The phrase partless means without parts.

original: rdul phra rab tsam 'dzin pa'i shes pa myong ba ni gang na yang med de /
analyzed: rdul phra rab tsam 'dzin pa'i shes pa myong ba ni gang na yang med de /
translated: There is no experience of a consciousness that apprehends a mere particle,

original: dus thams cad du rags pa'i rnam par snang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dus thams cad du rags pa'i rnam par snang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because at all times it appears in the aspect of the gross.

original: 'dis ni dmigs pa'i rig byar gyur pa mi dmigs pa'i phyir med pa'i tha snyad du bstan to //
analyzed: 'dis ni dmigs pa'i rig byar gyur pa mi dmigs pa'i phyir med pa'i tha snyad du bstan to //
translated: This shows that the convention of nonexistence is taught because of the nonapprehension of that which is suitable to appear.

original: des khas blang zhing zhes bya ba ni rdul phra mo tsam 'dzin pa'i shes pa yod do zhes khas blangs shing ngo //
analyzed: des khas blang zhing zhes bya ba ni rdul phra mo tsam 'dzin pa'i shes pa yod do zhes khas blangs shing ngo //
translated: The phrase that is accepted means that is accepted as the consciousness that apprehends a mere particle.

original: de ltar mi dmigs bzhin du 'on kyang ci'i phyir khas mi blang snyam pa la /
analyzed: de ltar mi dmigs bzhin du 'on kyang ci'i phyir khas mi blang snyam pa la /
translated: Given that it is not apprehended, why is it still accepted?

original: rtog pa dang ldan pa rnams kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: rtog pa dang ldan pa rnams kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: ‚ÄúThose who have ideas‚Äù and so on.

original: 'dis ni yod pa'i tha snyad dgag pa bstan to //
analyzed: 'dis ni yod pa'i tha snyad dgag pa bstan to //
translated: This shows the refutation of the convention of existence.

original: rnam pa rnams sna tshogs nyid yin yang lhan cig dmigs par nges pas shes pa gcig gi rang bzhin yin par rigs pa'i phyir shes pa gcig gi phyogs ci'i phyir 'gal snyam du sems par 'gyur ba 'di sems la bsdogs nas /
analyzed: rnam pa rnams sna tshogs nyid yin yang lhan cig dmigs par nges pas shes pa gcig gi rang bzhin yin par rigs pa'i phyir shes pa gcig gi phyogs ci'i phyir 'gal snyam du sems par 'gyur ba 'di sems la bsdogs nas /
translated: Since the aspects are various, but are ascertained as simultaneously observed, it is reasonable that they are of the nature of a single consciousness. Therefore, thinking that the position of a single consciousness is not contradictory,

original: gzhan yang bcos ma @98b dang zhes bya ba la sogs pas bsdus pa'i sgo nas shes pa gcig pa'i phyogs nyid sun dbyung ba bstan te /
analyzed: gzhan yang bcos ma @98b dang zhes bya ba la sogs pas bsdus pa'i sgo nas shes pa gcig pa'i phyogs nyid sun dbyung ba bstan te /
translated: he refutes the position of a single consciousness by way of the argument from the diversity of aspects and so on.

original: chos 'gal ba gnas pa'i phyir phye ma leb khra bo la sogs pa gcig pu nyid yin pa bsal to //
analyzed: chos 'gal ba gnas pa'i phyir phye ma leb khra bo la sogs pa gcig pu nyid yin pa bsal to //
translated: Since it is the abode of contradictory attributes, the position that a multicolored object such as a butterfly is a single entity is refuted.

original: rnam pa lhan cig dmigs pa de la yang chos 'gal ba yod pa kho na yin pas sna tshogs gcig pa nyid du don dam par ni rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: rnam pa lhan cig dmigs pa de la yang chos 'gal ba yod pa kho na yin pas sna tshogs gcig pa nyid du don dam par ni rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: Since contradictory attributes exist in the simultaneous observation of aspects, it is not reasonable for the diversity of aspects to be a single entity ultimately.

original: gal te nye bar btags pa yin na ni de'i tshe 'gal ba med do //
analyzed: gal te nye bar btags pa yin na ni de'i tshe 'gal ba med do //
translated: If it is a mere designation, then there is no contradiction.

original: 'o na sna tshogs ma yin pa'i rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni pha rol po phyogs kyi phyogs gcig la ma grub pa nyid du rjod par byed de /
analyzed: 'o na sna tshogs ma yin pa'i rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni pha rol po phyogs kyi phyogs gcig la ma grub pa nyid du rjod par byed de /
translated: But the opponent‚Äôs position is not established in one part, as stated in the line, ‚ÄúIf consciousness is not manifold, etc.‚Äù

original: 'di ltar shes pa sna tshogs gang yin pa de kho na rang bzhin gcig pa 'gal gyi gang sna tshogs ma yin pa de ni gcig pa nyid du mi 'gal bas gtan tshigs phyogs kyi phyogs gcig la ma grub pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar shes pa sna tshogs gang yin pa de kho na rang bzhin gcig pa 'gal gyi gang sna tshogs ma yin pa de ni gcig pa nyid du mi 'gal bas gtan tshigs phyogs kyi phyogs gcig la ma grub pa yin no //
translated: For, it is contradictory for that which is manifold to be of a single nature, but it is not contradictory for that which is not manifold to be of a single nature. Therefore, the reason is not established in one part of the subject.

original: dmigs pa ni dmigs pa kho na yin te /
analyzed: dmigs pa ni dmigs pa kho na yin te /
translated: The object is the object itself.

original: drug pa yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i khams gang la sems dang sems las byung ba la dmigs pa yod pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: drug pa yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i khams gang la sems dang sems las byung ba la dmigs pa yod pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: The sixth element, the mental consciousness, is called the ‚Äúmind‚Äù and the ‚Äúmental faculty‚Äù because it is the basis of the mind and mental factors.

original: de dang don mthun te zhes bya ba ni mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa dang yul gcig pa gang yin pa de yang bsags pa la dmigs pa kho na yin pa'o //
analyzed: de dang don mthun te zhes bya ba ni mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa dang yul gcig pa gang yin pa de yang bsags pa la dmigs pa kho na yin pa'o //
translated: The phrase in a manner consistent with that means that whatever is the same object as eye consciousness and so on is also an object that focuses on a composite.

original: 'o na yid kyi rnam par shes pa chos kyi khams la dmigs pa nam mkha' la sogs pa 'dus ma byas la dmigs pa'i phyir rang bzhin gcig par 'gyur ro snyam pa la /
analyzed: 'o na yid kyi rnam par shes pa chos kyi khams la dmigs pa nam mkha' la sogs pa 'dus ma byas la dmigs pa'i phyir rang bzhin gcig par 'gyur ro snyam pa la /
translated: If that is so, then mental consciousness that focuses on the phenomena element would be the same nature as the other four because it focuses on unconditioned states such as space.

original: chos kyi khams rnam par rig byed ma yin pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: chos kyi khams rnam par rig byed ma yin pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: To respond, the root text states, ‚ÄúThe phenomena element is nonindicative form and so on.‚Äù

original: 'dus ma byas nam mkha' dang so sor brtags pa dang / so sor brtags pa ma yin pas 'gog pa dang / rnam par rig byed ma yin pa ni tshad mas gnod pa'i phyir shugs kyis tshor ba dang 'du shes dang 'du byed dang phung po gsum gyi rang bzhin kho na yin no //
analyzed: 'dus ma byas nam mkha' dang so sor brtags pa dang / so sor brtags pa ma yin pas 'gog pa dang / rnam par rig byed ma yin pa ni tshad mas gnod pa'i phyir shugs kyis tshor ba dang 'du shes dang 'du byed dang phung po gsum gyi rang bzhin kho na yin no //
translated: Unconditioned space, analytical cessation, nonanalytical cessation and nonindicative form are the nature of the three aggregates of feeling, discernment and formation because they are implicitly included by valid cognition.

original: de la dmigs pa'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa yang zhes bya ba ni rnal 'byor pa rnams kyi shes pa gang yin pa de 'dir 'dod pa ste /
analyzed: de la dmigs pa'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa yang zhes bya ba ni rnal 'byor pa rnams kyi shes pa gang yin pa de 'dir 'dod pa ste /
translated: The mental consciousness that perceives it is also like that.

original: rnal 'byor ba'i shes pa la dmigs par rung bar thams cad 'dra ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnal 'byor ba'i shes pa la dmigs par rung bar thams cad 'dra ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The consciousness of yogins is accepted here, because it is similar to everything that is suitable to be the object of the consciousness of yogins.

original: so so'i skye bo rnams kyis yid kyi rnam par shes pa rnam par rtog pa gang yin pa de ni sems la sogs pa'i nyi tshe shes pa can du myong ba kho na yin mod kyi /
analyzed: so so'i skye bo rnams kyis yid kyi rnam par shes pa rnam par rtog pa gang yin pa de ni sems la sogs pa'i nyi tshe shes pa can du myong ba kho na yin mod kyi /
translated: The conceptual mental consciousness of ordinary beings is only experienced as the cognition of individual things such as the mind.

original: 'on kyang don dam par na de ni yul med pa kho na yin @99a * //üîΩno ; / de lta mod kyi /
analyzed: 'on kyang don dam par na de ni yul med pa kho na yin @99a * // no ; / de lta mod kyi /
translated: However, in the ultimate sense, it is only devoid of objects.

original: sgra'i rnam par skye ba'i phyir shes pa yang sna tshogs pa'i rnam pa nyid las mi 'da'o //
analyzed: sgra'i rnam par skye ba'i phyir shes pa yang sna tshogs pa'i rnam pa nyid las mi 'da'o //
translated: Nevertheless, because it arises in the aspect of sound, consciousness does not transcend the aspect of diversity.

original: re zhig de ltar rang gi sde pa'i lugs kyi shes pa thams cad sna tshogs pa nyid du bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: re zhig de ltar rang gi sde pa'i lugs kyi shes pa thams cad sna tshogs pa nyid du bstan pa yin no //
translated: Thus, it has been demonstrated that all consciousnesses of our own Buddhist schools are diverse.

original: da ni phyi rol pa'i lugs kyis bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni phyi rol pa'i lugs kyis bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to demonstrate the non-Buddhist schools, it is said:

original: gang dag bde bar gshegs pa'i gsung rab ces bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: gang dag bde bar gshegs pa'i gsung rab ces bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: Those who say that the scriptures of the Sugata are not the word of the Buddha, etc.

original: gzegs zan ni gzegs ma za ba'o //
analyzed: gzegs zan ni gzegs ma za ba'o //
translated: The Nirgranthas are those who go naked.üîΩThe substance of the effect, etc.

original: 'bras bu rdzas la sogs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa zhes bya ba'i sgras ni yon tan dang las la sogs pa bsdu ste /
analyzed: 'bras bu rdzas la sogs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa zhes bya ba'i sgras ni yon tan dang las la sogs pa bsdu ste /
translated: The word ‚Äúetc.‚Äù includes qualities, actions, etc.

original: 'di ltar de dag gi lugs ni lus la sogs pa 'bras bu'i rdzas kyang gcig pa kho na yin la /
analyzed: 'di ltar de dag gi lugs ni lus la sogs pa 'bras bu'i rdzas kyang gcig pa kho na yin la /
translated: Thus, their system is that the substance of the effect, such as the body, is only one,

original: rdzas dang ldan pa yon tan la sogs pa yang gcig pa kho nar gzung ngo zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: rdzas dang ldan pa yon tan la sogs pa yang gcig pa kho nar gzung ngo zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: and that substance, which possesses qualities, etc., is only one.üîΩIt is not tenable, etc.

original: mi rung ste zhes bya ba ni lan 'debs pa ste /
analyzed: mi rung ste zhes bya ba ni lan 'debs pa ste /
translated: is the reply.

original: 'bras bu'i rdzas gcig pa kho nar 'dod mod kyi /
analyzed: 'bras bu'i rdzas gcig pa kho nar 'dod mod kyi /
translated: Although they assert that the substance of the effect is only one,

original: 'bras bu'i rdzas yon tan la sogs pa dang lhan cig pa kho na 'dzin pa'i phyir dang / yon tan la sogs pa rten dang bral bar mi 'dzin pa'i phyir yul du ma yin pas shes pa sna tshogs kho na yin no //
analyzed: 'bras bu'i rdzas yon tan la sogs pa dang lhan cig pa kho na 'dzin pa'i phyir dang / yon tan la sogs pa rten dang bral bar mi 'dzin pa'i phyir yul du ma yin pas shes pa sna tshogs kho na yin no //
translated: since the substance of the effect is apprehended only as concomitant with qualities, etc., and since qualities, etc., are not apprehended as divorced from a basis, they are not multiple objects. Therefore, consciousness is only of various aspects.

original: 'o na zad byed pa dang dpyod pa pa'i lta ba la ji ltar snyam pa la /
analyzed: 'o na zad byed pa dang dpyod pa pa'i lta ba la ji ltar snyam pa la /
translated: Now, what is the view of the annihilationists and the investigators?

original: rgyal ba pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: rgyal ba pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The victors, etc.

original: zad byed pa rnams kyi ston pa rgyal ba yin la zad byed pa rnams rgyal ba'i yin pas na rgyal ba pa rnams so //
analyzed: zad byed pa rnams kyi ston pa rgyal ba yin la zad byed pa rnams rgyal ba'i yin pas na rgyal ba pa rnams so //
translated: The teacher of the annihilationists is the Victor, and the annihilationists are the victors, hence, the victors.

original: zad byed pa rnams kyi lugs ni dngos po thams cad nor bu'i gzi bzhin du du ma'i ngo bo kho na yin te /
analyzed: zad byed pa rnams kyi lugs ni dngos po thams cad nor bu'i gzi bzhin du du ma'i ngo bo kho na yin te /
translated: The system of the annihilationists is that all things are only of multiple natures, like the luster of a jewel,

original: rtogs pa po'i bye brag gis dngos po 'gal la ngo bo rnam pa sna tshogs su dmigs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: rtogs pa po'i bye brag gis dngos po 'gal la ngo bo rnam pa sna tshogs su dmigs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: because the various natures of things are observed to be different according to the differences in the perceivers.

original: gal te de lta na thams cad kyi rtogs pa 'dra bar 'gyur te dmigs pa gcig pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gal te de lta na thams cad kyi rtogs pa 'dra bar 'gyur te dmigs pa gcig pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If that is so, then all perceivers would be the same, because of the single object.

original: 'dir len du du ma'i ngo bo'i dngos po la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: 'dir len du du ma'i ngo bo'i dngos po la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Here, in response, he says, ‚ÄúThings that are of multiple natures,‚Äù etc.

original: su zhig ngo bo gang kho na smra bar 'dod pa de ni tha snyad 'dogs pa'i dus na de nyid cig car ram rim gyis ston par byed la rtogs pa'i dus na tha dad pa dang tha dad pa ma yin pa rtogs pa ni 'dod pa'i dbang gis
analyzed: su zhig ngo bo gang kho na smra bar 'dod pa de ni tha snyad 'dogs pa'i dus na de nyid cig car ram rim gyis ston par byed la rtogs pa'i dus na tha dad pa dang tha dad pa ma yin pa rtogs pa ni 'dod pa'i dbang gis
translated: Whoever wishes to speak of the nature of something, when he is designating a convention, teaches that nature either simultaneously or sequentially. When he is understanding, he understands it as either different or not different, depending on his desire.

original: kha dog khra bo bzhin du thams cad sna tshogs kyi dngos po'i ngo bo kho na ston pas nyes pa med do //
analyzed: kha dog khra bo bzhin du thams cad sna tshogs kyi dngos po'i ngo bo kho na ston pas nyes pa med do //
translated: Like a multicolored object, he teaches the nature of all things as variegated. Therefore, there is no fault.

original: gal te de ltar yul sna tshogs pa yin du zin kyang /
analyzed: gal te de ltar yul sna tshogs pa yin du zin kyang /
translated: If the object is variegated in that way,

original: yul sna tshogs 'dzin pa'i shes pa sna tshogs su 'gyur ro zhes bya ba 'di la @99b 'brel pa ci zhig yod snyam pa la /
analyzed: yul sna tshogs 'dzin pa'i shes pa sna tshogs su 'gyur ro zhes bya ba 'di la @99b 'brel pa ci zhig yod snyam pa la /
translated: what is the connection between the apprehension of a variegated object and a variegated consciousness?

original: yul sna tshogs la rnam par shes pa sna tshogs ma yin pa snang ba ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: yul sna tshogs la rnam par shes pa sna tshogs ma yin pa snang ba ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: In response to this question, Vasubandhu says, ‚ÄúThe appearance of a variegated object is not the appearance of a variegated consciousness.‚Äù

original: de dang mthun par mi 'jug ces bya ba ni shes pa rnam pa sna tshogs pa ma yin pas yul sna tshogs mi 'dzin par thal bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de dang mthun par mi 'jug ces bya ba ni shes pa rnam pa sna tshogs pa ma yin pas yul sna tshogs mi 'dzin par thal bar 'gyur te /
translated: The phrase it does not engage in accordance with that means that because consciousness is not of various aspects, it follows that it does not grasp various objects.

original: ji ltar sngar brjod pa bzhin no snyam du bsams pa'o //
analyzed: ji ltar sngar brjod pa bzhin no snyam du bsams pa'o //
translated: The meaning is that it is just as was stated previously.

original: lha'i bla ma ni phur bu'o //
analyzed: lha'i bla ma ni phur bu'o //
translated: The teacher of the gods is Brihaspati.

original: phur bu'i lta ba'i rjes su 'brang ba rnams ni tshu rol mdzes pa dag go //
analyzed: phur bu'i lta ba'i rjes su 'brang ba rnams ni tshu rol mdzes pa dag go //
translated: Those who follow the views of Brihaspati are the Lokayatas.

original: 'di ltar tshu rol mdzes pa pa rnams kyi mdo ni sa dang chu dang me dang rlung zhes bya ba ni de kho na bzhi yin la de kho na 'dus pa la ni yul dang dbang po dag gzhag go zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar tshu rol mdzes pa pa rnams kyi mdo ni sa dang chu dang me dang rlung zhes bya ba ni de kho na bzhi yin la de kho na 'dus pa la ni yul dang dbang po dag gzhag go zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: The Lokayata sutra states, Earth, water, fire, and wind are the four realities. The sense faculties and their objects are posited as a combination of those realities.

original: 'dus pa'i yul can yin bzhin du //
analyzed: 'dus pa'i yul can yin bzhin du //
translated: Although the sense faculties and their objects are posited as a combination of those realities,

original: ji ltar yul du ma nyid yin snyam pa la /
analyzed: ji ltar yul du ma nyid yin snyam pa la /
translated: how can they be multiple objects?

original: 'dus par rnam par gzhag pa'i rgyu ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: 'dus par rnam par gzhag pa'i rgyu ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The cause for positing a combination is the fact that the sense faculties and their objects are the basis for the arising of a single consciousness.

original: tshu rol mdzes pa pa rnams kyi ltar na yang 'dus pa can rnams las 'dus pa gzhan med do //
analyzed: tshu rol mdzes pa pa rnams kyi ltar na yang 'dus pa can rnams las 'dus pa gzhan med do //
translated: Even according to the LokƒÅyatas, the collection is not different from the collected.

original: ser skya pa ni grangs can no //
analyzed: ser skya pa ni grangs can no //
translated: The followers of Kapila are the SƒÅ·πÉkhyas.

original: de dag gi gzhung 'di ni sgra la sogs pa yul thams cad ni snying stobs dang rdul dang mun pa'i ngo bo dag yin no zhes bya ba yin te de dag gi gzhung la ni yul sna tshogs pa nyid du gsal ba kho na'o //
analyzed: de dag gi gzhung 'di ni sgra la sogs pa yul thams cad ni snying stobs dang rdul dang mun pa'i ngo bo dag yin no zhes bya ba yin te de dag gi gzhung la ni yul sna tshogs pa nyid du gsal ba kho na'o //
translated: Their doctrine is that all objects such as sound are of the nature of sattva, rajas, and tamas. In their doctrine, the diversity of objects is clearly evident.

original: ji ste gsum gyi bdag nyid ces bya ba la sogs pas ni pha rol po'i lan la dogs pa bsu ba ste /
analyzed: ji ste gsum gyi bdag nyid ces bya ba la sogs pas ni pha rol po'i lan la dogs pa bsu ba ste /
translated: If it is said that the object is of the nature of the three, etc., this anticipates an objection to the opponent‚Äôs response.

original: yul ni snying stobs la sogs pa'i ngo bor gsum gyi bdag nyid yin yang de ni gsum gyi bdag nyid du mi snang gi / snying stobs la sogs pa'i ngo bo shas che ba kho na snang ba'i phyir rnam pa sna tshogs nyid du mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yul ni snying stobs la sogs pa'i ngo bor gsum gyi bdag nyid yin yang de ni gsum gyi bdag nyid du mi snang gi / snying stobs la sogs pa'i ngo bo shas che ba kho na snang ba'i phyir rnam pa sna tshogs nyid du mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Even though the object is of the nature of the three, sattva, etc., it does not appear as the nature of the three, but because only the nature of sattva, etc., in excess appears, there is no diversity of aspects.

original: de yang de ltar mi rung ste zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni shas che ba yang 'khrul pa yod par ston par byed do //üîΩrigs kyi bye brag ni rnga mo la sogs pa'i rigs kyi bu bye brag las ni 'di ltar tsher ma la sogs pa la rnga mo la sogs pa ni dad la gzhan dag ni yid 'byung ngo /
analyzed: de yang de ltar mi rung ste zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni shas che ba yang 'khrul pa yod par ston par byed do // rigs kyi bye brag ni rnga mo la sogs pa'i rigs kyi bu bye brag las ni 'di ltar tsher ma la sogs pa la rnga mo la sogs pa ni dad la gzhan dag ni yid 'byung ngo /
translated: The author of the commentary explains that the predominance of one of the three constituents is also subject to error.üîΩThe predominance of a particular species is seen in the fact that camels and so on are attracted to thorns and so on, while others are repelled by them.üîΩThe predominance of a particular cultivation is seen in the fact that some are attracted to women and so on, while others are attracted to wandering ascetics and so on.üîΩThe predominance of a particular affliction is seen in the fact that some are attracted to the burning of a funeral pyre, while others are attracted to the embrace of a lover.

original: bsgoms pa'i bye brag ni bud med la sogs pa la g-yem pa dang kun tu rgyu la sogs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: bsgoms pa'i bye brag ni bud med la sogs pa la g-yem pa dang kun tu rgyu la sogs pa lta bu'o //
translated: The predominance of a particular constituent is seen in the fact that some are attracted to the smell of urine and excrement, while others are attracted to the smell of sandalwood and so on.üîΩThe predominance of a particular constituent is seen in the fact that some are attracted to the smell of urine and excrement, while others are attracted to the smell of sandalwood and so on.üîΩThe predominance of a particular constituent is seen in the fact that some are attracted to the smell of urine and excrement, while others are attracted to the smell of sandalwood and so on.üîΩThe predominance of a particular constituent is seen in the fact that some are attracted to the smell of urine and excrement, while others are attracted to the smell of sandalwood and so on.üîΩThe predominance of a particular constituent is seen in the fact that some are attracted to the smell of urine and excrement, while others are attracted to the smell of sandalwood and so on.üîΩThe predominance of a particular constituent is seen in the fact that some are attracted to the smell of urine and excrement, while others are attracted to the smell of sandalwood and so on.üîΩThe predominance of a particular constituent is seen in the fact that some are attracted to the smell of urine and excrement, while others are attracted to the smell of sandalwood and so on.üîΩThe predominance of a particular constituent is seen in the fact that some are attracted to the smell of urine and excrement, while others are attracted to the smell of sandalwood and so on.üîΩThe predominance of a particular constituent is seen in the fact that some are attracted to the smell of urine and excrement, while others are attracted to the smell of sandalwood and so on.

original: gdung ba la sogs pa dang / zhum pa dang dga' ba ni go rims bzhin du rdul dang mun pa dang snying stobs shas che ba rnams kyi 'bras bu dag yin no //üîΩngo bo gcig kho na shas che na gnyis kyi 'bras bu gang yin pa der yang mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gdung ba la sogs pa dang / zhum pa dang dga' ba ni go rims bzhin du rdul dang mun pa dang snying stobs shas che ba rnams kyi 'bras bu dag yin no // ngo bo gcig kho na shas che na gnyis kyi 'bras bu gang yin pa der yang mi 'gyur ro //
translated: The predominance of a particular constituent is seen in the fact that some are attracted to the smell of urine and excrement, while others are attracted to the smell of sandalwood and so on.

original: mi snang ba la sogs pa'i dbang gis zhes @100a * //üîΩbya ba ni pha rol gyi lan la dogs pa bsu ba ste /
analyzed: mi snang ba la sogs pa'i dbang gis zhes @100a * //üîΩbya ba ni pha rol gyi lan la dogs pa bsu ba ste /
translated: The predominance of a particular constituent is seen

original: shas che ba kho na 'dzin pa ma yin gyi mi snang ba chos dang chos ma yin pa'i mthus kyang 'dzin pa yin no //
analyzed: shas che ba kho na 'dzin pa ma yin gyi mi snang ba chos dang chos ma yin pa'i mthus kyang 'dzin pa yin no //
translated: It is not that only the predominant is apprehended, but also the non-appearing, through the power of the Dharma and non-Dharma.

original: sogs pa zhes bya ba'i sgras ni dbang phyug dang bcas pa'i grangs can gyi lugs kyis dbang phyug gi mthus kyang 'dzin pa bsdu'o //
analyzed: sogs pa zhes bya ba'i sgras ni dbang phyug dang bcas pa'i grangs can gyi lugs kyis dbang phyug gi mthus kyang 'dzin pa bsdu'o //
translated: The word etc. includes the apprehension through the power of God, according to the SƒÅ·πÉkhya system that includes God.

original: pha rol po dag na re dngos po 'ga' zhig 'dzin pa'i phyir shes pa 'ga' zhig rnam pa gcig pa kho nar 'gyur ro zhes zer ro //
analyzed: pha rol po dag na re dngos po 'ga' zhig 'dzin pa'i phyir shes pa 'ga' zhig rnam pa gcig pa kho nar 'gyur ro zhes zer ro //
translated: The opponent says: Because of the apprehension of some entity, some cognition would be of only one aspect.

original: 'dir lan du dngos po'i ngo bo rnam gsum la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: 'dir lan du dngos po'i ngo bo rnam gsum la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: Here, the response is: Regarding the three natures of the entity... and so on.

original: de dang mi mthun pa snang zhes bya ba ni rnam pa gsum gyi dngos po dang mi mthun par snang ba ste /
analyzed: de dang mi mthun pa snang zhes bya ba ni rnam pa gsum gyi dngos po dang mi mthun par snang ba ste /
translated: Appearing contrary to that means appearing contrary to the three natures of the entity.

original: dngos po gcig pa kho na la rnam pa gsum du 'dod do //
analyzed: dngos po gcig pa kho na la rnam pa gsum du 'dod do //
translated: It is asserted that in only one entity, there are three aspects.

original: rnam pa gsum gyi dngos po yang rnam pa gsum gyi ngo bor mi 'dzin na /
analyzed: rnam pa gsum gyi dngos po yang rnam pa gsum gyi ngo bor mi 'dzin na /
translated: If the three natures are not apprehended as having three natures,

original: ji ltar na dngos po gzung bar 'gyur /
analyzed: ji ltar na dngos po gzung bar 'gyur /
translated: how can the entity be apprehended?

original: yang dag par na rnam pa gzhan gyis ni gzhan 'dzin pa ma yin te /
analyzed: yang dag par na rnam pa gzhan gyis ni gzhan 'dzin pa ma yin te /
translated: In reality, it is not that one form apprehends another,

original: ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because that would lead to an absurd conclusion.

original: de ni du ma'i bdag nyid dngos po de //
analyzed: de ni du ma'i bdag nyid dngos po de //
translated: That which is of the nature of many

original: bdag nyid gcig tu ston byed na //
analyzed: bdag nyid gcig tu ston byed na //
translated: is shown to be of a single nature.

original: mi snang de ni ji lta bur //
analyzed: mi snang de ni ji lta bur //
translated: How can that which is not seen

original: don ston byed pa yin par 'gyur //
analyzed: don ston byed pa yin par 'gyur //
translated: show the object?

original: zhes bshad de //
analyzed: zhes bshad de //
translated: Thus it is explained.

original: re zhig de ltar pha rol pos brjod pa gnyis kyi tshul la shes pa rang bzhin gcig pa nyid med do zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: re zhig de ltar pha rol pos brjod pa gnyis kyi tshul la shes pa rang bzhin gcig pa nyid med do zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: In this way, it has been shown that in the two modes of expression by the opponent, consciousness does not have a single nature.

original: pha rol dang pha rol ma yin pas brjod pa gnyis ma yin pa'i tshul la yang bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: pha rol dang pha rol ma yin pas brjod pa gnyis ma yin pa'i tshul la yang bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to show that it is also not the case in the mode of expression that is neither of the two, other and not other,

original: gsang ba gang dag ces bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: gsang ba gang dag ces bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: he says, ‚ÄúWhat is the secret . . . ,‚Äù and so on.

original: gsang ba brjod pa'am rig pas na gsang ba bdag ste /
analyzed: gsang ba brjod pa'am rig pas na gsang ba bdag ste /
translated: Because it is expressed or known as a secret, it is the secret self.

original: rig byed kyi mtha' smra ba rnams zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rig byed kyi mtha' smra ba rnams zhes bya'o //
translated: Those who speak of the VedƒÅnta are called ‚Äúthe VedƒÅntins.‚Äù

original: de dag na re rnam par shes pa ni rtag pa gcig pu gnyis su med pa yin yang cig car dang rim gyis 'di thams cad sna tshogs kyi ngo bor rnam par shes pa nyid snang ngo zhes zer te /
analyzed: de dag na re rnam par shes pa ni rtag pa gcig pu gnyis su med pa yin yang cig car dang rim gyis 'di thams cad sna tshogs kyi ngo bor rnam par shes pa nyid snang ngo zhes zer te /
translated: They say that consciousness is permanent, unitary, and nondual, but it is consciousness itself that appears as all of this variety simultaneously and in succession.

original: de dag gi phyogs ltar na sna tshogs pa nyid 'bad mi dgos par grub pa kho na'o //
analyzed: de dag gi phyogs ltar na sna tshogs pa nyid 'bad mi dgos par grub pa kho na'o //
translated: According to their position, variety is established without any effort.

original: sna tshogs pa nyid yin yang ji ltar na gcig pa nyid du rung bar shin tu dka' snyam pa la /
analyzed: sna tshogs pa nyid yin yang ji ltar na gcig pa nyid du rung bar shin tu dka' snyam pa la /
translated: But it is very difficult to understand how it can be unitary when it is variety.

original: 'di ltar sngon po dang ser po'i rnam pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: 'di ltar sngon po dang ser po'i rnam pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: Thus he says, ‚ÄúThe aspects of blue, yellow, and so on,‚Äù and so forth.

original: rim gyis snang ba nyid la ji ltar rigs pa ma yin snyam pa la /
analyzed: rim gyis snang ba nyid la ji ltar rigs pa ma yin snyam pa la /
translated: How is it unreasonable that it appears in succession?

original: rim yang gzugs dang sgra la sogs par snang ba ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: rim yang gzugs dang sgra la sogs par snang ba ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: Thus he says, ‚ÄúThe appearance of form, sound, and so on,‚Äù and so forth.

original: 'di @100b dag nyid kyis zhes bya ba ni rnam pa du ma dag dang tha dad pa ma yin pa dang rnam pa de'i rang gi ngo bo bzhin zhes bya ba dag gis so //
analyzed: 'di @100b dag nyid kyis zhes bya ba ni rnam pa du ma dag dang tha dad pa ma yin pa dang rnam pa de'i rang gi ngo bo bzhin zhes bya ba dag gis so //
translated: ‚ÄúBy these very same‚Äù means by the many aspects, not being different, and the nature of those aspects.

original: 'dir bzlog na gnod pa can gyi tshad ma ci yod snyam pa la /
analyzed: 'dir bzlog na gnod pa can gyi tshad ma ci yod snyam pa la /
translated: Here, one might wonder, ‚ÄúWhat is the invalidating valid cognition that refutes this?‚Äù

original: de lta ma yin na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te //
translated: In response to that, he says, ‚ÄúIf it were not so,‚Äù and so on.

original: gal te grub pa dang bde ba gcig pa nyid du khas mi len na /
analyzed: gal te grub pa dang bde ba gcig pa nyid du khas mi len na /
translated: If one does not accept that the object and consciousness are the same,

original: de'i tshe rnam pa dang rnam par shes pa 'di gnyis gcig pa nyid du brjod par mi bya'o //
analyzed: de'i tshe rnam pa dang rnam par shes pa 'di gnyis gcig pa nyid du brjod par mi bya'o //
translated: then at that time one should not say that these two, the aspects and consciousness, are the same.

original: de'i phyir du ma nyid yin na phyogs snga ma'i nyes pa ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir du ma nyid yin na phyogs snga ma'i nyes pa ste /
translated: Therefore, if they are many, the fault of the opponent‚Äôs position arises.

original: rnam pa gnyis kyi phyogs la du ma'i nyes pa bshad pa thams cad du thal bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: rnam pa gnyis kyi phyogs la du ma'i nyes pa bshad pa thams cad du thal bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The fault of being many applies to the position of two aspects. The fault of being many applies to all of the positions. This is the meaning.

original: rim gyis phyogs la zhes bya ba ni rim gyis snang ba'i phyogs la'o //
analyzed: rim gyis phyogs la zhes bya ba ni rim gyis snang ba'i phyogs la'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIn the position of gradual appearance‚Äù means in the position of gradual appearance.

original: sbyor ba ni gang zhig gang gi bdag nyid du gyur pa de ni de rig pa na rig pa kho nar 'gyur ro /
analyzed: sbyor ba ni gang zhig gang gi bdag nyid du gyur pa de ni de rig pa na rig pa kho nar 'gyur ro /
translated: The argument is this: Whatever is of the nature of something, when that is cognized, it is cognized.

original: dper na mngon par 'dod pa sngon po la sogs pa'i rnam pa'i rnam pa shes pa'i bdag nyid dam /
analyzed: dper na mngon par 'dod pa sngon po la sogs pa'i rnam pa'i rnam pa shes pa'i bdag nyid dam /
translated: For example, the aspect of the object, such as blue, which is desired, is of the nature of the consciousness that cognizes it,

original: sngon po la sogs pa'i rnam pa lta bu'o//
analyzed: sngon po la sogs pa'i rnam pa lta bu'o//
translated: or it is like the aspect of blue, and so on.

original: ser po la sogs pa'i rnam pa rim gyis snang ba can thams cad kyang mngon par 'dod pa sngon po la sogs pa'i rnam pa myong ba'i bdag nyid can du gyur pa yin te /
analyzed: ser po la sogs pa'i rnam pa rim gyis snang ba can thams cad kyang mngon par 'dod pa sngon po la sogs pa'i rnam pa myong ba'i bdag nyid can du gyur pa yin te /
translated: All those that appear in sequence, such as the aspect of yellow, are of the nature of the experience of the desired aspect of blue, and so on.

original: rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs yin no //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs yin no //
translated: This is a natural inference.

original: 'di snyam du de'i tshe rnam pa snga ma dang phyi ma dag mi nye ba'i phyir de'i bdag nyid du gyur pa yin yang myong bar mi 'gyur ro snyam du sems par gyur na /
analyzed: 'di snyam du de'i tshe rnam pa snga ma dang phyi ma dag mi nye ba'i phyir de'i bdag nyid du gyur pa yin yang myong bar mi 'gyur ro snyam du sems par gyur na /
translated: If you think that at that time, although it is of the nature of the former and latter aspects, it is not experienced because they are not present,

original: de yang rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de yang rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: that is illogical.

original: de'i bdag nyid du gyur pa'i phyir mngon par 'dod pa'i rnam pa bzhin du de'i tshe rnam pa snga ma dang phyi ma de gnyis kyang nye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i bdag nyid du gyur pa'i phyir mngon par 'dod pa'i rnam pa bzhin du de'i tshe rnam pa snga ma dang phyi ma de gnyis kyang nye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is of the nature of that, at that time, the former and latter aspects are near, like the aspect that is desired.

original: de lta bas na mngon par 'dod pa sngon po la sogs pa'i rnam pa gcig rig na rnam pa snga ma dang phyi ma'i rig par thal bar 'gyur ba bzlog dka'o //
analyzed: de lta bas na mngon par 'dod pa sngon po la sogs pa'i rnam pa gcig rig na rnam pa snga ma dang phyi ma'i rig par thal bar 'gyur ba bzlog dka'o //
translated: Therefore, when one cognizes the aspect of a desired object, such as blue, it is difficult to avoid the consequence that one cognizes the former and latter aspects.

original: ji ste rim gyis snang ba la sogs pa brdzun pa'i phyir rim la sogs pa'i don mi 'thad pas /
analyzed: ji ste rim gyis snang ba la sogs pa brdzun pa'i phyir rim la sogs pa'i don mi 'thad pas /
translated: If you think that because the appearance of a sequence and so on is false, the meaning of a sequence and so on is untenable,

original: 'di ni klan kar mi rung ngo snyam na /
analyzed: 'di ni klan kar mi rung ngo snyam na /
translated: and therefore this is not a fault,

original: de ni rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: that is illogical.

original: gal te thams cad brdzun pa yin na 'o na bden pa de gang zhig yin pa brjod par bya dgos so //
analyzed: gal te thams cad brdzun pa yin na 'o na bden pa de gang zhig yin pa brjod par bya dgos so //
translated: If everything is false, then you must state what is true.

original: gal te tshangs pa'i ngo bo gnyis su med pa kho na bden no zhe na /
analyzed: gal te tshangs pa'i ngo bo gnyis su med pa kho na bden no zhe na /
translated: If you say that the nondual nature of BrahmƒÅ alone is true,

original: gal te de lta na gnyis su med pa'i shes pa brdzun pa dang lhan cig tu 'brel pa ci zhig yod /
analyzed: gal te de lta na gnyis su med pa'i shes pa brdzun pa dang lhan cig tu 'brel pa ci zhig yod /
translated: then how could nondual consciousness be related to what is false?

original: gang gis na de ltar bden pa de ltar brdzun pa'i ngo bor bdag @101a * //
analyzed: gang gis na de ltar bden pa de ltar brdzun pa'i ngo bor bdag @101a * //
translated: How could it be that the nature of things is true and the nature of things is false?

original: nyid snang bar 'gyur /
analyzed: nyid snang bar 'gyur /
translated: How could it be that the nature of reality appears in such a way and the nature of unreality appears in such a way?

original: re zhig bden pa'i ngo bo nyid ni ma yin te /
analyzed: re zhig bden pa'i ngo bo nyid ni ma yin te /
translated: First, it is not the nature of reality,

original: bden pa dang brdzun pa'i ngo bo gnyis 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bden pa dang brdzun pa'i ngo bo gnyis 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because the nature of reality and the nature of unreality are mutually exclusive.

original: bden pa las skyes pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: bden pa las skyes pa yang ma yin te /
translated: Nor is it born from reality,

original: brdzun pa ni bya ba ma yin pa'i phyir la rtag pa yang don byed pa'i nus pa dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: brdzun pa ni bya ba ma yin pa'i phyir la rtag pa yang don byed pa'i nus pa dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because the unreal is not an object of action and the real is devoid of the capacity to perform a function.

original: bden pa ni bdag nyid de ltar mi snang ngo zhes brjod pa yang rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: bden pa ni bdag nyid de ltar mi snang ngo zhes brjod pa yang rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: It is also not reasonable to say that the real does not appear in such a way,

original: gang gi bden pa bdag nyid de ltar snang bar 'gyur ba shes pa las ma gtogs pa gzhan yang med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang gi bden pa bdag nyid de ltar snang bar 'gyur ba shes pa las ma gtogs pa gzhan yang med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because apart from consciousness, there is nothing else that is real and could appear in such a way.

original: cung zad kyang mi snang ngo zhes kyang brjod par yang rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: cung zad kyang mi snang ngo zhes kyang brjod par yang rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: It is also not reasonable to say that it does not appear in any way whatsoever,

original: nyams su myong ba dang 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nyams su myong ba dang 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because that contradicts experience.

original: de lta bas na shes pa'i rang bzhin nyid de 'dra ste /
analyzed: de lta bas na shes pa'i rang bzhin nyid de 'dra ste /
translated: Therefore, the nature of consciousness is just like that.

original: des na de ltar brdzun pa'i rnam pa 'dzin par snang bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba 'di kho na brjod par bya dgos so //
analyzed: des na de ltar brdzun pa'i rnam pa 'dzin par snang bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba 'di kho na brjod par bya dgos so //
translated: Therefore, it must be said that it is the appearance that apprehends the aspect of falsity.

original: de lta yin te brdzun pa'i rnam par snang ba na ni brdzun pa nyid du mngon par rgyug go zhes bya bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta yin te brdzun pa'i rnam par snang ba na ni brdzun pa nyid du mngon par rgyug go zhes bya bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If that were so, then when there is an appearance of falsity, it would be the case that falsity itself is manifest.

original: de lta ma yin na ni shes pas yul brdzun par 'dzin pa'i mi nus pas de'i phyir grogs po khyod kyis kho bo 'phel ba yin no //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na ni shes pas yul brdzun par 'dzin pa'i mi nus pas de'i phyir grogs po khyod kyis kho bo 'phel ba yin no //
translated: If that were not so, then consciousness would be unable to apprehend a false object, and therefore you, my friend, would be increasing my pride.

original: brdzun pa'i ngo bos bden pa sgrub par byed pa'i tshad ma yang ci yang med pas khyod kyi de ni bdag tu 'dzin pa shin tu dam pos bskyed ba'i bdag chad pas skrag pa'i phyir ltung bas 'jigs nas nam mkha'i rtsva la 'ju bar byed pa lta bu
analyzed: brdzun pa'i ngo bos bden pa sgrub par byed pa'i tshad ma yang ci yang med pas khyod kyi de ni bdag tu 'dzin pa shin tu dam pos bskyed ba'i bdag chad pas skrag pa'i phyir ltung bas 'jigs nas nam mkha'i rtsva la 'ju bar byed pa lta bu
translated: And since there is no valid cognition whatsoever that establishes truth by means of a false entity, your position is like someone who, out of fear of falling, clings tightly to a rope and is terrified of letting go, even though there is no rope at all.

original: 'ba' zhig tu zad pas 'di ni gyi na'o //
analyzed: 'ba' zhig tu zad pas 'di ni gyi na'o //
translated: It is just a fantasy.

original: nam mkha' dang zhes bya ba la sogs pas mdo sde pa la sogs pa'i gzhung gis gtan tshigs ma grub par dogs pa bsu bar byed de /
analyzed: nam mkha' dang zhes bya ba la sogs pas mdo sde pa la sogs pa'i gzhung gis gtan tshigs ma grub par dogs pa bsu bar byed de /
translated: The passage beginning ‚ÄúSpace, etc.‚Äù anticipates the objection that the reason is not established for SautrƒÅntikas and so on.

original: de dag ltar na yang shes pa rnams sgra'i rnam par gzhag par 'byung ba'i phyir sna tshogs pa nyid yod pa kho na bsam grub pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de dag ltar na yang shes pa rnams sgra'i rnam par gzhag par 'byung ba'i phyir sna tshogs pa nyid yod pa kho na bsam grub pa ma yin no //
translated: Even according to them, since consciousnesses arise in the aspect of sound, the existence of variety is not established.

original: khas blangs te yang zhes bya ba ni sna tshogs su snang ba ma yin par ro //
analyzed: khas blangs te yang zhes bya ba ni sna tshogs su snang ba ma yin par ro //
translated: ‚ÄúEven though‚Äù means even though it does not appear as various.

original: mtshan nyid bcas pa la zhes bya ba ni mtshan nyid dang bcas par 'dod pa mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa la'o //
analyzed: mtshan nyid bcas pa la zhes bya ba ni mtshan nyid dang bcas par 'dod pa mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa la'o //
translated: ‚ÄúWith characteristics‚Äù refers to eye consciousness and so on, which are asserted to have characteristics.

original: mtshan nyid dang ldan pa la zhes bya ba ni dngos po mtshan nyid dang ldan pa la'o //
analyzed: mtshan nyid dang ldan pa la zhes bya ba ni dngos po mtshan nyid dang ldan pa la'o //
translated: ‚ÄúWith a thing having characteristics‚Äù refers to a thing that has characteristics.

original: 'di skad du gang gi tshe dngos po nyid du 'dod pa mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa rang bzhin med pa nyid du grub pa de'i tshe mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa la dngos po'i mtshan @101b nyid don byed pa nyid la
analyzed: 'di skad du gang gi tshe dngos po nyid du 'dod pa mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa rang bzhin med pa nyid du grub pa de'i tshe mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa la dngos po'i mtshan @101b nyid don byed pa nyid la
translated: In response to that, it is said that when consciousnesses such as eye consciousness that are asserted to be things are established as lacking intrinsic existence, at that time, the characteristic of a thing, the performance of a function,üîΩ

original: sogs pa bkag pa'i phyir nam mkha' rnam par rtog pa la sogs pa gzhan yang ji ltar dngos po nyid du 'gyur te /
analyzed: sogs pa bkag pa'i phyir nam mkha' rnam par rtog pa la sogs pa gzhan yang ji ltar dngos po nyid du 'gyur te /
translated: This is what is being said: when eye consciousness and so on, which are accepted as things, are established as essenceless, then, since the characteristic of a thing, the performance of a function, and so on, are refuted in eye consciousness and so on, how could space and so on become things?

original: mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa dang 'dra ba kho nar thams cad kyang dngos po med par gyur to zhes bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa dang 'dra ba kho nar thams cad kyang dngos po med par gyur to zhes bshad pa yin no //
translated: Just like eye consciousness and so on, everything would become a non-thing.

original: re zhig de ltar blo thams cad rang bzhin gcig pa nyid dang bral bar rab tu bsgrubs nas de ltar mjug bsdu ba'i tshigs su bcad pas ston par byed do //
analyzed: re zhig de ltar blo thams cad rang bzhin gcig pa nyid dang bral bar rab tu bsgrubs nas de ltar mjug bsdu ba'i tshigs su bcad pas ston par byed do //
translated: Thus, having in this way completely established that all cognitions are devoid of a single essence, he teaches the conclusion in the following verse.

original: 'dir zhes bya ba ni gzugs la sogs pa gcig gi rang bzhin nyid la sogs pa dgag par ro //
analyzed: 'dir zhes bya ba ni gzugs la sogs pa gcig gi rang bzhin nyid la sogs pa dgag par ro //
translated: ‚ÄúHere‚Äù means in the refutation of the single essence of form and so on.

original: gsungs pa zhes bya ba ni 'phags pa lhas so //
analyzed: gsungs pa zhes bya ba ni 'phags pa lhas so //
translated: The word ‚Äúsays‚Äù means that ƒÄryadeva says this.
