original: gal te tshigs rnams las sor mo gzhan yin par gyur na /
analyzed: gal te tshigs rnams las sor mo gzhan yin par gyur na /
translated: If the fingers were different from the joints,

original: de'i tshe dmigs pa'i rig byar gyur pa'i phyir bum pa dang ras yug bzhin du logs shig tu dmigs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i tshe dmigs pa'i rig byar gyur pa'i phyir bum pa dang ras yug bzhin du logs shig tu dmigs par 'gyur ro //
translated: then they would be perceived separately, because they would be perceived as the objects of observation, like a pot and a cloth.

original: ji ste tshigs dang 'du ba'i phyir logs shig tu dmigs par mi 'gyur na de'i tshe tshigs re re la bdag nyid thams cad du rdzogs pa'i phyir tshigs gcig bsgribs na yang sor mo bsgribs par 'gyur ba'am /
analyzed: ji ste tshigs dang 'du ba'i phyir logs shig tu dmigs par mi 'gyur na de'i tshe tshigs re re la bdag nyid thams cad du rdzogs pa'i phyir tshigs gcig bsgribs na yang sor mo bsgribs par 'gyur ba'am /
translated: But if they are not perceived separately because they are a collection of joints, then because each joint is complete in itself, if one joint is covered, the finger would be covered,

original: dmar na dmar bar 'gyur la sor mo mang po nyid du thal bar yang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dmar na dmar bar 'gyur la sor mo mang po nyid du thal bar yang 'gyur ro //
translated: or if one joint is red, the finger would be red, and it would follow that there would be many fingers.

original: phyogs gcig gis khyab na ni gcig pa nyid nyams par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: phyogs gcig gis khyab na ni gcig pa nyid nyams par 'gyur ro //
translated: If they were pervaded by one part, their oneness would be undermined.

original: de dag la yang phyogs gcig gis khyab na ni thug pa med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dag la yang phyogs gcig gis khyab na ni thug pa med par 'gyur ro //
translated: If they were pervaded by one part, there would be an infinite regress.

original: gzhan ma yin pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: gzhan ma yin pa yang ma yin te /
translated: They are not nondifferent.

original: sor mo gcig dang tha mi dad pa'i phyir sor mo'i rang gi ngo bo bzhin du rtse mo dang drung pa gnyis kyang gcig pa nyid du thal par 'gyur la sor mo yang tshigs du ma dang tha mi dad pa'i phyir du ma nyid du thal bar 'gyur
analyzed: sor mo gcig dang tha mi dad pa'i phyir sor mo'i rang gi ngo bo bzhin du rtse mo dang drung pa gnyis kyang gcig pa nyid du thal par 'gyur la sor mo yang tshigs du ma dang tha mi dad pa'i phyir du ma nyid du thal bar 'gyur
translated: Because it is not different from the finger, it follows that the tip and the base are the same as the finger itself. And because the finger is not different from the many joints, it follows that the finger is many.

original: ro // de ltar na rnam par dpyad pa 'dis tshigs la sogs pa yang rang gi yan lag rnams las gzhan dang gzhan ma yin pa nyid du brjod du med pa'i phyir ma grub pas med do zhes brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: ro // de ltar na rnam par dpyad pa 'dis tshigs la sogs pa yang rang gi yan lag rnams las gzhan dang gzhan ma yin pa nyid du brjod du med pa'i phyir ma grub pas med do zhes brjod par bya'o //
translated: Thus, because the joints, etc., are not expressible as different or not different from their parts, they are not established by this analysis. Therefore, they do not exist.

original: sor mo la sogs pa ma gtogs par yang 'dus pa med pa'i phyir dang / rdul phra rab rnams kyang phyogs tha dad pa nyid kyis ma grub pa'i phyir don dam par 'dus pa tsam yang med do //
analyzed: sor mo la sogs pa ma gtogs par yang 'dus pa med pa'i phyir dang / rdul phra rab rnams kyang phyogs tha dad pa nyid kyis ma grub pa'i phyir don dam par 'dus pa tsam yang med do //
translated: Apart from the finger, etc., there is no collection, and because the subtle atoms are not established by virtue of their different directions, ultimately there is no collection whatsoever.

original: 'on gzugs dang sgra la sogs pa bden pa nyid du 'gyur ro snyam pa la /
analyzed: 'on gzugs dang sgra la sogs pa bden pa nyid du 'gyur ro snyam pa la /
translated: But form, sound, etc., would be real!

original: sor mo la sogs pa rnams kyis ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //üîΩji ltar sor mo la sogs pa dang / sor mo 'dus pa med par bshad pa de bzhin du dngos po thams cad dang gzugs la @102a * //
analyzed: sor mo la sogs pa rnams kyis ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so // ji ltar sor mo la sogs pa dang / sor mo 'dus pa med par bshad pa de bzhin du dngos po thams cad dang gzugs la @102a * //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúby the fingers, etc.‚Äù is stated.

original: sogs pa yang med pa nyid du khong du chud par bya ste /
analyzed: sogs pa yang med pa nyid du khong du chud par bya ste /
translated: Just as the fingers, etc. and the collection of fingers are explained as non-existent, so too all entities and form, etc. should be understood as non-existent.

original: de dag gi rang bzhin yang 'dus pa tsam yin pa'i phyir la 'dus pa yang dngos po med pa nyid du bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag gi rang bzhin yang 'dus pa tsam yin pa'i phyir la 'dus pa yang dngos po med pa nyid du bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because their nature is also just a collection, and because a collection is taught to be non-existent.

original: 'o na 'dus pa las ma gtogs par gzugs la sogs pa yod par 'gyur ro snyam pa la /
analyzed: 'o na 'dus pa las ma gtogs par gzugs la sogs pa yod par 'gyur ro snyam pa la /
translated: If you think that apart from a collection, form, etc. would exist, then in response to that, it is said:

original: tshogs ma gtogs pa'i dngos phra'ang med //üîΩces bya ba smos so //
analyzed: tshogs ma gtogs pa'i dngos phra'ang med // ces bya ba smos so //
translated: There is no subtle entity apart from a collection.

original: phra ba'ang zhes bya ba ni phra rab kyi bdag nyid kyang ste rdul phra rab kyang phyogs kyi bye brag gis tha dad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phra ba'ang zhes bya ba ni phra rab kyi bdag nyid kyang ste rdul phra rab kyang phyogs kyi bye brag gis tha dad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The word ‚Äúsubtle‚Äù refers to the nature of the subtle, i.e., the subtle particle, because even the subtle particle is different in terms of directional parts.

original: 'o na blo'i ngo bo gcig par 'gyur ro snyam pa la /
analyzed: 'o na blo'i ngo bo gcig par 'gyur ro snyam pa la /
translated: If you think that the nature of cognition would be singular, then in response to that, it is said:

original: de ltar don gcig shes byed pa //
analyzed: de ltar don gcig shes byed pa //
translated: Thus, the one who knows one thing knows all things.üîΩ

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: Thus, it is said, ‚ÄúOne should understand that the meaning is the same.‚Äù

original: yul gyi rnam pa 'dzin par skye ba'i phyir shes pa yang sna tshogs pa'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir ro snyam du bsams pa yin no //
analyzed: yul gyi rnam pa 'dzin par skye ba'i phyir shes pa yang sna tshogs pa'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir ro snyam du bsams pa yin no //
translated: The meaning is that consciousness also has a manifold nature because it arises as the apprehender of the aspects of the object.

original: 'o na yid kyi rnam par shes pa dang yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i sems las byung ba rnams dmigs pa gcig pa can yin par 'gyur ro snyam pa la /üîΩsems byung tshogs dang bcas sems kyi //
analyzed: 'o na yid kyi rnam par shes pa dang yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i sems las byung ba rnams dmigs pa gcig pa can yin par 'gyur ro snyam pa la / sems byung tshogs dang bcas sems kyi //
translated: If that is so, then the mental consciousness and the mental factors of the mental consciousness will have the same object.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The root text states, ‚ÄúThe mind and the collection of mental factors . . . .‚Äù

original: re zhig yid kyi rnam par shes pa dang yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i sems las byung ba gzugs la sogs pa'i yul can gang dag yin pa de dag ni yul sna tshogs pa can yin pa'i phyir sna tshogs pa nyid kho na yin no //
analyzed: re zhig yid kyi rnam par shes pa dang yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i sems las byung ba gzugs la sogs pa'i yul can gang dag yin pa de dag ni yul sna tshogs pa can yin pa'i phyir sna tshogs pa nyid kho na yin no //
translated: The mental consciousness and the mental factors of the mental consciousness that have form, etc., as their object are, in fact, manifold because they have a variety of objects.

original: gzugs shes pa la sogs pa'i yul can gang dag yin pa de dag kyang sna tshogs nyid kho na yin te /
analyzed: gzugs shes pa la sogs pa'i yul can gang dag yin pa de dag kyang sna tshogs nyid kho na yin te /
translated: And those subjects, such as the cognition of form, are also only various.

original: gong du gzugs la sogs pa la dmigs par gyur pa gzugs la sogs pa shes pa sna tshogs pa nyid kyi phyir ro zhes bshad zin to //
analyzed: gong du gzugs la sogs pa la dmigs par gyur pa gzugs la sogs pa shes pa sna tshogs pa nyid kyi phyir ro zhes bshad zin to //
translated: This is because, as was previously explained, the cognition of form, etc., is various, since it has form, etc., as its object.

original: rang gi sde pa sems tsam gyi tshul la brten pa'i blo gros dkar ba gang dag ces bya ba ni rnal 'byor spyod pa pa rnams so //
analyzed: rang gi sde pa sems tsam gyi tshul la brten pa'i blo gros dkar ba gang dag ces bya ba ni rnal 'byor spyod pa pa rnams so //
translated: Those who are pure in mind, who rely on the Cittamatra method of our own schools, are the Yogacaras.

original: shes pa la mthun pa'i bag chags yongs su smin pa la rag las nas 'byung ba yod pa zhes tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
analyzed: shes pa la mthun pa'i bag chags yongs su smin pa la rag las nas 'byung ba yod pa zhes tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
translated: The meaning of the sentence is that the existence of the appearance of form, etc., is dependent on the full maturation of concordant latent impressions in consciousness.

original: bag chags gang la thogs pa med pa'i sems can gyi rgyud la yod pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: bag chags gang la thogs pa med pa'i sems can gyi rgyud la yod pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: Those latent impressions that exist in the mind-streams of sentient beings without interruption are called that.

original: bag chags de smin pa ni yongs su smin pa ste /
analyzed: bag chags de smin pa ni yongs su smin pa ste /
translated: The full maturation of those latent impressions is their full development.

original: 'jug pa thob pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: 'jug pa thob pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This means that they are obtained.

original: yongs su smin pa de sprul pa ni bskyed pa'o //
analyzed: yongs su smin pa de sprul pa ni bskyed pa'o //
translated: The production of that full development is the creation of emanations.

original: 'dir 'thad pa gzugs la sogs pa'i skye mchad ces bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: 'dir 'thad pa gzugs la sogs pa'i skye mchad ces bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: Here, the reason is stated: ‚Äúbecause there are no sense-fields of form, etc.‚Äù

original: rdzas dang yon tan la sogs pa zhes bya ba ni bye brag pa la sogs pa nye bar brtags pa @102b rnams so //
analyzed: rdzas dang yon tan la sogs pa zhes bya ba ni bye brag pa la sogs pa nye bar brtags pa @102b rnams so //
translated: ‚ÄúSubstance, quality, etc.‚Äù refers to the imputations of the Vai≈õe·π£ikas, etc.

original: sogs pa zhes bya ba'i sgras ni las dang spyi dang bye brag dang 'du ba rnams bsdu ste /
analyzed: sogs pa zhes bya ba'i sgras ni las dang spyi dang bye brag dang 'du ba rnams bsdu ste /
translated: The word ‚Äúetc.‚Äù includes action, universals, instances, and inherence.

original: 'dis ni phyi rol gyi gzung ba med pa'i phyir shes pa 'dzin pa med pa kho na'o zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dis ni phyi rol gyi gzung ba med pa'i phyir shes pa 'dzin pa med pa kho na'o zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: This demonstrates that consciousness is devoid of the apprehended object and apprehending subject, because there is no external object.

original: phyi rol gyi don yod na yang shes pa ni gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rnam pas stong pa kho na yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir tshor bar bya ba dang tshor ba po'i mtshan nyid dang yang bral ba'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: phyi rol gyi don yod na yang shes pa ni gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rnam pas stong pa kho na yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir tshor bar bya ba dang tshor ba po'i mtshan nyid dang yang bral ba'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Even if external objects exist, consciousness is devoid of the aspects of the apprehended object and apprehending subject. This is demonstrated by the statement, ‚Äúbecause it is devoid of the characteristics of the object of experience and the experiencer.‚Äù

original: re zhig rnam pa med na yod pa tsam gyis ni phyi rol gyi don rig par rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: re zhig rnam pa med na yod pa tsam gyis ni phyi rol gyi don rig par rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: If there is no aspect, it is not reasonable to cognize an external object by its mere existence.

original: ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it would follow, absurdly, that it would be the object of all cognitions.

original: yul gyi 'bras bu yin pas sam //
analyzed: yul gyi 'bras bu yin pas sam //
translated: It is not reasonable to say that it is the result of the object,

original: tshogs pa gcig la rag las pas kyang rig par rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: tshogs pa gcig la rag las pas kyang rig par rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: nor is it reasonable to say that it is the object because it is dependent on the same collection of causes,

original: mig la sogs pa la yang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mig la sogs pa la yang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it would follow, absurdly, that the eye and so on would also be the object.

original: yul gyi rnam pa can tsam gyis kyang ma yin te /
analyzed: yul gyi rnam pa can tsam gyis kyang ma yin te /
translated: It is not the case that it is the object simply because it has the aspect of the object,

original: rnam pa mtshungs pa'i sems gzhan yang 'dzin par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam pa mtshungs pa'i sems gzhan yang 'dzin par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it would follow, absurdly, that it would apprehend any other mind that had a similar aspect.

original: yul dang 'dra ba dang yul las byung ba dag gis kyang ma yin te /
analyzed: yul dang 'dra ba dang yul las byung ba dag gis kyang ma yin te /
translated: It is not the case that it is the object because it is similar to the object or because it arises from the object,

original: mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen don mthun pa yang yul nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen don mthun pa yang yul nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it would follow, absurdly, that the similar immediately preceding condition would also be the object.

original: de la sogs pa'i rnam pas tshor bar bya ba dang tshor ba po nyid kyi mtshan nyid mi srid pa'i phyir dngos po 'di dag ni sgyu ma la sogs pa'i rang bzhin ltar snang ngo //
analyzed: de la sogs pa'i rnam pas tshor bar bya ba dang tshor ba po nyid kyi mtshan nyid mi srid pa'i phyir dngos po 'di dag ni sgyu ma la sogs pa'i rang bzhin ltar snang ngo //
translated: Since the characteristics of the experiencer and the experienced are impossible in any of these ways, these things appear to be like illusions and so on.

original: 'di dag de ltar snang ba'i rgyu gang yin snyam pa la /
analyzed: 'di dag de ltar snang ba'i rgyu gang yin snyam pa la /
translated: What is the cause of their appearing in this way?

original: thog ma med par srid pa 'byung ba can zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: thog ma med par srid pa 'byung ba can zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: The root text states, It is the beginningless and endless process of cyclic existence.

original: dngos po la mngon par zhen pa 'di la thog ma med pa'i srid par 'byung ba'i ngang tshul yod pas de skad ces bya ste /
analyzed: dngos po la mngon par zhen pa 'di la thog ma med pa'i srid par 'byung ba'i ngang tshul yod pas de skad ces bya ste /
translated: This is so called because it is the process of cyclic existence that has been occurring since beginningless time.

original: mngon par zhen pa des bskyed pa'i bag chags gang yin pa'o ;
analyzed: mngon par zhen pa des bskyed pa'i bag chags gang yin pa'o ;
translated: It is the habitual propensities that are produced by that clinging.

original: / bag chags de yongs su smin pa ni 'jug pa thob pa nyid do //
analyzed: / bag chags de yongs su smin pa ni 'jug pa thob pa nyid do //
translated: The full maturation of those habitual propensities is the attainment of the state of being a sentient being.

original: bag chags yongs su smin pa de'i mthu ni nus pa ste /
analyzed: bag chags yongs su smin pa de'i mthu ni nus pa ste /
translated: The power of those fully matured habitual propensities is their ability.

original: bdag po zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: bdag po zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This is what is meant by the term ‚Äúpredominant influence.‚Äù

original: mthu de las rnam pa 'di dag snang ste /
analyzed: mthu de las rnam pa 'di dag snang ste /
translated: It is from that power that these appearances arise.

original: phyi rol gyi don med par yang zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: phyi rol gyi don med par yang zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This is what is meant by the phrase, ‚Äúeven though external objects do not exist.‚Äù

original: de dge zhes bya ba ni lugs thams cad kyi mchog yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dge zhes bya ba ni lugs thams cad kyi mchog yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The root text states, ‚ÄúThey are virtuous . . . ‚Äù This is because they are the highest of all the spiritual systems.

original: dngos po de yang bdag nyid dam ci zhes bya ba ni sngon po la sogs pa'i rnam pa'i ngo bo'o //
analyzed: dngos po de yang bdag nyid dam ci zhes bya ba ni sngon po la sogs pa'i rnam pa'i ngo bo'o //
translated: The root text asks, ‚ÄúIs that entity one‚Äôs own nature?‚Äù This refers to the essence of such things as the appearance of blue.

original: lugs 'di ni tshad ma dang zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni tshig le'ur byas pa'i don rnam par 'grel par byed do //
analyzed: lugs 'di ni tshad ma dang zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni tshig le'ur byas pa'i don rnam par 'grel par byed do //
translated: This system is explained by the words ‚Äúvalid cognition‚Äù and so on.

original: 'di ni zhes bya ba ni 'di zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: 'di ni zhes bya ba ni 'di zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: ‚Äú This‚Äù means ‚Äúthis‚Äù system.

original: @103a * // gang dag dmigs pa la spyod pa de dag ni dmigs pa can te /
analyzed: @103a * // gang dag dmigs pa la spyod pa de dag ni dmigs pa can te /
translated: Those who engage in the observation of objects are called ‚Äúobservers.‚Äù

original: de dag ni dmigs pa can yang yin la mtha' yas pa dag kyang yin zhes tshig rnam par sbyar te /üîΩdmigs pa can rnams kyi mngon par zhen pa ngan pa'am /
analyzed: de dag ni dmigs pa can yang yin la mtha' yas pa dag kyang yin zhes tshig rnam par sbyar te / dmigs pa can rnams kyi mngon par zhen pa ngan pa'am /
translated: They are observers and also infinite.üîΩThe bad, perverse attachment of observers,

original: dmigs pa can rnams kyi mngon par zhen pa ngan pa mtha' yas pa gang yin pa de'i gnyen po yin pas so //
analyzed: dmigs pa can rnams kyi mngon par zhen pa ngan pa mtha' yas pa gang yin pa de'i gnyen po yin pas so //
translated: or the bad, perverse attachment of observers is infinite.

original: tshad ma shin tu gsal ba gang yin snyam pa la /
analyzed: tshad ma shin tu gsal ba gang yin snyam pa la /
translated: What is the very clear valid cognition?

original: 'di ltar rdul phra rab la sogs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: 'di ltar rdul phra rab la sogs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: In response to this question, he says, ‚ÄúIt is like this. The atoms and so on . . .‚Äù

original: sngar bshad pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: sngar bshad pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: ‚Äú Previously explained‚Äù refers to the following.

original: tha dad phyogs dang 'dre bas na //
analyzed: tha dad phyogs dang 'dre bas na //
translated: Since they are mixed with different directions,

original: khyab rnams gcig pur ga la 'gyur ;
analyzed: khyab rnams gcig pur ga la 'gyur ;
translated: how could the all-pervading be one?

original: / zhes bya ba la sogs pas so //
analyzed: / zhes bya ba la sogs pas so //
translated: and so on.

original: lung gis shes par bya ba yang yin par bstan pa lung dang ldan pa yang yin te zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: lung gis shes par bya ba yang yin par bstan pa lung dang ldan pa yang yin te zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: And it is also taught to be known by scripture, and so on, with the words ‚Äúit is also endowed with scripture.‚Äù

original: gzugs brnyan lta bu zhes bya ba ni gzugs brnyan bzhin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: gzugs brnyan lta bu zhes bya ba ni gzugs brnyan bzhin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Like a reflection means like a reflection.

original: snang yang ni zhes bya ba ni don gyi rnam par zhes bya ba dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: snang yang ni zhes bya ba ni don gyi rnam par zhes bya ba dang sbyar ro //
translated: And it appears means it is connected with the aspect of the object.

original: thog ma med pa'i blos bsgos pa zhes bya ba ni thog ma med pa'i dngos por mngon par zhen pa can gang yin pa des bsgos pa ste sbags pa'o //
analyzed: thog ma med pa'i blos bsgos pa zhes bya ba ni thog ma med pa'i dngos por mngon par zhen pa can gang yin pa des bsgos pa ste sbags pa'o //
translated: It is imbued with the mind that has been operating since beginningless time means it is imbued with, that is, stained by, the mind that has been operating since beginningless time, since samsara has no observed beginning.

original: gcig tu na 'khor ba thog ma med pa nas bsgos pa yin no //
analyzed: gcig tu na 'khor ba thog ma med pa nas bsgos pa yin no //
translated: In other words, it is imbued with the mind since beginningless samsara.

original: gal te sems don gyi rnam pa can yin na 'o na ni yod do /
analyzed: gal te sems don gyi rnam pa can yin na 'o na ni yod do /
translated: If the mind has the aspect of an object, then you accept that it exists.

original: zhes bya ba khas blangs par 'gyur ro snyam pa la don med ces bya ba smos so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba khas blangs par 'gyur ro snyam pa la don med ces bya ba smos so //
translated: To this he says, ‚ÄúThere is no object.‚Äù

original: yang dag ji bzhin mthong zhes bya ba ni gcig dang du ma'i ngo bos don dpyod pa ste /
analyzed: yang dag ji bzhin mthong zhes bya ba ni gcig dang du ma'i ngo bos don dpyod pa ste /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúseeing things as they really are‚Äù refers to the investigation of the object by way of the natures of unity and multiplicity.

original: don yod pa nyid du mi snang ngo zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: don yod pa nyid du mi snang ngo zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthe object does not appear to exist‚Äù means that the object is not found.

original: de ltar na chos la bdag med pa bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na chos la bdag med pa bshad pa yin no //
translated: Thus, the selflessness of phenomena has been explained.

original: gang zag la bdag med pa yang gtso cher bshad pa'i phyir gang zag ces bya ba smos te /üîΩkha cig na re tshe rabs gzhan dang gzhan dag tu 'khor ba'i gang zag gang yin pa ni rdzas su yong par 'dod de zhes zer ro //
analyzed: gang zag la bdag med pa yang gtso cher bshad pa'i phyir gang zag ces bya ba smos te / kha cig na re tshe rabs gzhan dang gzhan dag tu 'khor ba'i gang zag gang yin pa ni rdzas su yong par 'dod de zhes zer ro //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthe person‚Äù is mentioned in order to explain the selflessness of the person, which is the principal topic.üîΩSome say that the person who transmigrates from one birth and death to another is substantially real.

original: gzhan dag na re 'khor bar 'gyur ba rgyun rdzas su yong par 'dod do zhes zer ro //
analyzed: gzhan dag na re 'khor bar 'gyur ba rgyun rdzas su yong par 'dod do zhes zer ro //
translated: Others say that the continuum of that which transmigrates is substantially real.

original: la lan re gzugs la sogs pa phung po rnams kho na 'khor ro zhes zer ro //
analyzed: la lan re gzugs la sogs pa phung po rnams kho na 'khor ro zhes zer ro //
translated: Still others say that only the aggregates of form and so on transmigrate.

original: gzhan dag na re phyi rol gyi rgyu dang rkyen rnams kho na 'khor ba pa yin no zhes brjod do //
analyzed: gzhan dag na re phyi rol gyi rgyu dang rkyen rnams kho na 'khor ba pa yin no zhes brjod do //
translated: Others say that only external causes and conditions transmigrate.

original: gzhan dag na re rdul rnams 'khor ro zhes zer ro //
analyzed: gzhan dag na re rdul rnams 'khor ro zhes zer ro //
translated: Others say that atoms transmigrate.

original: gzhan dag na re sna tshogs 'di ni gtso bo'i khongs su 'gyur ba yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: gzhan dag na re sna tshogs 'di ni gtso bo'i khongs su 'gyur ba yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: Others say that this variety is due to the predominance of the elements.

original: @103b kha cig gis ni thams cad kyi byed pa po ni dbang phyug kho na yin no snyam du rtogs te /
analyzed: @103b kha cig gis ni thams cad kyi byed pa po ni dbang phyug kho na yin no snyam du rtogs te /
translated: Some think that God is the creator of everything.

original: rab tu smra ba 'di dag thams cad ni sems tsam po kho na las rnam par rtog par byed kyi /
analyzed: rab tu smra ba 'di dag thams cad ni sems tsam po kho na las rnam par rtog par byed kyi /
translated: All these theories are mere conceptual fabrications about mind only.

original: don dam par gang zag la sogs pa yod pa ni ma yin no zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: don dam par gang zag la sogs pa yod pa ni ma yin no zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: In reality, there are no such things as a person, etc.

original: 'di thams cad ni ji ltar 'grub snyam pa la /
analyzed: 'di thams cad ni ji ltar 'grub snyam pa la /
translated: How is all this established?

original: phyi rol don mthong zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: phyi rol don mthong zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: He says, ‚ÄúThe perception of external objects, etc.‚Äù

original: don zhes bya ba'i sgra ni gzugs la sogs pa dang gang zag la sogs pa gnyi ga la yang bya'o //
analyzed: don zhes bya ba'i sgra ni gzugs la sogs pa dang gang zag la sogs pa gnyi ga la yang bya'o //
translated: The word ‚Äúobject‚Äù refers to both form, etc. and the person, etc.

original: log pa yin zhes bya ba ni log pa'i don zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: log pa yin zhes bya ba ni log pa'i don zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: ‚ÄúFalse‚Äù means ‚Äúhaving a false object.‚Äù

original: sbyor ba ni sems don gyi rnam pa can gang dang gang yin pa de ni log pa'i don yin te /
analyzed: sbyor ba ni sems don gyi rnam pa can gang dang gang yin pa de ni log pa'i don yin te /
translated: The argument is as follows: Whatever has the aspect of an object is false, like the perception of a double moon.

original: dper na rmi lam la sogs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na rmi lam la sogs pa lta bu'o //
translated: For example, it is like a dream, etc.

original: phyi rol gyi don mthong ba nyid du 'dod pa rtsod pa'i gzhir gyur pa'i sems 'di yang don gyi rnam pa can te /
analyzed: phyi rol gyi don mthong ba nyid du 'dod pa rtsod pa'i gzhir gyur pa'i sems 'di yang don gyi rnam pa can te /
translated: The mind, which is the basis of the dispute, is accepted as seeing external objects, and it has the aspect of an object.

original: rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs 'phel ba yin no //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs 'phel ba yin no //
translated: It is an inference based on the evidence of essential nature.

original: 'di la gnod pa can gyi tshad ma gang yin snyam pa la /
analyzed: 'di la gnod pa can gyi tshad ma gang yin snyam pa la /
translated: What is the authoritative cognition that contradicts it?

original: don yod ma yin te zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: don yod ma yin te zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: He says, ‚ÄúThe object does not exist.‚Äù

original: gang gi phyir gcig dang du ma'i rang bzhin dag gis dpyad na don mi gnas pa'i phyir don med par grub pa ni gnod pa can gyi tshad ma yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir gcig dang du ma'i rang bzhin dag gis dpyad na don mi gnas pa'i phyir don med par grub pa ni gnod pa can gyi tshad ma yin no //
translated: Since the object does not remain when it is analyzed in terms of a nature of singularity or plurality, the establishment of the nonexistence of the object is the authoritative cognition that contradicts it.

original: phyi rol gyi yul dang 'brel pa'i don mngon sum kho nar grub pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: phyi rol gyi yul dang 'brel pa'i don mngon sum kho nar grub pa ma yin nam /
translated: Isn‚Äôt it established that direct perception has an object that is related to an external object?

original: de ji ltar na med kyang dam bcas pa yang ji ltar 'gal pa can du mi 'gyur snyam pa la /
analyzed: de ji ltar na med kyang dam bcas pa yang ji ltar 'gal pa can du mi 'gyur snyam pa la /
translated: How is it that even though it does not exist, the thesis is not contradictory?

original: sems nyid de zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: sems nyid de zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: He says, ‚ÄúThe mind itself is that.‚Äù

original: 'dis ni lugs 'di sngar bshad pa mngon par zhen pa ngan pa'i gnyen po nyid yin par bstan to //
analyzed: 'dis ni lugs 'di sngar bshad pa mngon par zhen pa ngan pa'i gnyen po nyid yin par bstan to //
translated: This shows that this system is the antidote to the bad habit of attachment to the above explanation.

original: de nyid kyi phyir mkhas pa dag tshul 'di la brten nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir mkhas pa dag tshul 'di la brten nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Therefore, the wise, relying on this system, etc.

original: 'di tsam gyis ni de dge zhes bya ba rnam par phye ba yin no //
analyzed: 'di tsam gyis ni de dge zhes bya ba rnam par phye ba yin no //
translated: This much is the analysis of ‚Äúthey are virtuous.‚Äù

original: 'on kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni tshigs su bcad pa'i cha lhag ma 'grel par byed de /
analyzed: 'on kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni tshigs su bcad pa'i cha lhag ma 'grel par byed de /
translated: But, etc. explains the remainder of the verse.

original: yang dag pa nyid yin na rnam pa dang rnam par shes pa gnyis snga ma bzhin du rang bzhin phan tshun gnas par thal bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: yang dag pa nyid yin na rnam pa dang rnam par shes pa gnyis snga ma bzhin du rang bzhin phan tshun gnas par thal bar 'gyur te /

original: khong du chud par sla ba nyid do //üîΩg-yo dang mi g-yo la sogs la //
analyzed: khong du chud par sla ba nyid do // g-yo dang mi g-yo la sogs la //
translated: This is easy to understand.üîΩIn the moving and unmoving, etc.

original: zhes bya ba ni g-yo ba dang mi g-yo bar snang ba dag la zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni g-yo ba dang mi g-yo bar snang ba dag la zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //

translated: ‚ÄúThere‚Äù refers to the previous passage.üîΩ‚ÄúThere

original: ji skad bshad pa'i sun dbyung bar thal bar 'gyur bas 'jigs nas rnam pa shes pa rigs ma thun pa mang po yang cig car skye'o zhes brjod do //
analyzed: ji skad bshad pa'i sun dbyung bar thal bar 'gyur bas 'jigs nas rnam pa shes pa rigs ma thun pa mang po yang cig car skye'o zhes brjod do //
translated: Fearing the undesired consequence of the previously explained fault, they say that many consciousnesses of the same type arise simultaneously.

original: de dag gi lugs kyis gcig la sna tshogs nyid du khas mi len pa'i phyir ji skad bshad pa'i sun dbyung bar mi 'jug mod kyi /
analyzed: de dag gi lugs kyis gcig la sna tshogs nyid du khas mi len pa'i phyir ji skad bshad pa'i sun dbyung bar mi 'jug mod kyi /
translated: In their system, since they do not accept that one is a variety, the previously explained fault does not apply.

original: nyes pa gzhan yod pas smra ba de dag gi ni gang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: nyes pa gzhan yod pas smra ba de dag gi ni gang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: However, since other faults do exist, the root text states, ‚ÄúFor them, the statement, ‚ÄòWhen one . . .‚Äô ‚Äù and so on.

original: lung gang yin snyam pa la gang snga phyi med par sems gnyis 'byung ba 'di ni gnas ma yin te zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: lung gang yin snyam pa la gang snga phyi med par sems gnyis 'byung ba 'di ni gnas ma yin te zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: Thinking, ‚ÄúWhat is the scriptural source for this?‚Äù the root text states, ‚ÄúIt is said, ‚ÄòIt is impossible for two minds to occur simultaneously. . . .‚Äô ‚Äù

original: gnas ma yin te zhes bya ba ni mi srid pa'o //
analyzed: gnas ma yin te zhes bya ba ni mi srid pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIt is impossible‚Äù means it is not possible.

original: de nyid kyi bshad pa ni go skabs med do zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: de nyid kyi bshad pa ni go skabs med do zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: This is explained by ‚Äúthere is no opportunity.‚Äù

original: snga phyi med par zhes bya ba ni dus gcig tu zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
analyzed: snga phyi med par zhes bya ba ni dus gcig tu zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
translated: ‚ÄúWithout a prior or subsequent‚Äù means ‚Äúsimultaneously.‚Äù

original: 'dir 'gal ba ni 'di yin no //
analyzed: 'dir 'gal ba ni 'di yin no //
translated: This is the contradiction.

original: de bzhin du zhes bya ba ni lung dang 'gal ba gnyis pa yang ston pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du zhes bya ba ni lung dang 'gal ba gnyis pa yang ston pa'o //
translated: Similarly indicates a second contradiction with scripture.

original: rnam par smin pa'i rnam par shes pa'i dbang du mdzad de de skad ces gsungs par 'dod do zhe na zhes bya ba ni pha rol po lung gi gzhung 'dzugs pa'i dogs pa bsu bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par smin pa'i rnam par shes pa'i dbang du mdzad de de skad ces gsungs par 'dod do zhe na zhes bya ba ni pha rol po lung gi gzhung 'dzugs pa'i dogs pa bsu bar byed pa'o //
translated: If you maintain that the statement was made from the perspective of the fruitional consciousness, then the opponent's position is anticipated with, But it is well known that the BhagavƒÅn said this from the perspective of the ƒÅlaya consciousness.

original: rnam par smin pa'i rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba ni kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa ste /
analyzed: rnam par smin pa'i rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba ni kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa ste /
translated: The so-called fruitional consciousness is the ƒÅlaya consciousness.

original: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa ni gcig kho na 'byung gi / du ma cig car ni mi 'byung bas na de'i phyir 'di ni bcom ldan 'das kyis kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa'i dbang du mdzad nas gsungs kyi /
analyzed: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa ni gcig kho na 'byung gi / du ma cig car ni mi 'byung bas na de'i phyir 'di ni bcom ldan 'das kyis kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa'i dbang du mdzad nas gsungs kyi /
translated: Since only one ƒÅlaya consciousness occurs and not many simultaneously, therefore the BhagavƒÅn said this from the perspective of the ƒÅlaya consciousness.

original: 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa ni ma yin no zhes grags te /
analyzed: 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa ni ma yin no zhes grags te /
translated: It is not from the perspective of the active consciousnesses.

original: rnam par bshad ba 'di yang sngon gyi slob dpon gyis rnam par bshad pa dang 'gal ba'i phyir dang / rnam bar smin pa'i rnam par shes pa yang lus dang / longs spyod dang / gnas su snang bas sna tshogs pa yin pa'i phyir du mar thal bar 'gyur ba ma bzlog pas skyon chags @104b pa kho na yin no snyam du bsams nas /
analyzed: rnam par bshad ba 'di yang sngon gyi slob dpon gyis rnam par bshad pa dang 'gal ba'i phyir dang / rnam bar smin pa'i rnam par shes pa yang lus dang / longs spyod dang / gnas su snang bas sna tshogs pa yin pa'i phyir du mar thal bar 'gyur ba ma bzlog pas skyon chags @104b pa kho na yin no snyam du bsams nas /
translated: This explanation also is flawed because it contradicts the explanations of past masters and because it does not avoid the fallacy that the fruitional consciousness would be multiple since it appears as the body, resources, and abode.

original: gal te de lta na 'di ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: gal te de lta na 'di ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Thinking this, he says, if that is so, this is not so and so on.

original: sngon gyi slob dpon chos kyi grags pa la sogs pas 'di skad du bcom ldan 'das kyis gnas ma yin pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas rnam par rig pa rnams nges par bshad pa gang yin pa de ni rnam par rig pa de dag rnams las rnamüîΩpar shes pa rigs mthun pa kho na'i dbang du mdzad de gsungs kyi /
analyzed: sngon gyi slob dpon chos kyi grags pa la sogs pas 'di skad du bcom ldan 'das kyis gnas ma yin pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas rnam par rig pa rnams nges par bshad pa gang yin pa de ni rnam par rig pa de dag rnams las rnam par shes pa rigs mthun pa kho na'i dbang du mdzad de gsungs kyi /
translated: Past masters such as Dharmakirti say that the Lord spoke of the consciousnesses in the passage, It is not a place and so on, from the perspective of consciousnesses of the same type,

original: rigs mi mthun pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: rigs mi mthun pa ni ma yin te /
translated: but not from the perspective of different types.

original: 'di ltar rnam par rtog pa'i rigs mthun pa rnams rim gyis 'byung bar rtogs so zhes rnam par bshad do //
analyzed: 'di ltar rnam par rtog pa'i rigs mthun pa rnams rim gyis 'byung bar rtogs so zhes rnam par bshad do //
translated: Thus it is understood that the various types of conception occur in sequence.

original: de lta ma yin te gal te khyod sngon gyi slob dpon gyi tshul bor nas rang dgar rnam par 'chad par byed na ni de'i tshe kho bo yang 'di skad du 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de lta ma yin te gal te khyod sngon gyi slob dpon gyi tshul bor nas rang dgar rnam par 'chad par byed na ni de'i tshe kho bo yang 'di skad du 'di lta ste /
translated: If it were not so, if you were to abandon the method of the former masters and explain it as you like, then at that time I would also explain it in this way:

original: gnas ma yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'di ni mi mthun pa dang gnyen po'i sems gnyis cig car 'byung ba dgag pa lhur mdzad pa yin no zhes rnam par 'chad do //
analyzed: gnas ma yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'di ni mi mthun pa dang gnyen po'i sems gnyis cig car 'byung ba dgag pa lhur mdzad pa yin no zhes rnam par 'chad do //
translated: This statement, ‚ÄúIt is not possible,‚Äù and so on, is intended to refute the simultaneous occurrence of two opposing and counteractive minds.

original: 'o na rnam par shes pa'i rgyud gcig pa'o zhes bya ba 'di ni ji ltar dran snyam pa la /
analyzed: 'o na rnam par shes pa'i rgyud gcig pa'o zhes bya ba 'di ni ji ltar dran snyam pa la /
translated: If you think, ‚ÄúHow is it that the mindstream is one?‚Äù

original: gcig ces bya ba'i sgra ni 'ba' zhig ces bya ba'i rnam grangs su gtogs pa yin gyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: gcig ces bya ba'i sgra ni 'ba' zhig ces bya ba'i rnam grangs su gtogs pa yin gyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The word ‚Äúone‚Äù belongs to the category of the word ‚Äúonly.‚Äù

original: de lta yin na phyi rol gyi don dgag pa bstan par bshad pa yin no /
analyzed: de lta yin na phyi rol gyi don dgag pa bstan par bshad pa yin no /
translated: If that were so, it would explain the refutation of external objects.

original: de ltar bshad na yon tan ci zhig 'thob snyam pa la ;
analyzed: de ltar bshad na yon tan ci zhig 'thob snyam pa la ;
translated: If it is explained in this way, what good qualities are obtained?

original: de bas na rnam par smin pa'i rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de bas na rnam par smin pa'i rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Therefore, it is said, the so-called fruitional consciousness, and so on.

original: khyod kyis bshad pa ltar na tha dad par thal bar 'gyur ba'i gnod pa skyed par 'gyur ba kho na'o snyam du bsam pa'o //
analyzed: khyod kyis bshad pa ltar na tha dad par thal bar 'gyur ba'i gnod pa skyed par 'gyur ba kho na'o snyam du bsam pa'o //
translated: It is thought that if it is explained in this way, the fault of entailing difference will definitely be produced.

original: gal te de lta na pha rol bo de ltar bshad pa yin yang khyod kyis kho bo cag 'dod pa kho na bsgrubs pa yin no zhes smra bar 'gyur ro snyam pa la /
analyzed: gal te de lta na pha rol bo de ltar bshad pa yin yang khyod kyis kho bo cag 'dod pa kho na bsgrubs pa yin no zhes smra bar 'gyur ro snyam pa la /
translated: If that is so, the opponent might say, Although you explain it in this way, you have only accomplished what we assert.

original: ci lugs 'di rma med pa yin na ma zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: ci lugs 'di rma med pa yin na ma zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: If this system is faultless, what is it?

original: dpyad pa de gang yin snyam pa la /
analyzed: dpyad pa de gang yin snyam pa la /
translated: What is that analysis?

original: 'di ltar dbus su 'dod pa'i rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: 'di ltar dbus su 'dod pa'i rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: It is said, In this way, the so-called consciousness of the middle, and so on.

original: shes pa rnams ni lus can ma yin pa'i phyir yul gyis byas pa'i snga ma dang phyi ma med pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: shes pa rnams ni lus can ma yin pa'i phyir yul gyis byas pa'i snga ma dang phyi ma med pa ma yin nam /
translated: Since consciousnesses are not embodied, are they not without prior and posterior made by objects?

original: de ji ltar na shes pa rnams rdul phra mo bzhin du dbus na gnas par 'gyur /
analyzed: de ji ltar na shes pa rnams rdul phra mo bzhin du dbus na gnas par 'gyur /
translated: How could consciousness, like a subtle particle, be located in the middle?

original: de ni bden na smra ba 'di la skyon gzhan rnam pa yul khebs par snang ba rnams bden pa nyid du 'dod pas shes pa mang po yul med pa yin yang de bzhin du @105a * //üîΩyul khebs par gnas par skye bar yongs su rtogs pa gang yin pa 'di yod do //
analyzed: de ni bden na smra ba 'di la skyon gzhan rnam pa yul khebs par snang ba rnams bden pa nyid du 'dod pas shes pa mang po yul med pa yin yang de bzhin du @105a * // yul khebs par gnas par skye bar yongs su rtogs pa gang yin pa 'di yod do //
translated: If that is true, then in this theory there is another fault: since it is accepted that the appearance of the object is covered, even though many consciousnesses do not have an object, there is the idea that they arise in such a way as to cover the object.

original: de lta ma yin te gal te rnam par shes pa du ma skye bar rtogs pa la yang de ltar yul khebs par skye bar snang ba log pa yin par gyur na de'i tshe rnam par shes pa du ma skye bar rtogs pa don med par 'gyur te
analyzed: de lta ma yin te gal te rnam par shes pa du ma skye bar rtogs pa la yang de ltar yul khebs par skye bar snang ba log pa yin par gyur na de'i tshe rnam par shes pa du ma skye bar rtogs pa don med par 'gyur te
translated: If that were not so, if the appearance of the object were covered even when many consciousnesses arise, then it would be pointless to accept that many consciousnesses arise,

original: / sngon po la sogs par snang ba yul khebs par gnas pa ma rtogs par ni gang zhig bden par 'gyur ba sngon po la sogs pa gzhan nyams su myong ba ni med do //
analyzed: / sngon po la sogs par snang ba yul khebs par gnas pa ma rtogs par ni gang zhig bden par 'gyur ba sngon po la sogs pa gzhan nyams su myong ba ni med do //
translated: because without the experience of another object, such as blue, that is covered and located in the object, what would be true?

original: sngon po la sogs par snang ba yang brdzun pa nyid yin na gzhan ci zhig bden par 'gyur te /
analyzed: sngon po la sogs par snang ba yang brdzun pa nyid yin na gzhan ci zhig bden par 'gyur te /
translated: If the appearance as blue, etc. is false, then what else could be true?

original: 'di ni gyi na'o //
analyzed: 'di ni gyi na'o //
translated: This is a mere quibble.

original: rdul phra rab rnams ni lus can yin la rnam par shes pa ni lus can ma yin pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: rdul phra rab rnams ni lus can yin la rnam par shes pa ni lus can ma yin pa ma yin nam /
translated: But aren‚Äôt the atoms corporeal, and isn‚Äôt consciousness incorporeal?

original: de ji ltar na 'dir nyes pa 'di nyid du 'gyur snyam pa la /
analyzed: de ji ltar na 'dir nyes pa 'di nyid du 'gyur snyam pa la /
translated: How can the same fault apply here?

original: bar chad med par rigs gcig pa'i rdul du ma 'dzin pa na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: bar chad med par rigs gcig pa'i rdul du ma 'dzin pa na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúwhen many atoms of the same type are apprehended without interstice‚Äù is stated in response to this.

original: bsdus pa'i don ni ming tsam tha dad pa 'ba' zhig tu zad kyi /
analyzed: bsdus pa'i don ni ming tsam tha dad pa 'ba' zhig tu zad kyi /
translated: The meaning of the compound is that they are only different in name alone.

original: yul 'dab chags par gnas pa'i mtshan nyid kyi don la ni tha dad pa med do //
analyzed: yul 'dab chags par gnas pa'i mtshan nyid kyi don la ni tha dad pa med do //
translated: There is no difference in the meaning of the characteristic of the object that is situated without interstice.

original: ming tsam la 'jug pa'i sgos byas pa'i nyes pa mtshungs par bsgrub pa ni ma yin gyi /
analyzed: ming tsam la 'jug pa'i sgos byas pa'i nyes pa mtshungs par bsgrub pa ni ma yin gyi /
translated: It is not that the fault is established by merely engaging in a quibble about the name.

original: yul 'dab chags par gnas pas byas pa'i nyes pa mtshungs par byed pa de la yang ming tha dad pa yod kyang ji ltar nyes pa mtshungs par mi 'gyur zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: yul 'dab chags par gnas pas byas pa'i nyes pa mtshungs par byed pa de la yang ming tha dad pa yod kyang ji ltar nyes pa mtshungs par mi 'gyur zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: And even if there were different names for the offense committed by staying in a place where there are many people, how could the offense not be the same?

original: gang dag nor bu'i gzi bzhin du zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni rnal 'byor spyod pa pa gzhan gyi lta ba'i dogs pa bsu bar byed de /
analyzed: gang dag nor bu'i gzi bzhin du zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni rnal 'byor spyod pa pa gzhan gyi lta ba'i dogs pa bsu bar byed de /
translated: Others, like the YogƒÅcƒÅra, say that just as a jewel has facets, consciousness has various aspects.

original: de dag ni dus thams cad du rnam par shes pa sna tshogs kyi rnam pa can gcig kho na skye'o zhes brjod do //
analyzed: de dag ni dus thams cad du rnam par shes pa sna tshogs kyi rnam pa can gcig kho na skye'o zhes brjod do //
translated: They say that at all times, only one consciousness arises with various aspects.

original: snga ma rnams ni mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa sna tshogs kyi rnam pa can yin par 'dod kyang gcig pu kho nar mi 'dod kyi /
analyzed: snga ma rnams ni mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa sna tshogs kyi rnam pa can yin par 'dod kyang gcig pu kho nar mi 'dod kyi /
translated: The former assert that eye consciousness and so on have various aspects but they do not assert that they are only one.

original: rnam par shes pa brgyad par 'dod cing /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa brgyad par 'dod cing /
translated: They assert that there are eight types of consciousness.

original: gsang ba pa rnams ni 'gro ba thams cad ni rnam par shes pa rtag pa gcig pu tsam gyi rang bzhin yin par 'dod la /
analyzed: gsang ba pa rnams ni 'gro ba thams cad ni rnam par shes pa rtag pa gcig pu tsam gyi rang bzhin yin par 'dod la /
translated: The Guhyakas assert that all reincarnating beings are by nature only a single permanent consciousness.

original: 'di ni srog chags re re zhing so so'i mi rtag pa re rer 'dod pas phyogs snga ma gnyis las 'di la bye brag yod do //
analyzed: 'di ni srog chags re re zhing so so'i mi rtag pa re rer 'dod pas phyogs snga ma gnyis las 'di la bye brag yod do //
translated: This is because each living being has his own impermanence. Thus, this view differs from the previous two.

original: nam mkha' ni gnam yin te /
analyzed: nam mkha' ni gnam yin te /
translated: ƒÅkƒÅ≈õa is the sky.

original: gang dag la nam mkha' de nyid kyi gos yod pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: gang dag la nam mkha' de nyid kyi gos yod pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: Those who have the sky itself as their clothing are called ‚Äúsky-clad.‚Äù

original: de dag gi lta ba @105b zhes tshig rnam par sbyar te /
analyzed: de dag gi lta ba @105b zhes tshig rnam par sbyar te /
translated: The opponent‚Äôs view is to be construed in this way.

original: 'dir yang nam mkha'i gos can gyi lta ba bzhin du sun dbyung ba brjod par bya'o snyam du bsams pa'o //
analyzed: 'dir yang nam mkha'i gos can gyi lta ba bzhin du sun dbyung ba brjod par bya'o snyam du bsams pa'o //
translated: Here, too, the refutation is to be stated in the same way as in the case of the view of the sky-clad.

original: sun dbyung ba de nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: sun dbyung ba de nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate this refutation, he says,

original: sna tshogs gcig pu'i rang bzhin min //
analyzed: sna tshogs gcig pu'i rang bzhin min //
translated: The one is not of the nature of the many,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: and so on.

original: sbyor ba ni gang zhig sna tshogs yin pa de ni gcig pu ma yin te /
analyzed: sbyor ba ni gang zhig sna tshogs yin pa de ni gcig pu ma yin te /
translated: The argument is this: Whatever is manifold is not one,

original: dper na rin po che rigs sna tshogs pa lta bu'am /
analyzed: dper na rin po che rigs sna tshogs pa lta bu'am /
translated: like, for example, the various kinds of jewels,

original: dper na sems kyi rgyud sna tshogs la yod pa'i shes pa dag lta bu yin no //
analyzed: dper na sems kyi rgyud sna tshogs la yod pa'i shes pa dag lta bu yin no //
translated: or like, for example, the cognitions that exist in the various mental continua.

original: rnam par shes pa 'di yang sna tshogs pa yin te /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa 'di yang sna tshogs pa yin te /
translated: This consciousness is also manifold,

original: rang bzhin 'gal ba dmigs pa yin no //
analyzed: rang bzhin 'gal ba dmigs pa yin no //
translated: because it is observed to have a variety of natures.

original: 'di la ji ltar 'gal ba 'grub snyam pa la /
analyzed: 'di la ji ltar 'gal ba 'grub snyam pa la /
translated: How is this contradiction established?

original: sna tshogs zhes bya ba ni rnam pa tha dad pa la bya ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: sna tshogs zhes bya ba ni rnam pa tha dad pa la bya ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The term ‚Äúmanifold‚Äù refers to different aspects.

original: rang bzhin sna tshogs pa ma gtogs pa gzhan sna tshogs pa'i sgrar brjod par bya ba ni med do //
analyzed: rang bzhin sna tshogs pa ma gtogs pa gzhan sna tshogs pa'i sgrar brjod par bya ba ni med do //
translated: Apart from a manifold nature, there is nothing else that can be called ‚Äúmanifold.‚Äù

original: sna tshogs pa dang gcig pa gnyis kyang ngo bo phan tshun rnam par bcad pa med na med pa yin pa'i phyir phan tshun spangs te gnas pa'i mtshan nyid kyi 'gal ba yin pas 'gal ba grub bo //
analyzed: sna tshogs pa dang gcig pa gnyis kyang ngo bo phan tshun rnam par bcad pa med na med pa yin pa'i phyir phan tshun spangs te gnas pa'i mtshan nyid kyi 'gal ba yin pas 'gal ba grub bo //
translated: Because a manifold nature and oneness are such that one cannot exist without the other‚Äôs exclusion, they are contradictory in the sense of being mutually exclusive. Thus, the contradiction is established.

original: 'gal ba gnyis kyang rang bzhin gcig pa nyid yin na ni 'gro ba mtha' dag rdzas gcig tu 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'gal ba gnyis kyang rang bzhin gcig pa nyid yin na ni 'gro ba mtha' dag rdzas gcig tu 'gyur te /
translated: If these two contradictory natures were identical, then the entire world would be a single substance.

original: de'i phyir lhan cig skye ba dang 'jig pa la sogs par thal bar 'gyur ba bzlog dka'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir lhan cig skye ba dang 'jig pa la sogs par thal bar 'gyur ba bzlog dka'o //
translated: Therefore, it would be difficult to avoid the absurd consequence that everything would be produced and destroyed simultaneously.

original: de lta ma yin na ni gcig ces bya ba ming tsam kho nar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de lta ma yin na ni gcig ces bya ba ming tsam kho nar 'gyur te /
translated: If it were not so, then the term ‚Äúone‚Äù would be a mere name.

original: ming la ni brtsad pa med pas gtan tshigs ma nges pa nyid ma yin te /
analyzed: ming la ni brtsad pa med pas gtan tshigs ma nges pa nyid ma yin te /
translated: But since there is no dispute about names, the reason is not indeterminate.

original: dper na rin po che rigs sna tshogs ni nam mkha'i gos can gyi lugs kyis blta bar bya'i /
analyzed: dper na rin po che rigs sna tshogs ni nam mkha'i gos can gyi lugs kyis blta bar bya'i /
translated: For example, the various kinds of jewels are to be seen according to the system of the sky-clad ones,

original: rnal 'byor spyod pa'i lugs kyis ni ma yin te /
analyzed: rnal 'byor spyod pa'i lugs kyis ni ma yin te /
translated: but not according to the system of the YogƒÅcƒÅra,

original: rnal 'byor spyod pa la ni rin po che ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnal 'byor spyod pa la ni rin po che ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the YogƒÅcƒÅra do not accept the existence of jewels.

original: rnal 'byor spyod pa'i lugs kyis ni dpe sems rgyud sna tshogs la yod pa'i shes pa rnams yin te /
analyzed: rnal 'byor spyod pa'i lugs kyis ni dpe sems rgyud sna tshogs la yod pa'i shes pa rnams yin te /
translated: According to the YogƒÅcƒÅra system, the examples are the consciousnesses that exist in the various mind-streams.

original: dpe sems rgyud sna tshogs la yod pa'i shes pa ni sogs pa zhes bya ba'i sgras bstan pa kho na yin no //
analyzed: dpe sems rgyud sna tshogs la yod pa'i shes pa ni sogs pa zhes bya ba'i sgras bstan pa kho na yin no //
translated: The consciousnesses that exist in the various mind-streams are indicated by the word ‚Äúetc.‚Äù

original: des na sun dbyung ba 'di ni gnyis ka'i lugs la yang thun mong yin no //
analyzed: des na sun dbyung ba 'di ni gnyis ka'i lugs la yang thun mong yin no //
translated: Therefore this refutation is common to both systems.

original: sun dbyung ba thun mong gzhan yang //
analyzed: sun dbyung ba thun mong gzhan yang //
translated: Another common refutation is stated in the line:

original: sna tshogs gcig pu'i rang bzhin ni //üîΩzhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: sna tshogs gcig pu'i rang bzhin ni //üîΩzhes bya ba smos so //
translated: The nature of the various is not one.

original: sna tshogs ngo bor snang bar yang mi 'gyur zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: sna tshogs ngo bor snang bar yang mi 'gyur zhes bya ba ste /
translated: Nor would there be the appearance of a variety of natures.

original: sna tshogs kyi ngo bor snang ba ni sna tshogs kyi ngo bos khyab @106a * //üîΩpa yin no //
analyzed: sna tshogs kyi ngo bor snang ba ni sna tshogs kyi ngo bos khyab @106a * // pa yin no //
translated: The appearance of a variety of natures is pervaded by a variety of natures.

original: de ni tha dad pa'i bdag nyid du 'khrul pa med de zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni khyab pa de nyid ston par byed pa'o //
analyzed: de ni tha dad pa'i bdag nyid du 'khrul pa med de zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni khyab pa de nyid ston par byed pa'o //
translated: That is not a delusion of a different nature, etc. This shows just that pervasion.

original: de bzhin du gcig rtogs pas zhes bya ba ni rnam pa sna gcig snang na rnam pa thams cad snang bar 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du gcig rtogs pas zhes bya ba ni rnam pa sna gcig snang na rnam pa thams cad snang bar 'gyur ba'o //
translated: Similarly, by the understanding of one, etc. means that if one aspect appears, all aspects would appear.

original: sogs pa zhes bya ba'i sgras ni gcig dmar ram tshig na thams cad dmar ba la sogs par thal bar 'gyur ro zhes ston to //
analyzed: sogs pa zhes bya ba'i sgras ni gcig dmar ram tshig na thams cad dmar ba la sogs par thal bar 'gyur ro zhes ston to //
translated: The word ‚Äúetc.‚Äù indicates that it would follow that all would be red, etc. if one were red, etc.

original: ji ste ngo bo nyid du de'i zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni 'di la pha rol po'i lan gyis dogs pa bsu bar byed do //
analyzed: ji ste ngo bo nyid du de'i zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni 'di la pha rol po'i lan gyis dogs pa bsu bar byed do //
translated: If one says, ‚ÄúBut it is the nature of that . . . ,‚Äù etc. this anticipates the opponent‚Äôs response.

original: de'i zhes bya ba ni shes pa'i'o //
analyzed: de'i zhes bya ba ni shes pa'i'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThat‚Äù refers to consciousness.

original: 'o na ji ltar snang snyam pa la //
analyzed: 'o na ji ltar snang snyam pa la //
translated: If one asks, ‚ÄúWell then, how does it appear?‚Äù

original: nor pas zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: nor pas zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: it is said, ‚ÄúThrough error.‚Äù

original: bsdus pa'i don ni gal te rnam pa 'di dag bden pa'i ngo bo kho na zhig tu gyur na de'i tshe 'gal ba 'di dag thams cad du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bsdus pa'i don ni gal te rnam pa 'di dag bden pa'i ngo bo kho na zhig tu gyur na de'i tshe 'gal ba 'di dag thams cad du 'gyur ro //
translated: The condensed meaning is this: If these aspects were only the nature of reality, then all of these contradictions would ensue.

original: brdzun pa nyid gcig yin na ni 'gal ba med de /
analyzed: brdzun pa nyid gcig yin na ni 'gal ba med de /
translated: But if they are only false, then there is no contradiction,

original: don dam par shes pa'i ngo bo gcig pa kho na khas blangs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: don dam par shes pa'i ngo bo gcig pa kho na khas blangs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: because ultimately only the nature of consciousness is accepted as being one.

original: sngon po la sogs pa rnam pa'i bye brag tu gyur pa ma yin pa ni shes pa la phrad pa med pa'o //
analyzed: sngon po la sogs pa rnam pa'i bye brag tu gyur pa ma yin pa ni shes pa la phrad pa med pa'o //
translated: The distinction of aspects such as blue, etc., is not present in consciousness.

original: gzhan zhig gzhan gyi ngo bor snang bar ji ltar 'grub snyam pa la /
analyzed: gzhan zhig gzhan gyi ngo bor snang bar ji ltar 'grub snyam pa la /
translated: How can one thing be established as the appearance of the nature of another?

original: 'jim pa'i dum bu la sogs pa zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: 'jim pa'i dum bu la sogs pa zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúa lump of clay, etc.‚Äù is stated in response to this.

original: sngags la sogs pas dkrugs pa'i mig can gyi mi rnams la zhes bya bar sbyar te /
analyzed: sngags la sogs pas dkrugs pa'i mig can gyi mi rnams la zhes bya bar sbyar te /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúpeople whose eyes are affected by spells, etc.‚Äù is supplied.

original: sogs pa'i sgras ni sman la sogs pa yongs su bsdu'o //
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgras ni sman la sogs pa yongs su bsdu'o //
translated: The word ‚Äúetc.‚Äù includes medicine, etc.

original: gal te med na ji lta bur //
analyzed: gal te med na ji lta bur //
translated: If it does not exist, how can it beüîΩ?üîΩThe refutation is explained by the passage beginning with

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni sun dbyung bar bshad de /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni sun dbyung bar bshad de /
translated: This and more explains the refutation.

original: de dag ces bya ba ni rnam pa rnams so //
analyzed: de dag ces bya ba ni rnam pa rnams so //
translated: ‚ÄúThose‚Äù refers to the aspects.

original: 'di ltar zhes bya ba ni byis pa yan chad la shin tu grags pa ltar ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar zhes bya ba ni byis pa yan chad la shin tu grags pa ltar ro //
translated: ‚ÄúIn this way‚Äù means in the way that is well known to ordinary beings and above.

original: de yi dngos las tha dad pa'i //
analyzed: de yi dngos las tha dad pa'i //
translated: ‚ÄúFrom the entity of that‚Äù

original: zhes bya ba ni rnam pa gsal ba snang ba las tha dad pa gnyis su med pa'i ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni rnam pa gsal ba snang ba las tha dad pa gnyis su med pa'i ste /
translated: means that the nondual aspect is not different from the appearance of the clear object.

original: 'di ni 'jig rten las 'das pa yin no zhes ston par byed de /
analyzed: 'di ni 'jig rten las 'das pa yin no zhes ston par byed de /
translated: This is taught to be supramundane.

original: 'di ltar shin tu gsal bar nyams su myong ba gang yin pa de ni brdzun la nyams su myong ba med pa gang yin pa de ni bden no zhes bya ba 'di las legs par smras pa 'di ni gzhan ci zhig yod /
analyzed: 'di ltar shin tu gsal bar nyams su myong ba gang yin pa de ni brdzun la nyams su myong ba med pa gang yin pa de ni bden no zhes bya ba 'di las legs par smras pa 'di ni gzhan ci zhig yod /
translated: What else could be better said than this: ‚ÄúThat which is very clearly experienced is false, and that which is not experienced is true‚Äù?

original: 'di ltar gang la dngos gang med //
analyzed: 'di ltar gang la dngos gang med //
translated: ‚ÄúThat which does not exist in a thing‚Äù

original: ces bya ba la sogs pas ni tshad ma ston te /
analyzed: ces bya ba la sogs pas ni tshad ma ston te /
translated: and so on teaches the valid knowledge.

original: dngos po gang zhig gang la med pa de ni de la shes pa ma yin te /
analyzed: dngos po gang zhig gang la med pa de ni de la shes pa ma yin te /
translated: That which does not exist in a thing is not a consciousness of that.

original: dper na sdug bsngal la @106b bde ba la sogs pa'i dngos po 'am dkar po'i rnam pa la sngon po'i rnam pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na sdug bsngal la @106b bde ba la sogs pa'i dngos po 'am dkar po'i rnam pa la sngon po'i rnam pa lta bu'o //
translated: For example, it is like the entity of pleasure in regard to pain, or the aspect of white in regard to the aspect of blue.üîΩAnd in regard to consciousness, there is no aspect of blue, etc.

original: shes pa la yang sngon po la sogs pa'i rnam pa med do zhes bya ba ni khyab par byed pa 'gal ba dmigs pa yin no //
analyzed: shes pa la yang sngon po la sogs pa'i rnam pa med do zhes bya ba ni khyab par byed pa 'gal ba dmigs pa yin no //
translated: This is the observation of a contradiction with a pervasion.

original: gal te tshad ma 'di la don dam par shes pa med par thal bar 'gyur bar rab tu bsgrubs na ni de'i tshe sgrub pa la grub pa nyid do //
analyzed: gal te tshad ma 'di la don dam par shes pa med par thal bar 'gyur bar rab tu bsgrubs na ni de'i tshe sgrub pa la grub pa nyid do //
translated: If this valid cognition is well established as the consequence that consciousness does not exist ultimately, then at that time, the proof is established.üîΩBut if it is established in general, then at that time, it is just indeterminate because there is no valid cognition that contradicts the reversal.

original: ji ste spyir sgrub na ni de'i tshe bzlog na gnod pa can gyi tshad ma med pa'i phyir ma nges pa nyid yin no zhes pha rol po'i lan gyi skabs spang ba'i phyir 'di la bsgrub par bya ba'i chos las bzlog pa dang zhes bya ba la sogsüîΩpa smos so //
analyzed: ji ste spyir sgrub na ni de'i tshe bzlog na gnod pa can gyi tshad ma med pa'i phyir ma nges pa nyid yin no zhes pha rol po'i lan gyi skabs spang ba'i phyir 'di la bsgrub par bya ba'i chos las bzlog pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: In order to reject the opportunity for the opponent‚Äôs reply, here it is said, ‚ÄúThe reversal of the predicate of the proposition,‚Äù and so on.

original: 'dir ni spyi kho nar bsgrubs la ;
analyzed: 'dir ni spyi kho nar bsgrubs la ;
translated: Here, it is established in general.

original: 'di ma nges pa nyid kyang ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di ma nges pa nyid kyang ma yin te /
translated: And this is not indeterminate.

original: 'di ltar shes pa ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: 'di ltar shes pa ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: Knowledge is of two kinds:

original: dngos dang btags pa'o //
analyzed: dngos dang btags pa'o //
translated: real and nominal.

original: de la dngos ni bems po'i ngo bo ma yin pa yin la /
analyzed: de la dngos ni bems po'i ngo bo ma yin pa yin la /
translated: The real is not the nature of an insentient thing.

original: bems po'i ngo bo ma yin pa yang shes pa kho na'i thun mong ma yin pa rang gi bdag nyid du gyur pa'i chos can yin na ji ltar rnam pa med pa'i yin par 'gyur /
analyzed: bems po'i ngo bo ma yin pa yang shes pa kho na'i thun mong ma yin pa rang gi bdag nyid du gyur pa'i chos can yin na ji ltar rnam pa med pa'i yin par 'gyur /
translated: And if the nature of an insentient thing is not the unique property of consciousness, then how can it be without aspects?

original: sbyor ba ni gang zhig shes pa'i ngo bo ma yin pa de la ni shes pa'i dngos po yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: sbyor ba ni gang zhig shes pa'i ngo bo ma yin pa de la ni shes pa'i dngos po yod pa ma yin te /
translated: The syllogism is: Whatever is not the nature of consciousness does not have the nature of consciousness,

original: dper na nam mkha'i pad ma lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na nam mkha'i pad ma lta bu'o //
translated: like, for example, a sky-lotus.

original: med par khas blangs pa sngon po la sogs pa'i rnam pa rnams kyang shes pa'i ngo bo ma yin pas khyab par byed pa 'gal ba dmigs pa yin no //
analyzed: med par khas blangs pa sngon po la sogs pa'i rnam pa rnams kyang shes pa'i ngo bo ma yin pas khyab par byed pa 'gal ba dmigs pa yin no //
translated: The apprehension of the contradictory of a pervader is also present here: the aspects of blue, etc., which are accepted as not being absent, are not the nature of consciousness.

original: btags pa yang mi srid de /
analyzed: btags pa yang mi srid de /
translated: Nominal knowledge is also impossible.

original: 'di ltar rang gi rnam par snang ba'i shes pa bskyed pa nyid btags pa'i shes pa zhes bya na /
analyzed: 'di ltar rang gi rnam par snang ba'i shes pa bskyed pa nyid btags pa'i shes pa zhes bya na /
translated: Thus, the production of consciousness appearing as itself is called nominal knowledge.

original: btags pa'i shes pa yang nus pa thams cad kyis stong pa rta ru lta bur med pa la ni rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: btags pa'i shes pa yang nus pa thams cad kyis stong pa rta ru lta bur med pa la ni rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: It is not reasonable that the consciousness of the designation is empty of all abilities, like a horse that does not exist.

original: med pa'i mtshan nyid ni nus pa thams cad kyis dben pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: med pa'i mtshan nyid ni nus pa thams cad kyis dben pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the definition of non-existence is being devoid of all abilities.

original: rta ru med pa ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni de nyid ston pa yin te /
analyzed: rta ru med pa ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni de nyid ston pa yin te /
translated: The phrase not existing as a horse and so on teaches just that.

original: rta ru ni btags pa'i shes pa nyid nyams su myong ba med do zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: rta ru ni btags pa'i shes pa nyid nyams su myong ba med do zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: It should be applied as the consciousness designated as a horse does not experience itself.

original: ci'i phyir snyam pa la /
analyzed: ci'i phyir snyam pa la /
translated: Why is that?

original: rang snang ba'i shes pa bskyed par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: rang snang ba'i shes pa bskyed par mi 'gyur te /
translated: Because it would not generate a consciousness that appears as itself.

original: rigs pa gdags pa'i rgyur mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: rigs pa gdags pa'i rgyur mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: It would not be a reason for designating an ability.

original: sbyor ba ni gang zhig nus pa med pa de ni btags pa'i shes pa ma yin te /
analyzed: sbyor ba ni gang zhig nus pa med pa de ni btags pa'i shes pa ma yin te /
translated: The syllogism is: Whatever is without ability is not a consciousness designated as that,

original: dper na rta ru lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na rta ru lta bu'o //
translated: like a horse.

original: med par 'dod pa'i rnam pa rnams kyang nus pa med pa yin pas khyab par byed pa 'gal ba dmigs pa yin no //
analyzed: med par 'dod pa'i rnam pa rnams kyang nus pa med pa yin pas khyab par byed pa 'gal ba dmigs pa yin no //
translated: Since the aspects that are asserted to be non-existent are also without ability, there is a contradiction with the pervader.

original: de ltar dngos dang nye bar @107a * //
analyzed: de ltar dngos dang nye bar @107a * //
translated: Thus, the direct and indirect

original: btags pa phan tshun spangs te gnas pa'i mtshan nyid dag gis shes pa la khyab pa'i phyir khyab par byed pa de med de log pas des khyab pa shes pa yang ldog pa kho na yin pas shes par bya ba'i go skabs med pas na med pa'i phyir
analyzed: btags pa phan tshun spangs te gnas pa'i mtshan nyid dag gis shes pa la khyab pa'i phyir khyab par byed pa de med de log pas des khyab pa shes pa yang ldog pa kho na yin pas shes par bya ba'i go skabs med pas na med pa'i phyir
translated: Because the two mutually exclusive characteristics of the two imputations are pervaded by consciousness, when the pervader is absent, that is, when it is stopped, then the pervaded consciousness is also stopped. Therefore, since there is no opportunity for it to be cognized, it does not exist.

original: zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs ni ma nges pa nyid ma yin no //üîΩtshad ma gzhan rnam pa de /
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs ni ma nges pa nyid ma yin no // tshad ma gzhan rnam pa de /
translated: Thus the reason is not indeterminate.üîΩWhat relation does another valid cognition have

original: shes dang 'brel pa ci zhig yod //üîΩces bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: shes dang 'brel pa ci zhig yod // ces bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: to that aspect of consciousness?

original: sbyor ba ni gang zhig dang lhan cig 'brel pa med pa de ni de tshor ba na nges par tshor ba med de //
analyzed: sbyor ba ni gang zhig dang lhan cig 'brel pa med pa de ni de tshor ba na nges par tshor ba med de //
translated: The syllogism is: Whatever is not related to something else does not cognize it when it cognizes that,

original: dper na shes pa'i bdag nyid tshor na mo gsham gyi bu tshor ba med pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na shes pa'i bdag nyid tshor na mo gsham gyi bu tshor ba med pa lta bu'o //
translated: like the consciousness of a barren woman‚Äôs daughter does not cognize a self that is the same nature as consciousness.

original: med par 'dod pa'i rnam pa rnams kyang shes pa dang lhan cig de'i bdag nyid dang de las byung ba'i mtshan nyid kyi 'brel pa gnyi ga yang med pas khyab par byed pa mi dmigs pa yin no //
analyzed: med par 'dod pa'i rnam pa rnams kyang shes pa dang lhan cig de'i bdag nyid dang de las byung ba'i mtshan nyid kyi 'brel pa gnyi ga yang med pas khyab par byed pa mi dmigs pa yin no //
translated: The aspects that are asserted to be nonexistent are also pervaded by the nonobservation of a pervader, since they are neither related to consciousness by the character of having the same nature nor by the character of having a different nature.

original: shes pa las byung ba yin na yang rgyu dang 'bras bu ni dus tha dad pa'i phyir tshor ba med pa kho na ma yin nam /
analyzed: shes pa las byung ba yin na yang rgyu dang 'bras bu ni dus tha dad pa'i phyir tshor ba med pa kho na ma yin nam /
translated: If they were to arise from consciousness, then since cause and effect would be different in time, there would be no feeling.

original: des 'dir ci'i phyir klan ka mi btsal snyam pa la /
analyzed: des 'dir ci'i phyir klan ka mi btsal snyam pa la /
translated: Why is it not a problem here?

original: de las byung ba yin na yang snga phyi yod pas zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de las byung ba yin na yang snga phyi yod pas zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: If they were to arise from it, then since there would be a temporal sequence,

original: 'di yang 'dir nyes pa kho na yin mod kyi /
analyzed: 'di yang 'dir nyes pa kho na yin mod kyi /
translated: this is also a problem here.

original: 'on kyang 'di khas blangs nas nyes pa gzhan du brjod do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: 'on kyang 'di khas blangs nas nyes pa gzhan du brjod do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: However, the meaning of the statement is that having accepted this, another problem is stated.

original: rnam pa rnams med kyang tshor ba med par thal bar 'gyur ba 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi /
analyzed: rnam pa rnams med kyang tshor ba med par thal bar 'gyur ba 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi /
translated: Not only does the consequence of the nonexistence of feeling follow from the nonexistence of aspects,

original: rgyu med pa nyid du yang thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rgyu med pa nyid du yang thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: but also the consequence of causelessness follows.

original: de'i phyir res 'ga' ba nyid du mi 'thad pa'i nyes pa yod do zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de'i phyir res 'ga' ba nyid du mi 'thad pa'i nyes pa yod do zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, in order to demonstrate the fault that it is not tenable that the object is sometimes existent and sometimes nonexistent, he says:

original: shes pa dang dus mnyam du dmigs pa'i rnam pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: shes pa dang dus mnyam du dmigs pa'i rnam pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: The aspect that is observed simultaneously with consciousness, etc.

original: 'o na rgyu dang ldan par 'gyur ro snyam pa la /üîΩrgyu dang ldan na'ang 'ga' zhig gis //
analyzed: 'o na rgyu dang ldan par 'gyur ro snyam pa la / rgyu dang ldan na'ang 'ga' zhig gis //
translated: If it is said that it is a cause, then he says:

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: Even if it has a cause, it is not tenable that it is an object of knowledge, etc.

original: gzhan gyi dbang zhes bya ba ni rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba yin pa'i phyir gzhan gyi dbang gi rang bzhin du 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: gzhan gyi dbang zhes bya ba ni rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba yin pa'i phyir gzhan gyi dbang gi rang bzhin du 'gyur gyi /
translated: The dependent is the dependent nature because it arises in dependence.

original: kun brtags pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: kun brtags pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It is not the imagined.

original: yod par khas blangs ma thag pa ni rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba yin pa'i mtshan nyid de /
analyzed: yod par khas blangs ma thag pa ni rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba yin pa'i mtshan nyid de /
translated: The existence that is just accepted is characterized by dependent origination.

original: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i mtshan nyid dang lhan cig de'i bdag nyid kyis 'brel par nges pa'i phyir med na mi 'byung ba yin no //
analyzed: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i mtshan nyid dang lhan cig de'i bdag nyid kyis 'brel par nges pa'i phyir med na mi 'byung ba yin no //
translated: Since it is definitely related to the dependent origination characteristic by way of its identity, it is not tenable that it does not arise when that exists.

original: de'i bdag nyid kyis 'brel pa de nyid @107b bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de'i bdag nyid kyis 'brel pa de nyid @107b bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate just that connection by way of identity, he says:

original: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba las gzhan gyi dbang ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba las gzhan gyi dbang ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: The other-dependent is from dependent origination.

original: gal te de lta yin du chug kyang yod pa go rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba med na mi 'byung bar ji ltar 'grub snyam pa la /
analyzed: gal te de lta yin du chug kyang yod pa go rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba med na mi 'byung bar ji ltar 'grub snyam pa la /
translated: Even if one allows that, how is it established that existence does not occur without dependent origination?üîΩIn response to that, he says:

original: rkyen las byung ba'i rang bzhin las kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: rkyen las byung ba'i rang bzhin las kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: The nature of what arises from conditions.

original: de zhes bya ba ni rnam pa'o //
analyzed: de zhes bya ba ni rnam pa'o //
translated: That means the aspect.

original: rnam pa med pa nyid kyis 'gyur //
analyzed: rnam pa med pa nyid kyis 'gyur //
translated: It would be without an aspect.

original: zhes bya ba ni rtag tu rnam pa med pa kho nar myong bar 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni rtag tu rnam pa med pa kho nar myong bar 'gyur ba'o //
translated: That means it would always be experienced as just without an aspect.

original: gal te shes pa nyid dmigs pa'i rig byar gyur pa kho na'o snyam na /
analyzed: gal te shes pa nyid dmigs pa'i rig byar gyur pa kho na'o snyam na /
translated: If one thinks that consciousness itself is just the observed object,

original: shel sgong dag pa 'dra ba yin //
analyzed: shel sgong dag pa 'dra ba yin //
translated: It is like a pure crystal sphere.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te //
translated: In response to that, he says:

original: shel sgong dag pa nyid ni nye bar bzhag pas kha sgyur ba dang bral ba'i gnas skabs so //
analyzed: shel sgong dag pa nyid ni nye bar bzhag pas kha sgyur ba dang bral ba'i gnas skabs so //
translated: A pure crystal sphere is a state free from change due to the placement of something else.

original: tshu rol mthong ba rnams kyi dmigs pa'i rig byar gyur pa ma yin te /
analyzed: tshu rol mthong ba rnams kyi dmigs pa'i rig byar gyur pa ma yin te /
translated: It is not the object of observation of those who see only the near side.

original: de'i phyir shes pa dmigs par mi 'gyur ro snyam pa la /
analyzed: de'i phyir shes pa dmigs par mi 'gyur ro snyam pa la /
translated: Therefore, consciousness is not observed.

original: nang dang phyi rol du gyur pa'i rnam pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: nang dang phyi rol du gyur pa'i rnam pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: In response to that, the text says, ‚ÄúThe aspects that are internal or external,‚Äù and so on.

original: gal te nang ngam phyi rol gyi rnam pa dag cig srid par gyur na ni de'i tshe rnam pa rnams myong bas 'khrul pa bskyed pa rnams myong yang nges par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba 'gyur na gang gi tshe de dag nang na yang med phyi rol
