analyzed: gal te nang ngam phyi rol gyi rnam pa dag cig srid par gyur na ni de'i tshe rnam pa rnams myong bas 'khrul pa bskyed pa rnams myong yang nges par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba 'gyur na gang gi tshe de dag nang na yang med phyi rol
translated: If the aspects that are internal or external were possible, then it would be the case that the aspects that are generated by the experience of error are experienced but not ascertained.

original: na yang med pa de'i tshe gang gi mthus bslus par 'gyur /
analyzed: na yang med pa de'i tshe gang gi mthus bslus par 'gyur /
translated: But when they do not exist internally or externally, then by the power of what are they deceived?

original: gang gis na gnyis su med pa myong bzhin du yang nges par mi 'gyur /
analyzed: gang gis na gnyis su med pa myong bzhin du yang nges par mi 'gyur /
translated: By what are they not ascertained even though they experience the nondual?

original: smig rgyu la sogs pa la chu la sogs pa'i rnam pa med bzhin du yang myong ba'i phyir gang la gang dngos po med ces bya ba la sogs pa'i gtan tshigs ma nges pa nyid ma yin nam snyam pa la /üîΩsmig rgyu la sogs pas zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so /
analyzed: smig rgyu la sogs pa la chu la sogs pa'i rnam pa med bzhin du yang myong ba'i phyir gang la gang dngos po med ces bya ba la sogs pa'i gtan tshigs ma nges pa nyid ma yin nam snyam pa la / smig rgyu la sogs pas zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so /
translated: Since one experiences mirage, etc. as having the aspect of water, etc., is not the reason where something does not exist etc. indeterminate?üîΩThe response is because of the similarity of the investigation and analysis of mirage, etc.

original: brgal zhing brtag pa mthun pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la ni smig rgyu la sogs pa yang phyogs su byas pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
analyzed: brgal zhing brtag pa mthun pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la ni smig rgyu la sogs pa yang phyogs su byas pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
translated: The meaning of because of the similarity of the investigation and analysis of mirage, etc. is because mirage, etc. are also posited as the subject.

original: 'di ltar smig rgyu la sogs pa la yang chu la sogs pa'i rnam pa gal te nang na yang med phyi rol na yang med na de'i tshe shin tu med pa de ji ltar myong bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'di ltar smig rgyu la sogs pa la yang chu la sogs pa'i rnam pa gal te nang na yang med phyi rol na yang med na de'i tshe shin tu med pa de ji ltar myong bar 'gyur te /
translated: Thus, with regard to mirage, etc., if the aspect of water, etc. does not exist internally or externally, then at that time, how could that which is utterly nonexistent be experienced?

original: brgal zhing brtag pa mtshungs pa na kho na'o //
analyzed: brgal zhing brtag pa mtshungs pa na kho na'o //
translated: The response is because of the similarity of the investigation and analysis of mirage, etc.

original: 'di snyam du brdzun pa'i rnam pa kun tu snang ba gang yin pa 'di nyid 'khrul pa'i rang gi ngo bo yin te /
analyzed: 'di snyam du brdzun pa'i rnam pa kun tu snang ba gang yin pa 'di nyid 'khrul pa'i rang gi ngo bo yin te /
translated: One might think that the appearance of false aspects is the nature of error itself.

original: des na rnam pa med pa yang @108a * //
analyzed: des na rnam pa med pa yang @108a * //
translated: Therefore, even though there are no aspects,üîΩthey are experienced due to the power of error.

original: 'khrul pa'i dbang gis myong bar 'gyur ro snyam du sems par gyur na de ni yang dag pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'khrul pa'i dbang gis myong bar 'gyur ro snyam du sems par gyur na de ni yang dag pa ma yin te /
translated: But that is not correct.üîΩIn saying ‚Äúerror,‚Äù one would be referring to the latent potentialities that give rise to error, or else one would be referring to the erroneous consciousness itself that arises from such latent potentialities.

original: 'di ltar 'khrul pa yin zhes bya ba'i sgrar ni 'khrul pa skye ba'i bag chags brjod par 'gyur ba'am yang na bag chags de lta bu la skyes pa 'khrul pa can gyi shes pa kho na brjod par 'gyur grang na de la phyogs dang po ltar na ni
analyzed: 'di ltar 'khrul pa yin zhes bya ba'i sgrar ni 'khrul pa skye ba'i bag chags brjod par 'gyur ba'am yang na bag chags de lta bu la skyes pa 'khrul pa can gyi shes pa kho na brjod par 'gyur grang na de la phyogs dang po ltar na ni
translated: In the first case,

original: bag chags dang rnam pa rnams 'brel ba med pa'i phyir bag chags kyi stobs kyis rnam pa rnams myong bar rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: bag chags dang rnam pa rnams 'brel ba med pa'i phyir bag chags kyi stobs kyis rnam pa rnams myong bar rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: since the latent potentialities and the aspects are not related, it is not logical that the aspects are experienced due to the power of the latent potentialities,

original: ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because that would lead to absurd consequences.

original: de las byung ba'i mtshan nyid kyis 'brel ba yod pa kho na'o zhes bya bar yang rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de las byung ba'i mtshan nyid kyis 'brel ba yod pa kho na'o zhes bya bar yang rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: It is not right to say that they are related by the nature of effect, because

original: snga ma bzhin du gzhan gyi dbang nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: snga ma bzhin du gzhan gyi dbang nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: it would follow, as before, that they are dependent on something else.

original: ji de yang phyogs gnyis pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: ji de yang phyogs gnyis pa yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that this is the second position,

original: 'khrul pa can gyi shes pa dang rnam pa rnams 'brel pa zhig yin na yang de'i bdag nyid kyi mtshan nyid kho nar 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: 'khrul pa can gyi shes pa dang rnam pa rnams 'brel pa zhig yin na yang de'i bdag nyid kyi mtshan nyid kho nar 'gyur gyi /
translated: then even if the mistaken consciousness and the aspects are related, they would be related only by the nature of identity,

original: shes pa dang dus mnyam du myong ba'i phyir de las byung ba'i mtshan nyid ni ma yin no //
analyzed: shes pa dang dus mnyam du myong ba'i phyir de las byung ba'i mtshan nyid ni ma yin no //
translated: because they are experienced simultaneously with the consciousness, not by the nature of effect.

original: dus mnyam pa gnyis kyang rgyu dang 'bras bu'i mtshan nyid du mi rung ste /
analyzed: dus mnyam pa gnyis kyang rgyu dang 'bras bu'i mtshan nyid du mi rung ste /
translated: Two things that are simultaneous cannot be characterized as cause and effect.

original: de'i phyir bag chags kyi 'bras bu'i bdag nyid ces bya ba la sogs pas 'khrul pa bzhin du shes pa las tha mi dad pa'i phyir gzhan gyi dbang nyid du thal bar 'gyur bar bzlog dka'o zhes ston par byed do //
analyzed: de'i phyir bag chags kyi 'bras bu'i bdag nyid ces bya ba la sogs pas 'khrul pa bzhin du shes pa las tha mi dad pa'i phyir gzhan gyi dbang nyid du thal bar 'gyur bar bzlog dka'o zhes ston par byed do //
translated: Therefore, it is difficult to avoid the conclusion that, like the error, the dependent nature would be dependent on something else, because it is not different from the consciousness, as indicated by the phrase ‚Äúthe nature of the effect of the latent potentialities.‚Äù

original: 'khrul pa la ji skad bshad pa'i bag chags kyi 'bras bur gyur pa shes pa gang yin pa de kho na'i bdag nyid rang gi ngo bo yod pa zhes tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
analyzed: 'khrul pa la ji skad bshad pa'i bag chags kyi 'bras bur gyur pa shes pa gang yin pa de kho na'i bdag nyid rang gi ngo bo yod pa zhes tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
translated: The consciousness that is the result of the latent potentialities explained in the case of error is the very nature of that which is said to exist, that is, its essence.üîΩ‚Äú This‚Äù refers to the fact that the experience of the nonexistent is not tenable because the connection is not established.

original: 'dis ni zhes bya ba ni 'brel pa ma grub pa'i phyir med pa myong bar mi rung bar bsgrub pas so zhes bya ba la sogs pas zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i sgras ni /
analyzed: 'dis ni zhes bya ba ni 'brel pa ma grub pa'i phyir med pa myong bar mi rung bar bsgrub pas so zhes bya ba la sogs pas zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i sgras ni /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúand so on‚Äù in the line ‚Äúand so on, such as‚Äù includes the following lines:

original: sngags dkrugs la sogs mig can la //
analyzed: sngags dkrugs la sogs mig can la //
translated: Those who have eyes that are confused by mantras,

original: dper na 'jim du ma la sogs pa //
analyzed: dper na 'jim du ma la sogs pa //
translated: Just as clay and so on,

original: de yi ngo bo bral bzhin du //
analyzed: de yi ngo bo bral bzhin du //
translated: Although they are devoid of that nature,

original: gzhan nyid du ni snang ba ltar //üîΩzhes bya ba la sogs pas yongs su bsdu'o //
analyzed: gzhan nyid du ni snang ba ltar // zhes bya ba la sogs pas yongs su bsdu'o //
translated: They appear as if they were different.

original: gang la phyi rol gyi don la mngon par zhen pas dbang med par gyur pa'i blo yod pa zhes tshig rnam par sbyar te /
analyzed: gang la phyi rol gyi don la mngon par zhen pas dbang med par gyur pa'i blo yod pa zhes tshig rnam par sbyar te /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthat which exists‚Äù refers to the mind that is powerless due to its adherence to external objects.

original: phyi rol gyi don yod par smra ba'i dbang du byas nas bshad kyi bdag cag gi dbang du byas bas ni ma yin no zhes bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: phyi rol gyi don yod par smra ba'i dbang du byas nas bshad kyi bdag cag gi dbang du byas bas ni ma yin no zhes bshad pa yin no //
translated: This is explained from the perspective of those who propound external objects, but not from our own perspective.

original: 'dis ni slob dpon gyi tshig skyon chags pa ma yin pa nyid @108b du sgrub par byed do /üîΩ// / bam po gsum pa /
analyzed: 'dis ni slob dpon gyi tshig skyon chags pa ma yin pa nyid @108b du sgrub par byed do / // / bam po gsum pa /
translated: This proves that the master‚Äôs words are not faulty.üîΩTherefore, the master KalyƒÅ·πáamitra says,

original: de bas na dngos dang cig shos kyis rig pa'i don ma grub pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni /üîΩslob dpon dge ba srungs na re /
analyzed: de bas na dngos dang cig shos kyis rig pa'i don ma grub pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni / slob dpon dge ba srungs na re /
translated: ‚ÄúThe meaning of the statement ‚Äòbecause the object of cognition is not established by itself or something other‚Äô is as follows:

original: so so'i skye bo'i shes pa thams cad kyang sngon po la sogs pa'i rnam pas nye bar bsgyur bar gyur pa ma yin par 'jug ste /
analyzed: so so'i skye bo'i shes pa thams cad kyang sngon po la sogs pa'i rnam pas nye bar bsgyur bar gyur pa ma yin par 'jug ste /
translated: All the consciousnesses of ordinary beings engage without being transformed by the aspects of blue and so on.

original: shes pa de la ni gcig pa nyid nyams par thal bar mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: shes pa de la ni gcig pa nyid nyams par thal bar mi 'gyur te /
translated: In that consciousness, the fault of the loss of singularity does not arise.

original: blo sna tshogs kyi ngo bo nyid ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: blo sna tshogs kyi ngo bo nyid ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is not the nature of a variety of minds.‚Äù

original: shes pa de la sngon po la sogs pa myong ba'i ngo bo nyid du rnam par gzhag pa gang yin pa de ni sngon po la sogs pa myong ba'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir yin gyi /üîΩsngon po la sogs pa'i ngo bor gyur pa'i phyir ni ma yin te /
analyzed: shes pa de la sngon po la sogs pa myong ba'i ngo bo nyid du rnam par gzhag pa gang yin pa de ni sngon po la sogs pa myong ba'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir yin gyi / sngon po la sogs pa'i ngo bor gyur pa'i phyir ni ma yin te /
translated: The aspect of consciousness that is posited as the entity that experiences blue and so on is the entity that experiences blue and so on, but it is not the entity of blue and so on.

original: 'di ltar rnam pa ni dmigs pa 'dzin pa'i rnam pa kho na yin par brjod pa'i rnam pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: 'di ltar rnam pa ni dmigs pa 'dzin pa'i rnam pa kho na yin par brjod pa'i rnam pa ma yin gyi /
translated: This is because the aspect is said to be the aspect that apprehends the object, not the aspect that is expressed.

original: sngon po la sogs par rig pa'i shes rol gyi lta bur snang bar shes pa gang yin pa de ni shes pa'i rnam pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: sngon po la sogs par rig pa'i shes rol gyi lta bur snang bar shes pa gang yin pa de ni shes pa'i rnam pa ma yin gyi /
translated: The aspect of consciousness that appears as blue and so on is not the aspect of consciousness.

original: sngon po la sogs par rig pa'i shes pa nyams su myong na sgrub pa pos sngon po la sogs pa de lta bu'i ngo bor rtogs so zhes zer ba de 'di nyid kyis lan btab pa yin no zhes ston par byed do //
analyzed: sngon po la sogs par rig pa'i shes pa nyams su myong na sgrub pa pos sngon po la sogs pa de lta bu'i ngo bor rtogs so zhes zer ba de 'di nyid kyis lan btab pa yin no zhes ston par byed do //
translated: When the experience of the consciousness that is aware of blue and so on is experienced, the proponent of this view says that the proponent of the existence of external objects realizes that blue and so on is of that nature.

original: sngon po la sogs pa nyams su myong ba'i shes pa de'i 'jug pa ni nyams su byang ba ste /
analyzed: sngon po la sogs pa nyams su myong ba'i shes pa de'i 'jug pa ni nyams su byang ba ste /
translated: The engagement of the consciousness that experiences blue and so on is experience.

original: gang la des yongs su rmongs pa'i bdag nyid yod pa zhes tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
analyzed: gang la des yongs su rmongs pa'i bdag nyid yod pa zhes tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
translated: The word ‚Äúexists‚Äù is to be supplied to the phrase ‚Äúthe nature of which is completely obscured by that.‚Äù

original: 'di skad du gal te sngon po la sogs pa dang shes pa lhan cig 'brel pa 'ga' yang med na de'i tshe ji ltar sngon po la sogs pa de myong bar 'gyur /
analyzed: 'di skad du gal te sngon po la sogs pa dang shes pa lhan cig 'brel pa 'ga' yang med na de'i tshe ji ltar sngon po la sogs pa de myong bar 'gyur /
translated: In other words, if blue and so on are not related to consciousness in any way, then how can blue and so on be experienced?

original: sngon po la sogs pa'i ngo bo ma gtogs par gang gis na slob dpon gyis sngon po la sogs pa'i ngo bo las ma gtogs pa'i rnam pa rnam par gzhag pas khungs su 'gyur ba shes pa g-yo ba med pa dmigs pa 'dzin pa'i rnam pa gzhan ni
analyzed: sngon po la sogs pa'i ngo bo ma gtogs par gang gis na slob dpon gyis sngon po la sogs pa'i ngo bo las ma gtogs pa'i rnam pa rnam par gzhag pas khungs su 'gyur ba shes pa g-yo ba med pa dmigs pa 'dzin pa'i rnam pa gzhan ni
translated: Apart from the nature of blue and so on, there is no other consciousness that is not related to the nature of blue and so on, and that is the basis for the master‚Äôs positing of aspects.

original: med de / shes pa sngon po la sogs pa'i ngo bor skyes pa nyid bya ba dang bcas pa yin par shes la /
analyzed: med de / shes pa sngon po la sogs pa'i ngo bor skyes pa nyid bya ba dang bcas pa yin par shes la /
translated: This is because the consciousness that is generated in the aspect of blue and so on is known to be endowed with activity.

original: shes pas dmigs pa 'dzin pa'i rnam pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: shes pas dmigs pa 'dzin pa'i rnam pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Consciousness is said to apprehend the aspect of the object.

original: gzhan yang gal te sngon po la sogs pa nang na yang med /
analyzed: gzhan yang gal te sngon po la sogs pa nang na yang med /
translated: Moreover, if blue and so on do not exist internally,

original: phyi rol na yang med na ji ltar sems rnam par rtog pa med pa la sngon po la sogs pa shin tu gsal bar snang ba brjod dgos so //
analyzed: phyi rol na yang med na ji ltar sems rnam par rtog pa med pa la sngon po la sogs pa shin tu gsal bar snang ba brjod dgos so //
translated: and if they do not exist externally, then you must explain how a nonconceptual mind can clearly perceive blue and so on.

original: mi snang ba kho na'o zhes de skad brjod par yang mi nus te /üîΩsngon po la @109a * //
analyzed: mi snang ba kho na'o zhes de skad brjod par yang mi nus te / sngon po la @109a * //
translated: You cannot say that they do not appear at all,

original: sogs par snang ba thams cad kyi nyams su myong ba grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sogs par snang ba thams cad kyi nyams su myong ba grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the experience of the appearance of blue and so on is established.

original: gsal bar snang ba ni gang gis na rmongs pa'i bdag nyid la de ltar snang bar rnam par rtog pa'i yul yin par yang rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gsal bar snang ba ni gang gis na rmongs pa'i bdag nyid la de ltar snang bar rnam par rtog pa'i yul yin par yang rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: The appearance of clarity is not the object of a conceptual consciousness that appears in that way to a deluded mind.

original: gal te yang shes pa thams cad rnam pa med pa kho nar nyams su myong na ni de'i tshe shes pa rnam pa med pa'i rjes la 'byung ba'i tshul can rnam par rtog pas kyang sngon po la sogs pa'i rnam pa so sor nges pa shes par rigs
analyzed: gal te yang shes pa thams cad rnam pa med pa kho nar nyams su myong na ni de'i tshe shes pa rnam pa med pa'i rjes la 'byung ba'i tshul can rnam par rtog pas kyang sngon po la sogs pa'i rnam pa so sor nges pa shes par rigs
translated: If all consciousnesses are experienced as being only without aspects, then it would be reasonable to know the ascertained aspects of blue and so on through a conceptual consciousness that arises after a consciousness without aspects.

original: pa ma yin pa nyid de 'brel pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: pa ma yin pa nyid de 'brel pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is no relationship.

original: gal te sngon po la sogs par shes pa nyid nor pa'i rang bzhin yin no zhes na 'dir /
analyzed: gal te sngon po la sogs par shes pa nyid nor pa'i rang bzhin yin no zhes na 'dir /
translated: If it is said that the consciousness of blue and so on is itself the nature of error, then here it is explained:

original: 'di ni 'khrul pas shes she na //
analyzed: 'di ni 'khrul pas shes she na //
translated: This is known through error.

original: de ci 'khrul la rag las sam //
analyzed: de ci 'khrul la rag las sam //
translated: Is that dependent on error?

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa bshad zin to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa bshad zin to //
translated: This and so on has already been explained.

original: de lta bas na 'brel pa med pas rnam par rtog pa'i yul ma yin pa'i phyir yang sngon po la sogs pa myong bar mi 'thad pas 'di ni rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de lta bas na 'brel pa med pas rnam par rtog pa'i yul ma yin pa'i phyir yang sngon po la sogs pa myong bar mi 'thad pas 'di ni rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, because there is no relationship, it is also unreasonable that blue and so on are not the objects of conceptual consciousnesses because it is not tenable that they are experienced.

original: 'o na yongs su ma dag pa'i gnas skabs na shes pa sna tshogs su snang ba brdzun pa kho na yin du chug kyang yongs su dag pa'i gnas skabs na ni rang bzhin gcig pa gnyis su med pa'i ngo bo kho nar 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'o na yongs su ma dag pa'i gnas skabs na shes pa sna tshogs su snang ba brdzun pa kho na yin du chug kyang yongs su dag pa'i gnas skabs na ni rang bzhin gcig pa gnyis su med pa'i ngo bo kho nar 'gyur te /
translated: Now, even though it is accepted that in the impure phase, the appearance of the variety of consciousnesses is only false, in the phase of purity, it becomes only the nature of the single essence of nondualism.

original: de'i phyir gtan tshigs the tshom za ba'i ma grub pa nyid yin no snyam pa 'di sems la bsdogs nas de bas na sngon po la sogs pa'i rnam pa ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir gtan tshigs the tshom za ba'i ma grub pa nyid yin no snyam pa 'di sems la bsdogs nas de bas na sngon po la sogs pa'i rnam pa ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Having set this thought in his mind, he says, ‚ÄúIf it were possible that all aspects would cease in the state of purity,‚Äù and so on.

original: gal te dag pa'i gnas skabs na rnam pa thams cad ldog par srid par gyur na ni de'i tshe 'di yang srid pa zhig na 'di lta ste /
analyzed: gal te dag pa'i gnas skabs na rnam pa thams cad ldog par srid par gyur na ni de'i tshe 'di yang srid pa zhig na 'di lta ste /
translated: If it were possible that all aspects would cease in the state of purity, then this would be possible.

original: 'khrul pa log kyang rnam pa rnams ldog par mi srid de /
analyzed: 'khrul pa log kyang rnam pa rnams ldog par mi srid de /
translated: But even if error is reversed, it is impossible for aspects to cease.

original: 'khrul pa dang rnam pa rnams 'brel pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'khrul pa dang rnam pa rnams 'brel pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because error and aspects are not related.

original: de lta ma yin na ni ha cang thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na ni ha cang thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If it were otherwise, it would follow, absurdly, that

original: gzhan yang gal te ma dag pa'i gnas skabs na shes pa brdzun pa kho na yin na de'i tshe dag pa'i gnas skabs na bden pa'i ngo bo de dag las skye ba brjod par bya dgos so //
analyzed: gzhan yang gal te ma dag pa'i gnas skabs na shes pa brdzun pa kho na yin na de'i tshe dag pa'i gnas skabs na bden pa'i ngo bo de dag las skye ba brjod par bya dgos so //
translated: Furthermore, if in the impure state consciousness is false, then at the time of the pure state you must explain how it is that it arises from those that are true.

original: brdzun pa las ni bden pa'i ngo bo skye bar yang rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: brdzun pa las ni bden pa'i ngo bo skye bar yang rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: It is not logical for a true entity to arise from a false one.

original: brdzun pa la nus pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: brdzun pa la nus pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because what is false has no power.

original: nus na ni de ji ltar brdzun par 'gyur /
analyzed: nus na ni de ji ltar brdzun par 'gyur /
translated: If it has power, how can it be false?

original: de lta bu yang brdzun pa nyid yin na ni gzhan yang bden pa nyid du ji ltar 'gyur te //
analyzed: de lta bu yang brdzun pa nyid yin na ni gzhan yang bden pa nyid du ji ltar 'gyur te //
translated: If such a thing is false, how can anything else be true?

original: de'i phyir bden pa rgyu med pa can kho nar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir bden pa rgyu med pa can kho nar 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, truth would be causeless.

original: de yang rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de yang rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: But that is not reasonable.

original: rtag tu @109b yod pa la sogs par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtag tu @109b yod pa la sogs par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it would follow that it would always exist and so on.

original: ji ste 'ga' zhig gi shes pa rang bzhin gyis gnyis su med par grub pa kho nar 'gyur te //
analyzed: ji ste 'ga' zhig gi shes pa rang bzhin gyis gnyis su med par grub pa kho nar 'gyur te //
translated: If you think that the cognition of someone would be established as nondual by nature,

original: dper na dbang phyug gi shes pa dbang phyug tu smra ba rnams kyis rtogs pa lta bu'o snyam pa na /
analyzed: dper na dbang phyug gi shes pa dbang phyug tu smra ba rnams kyis rtogs pa lta bu'o snyam pa na /
translated: like the cognition of ƒ™≈õvara that is understood by the proponents of ƒ™≈õvara,

original: de lta na yang the tshom za bar ma grub pa nyid kho na yin no zhe na /
analyzed: de lta na yang the tshom za bar ma grub pa nyid kho na yin no zhe na /
translated: even so, it is not established because it is doubtful.

original: de ni rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de ni rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: That is not reasonable.

original: rang bzhin gyis grub pa nyid yin na yang de ltar yod pa de dang 'ga' yang 'bral bar mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis grub pa nyid yin na yang de ltar yod pa de dang 'ga' yang 'bral bar mi 'gyur te /
translated: Even if it were established by nature, it would not be separated from that existence.

original: snga ma bzhin du rag lus pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: snga ma bzhin du rag lus pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because, as before, it is not dependent on anything else.

original: dbang phyug la sogs pa'i dngos po de lta bu yang bkag zin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dbang phyug la sogs pa'i dngos po de lta bu yang bkag zin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: And because such things as the Almighty have already been refuted.

original: ji ste skad cig ma snga ma'i mthu'i stobs kyis skye ba'i phyir rgyu so sor nges pa la rag lus pa'i rang gi ngo bos 'ga' kho na la yod do zhes bya bar khas len na /
analyzed: ji ste skad cig ma snga ma'i mthu'i stobs kyis skye ba'i phyir rgyu so sor nges pa la rag lus pa'i rang gi ngo bos 'ga' kho na la yod do zhes bya bar khas len na /
translated: If you accept that it exists only in some things because it arises by the power of the force of the prior moment, then it is dependent on the individual determination of the cause.

original: de yang rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de yang rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: That is not reasonable,

original: don dam par rgyu dang 'bras bu 'brel pa'i dngos po kho na mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don dam par rgyu dang 'bras bu 'brel pa'i dngos po kho na mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because ultimately the connection between cause and effect is not tenable.

original: 'di ltar re zhes rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po dus mnyam pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar re zhes rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po dus mnyam pa ni ma yin te /
translated: Thus, the connection between cause and effect is not simultaneous,

original: 'bras bu skye ba'i snga rol na ni rgyu med pas nus pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'bras bu skye ba'i snga rol na ni rgyu med pas nus pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because prior to the arising of the effect, the cause does not exist, and so it is not capable of producing the effect.

original: nus pa'i tshe ni 'bras bu yang grub zin pa'i phyir de'i tshe rgyu'i nye bar sbyor ba med pa kho na yin no //
analyzed: nus pa'i tshe ni 'bras bu yang grub zin pa'i phyir de'i tshe rgyu'i nye bar sbyor ba med pa kho na yin no //
translated: And when it is capable, the effect has already been established, and so at that time the application of the cause is pointless.

original: 'di ni 'bras bu'o //
analyzed: 'di ni 'bras bu'o //
translated: This is the effect.

original: 'di ni rgyu'o zhes bya ba'i bye brag kyang ming pa'i phyir rnam par gzhag pa nges par yang mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di ni rgyu'o zhes bya ba'i bye brag kyang ming pa'i phyir rnam par gzhag pa nges par yang mi 'gyur ro //
translated: and ‚Äúthis is the cause‚Äù would not be established.

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu dus tha dad pa dag kyang ma yin te /
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu dus tha dad pa dag kyang ma yin te /
translated: Nor are cause and effect different in time,

original: dus gzhan gyis mchod pa'i rgyu las skyes na ni zhig pa kho na las skye bar khas blangs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dus gzhan gyis mchod pa'i rgyu las skyes na ni zhig pa kho na las skye bar khas blangs par 'gyur ro //
translated: because if it were produced from a cause that existed at another time, it would be accepted that it is produced from what has already ceased.

original: zhig pa ni rgyu'i dngos por yang rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: zhig pa ni rgyu'i dngos por yang rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: And it is not tenable that what has ceased is a thing that is a cause,

original: zhig pa ni med pa'i phyir dang / med pa yang nus pa thams cad dang bral ba'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhig pa ni med pa'i phyir dang / med pa yang nus pa thams cad dang bral ba'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because what has ceased does not exist and because that which does not exist is characterized by being devoid of all ability.

original: de lta ma yin na rgyu ji ltar zhig par 'gyur /
analyzed: de lta ma yin na rgyu ji ltar zhig par 'gyur /
translated: If it were otherwise, how could the cause have ceased?

original: mchod pa las kyang ma yin te /
analyzed: mchod pa las kyang ma yin te /
translated: Nor is it produced from what is not ceasing,

original: dus mnyam par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dus mnyam par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it follows that they would be simultaneous.

original: skad cig pa yan lag med pa gnyis mchod na ni dus mnyam pa ma gtogs pa rnam pa gzhan med de /
analyzed: skad cig pa yan lag med pa gnyis mchod na ni dus mnyam pa ma gtogs pa rnam pa gzhan med de /
translated: If two things that are momentary and partless meet, they must be simultaneous, because there is no other way for them to meet.

original: 'di ltar rgyu dang 'bras bu gnyis kyi bar na dus gzhan dang bral ba gang yin pa de nyid mchod pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar rgyu dang 'bras bu gnyis kyi bar na dus gzhan dang bral ba gang yin pa de nyid mchod pa yin no //
translated: Thus, the interval between cause and effect is devoid of any other time.

original: de'i phyir skad cig ma snga phyi bar mchod pa gnyis ni ji ltar na dus phan tshun 'dus te rig par mi 'gyur te /üîΩdper na rdul phra rab gnyis bar med pa yin @110a * //
analyzed: de'i phyir skad cig ma snga phyi bar mchod pa gnyis ni ji ltar na dus phan tshun 'dus te rig par mi 'gyur te / dper na rdul phra rab gnyis bar med pa yin @110a * //
translated: Therefore, how could the two moments of the prior and subsequent instants of consciousness be mutually combined and related, sinceüîΩfor example, if two partless particles are without interstice, then it follows that they would certainly be mutually combined and meet.

original: na gdon mi za bar rang bzhin phan tshun 'dus te phrad par thal bar 'gyur bas bdag nyid thams cad kyis phrad na gong du rdul phra mo tsam du gyur par bya ba de bzhin du bskal pa yang skad cig tsam du 'gyur bas gtan tshigs kyi the
analyzed: na gdon mi za bar rang bzhin phan tshun 'dus te phrad par thal bar 'gyur bas bdag nyid thams cad kyis phrad na gong du rdul phra mo tsam du gyur par bya ba de bzhin du bskal pa yang skad cig tsam du 'gyur bas gtan tshigs kyi the
translated: If they meet with their entire nature, then just as the atom is made to become the size of one atom, so also eons would become just an instant.

original: tshom za ba ma grub pa ma yin no //
analyzed: tshom za ba ma grub pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, the reason is not unestablished and open to doubt.

original: 'di snyam du kun rdzob tu dang rgyu dang 'bras bu yod pa la yang rnam par dpyad pa 'di ci'i phyir yang dag par mi 'jug snyam du sems pa ltar na de yang yang dag pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di snyam du kun rdzob tu dang rgyu dang 'bras bu yod pa la yang rnam par dpyad pa 'di ci'i phyir yang dag par mi 'jug snyam du sems pa ltar na de yang yang dag pa ma yin te /
translated: If you think, ‚ÄúWhy does this analysis not apply to the existence of cause and effect in the conventional?‚Äù then that is not correct.

original: gang gi phyir kho bo cag rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po 'di grags bzhin du yang rnam par dpyad pa'i brtag pa mi bzod pa'i phyir kun rdzob ces smra'i /
analyzed: gang gi phyir kho bo cag rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po 'di grags bzhin du yang rnam par dpyad pa'i brtag pa mi bzod pa'i phyir kun rdzob ces smra'i /
translated: Because we say that this entity of cause and effect is conventional because it cannot withstand analysis when it is investigated,

original: de lta ma yin na ni don dam pa kho nar 'gyur gyi kun rdzob tu ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na ni don dam pa kho nar 'gyur gyi kun rdzob tu ni ma yin no //
translated: otherwise it would be only ultimate, and not conventional.

original: de lta bas na kun rdzob la ni brgal zhing brtag pa mtshungs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de lta bas na kun rdzob la ni brgal zhing brtag pa mtshungs pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is not the same to raise objections and offer analyses with respect to the conventional.

original: de ltar dngos po rnams kyi gcig pa nyid bkag nas shugs kyis du ma nyid dgag pa yang dngos su dgag par 'dod nas /
analyzed: de ltar dngos po rnams kyi gcig pa nyid bkag nas shugs kyis du ma nyid dgag pa yang dngos su dgag par 'dod nas /
translated: Having thus refuted the sameness of things, he wishes to refute their difference, which is the opposite of sameness, directly, not just by implication.

original: de lta na /
analyzed: de lta na /
translated: Therefore he says,

original: dngos po gang dag rnam dpyad na //
analyzed: dngos po gang dag rnam dpyad na //
translated: If things exist through their essence,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: how could they become otherwise?

original: phra rab tsam yang zhes bya ba ni chung ngu tsam yang ngo //
analyzed: phra rab tsam yang zhes bya ba ni chung ngu tsam yang ngo //
translated: Even the slightest means even the smallest.

original: ci'i phyir rigs pa ma nyid yin snyam pa la /üîΩ'di ltar / du ma ni gcig pa bstsags pa //
analyzed: ci'i phyir rigs pa ma nyid yin snyam pa la / 'di ltar / du ma ni gcig pa bstsags pa //
translated: Why is it not reasonable?

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Thus, he says, ‚ÄúThe many is the collection of the one.‚Äù

original: 'di skad du gang gi tshe rnam par dpyad na dngos po rnams kyi cha shas kyi ngo bo 'ga' yang rang bzhin gcig pa cha shas dang bral ba nyid du ma grub pa de'i tshe du mar ji ltar 'grub par 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'di skad du gang gi tshe rnam par dpyad na dngos po rnams kyi cha shas kyi ngo bo 'ga' yang rang bzhin gcig pa cha shas dang bral ba nyid du ma grub pa de'i tshe du mar ji ltar 'grub par 'gyur te /
translated: This is what he means: When one analyzes, if the nature of the parts of things is not established as a single nature that is partless, then how can the many be established?

original: du ma ni gcig 'dus pa'i bdag nyid yin pas gtan tshigs ma grub pa yin no zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: du ma ni gcig 'dus pa'i bdag nyid yin pas gtan tshigs ma grub pa yin no zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
translated: Since the many is the nature of the collection of the one, the reason is not established.

original: bsags pa ni tshogs pa'o //
analyzed: bsags pa ni tshogs pa'o //
translated: The collection is the assembly.

original: de la du ma yang med pa yin zhes bya ba gsungs so zhes bya ba ni sngon gyi slob dpon rnams kyis so //
analyzed: de la du ma yang med pa yin zhes bya ba gsungs so zhes bya ba ni sngon gyi slob dpon rnams kyis so //
translated: The former masters say that the many is also nonexistent there.

original: mdo de nyid las yang zhes bya ba ni 'phags pa lang kar gshegs pa'i mdo las so //
analyzed: mdo de nyid las yang zhes bya ba ni 'phags pa lang kar gshegs pa'i mdo las so //
translated: In that very sutra, again means in the sutra the noble Lankavatara-sutra.

original: ngo bo nyid ni gzung du med ces bya ba ni gcig pa dang du ma'i ngo bo ste /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid ni gzung du med ces bya ba ni gcig pa dang du ma'i ngo bo ste /
translated: ‚ÄúThe nature itself is ungraspable‚Äù means that it is neither a single nor a manifold entity.

original: ji ltar sngar dpyad pa bzhin no //
analyzed: ji ltar sngar dpyad pa bzhin no //
translated: As was previously analyzed.

original: de'i phyir zhes bya ba ni gcig dang du ma'i rang bzhin dang bral ba'i phyir ngo bo nyid med pa yin pa dang / gcig dang du mar brjod du med par yang ngas bshad do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de'i phyir zhes bya ba ni gcig dang du ma'i rang bzhin dang bral ba'i phyir ngo bo nyid med pa yin pa dang / gcig dang du mar brjod du med par yang ngas bshad do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: ‚ÄúTherefore‚Äù means that because it is devoid of the nature of being a single or manifold entity, it is essenceless, and I have explained that it is inexpressible as being a single or manifold entity.

original: de ltar bcom ldan 'das kyis phyi rol gyi don yod par lta @110b ba la dngos po rnams rang bzhin med pa nyid du bstan nas /
analyzed: de ltar bcom ldan 'das kyis phyi rol gyi don yod par lta @110b ba la dngos po rnams rang bzhin med pa nyid du bstan nas /
translated: Thus the BhagavƒÅn, having taught that things are essenceless to those who view external objects as existent,

original: shes bya nang gi yin par lta ba la yang bstan pa'i phyir /üîΩblo yis rnam par gzhigs na ni //
analyzed: shes bya nang gi yin par lta ba la yang bstan pa'i phyir / blo yis rnam par gzhigs na ni //
translated: in order to teach this to those who view the objects of knowledge as internal,

original: zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: he said, ‚ÄúWhen the mind analyzes‚Ä¶‚Äù

original: gzhan dbang med ces bya ba ni gzhan gyi dbang po ngo bo nyid med ces bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
analyzed: gzhan dbang med ces bya ba ni gzhan gyi dbang po ngo bo nyid med ces bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
translated: ‚ÄúThe dependent is not existent‚Äù means that the nature of the dependent is essenceless.

original: gzhan gyi dbang yang gcig dang du ma'i rang bzhin gyis stong pa'i phyir ro snyam du dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyi dbang yang gcig dang du ma'i rang bzhin gyis stong pa'i phyir ro snyam du dgongs pa'o //
translated: The other-dependent is also empty of the nature of one and many.

original: brtags pa'ang med ces bya ba ni kun tu brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid do //
analyzed: brtags pa'ang med ces bya ba ni kun tu brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid do //
translated: The imagined is also non-existent.

original: kun tu brtags pa ni mtshan nyid stong pa kho nas ngo bo nyid med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: kun tu brtags pa ni mtshan nyid stong pa kho nas ngo bo nyid med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The imagined is just empty of the characteristic, because it is non-existent by nature.

original: grub pa zhes bya ba ni yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid de /
analyzed: grub pa zhes bya ba ni yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid de /
translated: The perfected is established.

original: yongs su grub pa ni chos nyid kyi ngo bo yin pa'i phyir la rtog pa'i yul ni ngo bo med pa nyid du grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yongs su grub pa ni chos nyid kyi ngo bo yin pa'i phyir la rtog pa'i yul ni ngo bo med pa nyid du grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The perfected is the nature of reality, because the object of imagination is established as non-existent by nature.

original: gal te 'di dag med pa kho na yin na ni 'jig rten la ji ltar grags pa yin snyam pa la /üîΩrang bzhin med cing rnam rig med //
analyzed: gal te 'di dag med pa kho na yin na ni 'jig rten la ji ltar grags pa yin snyam pa la / rang bzhin med cing rnam rig med //
translated: If these are non-existent, how can they be known in the world?

original: ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te //
analyzed: ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te //
translated: He says, ‚ÄúWithout intrinsic nature, without representation,‚Äù and so on.

original: rang bzhin ni gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo la sogs pa rnam pa gsum yin par dgongs so //
analyzed: rang bzhin ni gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo la sogs pa rnam pa gsum yin par dgongs so //
translated: He intends that the three kinds of intrinsic nature are the nature of the other-dependent and so on.

original: rnam rig ces bya ba ni phyi rol gyi yul rnam par rig pa rnam pa drug gzung ngo //
analyzed: rnam rig ces bya ba ni phyi rol gyi yul rnam par rig pa rnam pa drug gzung ngo //
translated: The so-called consciousnesses are the six kinds of consciousnesses of external objects.

original: rnam par rig pa'i dmigs pa gang yin pa de ni dngos po'i sgrar dgongs so //
analyzed: rnam par rig pa'i dmigs pa gang yin pa de ni dngos po'i sgrar dgongs so //
translated: The object of consciousness is intended as the word thing.

original: pha rol po dag gis mig la sogs pa'am /
analyzed: pha rol po dag gis mig la sogs pa'am /
translated: The other schools imagine that the eye, etc.,

original: bdag la sogs pa gang dag rnam par rig pa de'i rten nyid du brtags pa de dag ni rnam par rig pa'i rten yin pa'i phyir kun gzhi yin no //
analyzed: bdag la sogs pa gang dag rnam par rig pa de'i rten nyid du brtags pa de dag ni rnam par rig pa'i rten yin pa'i phyir kun gzhi yin no //
translated: or the self, etc., are the basis of that consciousness. They are the store-consciousness because they are the support of consciousness.

original: yang na 'jig pa'i tshe dngos po thams cad rang bzhin la sogs pa'i bag la zha bar 'gyur bas grangs can gyis yongs su brtags pa'i rang bzhin la sogs pa kun gzhi'i sgrar bzhed pa yin no //
analyzed: yang na 'jig pa'i tshe dngos po thams cad rang bzhin la sogs pa'i bag la zha bar 'gyur bas grangs can gyis yongs su brtags pa'i rang bzhin la sogs pa kun gzhi'i sgrar bzhed pa yin no //
translated: Or else, at the time of dissolution, all things are dissolved into their intrinsic natures, etc. The intrinsic nature, etc., imagined by the Samkhyas are intended as the word store.

original: ro mtshungs zhes bya ba ni chos yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rnam par 'byed pa'i g-yo ba dang bral ba'i phyir shi ba dang 'dra ba rnams kyis zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
analyzed: ro mtshungs zhes bya ba ni chos yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rnam par 'byed pa'i g-yo ba dang bral ba'i phyir shi ba dang 'dra ba rnams kyis zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
translated: Sameness of taste means that they are like corpses, because they are devoid of the movement of the correct discrimination of things as they are.

original: 'di skad du 'di dag don dam par na med pa kho na yin mod kyi /
analyzed: 'di skad du 'di dag don dam par na med pa kho na yin mod kyi /
translated: This is what is being taught: ‚ÄúIndeed, these do not exist ultimately.

original: byis pas kun tu brtags pa'i dbang gis grags te yang dag par ni ma yin no zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: byis pas kun tu brtags pa'i dbang gis grags te yang dag par ni ma yin no zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: However, they are known due to the power of the imagination of fools, not in reality.

original: 'o na ji ltar chos kyi tshul yang dag pa la mkhas pa gnas par 'gyur snyam pa la /
analyzed: 'o na ji ltar chos kyi tshul yang dag pa la mkhas pa gnas par 'gyur snyam pa la /
translated: ‚Äù Well then, how does one come to abide in the expertise in the correct way of the Dharma?üîΩThe verse says, ‚ÄúSigns, things, representations,

original: mtshan ma dngos po rnam rig dang // zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te //
analyzed: mtshan ma dngos po rnam rig dang // zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te //
translated: ‚Äù and so forth.

original: mtshan ma ni sngon po dang ser po dang skyes pa dang bud med la sogs pa'o//
analyzed: mtshan ma ni sngon po dang ser po dang skyes pa dang bud med la sogs pa'o//
translated: Signs are blue, yellow, male, female, and so forth.

original: @111a * // dngos po ni phyi dang nang gi skye mched do //
analyzed: @111a * // dngos po ni phyi dang nang gi skye mched do //
translated: Things are the inner and outer sense spheres.

original: rnam rig ni mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga'o //
analyzed: rnam rig ni mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga'o //
translated: Representations are the five collections of consciousness, such as the eye consciousness.

original: yid kyi g-yo ba zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi dbang la sogs pa rnam par rtog pa'o //
analyzed: yid kyi g-yo ba zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi dbang la sogs pa rnam par rtog pa'o //
translated: Mental movement is the dependent nature and so forth, which are conceptual thoughts.üîΩHaving transcended,

original: rab 'das te zhes bya ba ni mtshan ma la sogs pa spros pa thams cad las rnam par 'das te /
analyzed: rab 'das te zhes bya ba ni mtshan ma la sogs pa spros pa thams cad las rnam par 'das te /
translated: means having transcended all elaborations, such as signs.

original: 'di skad du sngon po la sogs pa'i mtshan ma la sogs pa la kun tu spyod pa'i gnas skabs ji snyed pa de dag thams cad ni spros pa'i gnas skabs yin pas spros pa'i gnas skabs dag las 'das na rnam par mi rtog pa'i ting nge 'dzin la
analyzed: 'di skad du sngon po la sogs pa'i mtshan ma la sogs pa la kun tu spyod pa'i gnas skabs ji snyed pa de dag thams cad ni spros pa'i gnas skabs yin pas spros pa'i gnas skabs dag las 'das na rnam par mi rtog pa'i ting nge 'dzin la
translated: In this way, all the occasions of engaging in the characteristics of blue and so on are occasions of conceptual elaborations.üîΩIf one passes beyond those occasions of conceptual elaborations, one will enter into the nonconceptual samƒÅdhi.üîΩ

original: 'jug pa yin no zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: 'jug pa yin no zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: This is what is being said: all the occasions of engaging in the signs of blue and so forth are occasions of conceptualization. When one passes beyond those occasions of conceptualization, one enters into non-conceptual samƒÅdhi.

original: de bas na zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir rigs pa dang lung dag gis grub pa'o //
analyzed: de bas na zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir rigs pa dang lung dag gis grub pa'o //
translated: Therefore, because of the reasoning and the scriptures,

original: blo gros dkar po rnams kyis zhes bya ba ni slob dpon chos kyi grags pa la sogs pas so //
analyzed: blo gros dkar po rnams kyis zhes bya ba ni slob dpon chos kyi grags pa la sogs pas so //
translated: the wise ones, the master Dharmakƒ´rti and so forth,

original: de dang der zhes bya ba ni tshad ma rnam 'grel la sogs par ro //
analyzed: de dang der zhes bya ba ni tshad ma rnam 'grel la sogs par ro //
translated: have explained it in this way and that way in the Prama·πáavarttika and so forth.

original: smos te zhes bya ba ni dngos su bshad pa ma yin pa ste /
analyzed: smos te zhes bya ba ni dngos su bshad pa ma yin pa ste /
translated: The word ‚Äúand‚Äù is not explicit,

original: tshad ma rnam par 'grel pa la sogs par ni rnal 'byor spyod pa'i tshul bshad pa'i gnas skabs yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshad ma rnam par 'grel pa la sogs par ni rnal 'byor spyod pa'i tshul bshad pa'i gnas skabs yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the Prama·πáavarttika and so forth are occasions of explaining the YogƒÅcƒÅra system.

original: slob dpon gyis kun tu brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi dbang du byas te de skad du bshad mod kyi /
analyzed: slob dpon gyis kun tu brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi dbang du byas te de skad du bshad mod kyi /
translated: The Master has explained this in terms of the imagined nature.

original: yongs su grub pa nyid ma grub pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: yongs su grub pa nyid ma grub pa'i phyir te /
translated: But the perfected is not established,

original: rigs pa thun mong ba'i phyir slob dpon gyi tshig 'di thams cad du rung ba nyid do snyam du bsams pa'o //
analyzed: rigs pa thun mong ba'i phyir slob dpon gyi tshig 'di thams cad du rung ba nyid do snyam du bsams pa'o //
translated: because the reason is common to all, the Master thinks that all these words are appropriate.

original: de nyid kyi phyir smos te zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir smos te zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: Therefore, he says, ‚Äújust because of that.‚Äù

original: de bas mtshan nyid stong pa'i phyir //
analyzed: de bas mtshan nyid stong pa'i phyir //
translated: Therefore, because of the emptiness of the imagined nature,

original: zhes bya ba smos pa 'di ni phyed 'og ma'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba smos pa 'di ni phyed 'og ma'o //
translated: this is the second half of the verse.

original: phyed gong ma ni /üîΩgzung 'dzin rnam par ma gtogs par //
analyzed: phyed gong ma ni / gzung 'dzin rnam par ma gtogs par //
translated: The first half is:

original: mtshan nyid yod pa ma yin no //üîΩzhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: mtshan nyid yod pa ma yin no // zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The characteristic does not exist apart from the grasped and the grasper.

original: de bas mtshan nyid stong pa'i phyir zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de bas mtshan nyid stong pa'i phyir zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it is said, ‚Äúbecause of the emptiness of the imagined nature.‚Äù

original: de ltar ma grub pa nyid yongs su spangs nas ma nges pa nyid dgag pa'i phyir gtan tshigs grub tu zin kyang zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: de ltar ma grub pa nyid yongs su spangs nas ma nges pa nyid dgag pa'i phyir gtan tshigs grub tu zin kyang zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: Thus, having completely rejected non-establishment, in order to refute indeterminacy, he says, ‚Äúeven if the reason is established.‚Äù

original: chos gnyis ka dang ldan pa zhes bya ba ni bsgrub par bya ba dang sgrub pa'i chos dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: chos gnyis ka dang ldan pa zhes bya ba ni bsgrub par bya ba dang sgrub pa'i chos dang ldan pa'o //
translated: That which possesses both properties is said to possess the property to be established and the property of the proof.

original: rgyal dpog pa la sogs pa na re gdong la sogs pa nyid de de ltar dmigs pa gzugs brnyan gyi tha snyad ston to zhes zer ro //
analyzed: rgyal dpog pa la sogs pa na re gdong la sogs pa nyid de de ltar dmigs pa gzugs brnyan gyi tha snyad ston to zhes zer ro //
translated: The Jains and others say that the face itself is the reflection, since it is perceived as such.

original: bye brag tu smra ba la sogs pa na ra me long la sogs par gzugs gzhan kho na zhig 'byung ngo zhes zer ro //
analyzed: bye brag tu smra ba la sogs pa na ra me long la sogs par gzugs gzhan kho na zhig 'byung ngo zhes zer ro //
translated: The VaibhƒÅ·π£ikas and others say that another form arises in the mirror and so on.

original: @111b mdo sde pa la sogs pa na re shes pa kho na de ltar 'khrul par snang ngo zhes zer te /
analyzed: @111b mdo sde pa la sogs pa na re shes pa kho na de ltar 'khrul par snang ngo zhes zer te /
translated: The SautrƒÅntikas and others say that consciousness itself appears as a mistaken reflection.

original: de dag thams cad kyi lugs kyis gdong la sogs pa dang dngos po yod pa'i phyir dpe ma grub bo //
analyzed: de dag thams cad kyi lugs kyis gdong la sogs pa dang dngos po yod pa'i phyir dpe ma grub bo //
translated: In all of these systems, the example is not established because the face and so on are real things.

original: yang dbyung ba'i mi rigs so zhes bya ba ni yang gyen du dbyung ba mi rigs so zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: yang dbyung ba'i mi rigs so zhes bya ba ni yang gyen du dbyung ba mi rigs so zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It is illogical to say that it is not possible to draw it out again means that it is illogical to say that it is not possible to draw it out again.

original: gang gis ni gdong la sogs pa tshad mas gnod par byas pa grub pa'i phyir dpe ma grub par 'gyur ba /
analyzed: gang gis ni gdong la sogs pa tshad mas gnod par byas pa grub pa'i phyir dpe ma grub par 'gyur ba /
translated: Because the face and so on are established as being undermined by valid knowledge, the example is not established.

original: rang dga'i stobs kyis dngos po rnams de lta bu'i ngo bor dmigs pa ni ma yin gyi /
analyzed: rang dga'i stobs kyis dngos po rnams de lta bu'i ngo bor dmigs pa ni ma yin gyi /
translated: It is not that things are observed to have such an essence by the power of one‚Äôs own wish.

original: ji ltar na dpe ma grub par 'gyur /
analyzed: ji ltar na dpe ma grub par 'gyur /
translated: How could the example not be established?

original: 'di la khyad par du gnod pa can gyi tshad ma yod pas de'i phyir dpe byed do snyam du bsams nas /
analyzed: 'di la khyad par du gnod pa can gyi tshad ma yod pas de'i phyir dpe byed do snyam du bsams nas /
translated: Thinking that because there is a valid knowledge that specifically undermines it, therefore it is made an example,üîΩhe says, ‚ÄúMoreover,‚Äù

original: gzhan yang zhes bya ba smos te /üîΩde la re zhig gzugs la sogs pa ni gzugs brnyan shes pa'i yul ma yin te /
analyzed: gzhan yang zhes bya ba smos te / de la re zhig gzugs la sogs pa ni gzugs brnyan shes pa'i yul ma yin te /
translated: and so on.

original: gzugs dang mtshan nyid mi mthun par snang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzugs dang mtshan nyid mi mthun par snang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: First, a reflection is not the object of a consciousness of a form and so on because it appears to have a different character.

original: sbyor ba ni rnam par shes pa gang zhig gang dang mtshan nyid mi mthun par snang ba de ni de'i dmigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: sbyor ba ni rnam par shes pa gang zhig gang dang mtshan nyid mi mthun par snang ba de ni de'i dmigs pa ma yin te /
translated: The syllogism is: Whatever appears to have a different character from a form is not the object of that consciousness,

original: dper na sgrar shes pa gzugs dang mtshan nyid mi mthun par snang ba bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na sgrar shes pa gzugs dang mtshan nyid mi mthun par snang ba bzhin no //
translated: like, for example, a consciousness of sound that appears to have a different character from a form.

original: gzugs brnyan gyi shes pa yang gdong la sogs pa yul ji lta ba bzhin gnas pa dang mtshan nyid mi mthun par snang ba yin pas khyab par byed pa 'gal ba dmigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gzugs brnyan gyi shes pa yang gdong la sogs pa yul ji lta ba bzhin gnas pa dang mtshan nyid mi mthun par snang ba yin pas khyab par byed pa 'gal ba dmigs pa ma yin no //
translated: The cognition of a reflection also appears as having a form that is different from the face, etc., the object. Therefore, the reason is not the observation of something contradictory with what pervades.

original: gal te me long gi ngos la sogs pa la zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni gtan tshigs 'di ma grub pa nyid yongs su spong bar byed do //
analyzed: gal te me long gi ngos la sogs pa la zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni gtan tshigs 'di ma grub pa nyid yongs su spong bar byed do //
translated: He rejects the fact that this reason is not established by saying, ‚ÄúThe surface of a mirror, etc.‚Äù

original: shing dang ri zhes bya ba ni shing rnams dang ri rnams so //
analyzed: shing dang ri zhes bya ba ni shing rnams dang ri rnams so //
translated: ‚ÄúTrees and mountains‚Äù means trees and mountains.

original: yal ga ni shing rnams kyi yal ga'o //
analyzed: yal ga ni shing rnams kyi yal ga'o //
translated: ‚ÄúBranches‚Äù are the branches of trees.

original: rtse mo ni ri rab rnams kyi rtse mo ste /
analyzed: rtse mo ni ri rab rnams kyi rtse mo ste /
translated: ‚ÄúPeaks‚Äù are the peaks of mountains.

original: rtse mo dag kho na me tog gi thod bzhin du rtse mo dag yin no //
analyzed: rtse mo dag kho na me tog gi thod bzhin du rtse mo dag yin no //
translated: The peaks themselves are like flower garlands.

original: ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i gnod pa can gyi tshad ma yin pas na gtan tshigs ma nges pa nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i gnod pa can gyi tshad ma yin pas na gtan tshigs ma nges pa nyid ma yin no //
translated: Since this is a valid cognition that contradicts the absurd consequence, the reason is not indeterminate.

original: phyogs gnyis pa yang bsal ba'i phyir /
analyzed: phyogs gnyis pa yang bsal ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to reject the second position, he says,

original: gzhan 'byung ba'i phyir rigs pa ma yin pa nyid de zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: gzhan 'byung ba'i phyir rigs pa ma yin pa nyid de zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: ‚ÄúBecause it is illogical for another to arise‚Äù and so on.

original: lhan cig mi gnas pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni yul gcig na mi gnas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lhan cig mi gnas pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni yul gcig na mi gnas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: ‚ÄúBecause they do not coexist‚Äù means because they do not exist in the same place.

original: rang gi yul du gzhan 'byung ba'i bgegs byed pa gang yin pa 'di ni lus can rnams kyi chos yin la /
analyzed: rang gi yul du gzhan 'byung ba'i bgegs byed pa gang yin pa 'di ni lus can rnams kyi chos yin la /
translated: This is the nature of corporeal things: they obstruct the arising of another in their own place.

original: 'di la yang yul tha dad pa med pas gzugs gzhan 'byung bar rigs pa ma yin no //üîΩ@112a * // sbyor ba ni dngos po lus can gang dag yin pa de dag ni yul phan tshun spangs te /
analyzed: 'di la yang yul tha dad pa med pas gzugs gzhan 'byung bar rigs pa ma yin no // @112a * // sbyor ba ni dngos po lus can gang dag yin pa de dag ni yul phan tshun spangs te /
translated: But since there is no difference in the object, it is illogical for another form to arise.

original: gnas pa'i rang bzhin dag yin te /üîΩdper na bum pa la sogs pa lta bu dag yin no //
analyzed: gnas pa'i rang bzhin dag yin te / dper na bum pa la sogs pa lta bu dag yin no //
translated: The syllogism is: ‚ÄúThose things that are corporeal are by nature mutually exclusive and incompatible, like pot and woolen cloth;üîΩand the things that are the basis of this dispute are corporeal.

original: rtsod pa'i gzhir gyur pa'i dngos po 'di dag kyang lus can yin pas rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs yin no //
analyzed: rtsod pa'i gzhir gyur pa'i dngos po 'di dag kyang lus can yin pas rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs yin no //
translated: Therefore, they are by nature mutually exclusive and incompatible, like pot and woolen cloth.‚Äù

original: rlung dang nyi ma la sogs pas ma nges pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: rlung dang nyi ma la sogs pas ma nges pa yang ma yin te /
translated: The wind and the sun are not indeterminate.

original: de la yang rlung dang nyi ma la sogs pa'i rdul phra mo rnams 'dres pa yin mod kyi /
analyzed: de la yang rlung dang nyi ma la sogs pa'i rdul phra mo rnams 'dres pa yin mod kyi /
translated: Moreover, although the subtle particles of wind, sun, etc. are mixed,

original: yul phan tshun spangs te gnas pa kho na'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yul phan tshun spangs te gnas pa kho na'i phyir ro //
translated: they are only mutually exclusive objects.

original: gal te yul gcig pa nyid du gyur na ni de'i tshe yul gcig rang bzhin phan tshun zhugs pas ngo bo gcig pa kho nar 'gyur bas 'di ni bzlog na gnod pa can gyi tshad ma yin no //
analyzed: gal te yul gcig pa nyid du gyur na ni de'i tshe yul gcig rang bzhin phan tshun zhugs pas ngo bo gcig pa kho nar 'gyur bas 'di ni bzlog na gnod pa can gyi tshad ma yin no //
translated: If they were to become the same object, then at that time, because of the mutual entry of the natures of the same object, they would be only one nature. Therefore, this is a valid cognition that contradicts the reversal.

original: de lta yang ma yin te de lta bas na bzlog ste brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de lta yang ma yin te de lta bas na bzlog ste brjod par bya'o //
translated: But it is not like that. Therefore, it should be stated in the opposite way.

original: der snang ba'i shes pa tsam 'byung bar zad do zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni phyogs gsum pa yang sel bar byed pa yin te /
analyzed: der snang ba'i shes pa tsam 'byung bar zad do zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni phyogs gsum pa yang sel bar byed pa yin te /
translated: The mere appearance of consciousness there arises, etc. This also eliminates the third position.

original: gal te yul gnod par byas pa nyid kyi phyir de la der snang ba'i rnam par shes pa tsam du dam 'cha' na de'i tshe bden pa'i gzugs la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa gzhan yang gnod par byas pa'i yul can de nyid de dang mtshungs pas khyad
analyzed: gal te yul gnod par byas pa nyid kyi phyir de la der snang ba'i rnam par shes pa tsam du dam 'cha' na de'i tshe bden pa'i gzugs la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa gzhan yang gnod par byas pa'i yul can de nyid de dang mtshungs pas khyad
translated: If you accept that consciousness appears as that object because the object is impaired, then the consciousness of real form and so on is also impaired, and since it is the same as the consciousness of unreal form and so on, there is no difference between them.

original: par med pa'i phyir lhag ma bden par 'dod pa'i gzugs la sogs pa la yang de kho na bzhin du rnam par shes pa tsam du ci'i phyir khas mi blang /
analyzed: par med pa'i phyir lhag ma bden par 'dod pa'i gzugs la sogs pa la yang de kho na bzhin du rnam par shes pa tsam du ci'i phyir khas mi blang /
translated: Therefore, why do you not accept that the remaining objects, such as real form, are also consciousness only?

original: 'di ltar rdul phra rab rnams zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni gnod par byas pa'i yul can de nyid dran par byed do //
analyzed: 'di ltar rdul phra rab rnams zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni gnod par byas pa'i yul can de nyid dran par byed do //
translated: Thus, the phrase ‚Äúthe so-called subtle particles‚Äù and so on reminds us that the object is impaired.

original: pha rol pos gzugs brnyan la sogs pa 'di dag rnam par shes pa'i ngo bor rdzas su yod par khas blangs mod kyi /
analyzed: pha rol pos gzugs brnyan la sogs pa 'di dag rnam par shes pa'i ngo bor rdzas su yod par khas blangs mod kyi /
translated: The opponent may accept that reflections and so on exist substantially as the nature of consciousness.

original: gzugs brnyan la sogs pa de dag ni dpe nyid du 'dod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gzugs brnyan la sogs pa de dag ni dpe nyid du 'dod pa ma yin no //
translated: But reflections and so on are not accepted as the example.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: What then is?

original: gzugs brnyan la sogs par shes pa'i snang ba can gyi ngo bo gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs brnyan la sogs par shes pa'i snang ba can gyi ngo bo gang yin pa'o //
translated: The nature of the cognition that perceives a reflection, etc.

original: de yang brdzun pa'i phyir dpe grub pa kho na'o snyam du bsams pa'o //
analyzed: de yang brdzun pa'i phyir dpe grub pa kho na'o snyam du bsams pa'o //
translated: Since that is false, the example is established.üîΩIn the same way, the five examples of illusion, etc., are also refuted.

original: de bzhin du sgyu ma la sogs pa dper byed pa lnga yang gang dag ci 'jim pa'i dum bu la sogs pa sgyu ma la sogs pa'i sgrar brjod dam /
analyzed: de bzhin du sgyu ma la sogs pa dper byed pa lnga yang gang dag ci 'jim pa'i dum bu la sogs pa sgyu ma la sogs pa'i sgrar brjod dam /
translated: Are those that are called ‚Äúillusion,‚Äù etc., a lump of clay, etc.?

original: ji sta de ltar snang ba can gyi shes pa yin /
analyzed: ji sta de ltar snang ba can gyi shes pa yin /
translated: Or is it the cognition that appears in that way?üîΩIn both cases, there is no example that establishes the probandum.

original: phyogs gnyi ga ltar na yang dpe bsgrub par bya ba dang sgrub pa med pa yin no snyam du rtogs par byed pa de dag kyang 'di kho nas lan btab @112b pa yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: phyogs gnyi ga ltar na yang dpe bsgrub par bya ba dang sgrub pa med pa yin no snyam du rtogs par byed pa de dag kyang 'di kho nas lan btab @112b pa yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate that this is the only response to those who think that way, he says,

original: 'dis sgyu ma dang rmi lam zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: 'dis sgyu ma dang rmi lam zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: ‚Äúillusion, dream, etc.‚Äù

original: brgya la 'di la yang rgyal dpog pa la sogs pa dag 'jim pa'i dum bu la sogs pa de dag nyid de ltar dmigs te /
analyzed: brgya la 'di la yang rgyal dpog pa la sogs pa dag 'jim pa'i dum bu la sogs pa de dag nyid de ltar dmigs te /
translated: Even in this case, the Vai≈õe·π£ikas, etc., apprehend just those lumps of clay, etc., as they are.

original: de'i phyir sgyu ma la sogs par shes pa la snang ba can gyi ngo bo brdzun pa nyid du ma grub bo zhes smra bar 'gyur bas /
analyzed: de'i phyir sgyu ma la sogs par shes pa la snang ba can gyi ngo bo brdzun pa nyid du ma grub bo zhes smra bar 'gyur bas /
translated: Therefore, it is said that the entity of the appearance is not established as false in the cognition of an illusion, etc.

original: 'jim pa'i dum bu la sogs pa ni de ltar dmigs pa ma yin no zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: 'jim pa'i dum bu la sogs pa ni de ltar dmigs pa ma yin no zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: But a lump of clay, etc. is not apprehended in that way.

original: rnam pa dang bcas pa'i phyogs la ni snang ba yin no //
analyzed: rnam pa dang bcas pa'i phyogs la ni snang ba yin no //
translated: In the position with aspects, it is the appearance.

original: rnam pa med pa'i phyogs la ni rigs pa yin no //
analyzed: rnam pa med pa'i phyogs la ni rigs pa yin no //
translated: In the position without aspects, it is the reason.

original: de gnas med do zhes bya ba ni gzhon nu ma len gyis smras pa gong du smos pa'o //
analyzed: de gnas med do zhes bya ba ni gzhon nu ma len gyis smras pa gong du smos pa'o //
translated: That is not the case, as stated by Kumarila above.

original: 'o na rmi lam gyi shes pa la dmigs pa gang yin snyam pa la /üîΩyul de dang ni yul gzhan no //
analyzed: 'o na rmi lam gyi shes pa la dmigs pa gang yin snyam pa la / yul de dang ni yul gzhan no //
translated: Then, what is the object of a consciousness in a dream?

original: zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: The object is either that or another object.

original: lhag ma ni go sla'o //
analyzed: lhag ma ni go sla'o //
translated: The rest is easy to understand.

original: bshad ma thag pa zhes bya ba ni gang rang gi ngo bor snang ba'am rig pa'o //
analyzed: bshad ma thag pa zhes bya ba ni gang rang gi ngo bor snang ba'am rig pa'o //
translated: Immediately after the explanation, that which appears as its own entity or is cognized.

original: mi mthun pa'i phyogs las ldog pa la the tshom za ba bsal ba'i phyir /
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i phyogs las ldog pa la the tshom za ba bsal ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to remove doubt about the opposite of the absence of a basis,

original: 'di ni phyogs dang mthun pa'i phyogs la yod par 'gyur du zin kyang zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: 'di ni phyogs dang mthun pa'i phyogs la yod par 'gyur du zin kyang zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: This is because, even if it were to exist in the similar instance,

original: 'di ni bdag gis sngar bshad pa kho na yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni bdag gis sngar bshad pa kho na yin no //
translated: it is just as I have already explained.

original: 'di la ldog pa mi ldog pa med do zhes bya ba ni bsgrub par bya ba las bzlog na gtan tshigs las ldog pa yod pa kho na ste med ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: 'di la ldog pa mi ldog pa med do zhes bya ba ni bsgrub par bya ba las bzlog na gtan tshigs las ldog pa yod pa kho na ste med ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: As for the statement, ‚ÄúThere is no invariable concomitance,‚Äù the meaning of the statement is that the reason is invariably concomitant with the opposite of the probandum.

original: 'dir dam bca' ba'i don gyi phyogs gcig yin pa'i phyir gtan tshigs ma grub pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: 'dir dam bca' ba'i don gyi phyogs gcig yin pa'i phyir gtan tshigs ma grub pa ma yin nam /
translated: In this case, is the reason not unestablished because it is one part of the meaning of the thesis?

original: gcig dang du ma'i ngo bo gnyis ni dngos po'i rnam grangs yin pa'i phyir de las bzlog pa'i ngo bo bsgrub par bya ba dang / sgrub pa gnyis tha mi dad pa'i ngo bo kho na yin no //
analyzed: gcig dang du ma'i ngo bo gnyis ni dngos po'i rnam grangs yin pa'i phyir de las bzlog pa'i ngo bo bsgrub par bya ba dang / sgrub pa gnyis tha mi dad pa'i ngo bo kho na yin no //
translated: This is because the two, the nature of one and the nature of many, are synonyms for entity. Therefore, the opposite of that is the probandum, and the reason and the proof are not different in nature.

original: de'i phyir gal te bsgrub par bya ba ma grub na /
analyzed: de'i phyir gal te bsgrub par bya ba ma grub na /
translated: Therefore, if the probandum is not established,

original: bsgrub par bya ba dang tha mi dad pa'i ngo bo gtan tshigs kyang ma grub pa yin no //
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba dang tha mi dad pa'i ngo bo gtan tshigs kyang ma grub pa yin no //
translated: then the reason, which is not different in nature from the probandum, is also not established.

original: ji ste gtan tshigs grub na ni de'i tshe dngos po rnams kyi rang bzhin med pa nyid kyang grub pa yin te /
analyzed: ji ste gtan tshigs grub na ni de'i tshe dngos po rnams kyi rang bzhin med pa nyid kyang grub pa yin te /
translated: But if the reason is established, then at that time the essencelessness of things is also established.

original: gcig dang du ma dang bral ba ri bong gi rva la sogs pa la ni dngos po'i ngo bo nyid 'ga' yang khas mi len to snyam du dogs pa la /
analyzed: gcig dang du ma dang bral ba ri bong gi rva la sogs pa la ni dngos po'i ngo bo nyid 'ga' yang khas mi len to snyam du dogs pa la /
translated: For, one should think that the horns of a rabbit and so on, which are devoid of being one or many, are not accepted as having any nature of being a thing.

original: gtan tshigs 'di la ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: gtan tshigs 'di la ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: In response to this, the text from ‚ÄúThis reason‚Äù and so on is stated.

original: re zhig gtan tshigs ji ltar grub pa de ltar ni rgyas par bsgrubs zin to //
analyzed: re zhig gtan tshigs ji ltar grub pa de ltar ni rgyas par bsgrubs zin to //
translated: The way in which the reason is established has already been extensively proven.

original: gtan tshigs grub kyang 'di @113a * //üîΩyin no zhes bya ba'i ngo bos rang bzhin med par sgrub mod kyi /
analyzed: gtan tshigs grub kyang 'di @113a * // yin no zhes bya ba'i ngo bos rang bzhin med par sgrub mod kyi /
translated: Even if the reason is established,üîΩit is indeed the case that the reason proves essencelessness by means of the meaning of the thesis.

original: 'on kyang rmongs pa la dngos po thams cad la rang bzhin med pa nyid du tha snyad gdags pa'i 'os nyid du rab tu bsgrub pa'i phyir gtan tshigs dam bcas pa'i don gyis phyogs gcig nyid ma yin te ;
analyzed: 'on kyang rmongs pa la dngos po thams cad la rang bzhin med pa nyid du tha snyad gdags pa'i 'os nyid du rab tu bsgrub pa'i phyir gtan tshigs dam bcas pa'i don gyis phyogs gcig nyid ma yin te ;
translated: However, in order to prove that all things are suitable to be labeled as essenceless, the reason is not just the meaning of the thesis.

original: dper na lkog shal la sogs pa dang ldan pas ba lang nyid lta bu dang / dper na dmigs pa'i rig byar gyur pa mi dmigs pas med pa lta bu yin pas klan kar mi rung ngo //
analyzed: dper na lkog shal la sogs pa dang ldan pas ba lang nyid lta bu dang / dper na dmigs pa'i rig byar gyur pa mi dmigs pas med pa lta bu yin pas klan kar mi rung ngo //
translated: it is a cow; and it is like the fact that because of the non-apprehension of the object of apprehension, it does not exist.

original: 'khor ba gang zhig thog ma dang bral ba de ni thog ma med pa ste /
analyzed: 'khor ba gang zhig thog ma dang bral ba de ni thog ma med pa ste /
translated: Samsara is that which is devoid of a beginning; it is beginningless.

original: thog ma yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: thog ma yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It does not have a beginning‚Äîthis is the meaning.

original: lhag ma ni go sla'o //
analyzed: lhag ma ni go sla'o //
translated: The rest is easy to understand.

original: gang gi tshe rang bzhin la khyab par byed pa gcig dang du ma nyid dag log pas shing log pas sha pa ldog pa bzhin du dngos po'i rang bzhin ldog par sgrub pa de'i tshe dam bcas pa'i don gyi phyogs gcig pa nyid du ga la 'gyur /
analyzed: gang gi tshe rang bzhin la khyab par byed pa gcig dang du ma nyid dag log pas shing log pas sha pa ldog pa bzhin du dngos po'i rang bzhin ldog par sgrub pa de'i tshe dam bcas pa'i don gyi phyogs gcig pa nyid du ga la 'gyur /
translated: When the pervasion of the nature is established by the reversal of the one and the many, and the nature of the thing is reversed, like the reversal of the tree by the reversal of the ≈õim≈õapƒÅ, then how can there be the fault of the proposition having only a part of the property?

original: khyab par bya ba dang khyab par byed pa ldog pa'i tshig rnam par chad pa tha dad pa'i ngo bo gnyis rnam grangs nyid ni ma yin no //
analyzed: khyab par bya ba dang khyab par byed pa ldog pa'i tshig rnam par chad pa tha dad pa'i ngo bo gnyis rnam grangs nyid ni ma yin no //
translated: The reversal of the pervaded and the pervader is not a different thing with a different nature, which is a different enumeration.

original: rnam grangs kyi ngo bo ma yin pa ni dam bcas pa'i don gyi phyogs gcig nyid ni ma yin te /
analyzed: rnam grangs kyi ngo bo ma yin pa ni dam bcas pa'i don gyi phyogs gcig nyid ni ma yin te /
translated: The non-enumerated nature is not just one part of the meaning of the thesis.

original: dper na byas pa nyid mi rtag pa nyid du bsgrub par bya ba la don dam par gcig kyang gang byas pa nyid ni mi rtag pa sgrub par byed pa lta bu yin pas gyi na'o //
analyzed: dper na byas pa nyid mi rtag pa nyid du bsgrub par bya ba la don dam par gcig kyang gang byas pa nyid ni mi rtag pa sgrub par byed pa lta bu yin pas gyi na'o //
translated: For example, in proving that what is produced is impermanent, the production itself is the proof of impermanence, so it is not so.

original: de ltar rigs pas chos thams cad rang bzhin med pa nyid du bsgrubs nas lung gis kyang bsgrub par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de ltar rigs pas chos thams cad rang bzhin med pa nyid du bsgrubs nas lung gis kyang bsgrub par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: Thus, having established by reasoning that all phenomena are essenceless, in order to establish it by scripture,

original: 'di thams cad ni bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang gsungs te zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: 'di thams cad ni bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang gsungs te zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: he says, ‚ÄúThis is also stated by the Transcendent Lord . . . ‚Äù

original: yongs dag ces bya ba ni gsal bar snang ba nyid kyi rgyu bstan to //
analyzed: yongs dag ces bya ba ni gsal bar snang ba nyid kyi rgyu bstan to //
translated: ‚ÄúCompletely pure‚Äù indicates the cause of the clear appearance.

original: de bzhin du zhes bya ba 'di rang bzhin med par te /
analyzed: de bzhin du zhes bya ba 'di rang bzhin med par te /
translated: ‚ÄúLikewise‚Äù means ‚Äúessenceless.‚Äù

original: 'di ni dngos kyi don dang sbyar ba yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni dngos kyi don dang sbyar ba yin no //
translated: This is the application to the actual meaning.

original: gtan tshigs ni gcig dang du ma'i rang bzhin stong pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la ltos par bya'o //
analyzed: gtan tshigs ni gcig dang du ma'i rang bzhin stong pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la ltos par bya'o //
translated: The reason is ‚Äúbecause of the emptiness of the nature of one and many.‚Äù

original: ljon pa zhes bya ba ni bod pa'o //
analyzed: ljon pa zhes bya ba ni bod pa'o //
translated: ‚Äú Tree‚Äù is a metaphor.

original: shes par gyis zhes bya ba ni shes par gyis shig ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: shes par gyis zhes bya ba ni shes par gyis shig ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: ‚Äú Understand‚Äù means ‚Äúunderstand this.‚Äù

original: gal te nyan pa po'i skye bo 'dir gzugs brnyan gyi dpes ni bcom ldan 'das kyis kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis ngo bo'i chos kho na rang bzhin stong par bstan to snyam du go bar 'gyur bas /
analyzed: gal te nyan pa po'i skye bo 'dir gzugs brnyan gyi dpes ni bcom ldan 'das kyis kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis ngo bo'i chos kho na rang bzhin stong par bstan to snyam du go bar 'gyur bas /
translated: If the audience understands that the Lord taught the emptiness of essence of only the imagined nature by means of the example of the reflection,

original: nga yis rang bzhin stong pa @113b zhes ;
analyzed: nga yis rang bzhin stong pa @113b zhes ;
translated: then he says, ‚ÄúI have taught the emptiness of essence of all phenomena,‚Äù

original: / zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: / zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: and so on.

original: brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis stong pa yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid ces bya ba'i dngos po gang yin pa de bcom ldan 'das kyis bdag la kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis stong par bstan to snyam du sems na de yang rang bzhin stong pa
analyzed: brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis stong pa yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid ces bya ba'i dngos po gang yin pa de bcom ldan 'das kyis bdag la kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis stong par bstan to snyam du sems na de yang rang bzhin stong pa
translated: If you think that the Lord taught the emptiness of the imagined nature to be the perfected nature, then that also is empty of essence.

original: nyid du shes par gyis shig ces bya bar sbyar te /
analyzed: nyid du shes par gyis shig ces bya bar sbyar te /
translated: One should understand that this is so.

original: de yang rigs pas dpyad na mi gnas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de yang rigs pas dpyad na mi gnas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Moreover, when one examines it with reasoning, it does not endure.

original: 'di ni 'dir khungs yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni 'dir khungs yin no //
translated: This is the source here.

original: gal te thams cad stong pa kho na yin na /
analyzed: gal te thams cad stong pa kho na yin na /
translated: If everything is just empty,

original: 'o na su la ni bstan par bya /
analyzed: 'o na su la ni bstan par bya /
translated: then for whom is it taught?

original: su zhig ni ston par byed /
analyzed: su zhig ni ston par byed /
translated: Who is the teacher?

original: ci'i phyir ni bstan snyam pa la /
analyzed: ci'i phyir ni bstan snyam pa la /
translated: For what purpose is it taught?

original: byis pa log pa'i blo can zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: byis pa log pa'i blo can zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: In response to that, it says ‚Äúthe childish, whose minds are distorted,‚Äù and so on.

original: don dam par 'gro ba rang bzhin med mod kyi /
analyzed: don dam par 'gro ba rang bzhin med mod kyi /
translated: Although ultimately beings are essenceless,

original: 'on kyang ston pa po la sogs pa yang dag pa dang yang dag pa ma yin pa'i kun rdzob kyi ngo bor yod pa kho na'o //
analyzed: 'on kyang ston pa po la sogs pa yang dag pa dang yang dag pa ma yin pa'i kun rdzob kyi ngo bor yod pa kho na'o //
translated: nevertheless, the teacher and so on exist only in the nature of the correct and incorrect conventional.

original: de'i phyir de'i byin gyi rlabs kyis rmongs pa bzlog pa'i phyir bshad pa la 'jug pa nyid do zhes bsdus pa'i don to //
analyzed: de'i phyir de'i byin gyi rlabs kyis rmongs pa bzlog pa'i phyir bshad pa la 'jug pa nyid do zhes bsdus pa'i don to //
translated: Therefore, the point of the summary is that in order to reverse the confusion of those, the explanation engages them.

original: de la de dag gi blo gros phyin ci log pa'i phyir log pa yang yin la /
analyzed: de la de dag gi blo gros phyin ci log pa'i phyir log pa yang yin la /
translated: In that regard, their minds are distorted, and therefore they are distorted.

original: blo ma byang ba'i phyir byis pa'i blo can dag kyang yin pas byis pa log pa'i blo can dag go //
