analyzed: blo ma byang ba'i phyir byis pa'i blo can dag kyang yin pas byis pa log pa'i blo can dag go //
translated: They are also childish because their minds are not trained.

original: yang na 'bru mang po par sbyar ro //
analyzed: yang na 'bru mang po par sbyar ro //
translated: Or else, the compound is to be analyzed as ‚Äúchildish‚Äù and ‚Äúerroneous mind.‚Äù

original: blo ni chos kyi de kho na la ma byang ba'i phyir byis pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: blo ni chos kyi de kho na la ma byang ba'i phyir byis pa nyid yin no //
translated: Childishness is the lack of training in the reality of things.

original: de dag rnams la bstan pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni ma rig pa bzlog nas rig pa bskyed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag rnams la bstan pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni ma rig pa bzlog nas rig pa bskyed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: ‚ÄúIn order to teach them‚Äù means in order to eliminate their ignorance and generate their knowledge.

original: gal te thams cad rang bzhin gyis stong pa kho na yin no //
analyzed: gal te thams cad rang bzhin gyis stong pa kho na yin no //
translated: If everything is just empty of intrinsic reality,

original: 'o na ji ltar kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang bar rnam par gnas snyam pa la /
analyzed: 'o na ji ltar kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang bar rnam par gnas snyam pa la /
translated: how is the distinction between affliction and purification possible?

original: kun tu rtog pa'i rtog pas bskyed //
analyzed: kun tu rtog pa'i rtog pas bskyed //
translated: It is generated by the conceptual thought of imagination.

original: ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /üîΩ'di lta bu dang 'di lta bu bya'o snyam pa'i sems pa ni kun tu rtog pa'o //
analyzed: ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te / 'di lta bu dang 'di lta bu bya'o snyam pa'i sems pa ni kun tu rtog pa'o //
translated: The verse begins with this.üîΩImagination is the thought that thinks, ‚ÄúIt is like this and like this.‚Äù

original: de nyid rtog pa yin te /
analyzed: de nyid rtog pa yin te /
translated: It is conceptual thought.

original: rnam par rtog pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It is a synonym for discrimination.

original: 'dis ni las kyi kun nas nyon mongs pa rgyu nyid du bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dis ni las kyi kun nas nyon mongs pa rgyu nyid du bstan pa yin no //
translated: This shows the defilement of action as a cause.

original: yang dag ma yin rtog pa ni ma rig pa la sogs pa ste nyon mongs pa thams cad ni yang dag pa ma yin pa kun tu rtog pa yin no //
analyzed: yang dag ma yin rtog pa ni ma rig pa la sogs pa ste nyon mongs pa thams cad ni yang dag pa ma yin pa kun tu rtog pa yin no //
translated: The imagination of what is unreal is ignorance, etc. All defilements are the imagination of what is unreal.

original: de dag gis bcings pa ni de dag gi dbang gis 'jug pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: de dag gis bcings pa ni de dag gi dbang gis 'jug pa'i phyir te /
translated: Those who are bound by them are engaged by their power.

original: 'dis ni nyon mongs pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa bdag po yang yin par bstan to //üîΩ'di skad du don dam par stong mod kyi /
analyzed: 'dis ni nyon mongs pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa bdag po yang yin par bstan to // 'di skad du don dam par stong mod kyi /
translated: This shows the defilement of defilement as a cause.
This is what is being said: although ultimately empty,

original: kyang rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po kun rdzob pa yod pa'i phyir kun nas nyon mongs pa la sogs pa rnam par gnas par 'gyur ro zhes bshad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: kyang rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po kun rdzob pa yod pa'i phyir kun nas nyon mongs pa la sogs pa rnam par gnas par 'gyur ro zhes bshad par 'gyur ro //
translated: nevertheless, since the reality of cause and effect exists conventionally, the defilement of action, etc.üîΩare well-established.

original: nyon mongs pa dang las kyi rgyu rkyen gyi kun nas nyon mongs pa bstan pas rnam par byang ba yang shugs kyis bstan pa kho na yin te /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa dang las kyi rgyu rkyen gyi kun nas nyon mongs pa bstan pas rnam par byang ba yang shugs kyis bstan pa kho na yin te /
translated: Since the defilement of cause and effect of defilement and action is taught, purification is also taught by implication.

original: nyon mongs pa dang las log na kun nas nyon mongs pa log par 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa dang las log na kun nas nyon mongs pa log par 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If the afflictions and karma are refuted, the establishment of the refutation of affliction is accomplished.

original: gzhan pa nyid dang gcig pa nyid ni ltos par lta bar byed pa yin pas gcig pa nyid dang du ma nyid dag gis spangs pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: gzhan pa nyid dang gcig pa nyid ni ltos par lta bar byed pa yin pas gcig pa nyid dang du ma nyid dag gis spangs pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Since difference and identity are seen in dependence, the meaning of ‚Äúabandoned by identity and difference‚Äù is the same as ‚Äúabandoned by identity and difference.‚Äù

original: dngos po'i zhes bya ba ni spyir brjod pa'i phyir rang dang gzhan gyi mngon par 'dod pa gzugs la sogs pa dngos po thams cad kyi'o //
analyzed: dngos po'i zhes bya ba ni spyir brjod pa'i phyir rang dang gzhan gyi mngon par 'dod pa gzugs la sogs pa dngos po thams cad kyi'o //
translated: Since ‚Äúentity‚Äù is stated generally, it refers to all entities, such as form, that are asserted by ourselves and others.

original: gal te dngos po 'di dag don dam par rang bzhin med na /
analyzed: gal te dngos po 'di dag don dam par rang bzhin med na /
translated: If these entities have no essence ultimately,

original: 'o na shugs kyis 'di dag gi mtshan nyid ci zhig yin par 'gyur snyam pa la /
analyzed: 'o na shugs kyis 'di dag gi mtshan nyid ci zhig yin par 'gyur snyam pa la /
translated: then what is their nature indirectly?

original: de'i phyir dngos po 'di dag ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir dngos po 'di dag ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Therefore, NƒÅgƒÅrjuna says, ‚ÄúThese entities are only imputed by thought,‚Äù and so on.

original: 'khrul pa'i blos dngos po'i de kho na nyid bsgrubs pas blo 'khrul pa thams cad ni kun rdzob yin no //
analyzed: 'khrul pa'i blos dngos po'i de kho na nyid bsgrubs pas blo 'khrul pa thams cad ni kun rdzob yin no //
translated: Since the nature of entities is established by a mistaken mind, all mistaken minds are conventional.

original: 'khrul pa'i blo'i bsam pa'i dbang gis brtags pa'i bdag nyid du gnas pa'i phyir de la yod pa ni kun rdzob pa yin no //
analyzed: 'khrul pa'i blo'i bsam pa'i dbang gis brtags pa'i bdag nyid du gnas pa'i phyir de la yod pa ni kun rdzob pa yin no //
translated: Because it exists as the self that is imagined by the power of the mind's erroneous conception, it is said to exist conventionally.

original: 'di ji lta snyam pa la /
analyzed: 'di ji lta snyam pa la /
translated: How is this?

original: gal te 'di dag don 'dod na //
analyzed: gal te 'di dag don 'dod na //
translated: If one desires the meaning of these words,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: he should understand them in the following way.

original: 'di skad du yang dag pa dang yang dag pa ma yin pa dag gis ni phung po thams cad la khyab ste /
analyzed: 'di skad du yang dag pa dang yang dag pa ma yin pa dag gis ni phung po thams cad la khyab ste /
translated: It is said that the real and the unreal pervade all the aggregates,

original: de gnyis ni phan tshun spangs te gnas pa'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de gnyis ni phan tshun spangs te gnas pa'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because these two are characteristics that exist in mutual exclusion.

original: yang dag pa'i ngo bo bkag na shugs kyis 'di dag cig shos su gnas par rang bzhin gyis 'gyur ro zhes bshad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i ngo bo bkag na shugs kyis 'di dag cig shos su gnas par rang bzhin gyis 'gyur ro zhes bshad par 'gyur ro //
translated: When the real nature is refuted, it is explained that these things exist by nature as the other, the unreal.

original: lcags kyu med pa zhes bya ba ni rang dga' ste de ni res 'ga' 'di dag gi ngo bo brdzun par yang 'jog par 'gyur ro snyam du bsams pa'o //
analyzed: lcags kyu med pa zhes bya ba ni rang dga' ste de ni res 'ga' 'di dag gi ngo bo brdzun par yang 'jog par 'gyur ro snyam du bsams pa'o //
translated: The word without means spontaneously, and it is thought that sometimes the nature of these things is also posited as false.

original: lhag ma ni go sla'o //
analyzed: lhag ma ni go sla'o //
translated: The rest is easy to understand.

original: lung gzhan yang ji ltar gnas pa'i dngos po'i de kho na la mkhas pas zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: lung gzhan yang ji ltar gnas pa'i dngos po'i de kho na la mkhas pas zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: Another scriptural passage is quoted: ‚ÄúThe wise one, in regard to the reality of things as they are situated. . . ‚Äù

original: mdo 'di las ni gzugs la sogs pa'i dngos po thams cad spyir mjug bsdus te /
analyzed: mdo 'di las ni gzugs la sogs pa'i dngos po thams cad spyir mjug bsdus te /
translated: This s≈´tra, in general, summarizes all things such as form,

original: kun rdzob tsam gyi rang bzhin yin par bstan to zhes ston par byed do //
analyzed: kun rdzob tsam gyi rang bzhin yin par bstan to zhes ston par byed do //
translated: and teaches that they are the nature of mere conventionality.

original: tha snyad du ston pa zhes bya ba ni phung po la sogs pa tha snyad tsam kho nar @114b ston pa yin gyi don dam par ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: tha snyad du ston pa zhes bya ba ni phung po la sogs pa tha snyad tsam kho nar @114b ston pa yin gyi don dam par ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: ‚ÄúTeaching conventionally‚Äù means that the aggregates and so on are taught as mere conventions, but not ultimately.üîΩEven though it is not possible to teach the nature of the ultimate, it is sometimes taught by the conventional expressions of speech.

original: don dam pa'i rang bzhin bstan par mi nus su zin kyang brjod pa'i kun rdzob kyis res 'ga' zhig na bstan par bya ba nyid do snyam pa de'i phyir de bzlog pa'i ched du tha snyad ces bya ba smos so //
analyzed: don dam pa'i rang bzhin bstan par mi nus su zin kyang brjod pa'i kun rdzob kyis res 'ga' zhig na bstan par bya ba nyid do snyam pa de'i phyir de bzlog pa'i ched du tha snyad ces bya ba smos so //
translated: Thus, in order to refute that, he says ‚Äúconventionally.‚Äù

original: de bzhin du tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa rnams so //
analyzed: de bzhin du tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa rnams so //
translated: Likewise, it is with regard to feeling, perception, formation, and consciousness.

original: ci zhe na 'dogs la don dam par yang mi dmigs so zhes bya bar sbyar te /
analyzed: ci zhe na 'dogs la don dam par yang mi dmigs so zhes bya bar sbyar te /
translated: What? It is applied to the non-apprehension of the object, ultimately.

original: 'di ni 'dir khungs yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni 'dir khungs yin no //
translated: This is the source here.

original: tshul bzhin zhes bya ba ni tshad ma dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: tshul bzhin zhes bya ba ni tshad ma dang ldan pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúProperly‚Äù means with valid cognition.

original: bdag med pa zhes bya ba ni bdag gi rang bzhin ma yin zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: bdag med pa zhes bya ba ni bdag gi rang bzhin ma yin zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: ‚ÄúSelflessness‚Äù means not having the nature of a self.

original: de bzhin du zhes bya ba ni bdag med par ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du zhes bya ba ni bdag med par ro //
translated: ‚ÄúLikewise‚Äù means as selfless.

original: sems can bdag med par zhes bya ba ni ji ltar gang zag la bdag med par bshad pa kho na ltar ro //
analyzed: sems can bdag med par zhes bya ba ni ji ltar gang zag la bdag med par bshad pa kho na ltar ro //
translated: ‚ÄúThe selflessness of sentient beings‚Äù means just as the selflessness of the person is explained.

original: de bzhin du zhes bya ba ni gang zag bzhin du rang bzhin kho nas ngo bo nyid med par mthong ngo zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du zhes bya ba ni gang zag bzhin du rang bzhin kho nas ngo bo nyid med par mthong ngo zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
translated: ‚ÄúLikewise‚Äù means that, like the person, one sees that it has no nature of its own. This is the meaning.

original: 'di ni 'dir khungs yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni 'dir khungs yin no //
translated: This is the source here.

original: rgyal ba skyed ma las zhes bya ba ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las so //
analyzed: rgyal ba skyed ma las zhes bya ba ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las so //
translated: ‚ÄúFrom the mother of the victors‚Äù means from the Perfection of Wisdom.

original: bar du zhes bya ba ni mtha' bstan pa ste /
analyzed: bar du zhes bya ba ni mtha' bstan pa ste /
translated: ‚ÄúIn the middle‚Äù indicates the teaching of the end.

original: rang gi mtshan nyid stong pa nyid kyi phyir gzugs ni gzugs kyi rang gi ngo bo nyid kyis stong la /
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid stong pa nyid kyi phyir gzugs ni gzugs kyi rang gi ngo bo nyid kyis stong la /
translated: Because of the emptiness of essential nature, form is empty of the essential nature of form.

original: rnam par shes pa'i bar du yang zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go ;
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i bar du yang zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go ;
translated: The same is true of feeling, etc.

original: /'dir khungs ni rang gi mtshan nyid stong pa nyid kyi phyir zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: /'dir khungs ni rang gi mtshan nyid stong pa nyid kyi phyir zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: The source here is ‚Äúbecause of the emptiness of essential nature.‚Äù

original: 'di ni zhes bya ba ni stong par bshad pa 'di thams cad du stong pa nyid du bshad pa gang yin pa'o //üîΩgang gi rang bzhin yod pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di ni zhes bya ba ni stong par bshad pa 'di thams cad du stong pa nyid du bshad pa gang yin pa'o // gang gi rang bzhin yod pa yin te /
translated: ‚ÄúThis‚Äù refers to all of the explanations of emptiness.

original: med pa ma yin pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: med pa ma yin pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: ‚ÄúWhose nature exists‚Äù means that which is not nonexistent.

original: 'di yang zhes bya ba ni ji skad bshad pa'i tshig gis bstan par bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'di yang zhes bya ba ni ji skad bshad pa'i tshig gis bstan par bya ba'i don to //
translated: ‚ÄúThis‚Äù refers to the meaning that is to be taught by the words that have been explained.

original: brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid kho na'o zhes bya ba ni rigs pa dang bral ba'i phyir dang tshad mas gnod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid kho na'o zhes bya ba ni rigs pa dang bral ba'i phyir dang tshad mas gnod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: ‚ÄúOnly imagined‚Äù means that it is unreasonable and is contradicted by valid cognition.

original: gnyis la sogs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni tshad mas gnod pa de nyid ston par byed do //
analyzed: gnyis la sogs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni tshad mas gnod pa de nyid ston par byed do //
translated: ‚ÄúThe duality, etc.‚Äù shows that it is contradicted by valid cognition.

original: lung gzhan yang glang po'i rtsal zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: lung gzhan yang glang po'i rtsal zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: Another scriptural passage is the Hastikakshya-sutra.

original: ma mchis zhes bya ba ni yul med pa'i phyir de yang med ces bya'o //
analyzed: ma mchis zhes bya ba ni yul med pa'i phyir de yang med ces bya'o //
translated: The phrase they do not exist means that they are nonexistent because they are not objects.

original: de ci'i slad du zhes bya ba ni 'di dag sgyu ma lta bu nyid du gang las grub /
analyzed: de ci'i slad du zhes bya ba ni 'di dag sgyu ma lta bu nyid du gang las grub /
translated: The phrase why is this? means from what are these established as being like an illusion?

original: gang gis na dpe des rang bzhin med pa nyid du 'grub par 'gyur zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs 'dri ba'o //üîΩ'di la yang @115a * //
analyzed: gang gis na dpe des rang bzhin med pa nyid du 'grub par 'gyur zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs 'dri ba'o // 'di la yang @115a * //
translated: The phrase by what means are they established as being essenceless? is the question that is asked by means of the example.

original: dag pa'i chos gang yang mi dmigs pa'i slad du'o zhes bya ba ni gcig pa nyid dang du ma nyid la sogs pas dpyad na snyam du dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: dag pa'i chos gang yang mi dmigs pa'i slad du'o zhes bya ba ni gcig pa nyid dang du ma nyid la sogs pas dpyad na snyam du dgongs pa'o //
translated: The phrase because no real entity is apprehended means that when one analyzes in terms of sameness and difference, etc., no real entity is apprehended.

original: ji ste don dam pa'i rang bzhin bkag pas dngos po rnams kun rdzob pa'i ngo bor bzhag pa gang yin pa de ci sgra'i tha snyad kyi bdag nyid kyi kun rdzob la yod pa'i phyir kun rdzob par 'dod dam /
analyzed: ji ste don dam pa'i rang bzhin bkag pas dngos po rnams kun rdzob pa'i ngo bor bzhag pa gang yin pa de ci sgra'i tha snyad kyi bdag nyid kyi kun rdzob la yod pa'i phyir kun rdzob par 'dod dam /
translated: If you posit entities as having a conventional nature by refuting their ultimate nature, then do you assert that they are conventional because they exist in a convention that is defined in terms of the sound I?

original: 'on te rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba don bya ba byed pa gnag rdzi yan chad la shin tu grags pa de nyid brda'i dbang gis kun rdzob kyi sgrar brjod ces bya ba rtog pa gnyis so //
analyzed: 'on te rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba don bya ba byed pa gnag rdzi yan chad la shin tu grags pa de nyid brda'i dbang gis kun rdzob kyi sgrar brjod ces bya ba rtog pa gnyis so //
translated: Or, is it that dependent origination, which is well known to everyone from cowherds on up as the performance of function, is called the conventional by the power of designation?

original: de la gal te phyogs dang po lta bu yin na ni de'i tshe mngon sum la sogs pas gnod pa yin te /
analyzed: de la gal te phyogs dang po lta bu yin na ni de'i tshe mngon sum la sogs pas gnod pa yin te /
translated: If it is the first case, then it is undermined by direct perception and so on.

original: 'di ltar sgra'i tha snyad ni spyi tsam gyi spyod yul can yin pa'i phyir rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i dngos po'i mtshan nyid kyi yul can ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar sgra'i tha snyad ni spyi tsam gyi spyod yul can yin pa'i phyir rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i dngos po'i mtshan nyid kyi yul can ma yin no //
translated: Thus, because the domain of verbal conventions is merely a universal, it is not the domain of the characteristics of things that are dependently arisen.

original: spyi de yang kun tu brtags pa'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir dngos po med pa yin na de'i ngo bo nyid du khas len pas dngos po rnams kyi don bya ba byed pa shin tu grags pa la skur par 'gyur te /
analyzed: spyi de yang kun tu brtags pa'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir dngos po med pa yin na de'i ngo bo nyid du khas len pas dngos po rnams kyi don bya ba byed pa shin tu grags pa la skur par 'gyur te /
translated: And if that universal is nonexistent because it is an imagined entity, then by accepting it as the nature of things, you would be denigrating the well-known performance of function of things,

original: spyi ni don byed mi bzod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: spyi ni don byed mi bzod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because a universal cannot perform a function.

original: ji ste phyogs gnyis pa lta bu yin na ni de'i tshe ming la brtsad pa yod do snyam pa'i bsam pas pha rol pos ji ste zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: ji ste phyogs gnyis pa lta bu yin na ni de'i tshe ming la brtsad pa yod do snyam pa'i bsam pas pha rol pos ji ste zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: But if it is the second case, then the opponent thinks that there is a dispute about the name, and so he says, ‚ÄúIf you say‚Ä¶‚Äù

original: gal te tshad mas dpyad na rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba yin pa 'di dag kyang rang gi ngo bo grub par gyur na ni de'i tshe de la kun rdzob kyi sgrar brjod par byed na ming la brtsad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te tshad mas dpyad na rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba yin pa 'di dag kyang rang gi ngo bo grub par gyur na ni de'i tshe de la kun rdzob kyi sgrar brjod par byed na ming la brtsad par 'gyur ro //
translated: If one analyzes with valid cognition, and if these dependently arisen things were to have an established essence, then at that time one would say the term ‚Äúconventional‚Äù about them, but there would be a dispute about the name.

original: gang gi tshe gcig pa nyid dang du ma nyid la sogs pas dpyad na 'di dag gi rang bzhin mi gnas pa de'i tshe de lta bu la kun rdzob kyi sgrar brjod na ni gnas kho na yin pas ji ltar ming la sogs par 'gyur /
analyzed: gang gi tshe gcig pa nyid dang du ma nyid la sogs pas dpyad na 'di dag gi rang bzhin mi gnas pa de'i tshe de lta bu la kun rdzob kyi sgrar brjod na ni gnas kho na yin pas ji ltar ming la sogs par 'gyur /
translated: But when one analyzes with such things as sameness and difference, and their nature does not endure, then at that time, if one says the term ‚Äúconventional‚Äù about such things, it is just that, and how could it be a dispute about the name?

original: mthong ba ni mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pas nyams su myong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mthong ba ni mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pas nyams su myong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: ‚ÄúSeeing‚Äù is because of the experience of eye consciousness and so on.

original: 'dod pa ni ji ltar nyams su myong ba bzhin nges pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dod pa ni ji ltar nyams su myong ba bzhin nges pa'i phyir ro //
translated: ‚ÄúDesire‚Äù is because of the ascertainment of experience.

original: gang dag la ma brtags gcig pu na dga' ba yod pa de dag la de skad ces bya ste /
analyzed: gang dag la ma brtags gcig pu na dga' ba yod pa de dag la de skad ces bya ste /
translated: Those which are delightful only when not investigated are called that.

original: ma brtags pa nyid ce na dga'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: ma brtags pa nyid ce na dga'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: If one says, ‚ÄúThey are delightful only when not investigated,‚Äù the meaning is that they are delightful only when not examined.

original: yang dag pa'i kun rdzob ces bya ba ni ji ltar grags pa bzhin nye bar brtags pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i kun rdzob ces bya ba ni ji ltar grags pa bzhin nye bar brtags pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The correct conventional is so called because it is investigated as it is renowned.

original: grags pa las 'das te rtogs pa dper na dbang phyug la sogs par rtogs pa gang yin pa de ni log pa'i kun rdzob @115b yin no //üîΩji skad du rten cing 'brel bar gang 'byung ba zhes bya ba ni 'di la sngon gyi slob dpon rnams 'dra bar byed pa ste /
analyzed: grags pa las 'das te rtogs pa dper na dbang phyug la sogs par rtogs pa gang yin pa de ni log pa'i kun rdzob @115b yin no // ji skad du rten cing 'brel bar gang 'byung ba zhes bya ba ni 'di la sngon gyi slob dpon rnams 'dra bar byed pa ste /
translated: The incorrect conventional is that which is imagined to be beyond what is renowned, for example, ƒ™≈õvara.

original: 'di ni 'phags pa klu sgrub kyi zhal snga nas kyis dbu ma'i bstan bcos las gsungs so //
analyzed: 'di ni 'phags pa klu sgrub kyi zhal snga nas kyis dbu ma'i bstan bcos las gsungs so //
translated: As for the statement, ‚ÄúWhatever arises in dependence on something else,‚Äù the former masters agree that this is the statement of the noble NƒÅgƒÅrjuna in the Treatise on the Middle Way.

original: rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i dngos po rnams kho na don dam pa'i rang bzhin dang bral ba'i phyir stong pa zhes bya'i ri bong gi rva dang 'dra ba'i bdag nyid kyi phyir ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i dngos po rnams kho na don dam pa'i rang bzhin dang bral ba'i phyir stong pa zhes bya'i ri bong gi rva dang 'dra ba'i bdag nyid kyi phyir ni ma yin no //
translated: Only things that are dependently arisen are said to be empty of an intrinsic nature, not that they are like the horns of a rabbit, which have no reality at all.

original: des na mthong ba la sogs pa dang mi 'gal lo //
analyzed: des na mthong ba la sogs pa dang mi 'gal lo //
translated: Therefore, this does not contradict seeing, etc.

original: de ni rgyur byas gdags pa ste //
analyzed: de ni rgyur byas gdags pa ste //
translated: It is a designation in terms of cause.

original: zhes bya ba ni kun rdzob de nyid ces bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni kun rdzob de nyid ces bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
translated: This means that it is a conventional designation.

original: rgyur byas pa dang gdags pa'i sgra ni kun rdzob kyi rnam grangs yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyur byas pa dang gdags pa'i sgra ni kun rdzob kyi rnam grangs yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The terms ‚Äúin terms of cause‚Äù and ‚Äúdesignation‚Äù are synonyms for ‚Äúconventional.‚Äù

original: 'di ni 'dir khungs yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni 'dir khungs yin no //
translated: This is the source for that.üîΩThat itself is the middle way.

original: de nyid dbu ma'i lam yin no zhes bya ba ni sgro 'dogs pa dang skur pa 'debs pa'i mtha' gnyis spangs pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de nyid dbu ma'i lam yin no zhes bya ba ni sgro 'dogs pa dang skur pa 'debs pa'i mtha' gnyis spangs pa'i phyir /
translated: This means that it is the middle way that is free from the two extremes of superimposition and denial.

original: de nyid de dang de las dbu ma'i lam du gsungs so zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de nyid de dang de las dbu ma'i lam du gsungs so zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It is said to be the middle way in this and that scripture.

original: 'o na gal te rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i dngos po dag kho na brtag mi bzod pa'i phyir kun rdzob kyi sgrar brjod na /
analyzed: 'o na gal te rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i dngos po dag kho na brtag mi bzod pa'i phyir kun rdzob kyi sgrar brjod na /
translated: Well, if things that are dependently arisen are called conventional because they cannot withstand analysis,

original: 'phags pa blo gros mi zad pa'i mdo las /
analyzed: 'phags pa blo gros mi zad pa'i mdo las /
translated: then how is it that the noble Aksayamati S≈´tra says:

original: kun rdzob sgra'i tha snyad kyi bdag nyid yin par ji ltar gsungs snyam du sems pa la /
analyzed: kun rdzob sgra'i tha snyad kyi bdag nyid yin par ji ltar gsungs snyam du sems pa la /
translated: ‚ÄúThe conventional is the identity of verbal and symbolic designation‚Äù?

original: 'phags pa blo gros mi zad pas bstan pa'i mdo las zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: 'phags pa blo gros mi zad pas bstan pa'i mdo las zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: The noble Aksayamati S≈´tra says, and so on.

original: 'dis ni mdo de dang de dag las sgra'i tha snyad kyi bdag nyid kyang kun rdzob yin par bstan du zin kyang /
analyzed: 'dis ni mdo de dang de dag las sgra'i tha snyad kyi bdag nyid kyang kun rdzob yin par bstan du zin kyang /
translated: Although it is taught in that and other s≈´tras that the identity of verbal and symbolic designation is the conventional,üîΩwe have already explained that what we call ‚Äúcorrect conventionalities‚Äù are also conventional.

original: kho bo cag gis yang dag pa'i kun rdzob tu brjod pa gang yin pa de yang der 'jig rten gyi tha snyad ji snyed pa zhes bya ba 'dis bstan pa kho na yin te /
analyzed: kho bo cag gis yang dag pa'i kun rdzob tu brjod pa gang yin pa de yang der 'jig rten gyi tha snyad ji snyed pa zhes bya ba 'dis bstan pa kho na yin te /
translated: This is indicated by the phrase ‚Äúwhatever is the case in the world.‚Äù

original: kho bo cag sgra'i tha snyad kyi bdag nyid kyang mi 'dod pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: kho bo cag sgra'i tha snyad kyi bdag nyid kyang mi 'dod pa ni ma yin te /
translated: We do not deny that the identity of verbal and symbolic designation is a conventionality.

original: de yang log pa'i kun rdzob yin no zhes de ston par byed do //
analyzed: de yang log pa'i kun rdzob yin no zhes de ston par byed do //
translated: Moreover, it is a false superficial reality.

original: myong bar bya ba dang myong ba'i ngo bo zhes bya ba ni shes bya dang shes pa'i bdag nyid do //
analyzed: myong bar bya ba dang myong ba'i ngo bo zhes bya ba ni shes bya dang shes pa'i bdag nyid do //
translated: The words ‚Äúthe nature of the object of experience and the experience‚Äù refer to the nature of the object of knowledge and the knower.üîΩHow can that be expressed by the words of conventional usage?

original: de ci ltar tha snyad kyi sgras brjod par nus snyam pa la /üîΩbyed pa'i sgrub pa yongs su gzung ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de ci ltar tha snyad kyi sgras brjod par nus snyam pa la / byed pa'i sgrub pa yongs su gzung ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: The words ‚Äúbecause it is the basis of the activity of verbal expression‚Äù are stated.

original: shes bya dang shes bya'i bdag nyid kyis sgro 'dogs par byed pa tha snyad do //
analyzed: shes bya dang shes bya'i bdag nyid kyis sgro 'dogs par byed pa tha snyad do //
translated: Conventional usage is the superimposition of the nature of the object of knowledge and the knower.üîΩThis is knowledge.

original: 'di ni shes pa'o //üîΩ'di ni shes bya'o zhes bya ba sgra'i tha snyad kyi gzhi yin pa'i phyir byed pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni shes pa'o // 'di ni shes bya'o zhes bya ba sgra'i tha snyad kyi gzhi yin pa'i phyir byed pa nyid yin no //
translated: This is the object of knowledge.üîΩBecause it is the basis of the conventional usage of words, it is the activity.üîΩThe words ‚Äúbecause it is the basis of the activity of verbal expression‚Äù are stated.üîΩThe words ‚Äúbecause it is the basis of the activity of verbal expression‚Äù are stated.

original: de'i rjes su 'brel pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni ji snyed pa zhes bya ba de'o//üîΩ@116a * // 'dir kyang gi don yang blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: de'i rjes su 'brel pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni ji snyed pa zhes bya ba de'o//üîΩ@116a * // 'dir kyang gi don yang blta bar bya'o //
translated: The words ‚Äúbecause it is the basis of the activity of verbal expression‚Äù are stated.üîΩThe words ‚Äúbecause it is the basis of the activity of verbal expression‚Äù are stated.üîΩThe words ‚Äúbecause it is the basis of the activity of verbal expression‚Äù are stated.üîΩThe words ‚Äúbecause it is the basis of the activity of verbal expression‚Äù are stated.üîΩThe words ‚Äúbecause it is the basis of the activity of verbal expression‚Äù are stated.üîΩThe words ‚Äúbecause it is the basis of the activity of verbal expression‚Äù are stated.üîΩThe words ‚Äúbecause it is the basis of the activity of verbal expression‚Äù are stated.üîΩThe words ‚Äúbecause it is the basis of the activity of verbal expression‚Äù are stated.üîΩThe words ‚Äúbecause it is the basis of the activity of verbal expression‚Äù are stated.üîΩThe words ‚Äúbecause it is the basis of the activity of verbal expression‚Äù are stated.üîΩThe words ‚Äúbecause it is the basis of the activity of verbal expression‚Äù are stated.üîΩThe words ‚Äúbecause it is the basis of the activity of verbal expression‚Äù are stated.üîΩThe words ‚Äúbecause it is the basis of the activity of verbal expression‚Äù are stated.üîΩThe words ‚Äúbecause it is the basis of the activity of verbal expression‚Äù are stated.üîΩThe words ‚Äúbecause it is the basis of the activity of verbal expression‚Äù are stated.üîΩThe words ‚Äúbecause it is the basis of the activity of verbal expression‚Äù are stated.üîΩThe words ‚Äúbecause it is the basis of the activity of verbal expression‚Äù are stated.üîΩThe words ‚Äúbecause it is the basis of the activity of verbal expression‚Äù are stated.üîΩThe words ‚Äúbecause it is the basis of

original: des na don ni yi ge'i sgra dang brda bstan pa ji snyed pa yod pa de thams cad kyang kun rdzob kyi bden pa yin no zhes bya ba 'dis yin no //
analyzed: des na don ni yi ge'i sgra dang brda bstan pa ji snyed pa yod pa de thams cad kyang kun rdzob kyi bden pa yin no zhes bya ba 'dis yin no //
translated: Therefore, the meaning is that all of the letters, sounds, and conventions that are taught are conventional truths.

original: de'i phyir / lung las 'byung ba dang 'jig rten pa'i yi ge bstan pa yang bsdu'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir / lung las 'byung ba dang 'jig rten pa'i yi ge bstan pa yang bsdu'o //
translated: Thus, the teachings of the scriptures and the world are also included.

original: de lta ma yin na 'ga' zhig 'phags pa ma yin pas bstan pa kho na kun rdzob yin gyi /
analyzed: de lta ma yin na 'ga' zhig 'phags pa ma yin pas bstan pa kho na kun rdzob yin gyi /
translated: Otherwise, one might mistakenly think that only the teachings of non-Aryas are conventional truths,

original: 'phags pa rnams kyis bstan pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'phags pa rnams kyis bstan pa ni ma yin no //
translated: but the teachings of the Aryas are not.

original: de dag ni phyin ci ma log pa de bzhin du gsungs pa'i phyir ro snyam du 'khrul par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dag ni phyin ci ma log pa de bzhin du gsungs pa'i phyir ro snyam du 'khrul par 'gyur ro //
translated: Because they are taught without error, just as it is.

original: de ni zhes bya ba ni rnam pa gnyis ka yang dag gi dang yid kyi bye brag gis rnam pa gnyis su dbye ste /
analyzed: de ni zhes bya ba ni rnam pa gnyis ka yang dag gi dang yid kyi bye brag gis rnam pa gnyis su dbye ste /
translated: The verse states, ‚ÄúThat‚Äù because both aspects are divided into two types by the distinction of mind and speech.

original: nang gi brjod pa'i rnam pa ni yid kyi'o //
analyzed: nang gi brjod pa'i rnam pa ni yid kyi'o //
translated: The internal aspect of expression is mental.

original: phyi rol gyi brjod pa'i ngo bo ni ngag gi'o //
analyzed: phyi rol gyi brjod pa'i ngo bo ni ngag gi'o //
translated: The external aspect of expression is verbal.

original: ji ltar na yid kyi bshad pa yin snyam pa la /
analyzed: ji ltar na yid kyi bshad pa yin snyam pa la /
translated: How is it mental?

original: dper na brgya byin zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: dper na brgya byin zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: For example, Indra, etc.

original: yang ci'i phyir 'jig rten gyi tha snyad yi ge dang skad bstan pa ji snyed pa'i bdag nyid ces bya ba kho nar tshig gcig tu mi shes snyam pa la /
analyzed: yang ci'i phyir 'jig rten gyi tha snyad yi ge dang skad bstan pa ji snyed pa'i bdag nyid ces bya ba kho nar tshig gcig tu mi shes snyam pa la /
translated: Moreover, why is it not understood that the very extent of the conventional expressions of the world is just one word?

original: de bas na spros pa'i tshogs zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de bas na spros pa'i tshogs zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Therefore, he says the collection of conceptual elaborations, etc.

original: spros pa phyin ci log gi bdag nyid thams cad kyi tshogs ni phung po'o //
analyzed: spros pa phyin ci log gi bdag nyid thams cad kyi tshogs ni phung po'o //
translated: The collection of all conceptual elaborations, which have the nature of error, is a heap.

original: de dang bral ba ni don dam pa'i bden pa gang yin pa ste de bstan pa'o //
analyzed: de dang bral ba ni don dam pa'i bden pa gang yin pa ste de bstan pa'o //
translated: That which is free from that is the ultimate truth, which is taught.

original: sems rgyu ba yang med ces bya ba ni nyams su myong ba'i rgyu ba yang med par ston pa'o //
analyzed: sems rgyu ba yang med ces bya ba ni nyams su myong ba'i rgyu ba yang med par ston pa'o //
translated: And there is no movement of mind means that there is no movement of experience.

original: gal te mngon par brjod pa'i mtshan nyid kho na kun rdzob kyi bden pa yin na de'i tshe gang la yi ge'i rgyu ba yang med pa zhes brjod par bya bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te mngon par brjod pa'i mtshan nyid kho na kun rdzob kyi bden pa yin na de'i tshe gang la yi ge'i rgyu ba yang med pa zhes brjod par bya bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If the conventional truth is just the characteristic of verbal expression, then it should be said that there is no movement of letters.

original: de lta na ni ji skad du bshad pa'i rim pa dang mi 'gal ba don dam pa'i bden pa kun rdzob las bzlog pa yin par bstan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta na ni ji skad du bshad pa'i rim pa dang mi 'gal ba don dam pa'i bden pa kun rdzob las bzlog pa yin par bstan par 'gyur ro //
translated: If it were so, then it would be taught that the ultimate truth is the opposite of the superficial, without contradicting the previously explained process.

original: gal te rnam par rtog pa'i rgyu ba bzlog pa'i phyir sems kyi zhes bya ba bshad do zhe na /
analyzed: gal te rnam par rtog pa'i rgyu ba bzlog pa'i phyir sems kyi zhes bya ba bshad do zhe na /
translated: If it is said that the word ‚Äúmind‚Äù is explained in order to stop the activity of conceptualization,

original: ma yin te rnam par rtog pa'i rgyu ba yang med pa zhes de skad kho na mngon par brjod par bya bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: ma yin te rnam par rtog pa'i rgyu ba yang med pa zhes de skad kho na mngon par brjod par bya bar 'gyur te /
translated: then it is not so, because it should be expressed in just that way, ‚Äúthe non-existence of the activity of conceptualization.‚Äù

original: de lta na ni ji ltar brjod par bzhed pa'i don bstan par mdzad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta na ni ji ltar brjod par bzhed pa'i don bstan par mdzad par 'gyur ro //
translated: If it were so, then it would be taught that the meaning intended to be expressed is.

original: rnam par rtog pa dang mngon par brjod pa gnyis kyang yul gcig pa yin pa'i phyir yi ge rnams lta ci smos zhes bya ba la dor ba'i tshig ci'i phyir mdzad par 'gyur //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa dang mngon par brjod pa gnyis kyang yul gcig pa yin pa'i phyir yi ge rnams lta ci smos zhes bya ba la dor ba'i tshig ci'i phyir mdzad par 'gyur //
translated: Since the objects of both conceptualization and verbalization are the same, why would the word ‚Äúeven‚Äù be used, let alone the letters?

original: de lta bas na nyams su myong ba'i mtshan nyid sems rgyu ba yang med pa yin pa @116b dang ; mngon par brjod pa phyi ma 'brel bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta bas na nyams su myong ba'i mtshan nyid sems rgyu ba yang med pa yin pa @116b dang ; mngon par brjod pa phyi ma 'brel bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, the characteristic of experience is the non-movement of mind, and the subsequent statement is connected.üîΩThis conventional reality is not tenable without a cause, etc.

original: kun rdzob 'di ni rgyu med par mi rung ste zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni dam bcas pa la rjes su dpag pa'i gnod pa yod par dogs pa ste /
analyzed: kun rdzob 'di ni rgyu med par mi rung ste zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni dam bcas pa la rjes su dpag pa'i gnod pa yod par dogs pa ste /
translated: This is the suspicion of an inferential contradiction in the thesis.

original: 'di ltar gang dang gang du kun rdzob yin pa de dang de ni rgyu dang bcas pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar gang dang gang du kun rdzob yin pa de dang de ni rgyu dang bcas pa yin te /
translated: Thus, whatever is conventional reality is accompanied by a cause.

original: dper na shing rta dang sems can la sogs pa btags pa lta bu yin no //
analyzed: dper na shing rta dang sems can la sogs pa btags pa lta bu yin no //
translated: For example, it is like the imputations of chariots, sentient beings, etc.

original: 'di ni kun rdzob yin pas rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni kun rdzob yin pas rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs yin no //
translated: This is a natural argument for conventional reality.

original: rgyu med pa nyid gcig yin na ni rtag tu yod pa la sogs par thal bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: rgyu med pa nyid gcig yin na ni rtag tu yod pa la sogs par thal bar 'gyur te /
translated: If it were causeless, the consequence would be that it is always existent, etc.

original: gnod pa can gyi tshad ma yin no //
analyzed: gnod pa can gyi tshad ma yin no //
translated: It is an invalidating valid cognition.

original: des na rgyu gang yin pa de ni don dam pa'i dngos po grub pa yin no snyam du bsams pa'o //
analyzed: des na rgyu gang yin pa de ni don dam pa'i dngos po grub pa yin no snyam du bsams pa'o //
translated: Therefore, whatever is a cause is an established ultimate entity.

original: gang dag la yan lag 'khor lo la sogs pa'i tshogs yod pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: gang dag la yan lag 'khor lo la sogs pa'i tshogs yod pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: That which has a collection of parts such as wheels, etc. is called that.

original: gang las yan lag gi tshogs las zhes 'byung ba der ni brten nas zhes bya ba de la ltos pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: gang las yan lag gi tshogs las zhes 'byung ba der ni brten nas zhes bya ba de la ltos pa'i phyir te /
translated: In the passage, ‚Äúfrom the collection of parts,‚Äù the word ‚Äúfrom‚Äù means ‚Äúin dependence upon,‚Äù because the collection of parts is the cause of the chariot.

original: nas bya ba mi mngon par byas na rnam par dbye ba lnga pa yin no //
analyzed: nas bya ba mi mngon par byas na rnam par dbye ba lnga pa yin no //
translated: The fifth case is used to indicate the cause when the word ‚Äúfrom‚Äù is elided.

original: gang gi tshe yan lag gi tshogs rnams la zhes 'byung ba de'i tshe yang 'og nas 'byung ba rgyur byas zhes bya ba de la ltos na las kyi rnam par dbye ba yin no //
analyzed: gang gi tshe yan lag gi tshogs rnams la zhes 'byung ba de'i tshe yang 'og nas 'byung ba rgyur byas zhes bya ba de la ltos na las kyi rnam par dbye ba yin no //
translated: In the passage, ‚Äúthe collection of parts,‚Äù the word ‚Äúcollection‚Äù is used in the sense of cause, because it is the cause of the chariot.

original: de la gal te spyir rgyu dang bcas pa tsam du sgrub par byed na ni de'i tshe grub pa sgrub pa yin te /
analyzed: de la gal te spyir rgyu dang bcas pa tsam du sgrub par byed na ni de'i tshe grub pa sgrub pa yin te /
translated: If one proves the mere existence of a cause in general, then one is proving what is already established,

original: kun rdzob pa'i rgyu snga ma snga ma thog ma med par 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: kun rdzob pa'i rgyu snga ma snga ma thog ma med par 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is accepted that there is no beginning of the prior continuum of conventional causes.

original: ji ste don dam pa'i rgyu zhig sgrub par byed na ni de'i tshe dpe bsgrub par bya ba'i chos ma tshang ba'i phyir rjes su 'gro ba ma grub pas ma nges pa nyid yin no zhes ston par byed do //
analyzed: ji ste don dam pa'i rgyu zhig sgrub par byed na ni de'i tshe dpe bsgrub par bya ba'i chos ma tshang ba'i phyir rjes su 'gro ba ma grub pas ma nges pa nyid yin no zhes ston par byed do //
translated: If you are proving a cause that is ultimate, then at that time, because the example lacks the property to be proven, the pervasion is not established, and so it is not ascertained.

original: brtags pa ma byas zhes bya ba la sogs pa la de 'dra zhes bya ba ni kun rdzob pa kho na'o /
analyzed: brtags pa ma byas zhes bya ba la sogs pa la de 'dra zhes bya ba ni kun rdzob pa kho na'o /
translated: ‚Äú Without analysis‚Äù and so on. ‚Äú Such‚Äù refers to the conventional.

original: 'di yi zhes bya ba ni kun rdzob pa'i'o //
analyzed: 'di yi zhes bya ba ni kun rdzob pa'i'o //
translated: ‚Äú This‚Äù refers to the conventional.

original: brjod pa'i tshul gyis zhes bya ba ni gcig dang du ma'i rang bzhin stong pa nyid du bstan pas so //
analyzed: brjod pa'i tshul gyis zhes bya ba ni gcig dang du ma'i rang bzhin stong pa nyid du bstan pas so //
translated: ‚Äú By the mode of expression‚Äù refers to the teaching of the emptiness of the nature of one and many.

original: blo gros dang ldan pa zhes bya ba ni bod pa'o //
analyzed: blo gros dang ldan pa zhes bya ba ni bod pa'o //
translated: ‚Äú The wise‚Äù refers to the learned.

original: shing rta la sogs pa yang zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni dpe bsgrub par bya bas stong pa nyid du ston par byed do chos nyid 'di las zhes bya ba ni kun rdzob kyi mtshan nyid kyi rgyu'i chos nyid las te /
analyzed: shing rta la sogs pa yang zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni dpe bsgrub par bya bas stong pa nyid du ston par byed do chos nyid 'di las zhes bya ba ni kun rdzob kyi mtshan nyid kyi rgyu'i chos nyid las te /
translated: ‚Äú Even a chariot‚Äù and so on teaches that the example lacks the property to be proven. ‚Äú From this reality‚Äù refers to the reality of the cause, the characteristic of the conventional.

original: de'i rgyu rdul phra rab la sogs pa sngar dpyad zin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i rgyu rdul phra rab la sogs pa sngar dpyad zin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because its cause, the subtle particle, etc., has already been analyzed above.

original: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba ni ma brtags na nyams dga' bar 'dod pa kho na yin gyi /
analyzed: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba ni ma brtags na nyams dga' bar 'dod pa kho na yin gyi /
translated: Dependent origination is asserted to be delightful when not analyzed;

original: don dam par ni ma yin te /
analyzed: don dam par ni ma yin te /
translated: but not in the ultimate sense.

original: don dam par ni de @117a * //
analyzed: don dam par ni de @117a * //
translated: In the ultimate sense,üîΩit is beyond existence and nonexistence.

original: bzhin nyid yod pa dang med pa las rnam par 'das pa kho na yin no zhes slob dpon gyi tshig gis bstan pa'i phyir 'dir yang gsungs pa zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: bzhin nyid yod pa dang med pa las rnam par 'das pa kho na yin no zhes slob dpon gyi tshig gis bstan pa'i phyir 'dir yang gsungs pa zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: In order to demonstrate this with the words of a master, he says, ‚ÄúAs it is said.‚Äù

original: 'di ni 'phags pa klu sgrub kyi zhal snga nas kyis tha snyad grub pa las bstan to //
analyzed: 'di ni 'phags pa klu sgrub kyi zhal snga nas kyis tha snyad grub pa las bstan to //
translated: This is taught in ƒÄcƒÅrya NƒÅgƒÅrjuna‚Äôs Establishing the Conventional.

original: de las ni sngags dang sman dang sgyu ma'i dpes chos thams cad rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba nyid kyi gtan tshigs kyis don dam par yod pa dang med pa nyid las yang dag par 'das par sgrub par byed do //
analyzed: de las ni sngags dang sman dang sgyu ma'i dpes chos thams cad rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba nyid kyi gtan tshigs kyis don dam par yod pa dang med pa nyid las yang dag par 'das par sgrub par byed do //
translated: In that text, he proves that ultimately all things are beyond existence and nonexistence by means of the argument that all things are dependent origination, using the examples of a mantra, medicine, and a magical creation.

original: 'di ltar sngags ni yi ge re re 'am 'dus pa zhig yin par 'gyur grang na /
analyzed: 'di ltar sngags ni yi ge re re 'am 'dus pa zhig yin par 'gyur grang na /
translated: Thus, a mantra would be either a single syllable or a collection of syllables.

original: re zhig re re ni ma yin te /
analyzed: re zhig re re ni ma yin te /
translated: First, it is not a single syllable,

original: yi ge gcig brjod pa kho nas 'bras bu 'byung bar thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yi ge gcig brjod pa kho nas 'bras bu 'byung bar thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: because it would follow that the result would occur just by uttering a single syllable.

original: gang yang aa zhes bya ba la sogs pa yi ge gcig pa'i sngags 'byung ba de yang yi ge rnams ni cha shas dang bcas pa yin pa'i phyir yang dag par na gcig par mi rung ba nyid de de lta bas na /
analyzed: gang yang aa zhes bya ba la sogs pa yi ge gcig pa'i sngags 'byung ba de yang yi ge rnams ni cha shas dang bcas pa yin pa'i phyir yang dag par na gcig par mi rung ba nyid de de lta bas na /
translated: Also, that which is said to be a mantra of a single syllable such as ‚Äúa‚Äù is not suitable as a single syllable in reality because syllables have parts.

original: yi ge gcig sngags gang yang med de /
analyzed: yi ge gcig sngags gang yang med de /
translated: Thus, there is no mantra of a single syllable.

original: yi ge re re'i sngags med do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: yi ge re re'i sngags med do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning is that there is no mantra of a single syllable.

original: yi ge mang po gzhan yang med ces bya ba ni yi ge 'dus pa rnams kyang sngags ma yin pa ste /
analyzed: yi ge mang po gzhan yang med ces bya ba ni yi ge 'dus pa rnams kyang sngags ma yin pa ste /
translated: Also, there is no other mantra of many syllables means that a collection of syllables is not a mantra.

original: yi ge rnams ni rim gyis 'byung ba can yin pas tshogs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yi ge rnams ni rim gyis 'byung ba can yin pas tshogs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because syllables occur in sequence, they do not exist as a collection.

original: 'o na 'gags pa rnams tshogs par 'gyur ro snyam pa la /
analyzed: 'o na 'gags pa rnams tshogs par 'gyur ro snyam pa la /
translated: If you think that a collection of syllables that have ceased would exist,üîΩthen NƒÅgƒÅrjuna explains:

original: yi ge 'gags pa rnams min la zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: yi ge 'gags pa rnams min la zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: ‚ÄúNot the ceased syllables‚Äù is stated.

original: 'gags pa zhes bya ba ni rang gi ngo bo las nyams pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'gags pa zhes bya ba ni rang gi ngo bo las nyams pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Ceased means that they have lost their intrinsic reality.

original: gang dag rang gi ngo bo las nyams pa de dag ni bdag nyid med pa yin na gang dag rang gi bdag nyid med pa de dag ji ltar bsags par 'gyur /
analyzed: gang dag rang gi ngo bo las nyams pa de dag ni bdag nyid med pa yin na gang dag rang gi bdag nyid med pa de dag ji ltar bsags par 'gyur /
translated: Those that have lost their intrinsic reality are without self. How could those that are without self be accumulated?

original: de lta bas na re zhig sngags yod pa nyid bstsal ba yin no //
analyzed: de lta bas na re zhig sngags yod pa nyid bstsal ba yin no //
translated: Thus, first, the existence of the mantra is refuted.

original: 'o na ni shugs kyis med pa nyid du 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'o na ni shugs kyis med pa nyid du 'gyur te /
translated: But if it is not, then it would be nonexistent by implication.

original: de'i phyir rtog pa dang ldan pa rnams sngags grub par bya ba'i phyir 'bad pa don med pa kho na'o snyam pa la brten nas de ni med pa'ang min zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir rtog pa dang ldan pa rnams sngags grub par bya ba'i phyir 'bad pa don med pa kho na'o snyam pa la brten nas de ni med pa'ang min zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Therefore, those who are rational think that the effort to achieve the mantra is meaningless. In response to this, it says, ‚ÄúIt is not nonexistent.‚Äù

original: rkan la sogs pa'i byed pa las yi ge rnams 'byung ba yang mthong sa de las kyang dug sel ba la sogs pa'i 'bras bu 'byung ba yang mthong na /
analyzed: rkan la sogs pa'i byed pa las yi ge rnams 'byung ba yang mthong sa de las kyang dug sel ba la sogs pa'i 'bras bu 'byung ba yang mthong na /
translated: The arising of the syllables from the action of the palate and so on is seen, and the effect of removing poison and so on is also seen.

original: ji ltar gcig tu med pa nyid du 'gyur /
analyzed: ji ltar gcig tu med pa nyid du 'gyur /
translated: How could it be nonexistent?

original: 'dis ni sngags kyi dpe bsgrub par bya ba ma tshang ba nyid yongs su spangs so //
analyzed: 'dis ni sngags kyi dpe bsgrub par bya ba ma tshang ba nyid yongs su spangs so //
translated: This completely eliminates the incompleteness of the example of mantra.

original: sman gyi dpe'i yang yongs su spang ba'i phyir /üîΩde bzhin rang gi yan lag las //
analyzed: sman gyi dpe'i yang yongs su spang ba'i phyir / de bzhin rang gi yan lag las //
translated: In order to completely eliminate the example of medicine,üîΩhe says,üîΩ‚ÄúIn the same way, from its own parts,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa @117b smos so //üîΩgal te zva rgod dang gla sgang la sogs pa rang gi yan lag rnams las sman tha dad pa zhig yin na ni de'i tshe dmigs pa'i rig byar gyur pa'i phyir /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa @117b smos so // gal te zva rgod dang gla sgang la sogs pa rang gi yan lag rnams las sman tha dad pa zhig yin na ni de'i tshe dmigs pa'i rig byar gyur pa'i phyir /
translated: etc.

original: logs shig na dmigs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: logs shig na dmigs par 'gyur ro //
translated: If medicine were different from its own parts, such as turmeric and ginger, etc., then it would be perceived separately, because it would be the object of perception.

original: ji ste dmigs pa'i rig byar gyur pa ma yin na ni de'i tshe yan lag rgyur byed pa don med pa kho nar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ji ste dmigs pa'i rig byar gyur pa ma yin na ni de'i tshe yan lag rgyur byed pa don med pa kho nar 'gyur ro //
translated: But if it is not the object of perception, then it is completely pointless to make its parts the cause.

original: ji ste yan lag 'dus pa tsam sman yin no snyam na de yang rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: ji ste yan lag 'dus pa tsam sman yin no snyam na de yang rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: If you think that the mere collection of parts is medicine, that is also unreasonable,

original: de'i yan lag rnams kyang 'dus pa tsam gyi rang bzhin yin pas rang gi ngo bo ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i yan lag rnams kyang 'dus pa tsam gyi rang bzhin yin pas rang gi ngo bo ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because its parts also have the nature of mere collection, so their own nature is not established.

original: rang gi ngo bo ma grub pa rnams kyang ji ltar 'dus par 'grub par 'gyur /
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo ma grub pa rnams kyang ji ltar 'dus par 'grub par 'gyur /
translated: How could those that do not exist by way of their own entity be established as a collection?

original: sgyu ma'i dpe las yang bsgrub par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: sgyu ma'i dpe las yang bsgrub par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to prove that by means of the example of illusion,

original: sgyu ma'i glang po de yang snang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: sgyu ma'i glang po de yang snang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: he says, ‚ÄúThat illusory elephant is also seen, etc.‚Äù

original: 'di ltar sgyu ma'i glang po che de ni 'jim pa'i dum bu la sogs pa las tha dad pa'am tha dad pa ma yin pa zhig tu 'gyur grang na /
analyzed: 'di ltar sgyu ma'i glang po che de ni 'jim pa'i dum bu la sogs pa las tha dad pa'am tha dad pa ma yin pa zhig tu 'gyur grang na /
translated: Thus, that illusory elephant is either different from the lump of clay, etc. or not different.

original: re zhig tha dad par ni ma yin te /
analyzed: re zhig tha dad par ni ma yin te /
translated: First, it is not different because

original: 'di ltar sgyu ma mkhan dang sgyu ma'i rgyu de dag las gud na mi snang ba'i phyir ro zhes khong nas 'byung ngo //
analyzed: 'di ltar sgyu ma mkhan dang sgyu ma'i rgyu de dag las gud na mi snang ba'i phyir ro zhes khong nas 'byung ngo //
translated: it does not appear apart from the magician and the illusory causes.

original: yang na de dag las zhes bya ba ni sngags dang sman dag las te /
analyzed: yang na de dag las zhes bya ba ni sngags dang sman dag las te /
translated: Or, ‚Äúfrom them‚Äù refers to the mantra and medicine.

original: gang gis ni de dag las tha dad par 'gyur ba 'jim pa'i dum bu la sogs pa dag las logs shig tu ni sgyu ma'i glang po che yang dag par mi dmigs so //
analyzed: gang gis ni de dag las tha dad par 'gyur ba 'jim pa'i dum bu la sogs pa dag las logs shig tu ni sgyu ma'i glang po che yang dag par mi dmigs so //
translated: The illusory elephant is not perceived as different from them, apart from the lump of clay, etc.

original: tha dad pa ma yin pa yang ma yin no snyam pa la /
analyzed: tha dad pa ma yin pa yang ma yin no snyam pa la /
translated: It is not non-different.

original: gzhan min min zhes bya ba smos te /üîΩrigs pa zhes bya ba lhag ma yin no //üîΩgzhan ni tha dad pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gzhan min min zhes bya ba smos te / rigs pa zhes bya ba lhag ma yin no // gzhan ni tha dad pa zhes bya'o //
translated: To this he says, ‚ÄúIt is not non-other,‚ÄùüîΩand the rest is for the purpose of clarifying this.üîΩ‚ÄúOther‚Äù means ‚Äúdifferent.‚Äù

original: gzhan ma yin pa ni tha dad pa ma yin pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
analyzed: gzhan ma yin pa ni tha dad pa ma yin pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
translated: ‚ÄúNon-other‚Äù means ‚Äúnon-different.‚Äù

original: de lta bu kho nar mig ma 'khrul pa can rnams kyis mi mthong ba'i phyir tha dad pa ma yin pa'ang ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de lta bu kho nar mig ma 'khrul pa can rnams kyis mi mthong ba'i phyir tha dad pa ma yin pa'ang ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Since those with unmistaken eyes do not see it in that way, it is not non-different.

original: 'o na ni de med pa kho na yin no snyam pa la /
analyzed: 'o na ni de med pa kho na yin no snyam pa la /
translated: But if it is not different or non-different, then it must be nonexistent.

original: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba de zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba de zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: To this he says, ‚ÄúThat dependent origination,‚Äù and so on.

original: de zhes bya ba ni sgyu ma'i glang po che ste /
analyzed: de zhes bya ba ni sgyu ma'i glang po che ste /
translated: ‚ÄúThat‚Äù refers to the illusory elephant.

original: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba yin pa'i phyir med do zhes brjod par yang mi nus la /
analyzed: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba yin pa'i phyir med do zhes brjod par yang mi nus la /
translated: Since it is dependently originated, it cannot be said to be nonexistent.

original: de nyid dang gzhan du brjod par bya ba ma yin pa'i phyir yod do zhes brjod par yang mi nus pas de'i phyir dpe grub pa yin no //
analyzed: de nyid dang gzhan du brjod par bya ba ma yin pa'i phyir yod do zhes brjod par yang mi nus pas de'i phyir dpe grub pa yin no //
translated: Since it cannot be said to be either the same as or different from that, it cannot be said to exist. Therefore, the example is established.

original: phyogs kyi chos bsdu ba'i phyir de la dmigs par byed pa yin zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: phyogs kyi chos bsdu ba'i phyir de la dmigs par byed pa yin zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: In order to include the property of the position, he says, ‚Äúthat which has the mode of apprehension of that.‚Äù

original: gang la gzugs kyi skye mched de la dmigs pa'i ngang tshul yod pa de la de skad @118a * //
analyzed: gang la gzugs kyi skye mched de la dmigs pa'i ngang tshul yod pa de la de skad @118a * //
translated: That which has the mode of apprehension of the form base is so called.

original: ces bya'o // mig gi zhes bya ba ni mjug lnga pa can yin te /
analyzed: ces bya'o // mig gi zhes bya ba ni mjug lnga pa can yin te /
translated: ‚ÄúOf the eye‚Äù is a five-case genitive,

original: mig nas 'byung ngo zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: mig nas 'byung ngo zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: meaning ‚Äúarising from the eye.‚Äù

original: yang na 'di ni mjug drug pa can yin te /
analyzed: yang na 'di ni mjug drug pa can yin te /
translated: Or this is a six-case genitive,

original: mig dang 'brel pa can gyi mig gi rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
analyzed: mig dang 'brel pa can gyi mig gi rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
translated: meaning ‚Äúthe eye consciousness that is related to the eye.‚Äù

original: srid pa las 'byung ngo zhes 'og nas 'byung ba dang sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: srid pa las 'byung ngo zhes 'og nas 'byung ba dang sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: It should be connected with the following, ‚Äúarising from existence.‚Äù

original: las kyi bag chags 'bras bu 'byin pa la mngon du phyogs par gyur pa ni srid pa'o //
analyzed: las kyi bag chags 'bras bu 'byin pa la mngon du phyogs par gyur pa ni srid pa'o //
translated: Existence is the approach of the fruition of the latent propensities of karma.

original: las dang nyon mongs dbang 'phangs pa //
analyzed: las dang nyon mongs dbang 'phangs pa //
translated: Propelled by karma and afflictions,

original: zhes bya ba ni chod pa'i las kyi dbang gis 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni chod pa'i las kyi dbang gis 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is projected by the power of karma that is to be experienced.

original: len bcas pa ni zag pa dang bcas pa ste /
analyzed: len bcas pa ni zag pa dang bcas pa ste /
translated: That which is associated with appropriation is contaminated.

original: srid pa las de lta bu'i ngo bo byung ba zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: srid pa las de lta bu'i ngo bo byung ba zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: The meaning of the phrase ‚Äúarises from that sort of existence‚Äù should be supplied.

original: de bzhin du zhes bya ba ni las dang nyon mongs pa'i dbang gis 'phangs pa nye bar len pa dang bcas pa bzhin du'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du zhes bya ba ni las dang nyon mongs pa'i dbang gis 'phangs pa nye bar len pa dang bcas pa bzhin du'o //
translated: Just as, means just as it is propelled by the power of karma and afflictions, and is associated with appropriation.

original: srid pa'i yan lag kun zhes bya ba ni ma rig pa la sogs pa rnams so //
analyzed: srid pa'i yan lag kun zhes bya ba ni ma rig pa la sogs pa rnams so //
translated: All the members of existence, means ignorance, etc.

original: de la sbyor ba ni 'di ltar bya ste /
analyzed: de la sbyor ba ni 'di ltar bya ste /
translated: The argument is to be formulated as follows:

original: gang dang gang dag rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba de dag ni don dam par yod pa dang med pa nyid kyi tha snyad kyi lam las 'das pa'i yul yin te /
analyzed: gang dang gang dag rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba de dag ni don dam par yod pa dang med pa nyid kyi tha snyad kyi lam las 'das pa'i yul yin te /
translated: Whatever is dependently arisen is an object that transcends the sphere of the description ‚Äúultimately existent‚Äù or ‚Äúnonexistent,‚Äù

original: dper na sngags la sogs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na sngags la sogs pa lta bu'o //
translated: like a magical creation, etc.

original: rnam par shes pa la sogs pa 'di dag kyang de dang 'dra bas na rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa la sogs pa 'di dag kyang de dang 'dra bas na rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //
translated: Since these consciousnesses, etc. are also like that, it is a natural inference.

original: gal te de lta na ji ltar bcom ldan 'das kyis 'du byed rnams ni rtag pa med ces bya ba la sogs pas dngos po rnams skye ba la sogs par bstan snyam pa la /
analyzed: gal te de lta na ji ltar bcom ldan 'das kyis 'du byed rnams ni rtag pa med ces bya ba la sogs pas dngos po rnams skye ba la sogs par bstan snyam pa la /
translated: If that is so, how is it that the Lord has taught the production, etc. of things, saying, ‚ÄúConditionings are not permanent,‚Äù etc.?

original: 'di ltar 'gog pa la sogs pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'gog pa la sogs pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: To this he says, ‚ÄúIn this way, the cessation, etc. of things,‚Äù etc.

original: gang gi phyir dgongs nas bstan pa de'i phyir 'gal ba med do zhes bya ba lhag ma yin no //üîΩdgongs pa ni skye ba la sogs pa ji ltar snang ba kho na bzhin yod pa'i phyir de las dgongs nas /
analyzed: gang gi phyir dgongs nas bstan pa de'i phyir 'gal ba med do zhes bya ba lhag ma yin no // dgongs pa ni skye ba la sogs pa ji ltar snang ba kho na bzhin yod pa'i phyir de las dgongs nas /
translated: Since it is taught with a special intention, therefore there is no contradiction, is the remainder.

original: bdag med pa la 'jug par bya ba'i phyir skye ba la sogs pa bstan to snyam pa yin no //üîΩji ltar sman yang sman min pa //
analyzed: bdag med pa la 'jug par bya ba'i phyir skye ba la sogs pa bstan to snyam pa yin no // ji ltar sman yang sman min pa //
translated: The intention is that since production, etc. exist just as they appear, with that intention he taught production, etc. in order to introduce people to selflessness.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni ji skad bshad pa'i don gyi mjug sdud do //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni ji skad bshad pa'i don gyi mjug sdud do //
translated: ‚ÄúJust as medicine is not medicine,‚Äù etc. concludes the meaning as it has been explained.

original: gnyis ka zhes bya ba ni rgyu dang 'bras bu'o //
analyzed: gnyis ka zhes bya ba ni rgyu dang 'bras bu'o //
translated: ‚ÄúBoth‚Äù refers to cause and effect.

original: chos thams cad rang bzhin med pa nyid du zin na zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni sbyor ba'i gzhi nyid la dam bcas pa dang lung dang 'gal bar ston par byed de /
analyzed: chos thams cad rang bzhin med pa nyid du zin na zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni sbyor ba'i gzhi nyid la dam bcas pa dang lung dang 'gal bar ston par byed de /
translated: ‚Äú If all phenomena are essenceless‚Äù and so forth shows that the basis of the argument itself contradicts the thesis and the scriptures.

original: 'di ltar grub pa'i mtha' las ni mthong ba dang thos pa @118b dang ; bye brag phyed pa dang / rnam par shes pa'i don rnams la de bzhin du smra ba gang yin pa 'di ni 'phags pa rnams kyi tha snyad yin la /
analyzed: 'di ltar grub pa'i mtha' las ni mthong ba dang thos pa @118b dang ; bye brag phyed pa dang / rnam par shes pa'i don rnams la de bzhin du smra ba gang yin pa 'di ni 'phags pa rnams kyi tha snyad yin la /
translated: This is because the treatise presents the following: ‚ÄúThe noble ones‚Äô convention is to say that things seen, heard, distinguished, and cognized exist in just the way they are.üîΩThe opposite of this is the convention of the non-noble ones.‚Äù

original: bzlog ste smra ba ni 'phags pa ma yin pa rnams kyi tha snyad yin no zhes bstan na de yang mthong ba la sogs pa'i don med pa'i phyir rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: bzlog ste smra ba ni 'phags pa ma yin pa rnams kyi tha snyad yin no zhes bstan na de yang mthong ba la sogs pa'i don med pa'i phyir rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: But this is not right, because objects such as seeing do not exist.

original: nam mkha'i me tog ni nam mkha'i padma'o //
analyzed: nam mkha'i me tog ni nam mkha'i padma'o //
translated: A sky flower is a flower in the sky.

original: da dang mtshungs pa ni 'dra ba'o //
analyzed: da dang mtshungs pa ni 'dra ba'o //
translated: It is similar to that.

original: klan ka 'di ni snying po yod pa ma yin te zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni lan 'debs so //
analyzed: klan ka 'di ni snying po yod pa ma yin te zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni lan 'debs so //
translated: The response to this is ‚ÄúThis objection has no force,‚Äù and so on.

original: de la bsdus pa'i don ni pha rol po dag gis ji ltar snang ba las 'das par rigs pa kho nas dngos po rnams kyi rang bzhin yod do zhes sgro 'dogs par byed pa de kho na 'gog par byed kyi /
analyzed: de la bsdus pa'i don ni pha rol po dag gis ji ltar snang ba las 'das par rigs pa kho nas dngos po rnams kyi rang bzhin yod do zhes sgro 'dogs par byed pa de kho na 'gog par byed kyi /
translated: The condensed meaning of this is that we refute only the superimposition by others that the intrinsic reality of things exists by means of reasoning that transcends what is commonly acknowledged.

original: sngon po la sogs pa snang ba ma brtags gcig pu na nyams dga' ba la sogs pa 'gog pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: sngon po la sogs pa snang ba ma brtags gcig pu na nyams dga' ba la sogs pa 'gog pa ni ma yin no //
translated: We do not refute the appearance of blue and so on, which is delightful when left unanalyzed.

original: don dam par ni dpyad na yod pa 'ga' yang ma grub pa'i phyir yod par yang khas mi len la med par yang khas mi len te ;
analyzed: don dam par ni dpyad na yod pa 'ga' yang ma grub pa'i phyir yod par yang khas mi len la med par yang khas mi len te ;
translated: When analyzed in terms of the ultimate, since nothing at all is established as existent, we do not accept existence, nor do we accept nonexistence.

original: med pa ni dngos po ldog pa'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir yod pa ma grub na yod pa sngon du 'gro ba can gyi med pa yang ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: med pa ni dngos po ldog pa'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir yod pa ma grub na yod pa sngon du 'gro ba can gyi med pa yang ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because nonexistence is the characteristic of the negation of an existent thing, and if existence is not established, then nonexistence, which is preceded by existence, is also not established.

original: de'i phyir gcig tu yod pa dang med pa'i phyogs la yod pa'i nyes pas kho bo cag la mi dgos so zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de'i phyir gcig tu yod pa dang med pa'i phyogs la yod pa'i nyes pas kho bo cag la mi dgos so zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Therefore, the fault of existence and non-existence in the one position is not necessary for us. This is the meaning.

original: myong ba zhes bya ba ni sngon po la sogs pa myong ba'o //
analyzed: myong ba zhes bya ba ni sngon po la sogs pa myong ba'o //
translated: Experience means the experience of blue, etc.

original: 'o na gang zhig 'gog par byed snyam pa la /
analyzed: 'o na gang zhig 'gog par byed snyam pa la /
translated: If you ask, What is being refuted?

original: 'bras bu yang dag par yod pa dang med pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: 'bras bu yang dag par yod pa dang med pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The response is The existence or non-existence of the effect, etc.

original: 'bras bu yod par smra ba ni ser skya ba rnams so //
analyzed: 'bras bu yod par smra ba ni ser skya ba rnams so //
translated: The proponents of the existence of the effect are the SƒÅ·πÉkhyas.

original: 'bras bu med par smra ba ni bye brag pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'bras bu med par smra ba ni bye brag pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The proponents of the non-existence of the effect are the Vai≈õe·π£ikas, etc.

original: gnyi gar smra ba ni 'tsho ba pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: gnyi gar smra ba ni 'tsho ba pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The proponents of both are the Jains, etc.

original: yod pa dang med pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa rnam par 'byed pa ni 'phags pa lha'i tshigs su bcad pa 'di dang sbyar ba de'i phyir zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: yod pa dang med pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa rnam par 'byed pa ni 'phags pa lha'i tshigs su bcad pa 'di dang sbyar ba de'i phyir zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: The analysis of existence and non-existence, etc. is connected with this verse of ƒÄryadeva. Therefore, he says because of that.

original: 'di ni zhes bya ba ni phyogs dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: 'di ni zhes bya ba ni phyogs dang sbyar ro //
translated: This is connected with the position.

original: de'i phyir yang dag nyid du na zhes bya ba la sogs pa tshigs su bcad pa 'di ni slob dpon bdag nyid kyi yin no //üîΩ'dis ni tshad ma'i 'bras bu lung gi don dang sbyar ba'am /
analyzed: de'i phyir yang dag nyid du na zhes bya ba la sogs pa tshigs su bcad pa 'di ni slob dpon bdag nyid kyi yin no // 'dis ni tshad ma'i 'bras bu lung gi don dang sbyar ba'am /
translated: Therefore, this verse beginning with ‚ÄúIn reality‚Äù is that of the Master himself.üîΩThis verse shows the result of valid knowledge applied to the meaning of scripture,

original: lung gi don tshad ma'i 'bras bu dang sbyor bar byed do //
analyzed: lung gi don tshad ma'i 'bras bu dang sbyor bar byed do //
translated: or it shows the meaning of scripture applied to the result of valid knowledge.

original: 'dir yang gang gi phyir zhes bya ba la ltos par bya ste /üîΩdes na don ni gang gi phyir dngos po 'ga' yang yang dag par bsgrub pa /
analyzed: 'dir yang gang gi phyir zhes bya ba la ltos par bya ste / des na don ni gang gi phyir dngos po 'ga' yang yang dag par bsgrub pa /
translated: Here too, one should supply ‚Äúbecause.‚Äù

original: med pa de'i @119a * //
analyzed: med pa de'i @119a * //
translated: Thus, the meaning is: Because there is no establishment of any thing whatsoever,

original: phyir chos thams cad ma skyes pa'o zhes bya /
analyzed: phyir chos thams cad ma skyes pa'o zhes bya /
translated: therefore, all phenomena are said to be non-arisen.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs so zhes bya ba 'di yin no //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs so zhes bya ba 'di yin no //
translated: This is what the Buddha, the Blessed One, said.

original: gzhan yang zhes bya ba ni rga ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang zhes bya ba ni rga ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúMoreover‚Äù refers to aging and so on.

original: de la brten pa zhes bya ba ni skye ba la brten pa'o //
analyzed: de la brten pa zhes bya ba ni skye ba la brten pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúDependent on that‚Äù means dependent on arising.

original: 'byung ba med pa zhes bya ba ni gang dag la 'byung ba med pa yod pa de dag la de skad ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'byung ba med pa zhes bya ba ni gang dag la 'byung ba med pa yod pa de dag la de skad ces bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúNon-arising‚Äù means that which has non-arising.

original: rang bzhin yod pa ma yin te zhes bya ba ni gcig pa nyid la sogs pas dpyad na don dam par gang la rang bzhin yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //üîΩrang bzhin med pas gzhan rkyen ji ltar 'gyur zhes bya ba ni ri bong gi rva la sogs pa bzhin du rtag tu rang bzhin med pa'i phyir gzhan gyi rkyen du rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: rang bzhin yod pa ma yin te zhes bya ba ni gcig pa nyid la sogs pas dpyad na don dam par gang la rang bzhin yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go // rang bzhin med pas gzhan rkyen ji ltar 'gyur zhes bya ba ni ri bong gi rva la sogs pa bzhin du rtag tu rang bzhin med pa'i phyir gzhan gyi rkyen du rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: ‚ÄúThere is no intrinsic reality‚Äù means that when analyzed in terms of sameness and so on, ultimately there is no intrinsic reality.üîΩ‚ÄúHow can something without intrinsic reality be a condition of something else?‚Äù means that, like the horns of a rabbit and so on, it is not logical that something that is always without intrinsic reality be a condition of something else.

original: rang bzhin med pas gzhan gyis ji ltar bskyed ces bya ba ni rkyen gzhan yang de'i 'bras bu rtag tu med pa'i phyir ri bong gi rva la sogs pa lta bu kho na yin na rang bzhin yod pa ma yin pa ji ltar bskyed ces bya ba'i tha
analyzed: rang bzhin med pas gzhan gyis ji ltar bskyed ces bya ba ni rkyen gzhan yang de'i 'bras bu rtag tu med pa'i phyir ri bong gi rva la sogs pa lta bu kho na yin na rang bzhin yod pa ma yin pa ji ltar bskyed ces bya ba'i tha
translated: ‚ÄúHow can something without intrinsic reality be produced by something else?‚Äù means that, like the horns of a rabbit and so on, since the other conditions are always without the effect, how can something without intrinsic reality be produced?

original: tshig go // 'di zhes bya ba ni don dam par skyed pa po ma yin pa nyid do //
analyzed: tshig go // 'di zhes bya ba ni don dam par skyed pa po ma yin pa nyid do //
translated: ‚ÄúThis‚Äù means that ultimately it is not a producer.

original: yang na rgyu zhes bya ba'i sgras ni rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba mtshon par byed do //
analyzed: yang na rgyu zhes bya ba'i sgras ni rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba mtshon par byed do //
translated: Or else, the word ‚Äúcause‚Äù indicates dependent origination.

original: des na rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba don dam par skye ba med pa'i mtshan nyid can 'di bde bar gshegs pas bstan to zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go ;
analyzed: des na rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba don dam par skye ba med pa'i mtshan nyid can 'di bde bar gshegs pas bstan to zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go ;
translated: Therefore, the Sugata has taught this dependent origination, which is characterized by ultimate non-arising.

original: / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba la 'jug pas zhes bya ba ni ma rig pa la sogs pa'i rang bzhin dpyad pas zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba la 'jug pas zhes bya ba ni ma rig pa la sogs pa'i rang bzhin dpyad pas zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: ‚ÄúBy engaging in dependent origination‚Äù means by analyzing the nature of ignorance, etc.

original: chos kyi dbyings zhes bya ba ni chos thams cad kyi rang bzhin skye ba med pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings zhes bya ba ni chos thams cad kyi rang bzhin skye ba med pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: The ‚ÄúdharmadhƒÅtu‚Äù is the nature of all phenomena, which is characterized by non-arising.

original: ming ma mchis pa zhes bya ba ni sgra'i spyod yul ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: ming ma mchis pa zhes bya ba ni sgra'i spyod yul ma yin pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúWithout name‚Äù means not being the domain of sound.

original: mtshan nyid ma mchis pa zhes bya ba ni skye ba la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: mtshan nyid ma mchis pa zhes bya ba ni skye ba la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid dang bral ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúWithout characteristics‚Äù means being free from the characteristics of arising, etc.

original: mtshan ma ma mchis pa zhes bya ba ni 'du shes kyi yul sngon po la sogs pa'i mtshan ma med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mtshan ma ma mchis pa zhes bya ba ni 'du shes kyi yul sngon po la sogs pa'i mtshan ma med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Signless means that there is no sign of the object of perception, such as blue, etc.

original: gdags su ma mchis pa zhes bya ba ni rnam par rtog pa'i yul ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gdags su ma mchis pa zhes bya ba ni rnam par rtog pa'i yul ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Non-apprehensible means that it is not the object of conceptual thought.

original: 'o na ji ltar de dag bstan snyam pa la /
analyzed: 'o na ji ltar de dag bstan snyam pa la /
translated: But how are they taught?

original: gzhan du ma lags kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: gzhan du ma lags kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Not otherwise and so on.

original: sems can rnams gzung ba'i don du ming la sogs pa tsam gyis ston par zad kyi gzhan du ni ma yin no zhes bya bar sbyar te /
analyzed: sems can rnams gzung ba'i don du ming la sogs pa tsam gyis ston par zad kyi gzhan du ni ma yin no zhes bya bar sbyar te /
translated: It is only by the mere names, etc. for the purpose of apprehending sentient beings, but not otherwise.

original: 'dir yang bstan pa zhes bya ba khong nas 'byung ngo //
analyzed: 'dir yang bstan pa zhes bya ba khong nas 'byung ngo //
translated: Teaching is supplied from the previous verse.

original: ming tsam zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshig @119b rnams ni tshig gnyis gnyis shing tshig snga ma snga ma'i bshad pa phyi ma phyi ma yin no //
analyzed: ming tsam zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshig @119b rnams ni tshig gnyis gnyis shing tshig snga ma snga ma'i bshad pa phyi ma phyi ma yin no //
translated: The words mere name, etc. are in pairs, and the latter explain the former.

original: kun rdzob ni 'dir kun rdzob kyi shes pa la snang ba'i ngang can gyi ngo bo yin par dgongs so //
analyzed: kun rdzob ni 'dir kun rdzob kyi shes pa la snang ba'i ngang can gyi ngo bo yin par dgongs so //
translated: The conventional here is considered to be the nature that appears to conventional cognition.
