original: 'dis mngon par rjod par byed pas na brjod pa ste rnam par rtog pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'dis mngon par rjod par byed pas na brjod pa ste rnam par rtog pa zhes bya'o //
translated: It is called expression because it expresses, or it is called imagination.

original: yang na 'di dag thams cad ni rnam grangs yin no //
analyzed: yang na 'di dag thams cad ni rnam grangs yin no //
translated: Or, all of these are synonyms.

original: yang na dang po'i bshad pa lhag ma yin no //
analyzed: yang na dang po'i bshad pa lhag ma yin no //
translated: Or, the first explanation is the remainder.

original: ma rig pa dus gsum du med du zin kyang ci'i phyir gdags pa'i yul ma yin snyam pa la /
analyzed: ma rig pa dus gsum du med du zin kyang ci'i phyir gdags pa'i yul ma yin snyam pa la /
translated: Even though ignorance does not exist in the three times, why is it not the object of designation?

original: ma rig pa de ni zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: ma rig pa de ni zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: In response, it is said, ‚ÄúThat ignorance . . . ‚Äù

original: 'o na ni thams cad ming tsam du yod par khas blangs pa'i phyir ming tsam bden par yod do snyam pa la /
analyzed: 'o na ni thams cad ming tsam du yod par khas blangs pa'i phyir ming tsam bden par yod do snyam pa la /
translated: If that is so, since it is accepted that everything exists as mere name, it is thought that mere name truly exists.

original: bcom ldan 'das gang ming tsam zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das gang ming tsam zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: In response, it is said, ‚ÄúBhagavƒÅn, that which is mere name . . . ‚Äù

original: de ltar byas na zhes bya ba ni ma rig pa la sogs pa dus gsum du yang med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ltar byas na zhes bya ba ni ma rig pa la sogs pa dus gsum du yang med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: In that case, because ignorance and so on do not exist in the three times.

original: yang de nyid las zhes bya ba ni yab dang sras mjal ba'i mdo las so //
analyzed: yang de nyid las zhes bya ba ni yab dang sras mjal ba'i mdo las so //
translated: In that very text, in the Meeting of Father and Son S≈´tra, it says,üîΩ‚ÄúBhagavƒÅn, that which is mere name . . . ‚Äù

original: gal te skye ba la sogs pa kun tu brtags pa'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir dngos po rnams kyi skye ba la sogs pa khas mi len na /
analyzed: gal te skye ba la sogs pa kun tu brtags pa'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir dngos po rnams kyi skye ba la sogs pa khas mi len na /
translated: If one does not accept the production, etc. of things because production, etc. are imagined entities,

original: 'o na ji ltar bcom ldan 'das kyis skye ba med pa ni bden no zhes bya ba la sogs pas skye ba med pa la sogs pa bden pa nyid du gsungs snyam pa la /
analyzed: 'o na ji ltar bcom ldan 'das kyis skye ba med pa ni bden no zhes bya ba la sogs pas skye ba med pa la sogs pa bden pa nyid du gsungs snyam pa la /
translated: then how is it that the Lord has said that non-production, etc. are true, etc. in such passages as ‚Äúnon-production is true‚Äù?

original: skye ba med pa la sogs pa yang zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: skye ba med pa la sogs pa yang zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: The word ‚Äúalso‚Äù in ‚Äúnon-production, etc.‚Äù

original: de zhes bya ba ni don dam pa'o //
analyzed: de zhes bya ba ni don dam pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThat‚Äù refers to the ultimate.

original: skye ba med pa la sogs par rnam par rtog pa dang / rnam par rtog pas dngos po rnams kyi ngo bo rnam par gzhag pa ni skye ba med pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: skye ba med pa la sogs par rnam par rtog pa dang / rnam par rtog pas dngos po rnams kyi ngo bo rnam par gzhag pa ni skye ba med pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The conceptualization of non-production, etc. and the positing of the nature of things by conceptualization is non-production, etc.

original: stsogs pa'i sgras ni 'gog pa dang zhi ba la sogs pa bsdu'o //
analyzed: stsogs pa'i sgras ni 'gog pa dang zhi ba la sogs pa bsdu'o //
translated: The word ‚Äúetc.‚Äù includes cessation, peace, etc.

original: yang de med par don dam pa la 'dzeg mi nus sam zhe na /
analyzed: yang de med par don dam pa la 'dzeg mi nus sam zhe na /
translated: But can one not ascend to the ultimate without that?

original: gang gi phyir de lta bu'i ngo bo bstan pa'i phyir de skad ces bya snyam pa la /
analyzed: gang gi phyir de lta bu'i ngo bo bstan pa'i phyir de skad ces bya snyam pa la /
translated: In order to demonstrate that such is the case, he says, ‚ÄúBecause of that, it is said‚Ä¶‚Äù

original: yang dag kun rdzob rnams kyi skas //üîΩzhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: yang dag kun rdzob rnams kyi skas // zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: are the steps for climbing to the palace of the ultimate.

original: yang dag pa nyid khang pa yin no //
analyzed: yang dag pa nyid khang pa yin no //
translated: The correct relative is the palace.

original: de'i steng ni rab kyi mtha' ste der 'gro bar zhes bsdu'o //
analyzed: de'i steng ni rab kyi mtha' ste der 'gro bar zhes bsdu'o //
translated: The peak of existence is the top step, and one goes there.

original: yang dag kun rdzob nyid them skas bzhin du skas yin te /
analyzed: yang dag kun rdzob nyid them skas bzhin du skas yin te /
translated: The correct relative is the steps, like a staircase.

original: gom pa'i rten zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: gom pa'i rten zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It is the support for the steps, that is, the meaning of the passage.

original: 'di ni slob dpon snang bral gyis dbu ma'i snying po las gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni slob dpon snang bral gyis dbu ma'i snying po las gsungs pa yin no //
translated: This is stated by the master VidyƒÅkaraprabha in his Heart of the Middle Way.

original: des na gang la la gal te tshul gsum pa'i rtags kyis bskyed pa'i blo don dam pa'i sgrar brjod na ni de'i tshe de yang kun rdzob kyi ngo bo yin pa'i phyir ji ltar na don dam pa nyid yin /üîΩgal te yang de'i dbang gis dngos po rnams rang bzhin med pa nyid du rnam @120a * //
analyzed: des na gang la la gal te tshul gsum pa'i rtags kyis bskyed pa'i blo don dam pa'i sgrar brjod na ni de'i tshe de yang kun rdzob kyi ngo bo yin pa'i phyir ji ltar na don dam pa nyid yin / gal te yang de'i dbang gis dngos po rnams rang bzhin med pa nyid du rnam @120a * //
translated: Therefore, if the cognition produced by a sign that has the three conditions is called the ultimate, then how can it be the ultimate, since it is the nature of the relative?

original: par 'jog na de yang gang gis gzhag par bya /
analyzed: par 'jog na de yang gang gis gzhag par bya /
translated: If things are posited as lacking intrinsic existence by the power of that cognition, then by what is that cognition itself posited?

original: de nyid kyis gzhan du ni rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de nyid kyis gzhan du ni rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: It cannot be posited by itself, because that would be to commit the error of reification.

original: rang gis bdag nyid la byed pa 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang gis bdag nyid la byed pa 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is contradictory for something to act on itself.

original: tshad ma gzhan gyis kyang ma yin te /
analyzed: tshad ma gzhan gyis kyang ma yin te /
translated: Nor is it by another valid cognition,

original: thug pa med par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thug pa med par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because an infinite regress would ensue.

original: ji ste blo de gcig pu ma gtogs par 'jog go zhe na /
analyzed: ji ste blo de gcig pu ma gtogs par 'jog go zhe na /
translated: But if you say that the cognition is posited as being only one,

original: 'o na ni yul thams cad bdag med par ma bsgrubs par 'gyur ro zhes rgol ba gang yin pa de yang 'di nyid kyis lan btab pa yin te /
analyzed: 'o na ni yul thams cad bdag med par ma bsgrubs par 'gyur ro zhes rgol ba gang yin pa de yang 'di nyid kyis lan btab pa yin te /
translated: then the opponent‚Äôs objection that ‚Äúall objects would not be established as selfless‚Äù is answered by this.

original: de yang don dam pa dang mthun pa'i phyir don dam pa nyid yin la rang bzhin med pa yang de nyid kyis rnam par 'jog go //
analyzed: de yang don dam pa dang mthun pa'i phyir don dam pa nyid yin la rang bzhin med pa yang de nyid kyis rnam par 'jog go //
translated: And that is ultimate because it is in accord with the ultimate, and it is also posited as essenceless.

original: rang gis bdag nyid la byed pa 'gal ba yang med de /
analyzed: rang gis bdag nyid la byed pa 'gal ba yang med de /
translated: And there is no contradiction in something acting on itself,

original: spyi'i ngo bor chos thams cad rang bzhin med pa nyid du rnam par 'jog pa'i phyir la /
analyzed: spyi'i ngo bor chos thams cad rang bzhin med pa nyid du rnam par 'jog pa'i phyir la /
translated: because all phenomena are posited as essenceless in general,

original: blo'i rang gi ngo bo yang spyi'i mtshan nyid der 'dus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: blo'i rang gi ngo bo yang spyi'i mtshan nyid der 'dus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: and the essence of the cognition is included in that definition of the general characteristic.

original: dper na chos thams cad la yod pa la sogs pa'i gtan tshigs rnams kyis 'jig pa nyid kyi rkyen du 'gyur ba na bdag nyid spangs nas ma yin pa ltar 'dir yang de dang 'dra bar klan kar mi rung ngo //
analyzed: dper na chos thams cad la yod pa la sogs pa'i gtan tshigs rnams kyis 'jig pa nyid kyi rkyen du 'gyur ba na bdag nyid spangs nas ma yin pa ltar 'dir yang de dang 'dra bar klan kar mi rung ngo //
translated: For example, when reasons such as existence are conditions for destruction of all things, they do not do so by abandoning their own nature. The same is true here. It is not proper to object.

original: skye ba med la sogs mi srid //
analyzed: skye ba med la sogs mi srid //
translated: Non-production, etc. are impossible.

original: ces bya ba ni don dam par skye ba med pa la sogs pa'i shes pa dang / mngon par brjod pa rnams 'jug pa mi srid do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: ces bya ba ni don dam par skye ba med pa la sogs pa'i shes pa dang / mngon par brjod pa rnams 'jug pa mi srid do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This means that the cognition of non-production, etc. ultimately, and the engagement of expressions are impossible.

original: ci'i phyir snyam pa la /
analyzed: ci'i phyir snyam pa la /
translated: Why?

original: de'i ngo bo dgag pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa tha ma smos te /
analyzed: de'i ngo bo dgag pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa tha ma smos te /
translated: The last line says, ‚Äúbecause of the negation of its nature,‚Äù etc.

original: gang gi phyir phyis brjod par bya ba'i ngo bo dgag par bya ba la don dam par de brjod pa'i sgra'i sbyor ba mi srid pa de'i phyir skye ba med pa la sogs pa mi srid do //
analyzed: gang gi phyir phyis brjod par bya ba'i ngo bo dgag par bya ba la don dam par de brjod pa'i sgra'i sbyor ba mi srid pa de'i phyir skye ba med pa la sogs pa mi srid do //
translated: Because later the negation of the nature of the object to be expressed is to be done, the application of the word expressing it ultimately is impossible. Therefore, non-production, etc. are impossible.

original: 'o na med pa 'ba' zhig sbyor bar 'gyur ro snyam pa la /
analyzed: 'o na med pa 'ba' zhig sbyor bar 'gyur ro snyam pa la /
translated: If you think that only non-existence will be applied,üîΩthen the verse says,

original: yul med pa la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: yul med pa la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: ‚ÄúWithout an object‚Äù and so on.

original: 'di snyam du don dam par skye ba la sogs pa med du zin kyang gzhan gyi rjes su smra bas blos skye ba la sogs pa gzhag ste /
analyzed: 'di snyam du don dam par skye ba la sogs pa med du zin kyang gzhan gyi rjes su smra bas blos skye ba la sogs pa gzhag ste /
translated: You might think that even though ultimately arising and so on do not exist, still, by following others, one posits arising and so on conceptually.

original: de dag bkag pas skye ba med pa la sogs pa rnam par 'jog par 'gyur ro snyam pa la /
analyzed: de dag bkag pas skye ba med pa la sogs pa rnam par 'jog par 'gyur ro snyam pa la /
translated: And by refuting them, one posits nonarising and so on.

original: rnam par rtog pa la brten na yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa la brten na yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: In response to this, Candrakƒ´rti says, ‚ÄúEven if one relies on conceptual thought,‚Äù and so on.

original: skye ba med pa la sogs pa rnam par rtog pa la brten pa nyid du khas len na skye ba med pa la sogs pa de kun rdzob yin gyi don dam pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: skye ba med pa la sogs pa rnam par rtog pa la brten pa nyid du khas len na skye ba med pa la sogs pa de kun rdzob yin gyi don dam pa ni ma yin te /
translated: If one accepts that nonarising and so on are dependent on conceptual thought, then nonarising and so on are conventional and not ultimate.

original: rnam par rtog pa la kun rdzob kyi ngo bo yin pa'i phyir dang / rnam par rtog pa'i spyod yul yang sgro btags pa'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir ji ltar don dam par @120b 'gyur; ;üîΩ// bam po bzhi pa ste tha ma'o //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa la kun rdzob kyi ngo bo yin pa'i phyir dang / rnam par rtog pa'i spyod yul yang sgro btags pa'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir ji ltar don dam par @120b 'gyur; ;üîΩ// bam po bzhi pa ste tha ma'o //
translated: For conceptual thought is the nature of the conventional, and the domain of conceptual thought is the nature of superimposition. So how could it be ultimate?

original: ji ste rang gi mtshan nyid ni zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni /
analyzed: ji ste rang gi mtshan nyid ni zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni /
translated: If one says own characteristic, etc.

original: rnam par rtog la brten na yang //
analyzed: rnam par rtog la brten na yang //
translated: Even if it were based on conceptualization,

original: kun rdzob par 'gyur yang dag min //
analyzed: kun rdzob par 'gyur yang dag min //
translated: it would be conventional, not real.

original: zhes bya ba phyogs snga ma dang bcas te rnam par 'grel par byed do //
analyzed: zhes bya ba phyogs snga ma dang bcas te rnam par 'grel par byed do //
translated: Thus, he interprets the opponent's position.

original: bag chags gang la thog ma med pa'i dus yod pa de las byung ba rnam par rtog pa gang yin pa de la snang ba'i ngang tshul can gyi don gang yin pa zhes tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
analyzed: bag chags gang la thog ma med pa'i dus yod pa de las byung ba rnam par rtog pa gang yin pa de la snang ba'i ngang tshul can gyi don gang yin pa zhes tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
translated: The meaning that appears in the conceptualization that arises from the habitual tendencies that have existed since beginningless time is the meaning that is the mode of appearance.

original: de nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir chos can 'di nyid la gnas nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: de nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir chos can 'di nyid la gnas nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: In order to demonstrate just that, he says abiding in this very basis, etc.

original: rnam par rtog pa la snang ba'i ngang can gyi don bkag na tha snyad thams cad chad par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa la snang ba'i ngang can gyi don bkag na tha snyad thams cad chad par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because if the meaning that appears in conceptualization were refuted, it would follow, absurdly, that all conventional activity would cease.

original: rnam par rtog pa yang zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni lan btab bo //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa yang zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni lan btab bo //
translated: To this he replies Conceptualization, etc.

original: bsam pa ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: bsam pa ni 'di yin te /
translated: The idea is as follows.

original: gal te rnam par rtog pa'i blo la snang ba'i ngang can nyid skye ba med pa la sogs pa yin na de'i tshe snang ba dang blo tha mi dad pa'i phyir de yang gong du rnam par shes pa'i rang gi ngo bo dpyad pas brdzun pa nyid du
analyzed: gal te rnam par rtog pa'i blo la snang ba'i ngang can nyid skye ba med pa la sogs pa yin na de'i tshe snang ba dang blo tha mi dad pa'i phyir de yang gong du rnam par shes pa'i rang gi ngo bo dpyad pas brdzun pa nyid du
translated: If non-production, etc. were the nature of the appearance to the conceptual mind, then, because of the non-difference of appearance and mind, it would be like the nature of consciousness, which was shown to be false by the above analysis of the nature of consciousness.

original: bstan pa'i phyir ji ltar don dam pa nyid du 'gyur snyam pa yin no //
analyzed: bstan pa'i phyir ji ltar don dam pa nyid du 'gyur snyam pa yin no //
translated: So how could it be ultimate?

original: blo bden pa nyid du chud kyang de la snang ba'i ngang can gyi ngo bo thams cad brdzun pa yin pa'i phyir skye ba med pa la sogs pa brdzun pa nyid do zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: blo bden pa nyid du chud kyang de la snang ba'i ngang can gyi ngo bo thams cad brdzun pa yin pa'i phyir skye ba med pa la sogs pa brdzun pa nyid do zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Even though the mind is true, all natures that have the appearance of it are false, so in order to show that non-production, etc. are false, he says,

original: gzhan yang de lta na yang zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: gzhan yang de lta na yang zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: ‚ÄúMoreover, even if that were so . . . ‚Äù

original: gzhan yang zhes bya ba ni lan gzhan brjod pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang zhes bya ba ni lan gzhan brjod pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúMoreover‚Äù means stating another reply.

original: 'di skad gsungs te zhes bya ba ni 'phags pa klu sgrub kyi zhal snga nas so //
analyzed: 'di skad gsungs te zhes bya ba ni 'phags pa klu sgrub kyi zhal snga nas so //
translated: ‚ÄúThis is what is said‚Äù is from the mouth of the noble Nagarjuna.

original: rgyal dpog pa la sogs pa med pa ni dngos po gzhan du gyur pa yin no zhes zer ba de bstan pa'i phyir de skad du zhes bya ba smos te ;
analyzed: rgyal dpog pa la sogs pa med pa ni dngos po gzhan du gyur pa yin no zhes zer ba de bstan pa'i phyir de skad du zhes bya ba smos te ;
translated: To demonstrate that, he says, ‚ÄúThus, etc.‚Äù

original: 'di ni gzhon nu ma len gyis bshad do //
analyzed: 'di ni gzhon nu ma len gyis bshad do //
translated: This is explained by KumƒÅralƒÅta.

original: des na med pa rnam pa bzhi dngos po gzhan du gyur ba kho na yin par brjod do //
analyzed: des na med pa rnam pa bzhi dngos po gzhan du gyur ba kho na yin par brjod do //
translated: Therefore, the four types of non-existence are said to be only a transformation of another thing.

original: de la 'o ma la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid yod pa nyid zho la sogs pa 'bras bu'i mtshan nyid snga na med pa zhes bya la /
analyzed: de la 'o ma la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid yod pa nyid zho la sogs pa 'bras bu'i mtshan nyid snga na med pa zhes bya la /
translated: Among them, the existence of the characteristics of milk, etc. is the non-existence prior to the characteristics of the effect, curd, etc.

original: zho la sogs pa 'bras bu yod pa nyid kyang 'o ma la sogs pa rgyu zhig nas med pa yin no //
analyzed: zho la sogs pa 'bras bu yod pa nyid kyang 'o ma la sogs pa rgyu zhig nas med pa yin no //
translated: The existence of the effect, curd, etc. is also the non-existence after the destruction of the cause, milk, etc.

original: ri bong gi mgo bo'i yan lag khyad par can nyid ri bong gi rva gtan med pa yin no //
analyzed: ri bong gi mgo bo'i yan lag khyad par can nyid ri bong gi rva gtan med pa yin no //
translated: The specific parts of the rabbit‚Äôs head are the non-existence of the rabbit‚Äôs horns.

original: ba lang la sogs pa la rta la sogs pa ngo bo med pa ni gcig la gcig med pa zhes zer ro //
analyzed: ba lang la sogs pa la rta la sogs pa ngo bo med pa ni gcig la gcig med pa zhes zer ro //
translated: The non-existence of the horse, etc. in the cow, etc. is the mutual non-existence.

original: de bas na zhes bya ba ni med pa ni yod pa sngon du 'gro ba can yin pa'i phyir @121a * //
analyzed: de bas na zhes bya ba ni med pa ni yod pa sngon du 'gro ba can yin pa'i phyir @121a * //
translated: Therefore, since non-existence is preceded by existence,

original: yod pa med na med pa yang med pa legs par bshad pa yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: yod pa med na med pa yang med pa legs par bshad pa yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: it is well explained that non-existence does not exist if existence does not exist.üîΩThis is the meaning.

original: de'i phyir de gnyis ni phan tshun ltos par rab tu brtags pa'i bdag nyid du gnas pa'i phyir med do zhes brjod par mi bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir de gnyis ni phan tshun ltos par rab tu brtags pa'i bdag nyid du gnas pa'i phyir med do zhes brjod par mi bya'o //
translated: Therefore, since these two are well established as having the nature of mutual dependence, one should not say that they do not exist.

original: 'di snyam du skye ba'i sngon rol na yod pa nyid med pa nyid dag med du zin kyang skye ba dang 'gag pa dag gi 'og tu dngos po yod pa nyid dang med pa nyid rnam par gzhag par 'gyur ro snyam pa la /
analyzed: 'di snyam du skye ba'i sngon rol na yod pa nyid med pa nyid dag med du zin kyang skye ba dang 'gag pa dag gi 'og tu dngos po yod pa nyid dang med pa nyid rnam par gzhag par 'gyur ro snyam pa la /
translated: One might think that even if existence and non-existence do not exist prior to arising, the existence and non-existence of things are established after arising and ceasing.

original: gang la ci yang mi skye ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: gang la ci yang mi skye ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: To this, the root text says, ‚ÄúWhat is not arisen at all . . .‚Äù and so forth.

original: 'gro ba gang la sngar dpyad pa bzhin ngo bo ci yang skye ba med cing 'gag pa yang med pa de la yod pa nyid dang med pa nyid med do zhes bya bar mthong ba'i rnal 'byor pa la ste /üîΩnges pa yin no zhes bya ba lhag ma'o //
analyzed: 'gro ba gang la sngar dpyad pa bzhin ngo bo ci yang skye ba med cing 'gag pa yang med pa de la yod pa nyid dang med pa nyid med do zhes bya bar mthong ba'i rnal 'byor pa la ste / nges pa yin no zhes bya ba lhag ma'o //
translated: For any being, as previously analyzed, that is not arisen in any way and does not cease, it is seen that it is neither existent nor nonexistent.üîΩThis is the certainty of the yogi/nƒ´.

original: 'di la don ni 'di yin te zhes bya ba ni mdo gnyi ga'i 'o //
analyzed: 'di la don ni 'di yin te zhes bya ba ni mdo gnyi ga'i 'o //
translated: The meaning here is this.

original: de lta bas na blo gros bzang pos gang gsungs pa zhes bya ba ni 'phags pa klu sgrub kyi zhal snga nas so ;
analyzed: de lta bas na blo gros bzang pos gang gsungs pa zhes bya ba ni 'phags pa klu sgrub kyi zhal snga nas so ;
translated: Therefore, what is said by the one with good intellect is by the noble NƒÅgƒÅrjuna.üîΩThose who think of self and other

original: / gang dag bdag dngos gzhan dngos dang // zhes bya ba 'dis ni bdag tu rtog pa ston par byed de /
analyzed: / gang dag bdag dngos gzhan dngos dang // zhes bya ba 'dis ni bdag tu rtog pa ston par byed de /
translated: This shows the conception of self.

original: bdag dang gzhan du 'byed pa ni bdag tu 'dzin pas byas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag dang gzhan du 'byed pa ni bdag tu 'dzin pas byas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The distinction between self and other is made by the conception of self.üîΩExistence and nonexistence

original: dngos dang dngos po med ces bya ba ni chos su rnam par rtog pa ston par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: dngos dang dngos po med ces bya ba ni chos su rnam par rtog pa ston par byed pa yin no //
translated: This shows the conception of phenomena.

original: yang dag mthong ba ma yin no //
analyzed: yang dag mthong ba ma yin no //
translated: It is not the correct view.

original: zhes bya ba ni lta ba'i gnas su gyur pa'i phyir ro //üîΩgang gi tshe yang dag pa mthong ba dag yin snyam pa la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni lta ba'i gnas su gyur pa'i phyir ro // gang gi tshe yang dag pa mthong ba dag yin snyam pa la /
translated: because it is the basis of the view.üîΩWhen they are seeing reality,

original: gang dag brten nas dngos po rnams //
analyzed: gang dag brten nas dngos po rnams //
translated: they say, ‚ÄúThose things that are dependent

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: and so on.

original: de dag ltas mi 'phrogs zhes bya ba ni sgro 'dogs pa dang / skur pa 'debs pa'i mtha' gnyis spangs nas dbu ma'i lam du zhugs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag ltas mi 'phrogs zhes bya ba ni sgro 'dogs pa dang / skur pa 'debs pa'i mtha' gnyis spangs nas dbu ma'i lam du zhugs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: They are not carried away by views, because they have entered the middle way, having abandoned the two extremes of superimposition and denial.

original: de ni zhes bya ba ni dngos po'o //
analyzed: de ni zhes bya ba ni dngos po'o //
translated: ‚Äú That‚Äù refers to entities.

original: ga la yod ces bya ba med pa nyid do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //üîΩstong zhes bya ba de yang stong //
analyzed: ga la yod ces bya ba med pa nyid do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go // stong zhes bya ba de yang stong //
translated: ‚Äú Where?‚Äù means ‚Äúin non-existence.‚Äù

original: zhes bya ba ni stong pa zhes mngon par brjod pa gang yin pa de yang stong ngo zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni stong pa zhes mngon par brjod pa gang yin pa de yang stong ngo zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: ‚Äú That emptiness is also empty‚Äù means that the verbal expression ‚Äúemptiness‚Äù is also empty.

original: 'byung ba zhes bya ba ni kun tu spyod pa'o //
analyzed: 'byung ba zhes bya ba ni kun tu spyod pa'o //
translated: ‚Äú Origination‚Äù means ‚Äúactivity.‚Äù

original: 'di zhes bya ba ni dngos po thams cad la khyab pa yin gyi nyi tshe ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di zhes bya ba ni dngos po thams cad la khyab pa yin gyi nyi tshe ba ni ma yin no //
translated: ‚Äú This‚Äù means that it pervades all entities, and is not limited to a particular entity.

original: de la don rnams thams cad 'byung //
analyzed: de la don rnams thams cad 'byung //
translated: All aims are fulfilled in it.

original: zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i phun sum tshogs pa thams cad 'byor par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i phun sum tshogs pa thams cad 'byor par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This means that all mundane and supramundane perfections are attained.

original: de la tshigs su bcad pa dang po ni slob dpon gyis dbu ma'i bstan bcos kyi rtsa ba las gsungs so //
analyzed: de la tshigs su bcad pa dang po ni slob dpon gyis dbu ma'i bstan bcos kyi rtsa ba las gsungs so //
translated: The first verse was spoken by the Master in the Mulamadhyamakakarika.

original: gnyis pa @121b ni rigs pa drug cu pa las gsungs so //
analyzed: gnyis pa @121b ni rigs pa drug cu pa las gsungs so //
translated: The second was spoken in the Yuktisastika.

original: gsum pa dang bzhi pa ni stong pa nyid bdun cu pa las gsungs so //
analyzed: gsum pa dang bzhi pa ni stong pa nyid bdun cu pa las gsungs so //
translated: The third and fourth were spoken in the Sata.

original: lnga pa ni rtsod pa bzlog pa las gsungs so //
analyzed: lnga pa ni rtsod pa bzlog pa las gsungs so //
translated: The fifth was spoken in the Vigrahavyavartani.

original: de bas na zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir dngos po'i yul thams cad stong pa nyid du tshad mas grub pa'o //
analyzed: de bas na zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir dngos po'i yul thams cad stong pa nyid du tshad mas grub pa'o //
translated: Therefore, means that all objects of knowledge are established as emptiness by a valid cognition.

original: sngon mtha' stong zhes bya ba ni 'das pa'i dus su stong pa ste /
analyzed: sngon mtha' stong zhes bya ba ni 'das pa'i dus su stong pa ste /
translated: The past limit is empty means that in the past time it was empty.

original: sngon yang don dam par ma skyes pa kho na'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: sngon yang don dam par ma skyes pa kho na'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It means that in the past it was not ultimately produced.

original: phyi ma'i mtha' yang stong zhes bya ba ni ma 'ongs pa'i dus su stong pa ste /
analyzed: phyi ma'i mtha' yang stong zhes bya ba ni ma 'ongs pa'i dus su stong pa ste /
translated: The future is empty means that the future time is empty.

original: der yang skye bar mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: der yang skye bar mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning is that one will not be born there.

original: skye dang 'jig dang gnas pa'i dngos po stong //
analyzed: skye dang 'jig dang gnas pa'i dngos po stong //
translated: Things that arise, disintegrate, and endure are empty.

original: zhes bya ba 'dis ni da ltar byung ba'i dus su yang mtshan nyid stong pa nyid kyis stong pa nyid du ston par byed do //
analyzed: zhes bya ba 'dis ni da ltar byung ba'i dus su yang mtshan nyid stong pa nyid kyis stong pa nyid du ston par byed do //
translated: This shows that even in the present time, they are empty by way of the emptiness of characteristics.

original: ci'i phyir dus gsum char du yang stong snyam pa la /
analyzed: ci'i phyir dus gsum char du yang stong snyam pa la /
translated: Why are they empty in all three times?

original: 'di ni dngos po yod min zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: 'di ni dngos po yod min zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: To explain this, he says, ‚Äúbecause things do not exist. ‚Äù

original: gang gi phyir zhes bya ba'i sgras ni rim pa gzhan du sbyar ba yin pa'i phyir gong ma dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: gang gi phyir zhes bya ba'i sgras ni rim pa gzhan du sbyar ba yin pa'i phyir gong ma dang sbyar ro //
translated: The word ‚Äúbecause‚Äù is connected to the previous sentence.

original: des na don ni gang gi phyir don dam par dngos po yod pa yang ma yin la med pa yang ma yin pa de'i phyir chos thams cad rtag tu ngo bo nyid kyis stong zhes bya ba 'di yin no //
analyzed: des na don ni gang gi phyir don dam par dngos po yod pa yang ma yin la med pa yang ma yin pa de'i phyir chos thams cad rtag tu ngo bo nyid kyis stong zhes bya ba 'di yin no //
translated: The meaning is that because ultimately things do not exist and do not not exist, therefore all phenomena are always empty by their intrinsic reality.

original: 'o na de ni rtog gyur pas //
analyzed: 'o na de ni rtog gyur pas //
translated: But that is a conceptual superimposition.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni dam bcas pa la mngon sum la sogs pas gnod pa rjod par byed de /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni dam bcas pa la mngon sum la sogs pas gnod pa rjod par byed de /
translated: Thus, he states that the thesis is undermined by perception and so on.

original: 'di ltar dngos po'i rang bzhin nyid sgro btags pa'i rnam pa dang bral ba'i phyir stong pa nyid kyi sgra brjod la /
analyzed: 'di ltar dngos po'i rang bzhin nyid sgro btags pa'i rnam pa dang bral ba'i phyir stong pa nyid kyi sgra brjod la /
translated: In this way, the term emptiness is used to describe the nature of things because it is free from the superimposition of aspects.

original: dngos po'i rang bzhin de yang mngon sum yin pa'i phyir de'i rang bzhin du gyur pa stong pa nyid kyang mngon sum kho nar khas blangs pa la /
analyzed: dngos po'i rang bzhin de yang mngon sum yin pa'i phyir de'i rang bzhin du gyur pa stong pa nyid kyang mngon sum kho nar khas blangs pa la /
translated: And since that nature of things is perceived, it is accepted that emptiness, which is its nature, is also just perception.

original: stong pa nyid ni byis pa rnams kyis mngon sum du mi rtogs pas mngon sum gyis gnod pa yin no //
analyzed: stong pa nyid ni byis pa rnams kyis mngon sum du mi rtogs pas mngon sum gyis gnod pa yin no //
translated: But since emptiness is not directly realized by childish beings, it is undermined by perception.

original: dmigs pa'i rig byar gyur pa mi dmigs pas med par thal bar tha snyad gdags su rung ba'i phyir rjes su dpag pas gnod pa yang yin no //
analyzed: dmigs pa'i rig byar gyur pa mi dmigs pas med par thal bar tha snyad gdags su rung ba'i phyir rjes su dpag pas gnod pa yang yin no //
translated: And since it is suitable to impute the nonexistence of the nonobservation of that which is suitable to appear, it is also undermined by inference.

original: mi mkhas rnams zhes bya ba ni byis pa rnams so //
analyzed: mi mkhas rnams zhes bya ba ni byis pa rnams so //
translated: The unwise are childish beings.

original: gal te mngon sum ma yin pa'i phyir mi rtogs so snyam pa la /
analyzed: gal te mngon sum ma yin pa'i phyir mi rtogs so snyam pa la /
translated: If you think that it is not realized because it is not direct perception,

original: mngon sum phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: mngon sum phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: then NƒÅgƒÅrjuna says, ‚ÄúBecause it is direct perception,‚Äù and so on.

original: gang gi phyir stong pa'i rang gi ngo bo nyid dngos po'i rang bzhin rtogs pa yin na tha mi dad pa'i phyir mngon sum kho na yin gyi /
analyzed: gang gi phyir stong pa'i rang gi ngo bo nyid dngos po'i rang bzhin rtogs pa yin na tha mi dad pa'i phyir mngon sum kho na yin gyi /
translated: If the nature of things, the emptiness of things, is realized, then because it is not different, it is direct perception alone.

original: mngon sum ma yin pa ni ma yin pa de'i phyir ci'i phyir mi rtogs /
analyzed: mngon sum ma yin pa ni ma yin pa de'i phyir ci'i phyir mi rtogs /
translated: It is not not direct perception. Therefore why is it not realized?

original: de rtogs na zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni ldog pa'i sgo nas rnam par 'grel te /üîΩde lta na ni grub pa dang bde ba tha dad pa'i phyir tha mi dad pa @122a * //
analyzed: de rtogs na zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni ldog pa'i sgo nas rnam par 'grel te / de lta na ni grub pa dang bde ba tha dad pa'i phyir tha mi dad pa @122a * //
translated: ‚Äú If it is realized,‚Äù and so on, explains this by way of the contrapositive.

original: nyid nyams par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nyid nyams par 'gyur ro //
translated: If that were the case, then because it would be different from what is established and what is happiness, nondifference itself would be undermined.

original: de'i phyir dngos po stong pa nyid du mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: de'i phyir dngos po stong pa nyid du mi 'gyur te /
translated: Therefore things would not be empty.

original: 'brel pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'brel pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there would be no relation.

original: stong pa nyid dang de las byung ba'i mtshan nyid kyi 'brel pa yang med de /
analyzed: stong pa nyid dang de las byung ba'i mtshan nyid kyi 'brel pa yang med de /
translated: There would also be no relation characterized by emptiness arising from it,

original: de ni rtag pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni rtag pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because that is permanent.

original: dngos po rnams kyi stong pa ni sus kyang mi byed de /
analyzed: dngos po rnams kyi stong pa ni sus kyang mi byed de /
translated: The emptiness of things is not produced by anyone.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams byung yang rung ma byung yang rung chos nyid ni gnas pa'i phyir dang / dngos po med pa'i phyir de ni 'bras bu ma yin pas 'brel pa ga la zhig yod /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams byung yang rung ma byung yang rung chos nyid ni gnas pa'i phyir dang / dngos po med pa'i phyir de ni 'bras bu ma yin pas 'brel pa ga la zhig yod /
translated: Whether Tathagatas arise or not, the reality of things remains, and because things do not exist, how can there be any connection with a result, since it is not a result?

original: de ni sgro btags pa yang yin la /
analyzed: de ni sgro btags pa yang yin la /
translated: It is a superimposition,üîΩand it is also as has been stated,

original: ji skad smos pa yang yin pas zhes tshig rnam par sbyar te /
analyzed: ji skad smos pa yang yin pas zhes tshig rnam par sbyar te /
translated: so the words are to be connected.

original: des na sgro btags pa dngos po la sogs pa'i rnam pa yang dag pa gang yin pa de dag dang bral ba zhes bsdus pa'i don yin no //
analyzed: des na sgro btags pa dngos po la sogs pa'i rnam pa yang dag pa gang yin pa de dag dang bral ba zhes bsdus pa'i don yin no //
translated: Thus, the meaning of the summary is that it is free from those superimpositions, which are the aspects of things and so on that are real.

original: so so'i skye bo tha shal ni gnag rdzi la sogs pa bstan bcos kyis blo ma sbyangs pa gang dag yin pa'o //
analyzed: so so'i skye bo tha shal ni gnag rdzi la sogs pa bstan bcos kyis blo ma sbyangs pa gang dag yin pa'o //
translated: The lowly ordinary beings are those whose minds have not been trained by treatises, such as cowherds.

original: ma yin thog med rgyud lci bar //
analyzed: ma yin thog med rgyud lci bar //
translated: It is not so, because of beginningless mental continuum.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni lan 'debs te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni lan 'debs te /
translated: This is the reply.

original: 'dis ni dngos po rnams kyi sgro btags pa'i rnam pas dben pa nyid stong pa nyid ces bya na /
analyzed: 'dis ni dngos po rnams kyi sgro btags pa'i rnam pas dben pa nyid stong pa nyid ces bya na /
translated: This shows that the emptiness of things is their freedom from the superimposition of the nature of entities.

original: stong pa nyid sgro btags pa'i rnam pas bsgribs pa'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir dngos po'i rang bzhin bzung bzhin du yang byis pa rnams kyis nges par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: stong pa nyid sgro btags pa'i rnam pas bsgribs pa'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir dngos po'i rang bzhin bzung bzhin du yang byis pa rnams kyis nges par mi 'gyur te /
translated: But because the nature of entities is obscured by the superimposition of emptiness, the nature of entities is not ascertained by the childish.

original: de'i phyir bzung mod kyi /
analyzed: de'i phyir bzung mod kyi /
translated: Therefore, although it is grasped,

original: tha snyad gdags su mi rung ba'i phyir ma bzung ba dang 'dra ba nyid pas 'di ni dmigs pa'i rig byar gyur pa ma yin no //
analyzed: tha snyad gdags su mi rung ba'i phyir ma bzung ba dang 'dra ba nyid pas 'di ni dmigs pa'i rig byar gyur pa ma yin no //
translated: it is not an object of perception because it is as if it were not grasped, since it is not suitable to be designated by a term.

original: de lta bas na mngon sum la sogs pas gnod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba 'di ston to //
analyzed: de lta bas na mngon sum la sogs pas gnod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba 'di ston to //
translated: Thus, it is shown that it is not contradicted by perception and so on.

original: dngos po la sogs par sgro btags pa gang la thog ma med pa'i rgyud yod pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: dngos po la sogs par sgro btags pa gang la thog ma med pa'i rgyud yod pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: That which has the superimposition of entities and so on and has an beginningless continuum is said to be that.

original: de ni spang bar dka' ba'i phyir lci ba yang yin la /
analyzed: de ni spang bar dka' ba'i phyir lci ba yang yin la /
translated: It is heavy because it is difficult to abandon.

original: dngos por sgro 'dogs pa thog ma med pa yang yin pas zhes tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
analyzed: dngos por sgro 'dogs pa thog ma med pa yang yin pas zhes tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúbecause it is a beginningless reification of things‚Äù is to be supplied in the verse.

original: des dbang du byas zhes tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
analyzed: des dbang du byas zhes tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúgoverned by that‚Äù is to be supplied in the verse.

original: mngon sum zhes bya ba ni mngon sum du'o //
analyzed: mngon sum zhes bya ba ni mngon sum du'o //
translated: ‚ÄúDirectly perceived‚Äù means directly perceived.

original: dbang po las byung ba'i phyir na mngon sum ste shes pa la bya'o //
analyzed: dbang po las byung ba'i phyir na mngon sum ste shes pa la bya'o //
translated: It is called ‚Äúdirect perception‚Äù because it arises from the senses.

original: dngos po la mngon par zhen pa gang la thog ma med pa'i srid pa 'khor bar 'byung ba skye ba'i ngang tshul yod pa de nyid yang dag pa'i don mthong ba la myos pa'i rgyu yin pa nyid kyis dug bzhin du dug yin te /
analyzed: dngos po la mngon par zhen pa gang la thog ma med pa'i srid pa 'khor bar 'byung ba skye ba'i ngang tshul yod pa de nyid yang dag pa'i don mthong ba la myos pa'i rgyu yin pa nyid kyis dug bzhin du dug yin te /
translated: The reification of things is the cause of the arising of the beginningless cycle of birth and death. It is poison, like poison, because it is the cause of intoxication with regard to seeing the truth.

original: gang dag la des dkrugs pa'i blo yod pa zhes tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
analyzed: gang dag la des dkrugs pa'i blo yod pa zhes tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthose whose minds are disturbed by it‚Äù is to be supplied in the verse.

original: gzhan yang 'di ni ngo mtshar mi che ste zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni nyes par bshad pa'i grub pa'i mtha' la mngon par zhen pas kyang @122b blo gros phyin ci log pa rnams nges par mi byed do zhes dpes ston par byed de /
analyzed: gzhan yang 'di ni ngo mtshar mi che ste zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni nyes par bshad pa'i grub pa'i mtha' la mngon par zhen pas kyang @122b blo gros phyin ci log pa rnams nges par mi byed do zhes dpes ston par byed de /
translated: Moreover, ‚ÄúThis is not at all amazing‚Äù and so on shows that even those who are attached to the tenets of bad explanations do not necessarily have distorted minds, as is illustrated by the example.

original: 'di ltar ser skya ba la sogs pa ba lang nyid la sogs pa spyi mi snang ba bzhin du rtogs par byed de /
analyzed: 'di ltar ser skya ba la sogs pa ba lang nyid la sogs pa spyi mi snang ba bzhin du rtogs par byed de /
translated: Thus, just as the SƒÅ·πÉkhya and so on realize the nonappearance of universals such as cowness,

original: dngos po snang ba la lta ci'i phyir rtogs par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: dngos po snang ba la lta ci'i phyir rtogs par mi 'gyur te /
translated: why would they not realize the appearance of things?

original: 'di ni ngo mtshar mi che'o //
analyzed: 'di ni ngo mtshar mi che'o //
translated: This is not at all amazing.

original: dngos po la sogs par sgro 'dogs pa de gcod pa ni med pa'o //
analyzed: dngos po la sogs par sgro 'dogs pa de gcod pa ni med pa'o //
translated: The elimination of the superimposition of things and so on is nonexistence.

original: de shes par byed pa'i gtan tshigs ni gcig pa nyid dang du ma nyid la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: de shes par byed pa'i gtan tshigs ni gcig pa nyid dang du ma nyid la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: The reason that causes that to be known is the definition of being one or many and so on.

original: 'dis ni legs par nyan pa dang / bsams pa dang / bsgoms pa las byung ba'i shes rab skyes pas de nges par 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: 'dis ni legs par nyan pa dang / bsams pa dang / bsgoms pa las byung ba'i shes rab skyes pas de nges par 'gyur gyi /
translated: This is because the wisdom arisen from listening, reflection, and meditation is generated and that is ascertained.

original: gzhan du ni ma yin no zhes bshad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan du ni ma yin no zhes bshad par 'gyur ro //
translated: It is not otherwise.

original: spros pa dang bral ba zhes bya ba ni spros pa thams cad med pa'i mtshan nyid stong pa nyid ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: spros pa dang bral ba zhes bya ba ni spros pa thams cad med pa'i mtshan nyid stong pa nyid ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Free from fabrication means the reality of the absence of all fabrication, which is synonymous with emptiness.

original: gang dag la bsams pa las byung ba'i chos rab tu rnam par 'byed pa shes rab bsags pa yod pa zhes tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
analyzed: gang dag la bsams pa las byung ba'i chos rab tu rnam par 'byed pa shes rab bsags pa yod pa zhes tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
translated: Those who have the accumulation of wisdom that is the discernment of phenomena that arises from reflection.

original: yang mi skye ba zhes bya ba ni mi 'byung ba zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: yang mi skye ba zhes bya ba ni mi 'byung ba zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Again, non-arising means non-occurrence.

original: snying po med pa nyid du ston par byed pa'i lung /
analyzed: snying po med pa nyid du ston par byed pa'i lung /
translated: The prophecy that reveals the lack of essence

original: snying rje chen po la 'jug pa'i mdo zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: snying rje chen po la 'jug pa'i mdo zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The MahƒÅkaru·πáƒÅprave≈õa S≈´tra says:

original: de las ni /üîΩdper na chu shing rlon pa'i sdong po la //
analyzed: de las ni / dper na chu shing rlon pa'i sdong po la //
translated: In that s≈´tra it is said:üîΩFor example, a person desiring the essence

original: snying po 'dod mis rim par bshegs byas kyang //
analyzed: snying po 'dod mis rim par bshegs byas kyang //
translated: may peel away the layers of a green plantain tree,

original: phyi dang nang na snying po med pa ltar //üîΩchos rnams thams cad de ltar shes par gyis //
analyzed: phyi dang nang na snying po med pa ltar // chos rnams thams cad de ltar shes par gyis //
translated: but finding no essence inside or out,

original: zhes 'byung ngo /
analyzed: zhes 'byung ngo /
translated: should know all phenomena are like that.

original: ma rtogs pa zhes bya ba ni rtogs par ma gyur pa ste /
analyzed: ma rtogs pa zhes bya ba ni rtogs par ma gyur pa ste /
translated: Non-realization is non-realization of the essence of cyclic existence.

original: ji ltar au dum w'a ra la me tog dpyad na med pa kho na'i phyir rtogs par ma gyur gyi phra ba nyid la sogs pa'i phyir ni ma yin no //
analyzed: ji ltar au dum w'a ra la me tog dpyad na med pa kho na'i phyir rtogs par ma gyur gyi phra ba nyid la sogs pa'i phyir ni ma yin no //
translated: Just as the udumbara flower is said to be non-existent because it is not found when sought, and not because it is subtle,

original: de bzhin du srid pa dag la snying po 'di yang rtogs par ma gyur pa zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du srid pa dag la snying po 'di yang rtogs par ma gyur pa zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: in the same way, this essence of cyclic existence is said to be non-realized.

original: pha rol min pa'i pha rol son //
analyzed: pha rol min pa'i pha rol son //
translated: Having gone beyond the non-other shore.

original: zhes bya ba ni pha rol ma yin pa da ltar byung ba'i skye ba nas pha rol ma 'ongs pa'i skye ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni pha rol ma yin pa da ltar byung ba'i skye ba nas pha rol ma 'ongs pa'i skye ba'o //
translated: The non-other shore is the present life, and the other shore is the future life.üîΩIf one accepts that all phenomena are essenceless, etc.

original: chos thams cad rang bzhin med pa nyid du khas blangs na zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni dam bcas pa 'gal bar rjod par byed de /
analyzed: chos thams cad rang bzhin med pa nyid du khas blangs na zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni dam bcas pa 'gal bar rjod par byed de /
translated: This is a statement of contradiction of the thesis.

original: 'di ltar chos thams cad rang bzhin med pa nyid du rab tu bsgrubs pa'i phyir gtan tshigs la sogs pa yongs su gzung ba byas pa de dag yod par khas blangs la chos thams cad rang bzhin med pa nyid du dam bcas pas med do zhes khas blangs
analyzed: 'di ltar chos thams cad rang bzhin med pa nyid du rab tu bsgrubs pa'i phyir gtan tshigs la sogs pa yongs su gzung ba byas pa de dag yod par khas blangs la chos thams cad rang bzhin med pa nyid du dam bcas pas med do zhes khas blangs
translated: Thus, because we have thoroughly established that all phenomena lack intrinsic reality, we accept that the reason and so on are apprehended, but we accept that they do not exist, because we have asserted that all phenomena lack intrinsic reality.

original: pas phan tshun 'gal ba yin no //
analyzed: pas phan tshun 'gal ba yin no //
translated: Thus, they are mutually contradictory.

original: 'di snyam du kho bo cag sgrub pa mi brjod pa nyid do snyam na /
analyzed: 'di snyam du kho bo cag sgrub pa mi brjod pa nyid do snyam na /
translated: If you think, ‚ÄúWe do not state a proof,‚Äù

original: gal te yang zhes bya ba smos te /üîΩdam bcas pa tsam kho nas ni 'dod @123a * //
analyzed: gal te yang zhes bya ba smos te / dam bcas pa tsam kho nas ni 'dod @123a * //
translated: then NƒÅgƒÅrjuna says, ‚ÄúIf you think that . . .‚ÄùüîΩThe mere assertion of a thesis does not accomplish the desired aim,

original: pa'i don 'grub pa ma yin te thams cad kyi thams cad 'grub par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: pa'i don 'grub pa ma yin te thams cad kyi thams cad 'grub par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it would follow that everything would accomplish everything.

original: 'di yang gi na ste zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni lan 'debs so //
analyzed: 'di yang gi na ste zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni lan 'debs so //
translated: This is also answered by ‚ÄúIf you think that . . .‚Äù and so on.

original: gzhung ni grub pa'i mtha'o //
analyzed: gzhung ni grub pa'i mtha'o //
translated: The text is the philosophical system.

original: des bskyed pa'i bye brag bsgrub par bya ba dang / dpe'i chos can rnam pa gnyi ga la yang yod pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: des bskyed pa'i bye brag bsgrub par bya ba dang / dpe'i chos can rnam pa gnyi ga la yang yod pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: That which is produced by that is the specific property to be established. That which exists in both the example subject and the property to be established is called that.

original: mkhas pa dang bud med dang byis pa zhes bya ba bsdu ste /
analyzed: mkhas pa dang bud med dang byis pa zhes bya ba bsdu ste /
translated: The words the learned, women, and children are included.

original: mjug tu bar gyi sgras mi 'gyur ba'i dngos po yin no //
analyzed: mjug tu bar gyi sgras mi 'gyur ba'i dngos po yin no //
translated: At the end, the word and indicates that it is an invariable entity.

original: de la grags par gyur pa rnam shes drug par bsdu'o //
analyzed: de la grags par gyur pa rnam shes drug par bsdu'o //
translated: Among those, what is well known is included in the six consciousnesses.

original: ma lus pa ni rgol ba thams cad kyi'o //üîΩgal te grub pa'i mtha' la brten pa'i gtan tshigs sam chos can byas na nyes pa ci yod snyam pa la /
analyzed: ma lus pa ni rgol ba thams cad kyi'o // gal te grub pa'i mtha' la brten pa'i gtan tshigs sam chos can byas na nyes pa ci yod snyam pa la /
translated: The word all refers to all opponents.

original: de lta min na gzhi ma grub ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de lta min na gzhi ma grub ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: If the reason or subject is based on tenets, what is the fault? Thinking this, he says, Otherwise, it would be called 'unestablished basis,' etc.

original: de lta yin na ni chos can de rtsod pa'i gzhir gyur pa'i phyir ma grub pas gzhi ma grub pa'i gtan tshigs su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta yin na ni chos can de rtsod pa'i gzhir gyur pa'i phyir ma grub pas gzhi ma grub pa'i gtan tshigs su 'gyur ro //
translated: If it were like that, because that subject would be the basis of dispute, it would be unestablished, so it would be a reason with an unestablished basis.

original: sogs pa smos pas ni rang gi ngo bo ma grub na /
analyzed: sogs pa smos pas ni rang gi ngo bo ma grub na /
translated: By saying etc., it is said that if the intrinsic nature is not established,

original: dpe'i chos can yang mi 'grub po zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: dpe'i chos can yang mi 'grub po zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: the example subject is also not established.

original: de skad du sun dbyung ba brjod na /
analyzed: de skad du sun dbyung ba brjod na /
translated: If you say that,

original: lan ci zhig brjod par bya /
analyzed: lan ci zhig brjod par bya /
translated: then what answer will you give?

original: de'i phyir bsgrub par bya ba dang / sgrub pa'i tha snyad thams cad chad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir bsgrub par bya ba dang / sgrub pa'i tha snyad thams cad chad par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, all conventions of the probandum and the logical argument are repudiated.

original: 'di snyam du gang zhig chos can snang ba la brten nas sgro btags pa'i rnam pa dgag pa'i phyir sgrub pa sbyor bar byed pa de la ni gzhi ma grub pa la sogs pa nyes pa'i glags mi thod na /
analyzed: 'di snyam du gang zhig chos can snang ba la brten nas sgro btags pa'i rnam pa dgag pa'i phyir sgrub pa sbyor bar byed pa de la ni gzhi ma grub pa la sogs pa nyes pa'i glags mi thod na /
translated: If you think, ‚ÄúWhen someone posits a logical argument in order to refute the superimposition that is based on the appearance of the subject, then he cannot be faulted by saying that the basis of the argument does not exist, and so on.

original: khyod ni chos can snang ba 'gog par byed de /
analyzed: khyod ni chos can snang ba 'gog par byed de /
translated: But you are refuting the appearance of the subject.

original: de lta bas na khyod la ci'i phyir gzhi ma grub pa la sogs pa'i glags mi thod snyam pa la /üîΩbdag ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /üîΩchos can snang ba 'di la yang rang bzhin yang dag par sgro btags pa dgag pa sgrub par byed kyi /
analyzed: de lta bas na khyod la ci'i phyir gzhi ma grub pa la sogs pa'i glags mi thod snyam pa la / bdag ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te / chos can snang ba 'di la yang rang bzhin yang dag par sgro btags pa dgag pa sgrub par byed kyi /
translated: Therefore, why can you not be faulted by saying that the basis of the argument does not exist, and so on?‚ÄùüîΩIn response to this, BhƒÅviveka says, ‚ÄúWe refute the true nature that is superimposed on this appearance of the subject.‚Äù

original: chos can gyi rang gi ngo bo 'gog par ni ma yin pas mtshungs so //
analyzed: chos can gyi rang gi ngo bo 'gog par ni ma yin pas mtshungs so //
translated: Since we refute the true nature that is superimposed on this appearance of the subject, it is the same for us.

original: 'di snyam du gal te don dam pa pa'i rang bzhin bkag na chos can de'i ngo bo gang snang bar 'gyur ba gzhan ci zhig lus par 'gyur snyam du sems na /
analyzed: 'di snyam du gal te don dam pa pa'i rang bzhin bkag na chos can de'i ngo bo gang snang bar 'gyur ba gzhan ci zhig lus par 'gyur snyam du sems na /
translated: If you think, ‚ÄúIf the ultimate nature is refuted, what other nature of the subject remains to appear?‚Äù

original: de yang yang dag pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de yang yang dag pa ma yin te /
translated: That is also not correct.

original: gang gis na don dam pa pa'i rang bzhin log na ldog par 'gyur ba /
analyzed: gang gis na don dam pa pa'i rang bzhin log na ldog par 'gyur ba /
translated: Because of what, if the ultimate nature is refuted, would it cease?

original: don dam pa pa'i rang bzhin nyid kyis snang ba la khyab pa ni med de /
analyzed: don dam pa pa'i rang bzhin nyid kyis snang ba la khyab pa ni med de /
translated: The ultimate nature does not pervade appearance.

original: zla ba gnyis dang skra shad la sogs pa brdzun pa yang snang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zla ba gnyis dang skra shad la sogs pa brdzun pa yang snang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because false things such as two moons and floating hairs appear.

original: 'di skad du zla ba gnyis la sogs pa phyi rol gyi gzugs su brdzun mod kyi /
analyzed: 'di skad du zla ba gnyis la sogs pa phyi rol gyi gzugs su brdzun mod kyi /
translated: You cannot say, ‚ÄúThe two moons and so on are false as external forms,

original: de dag shes pa'i ngo bor ni don dam pa pa kho na yin pas snang bar rigs so zhes bya bar brjod par yang mi nus te /
analyzed: de dag shes pa'i ngo bor ni don dam pa pa kho na yin pas snang bar rigs so zhes bya bar brjod par yang mi nus te /
translated: but because they are ultimately the nature of consciousness, it is reasonable that they appear.‚Äù

original: de @123b dag sna tshogs kyi ngo bo dang yul na gnas par snang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de @123b dag sna tshogs kyi ngo bo dang yul na gnas par snang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they appear as the nature of multiplicity and as abiding in the field.

original: shes pa ni sna tshogs su rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: shes pa ni sna tshogs su rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: Consciousness is not reasonable as multiplicity.

original: gcig pu nyid nyams par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir dang / shes pa du ma skye ba yang sngar bkag zin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gcig pu nyid nyams par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir dang / shes pa du ma skye ba yang sngar bkag zin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it would follow, absurdly, that it would be singular, and because the arising of many consciousnesses has already been refuted.

original: yul na gnas pa yang ma yin te lus med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yul na gnas pa yang ma yin te lus med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Nor does it exist in the object, because it has no body.

original: de lta bas na zla ba gnyis la sogs pa don dam pa ma yin bzhin du 'on kyang snang bas don dam pa'i rang bzhin log kyang snang ba 'gal ba med pas chos can la sogs pa grub pa nyid do //
analyzed: de lta bas na zla ba gnyis la sogs pa don dam pa ma yin bzhin du 'on kyang snang bas don dam pa'i rang bzhin log kyang snang ba 'gal ba med pas chos can la sogs pa grub pa nyid do //
translated: Thus, although the nature of the ultimate is refuted by the appearance of such things as two moons, which are not ultimate, the appearance of the subject and so on is not refuted.

original: de'i phyir bsgrub par bya ba dang / sgrub pa 'jug pa 'gal ba med pa kho na yin pas mang du ni mi dgos so //
analyzed: de'i phyir bsgrub par bya ba dang / sgrub pa 'jug pa 'gal ba med pa kho na yin pas mang du ni mi dgos so //
translated: Therefore, since there is no contradiction in the application of the predicate and reason, there is no need to say more.

original: bye brag pa la sogs pa ni phyogs la sogs pa chos can yan lag can yin pa dang / sgra yang nam mkha'i yon tan yin no zhes bya bar 'dod de /
analyzed: bye brag pa la sogs pa ni phyogs la sogs pa chos can yan lag can yin pa dang / sgra yang nam mkha'i yon tan yin no zhes bya bar 'dod de /
translated: The Vai≈õe·π£ikas and so on assert that the subject is a whole such as a direction and that sound is a quality of space.

original: chos can de dag ni sangs rgyas pa la sogs pa la ma grub po //
analyzed: chos can de dag ni sangs rgyas pa la sogs pa la ma grub po //
translated: But these subjects are not established for the Buddhist and so on.

original: brgal ba'i grags pa zhes bya ba ni brgal bas grags pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //üîΩbdag ni snang ba'i ngang can gyi //
analyzed: brgal ba'i grags pa zhes bya ba ni brgal bas grags pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go // bdag ni snang ba'i ngang can gyi //
translated: The term ‚Äúrenowned in debate‚Äù means ‚Äúrenowned in debate.‚Äù

original: dngos po dgag par mi byed de //
analyzed: dngos po dgag par mi byed de //
translated: We do not deny the existence of things that are perceived by the senses.

original: zhes bya ba ni 'di'i 'grel pa ni /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni 'di'i 'grel pa ni /
translated: The commentary explains this as follows:

original: kho bo yang mig la sogs pa'i shes pa la snang ba'i dngos po ni mi sel to zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: kho bo yang mig la sogs pa'i shes pa la snang ba'i dngos po ni mi sel to zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: ‚ÄúWe do not deny the existence of things that are perceived by the senses, such as the visual faculty.‚Äù

original: dgag pa 'di ni don dam par mi 'dod do zhes 'og nas 'byung ba dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: dgag pa 'di ni don dam par mi 'dod do zhes 'og nas 'byung ba dang sbyar ro //
translated: This denial is not accepted ultimately, as will be explained later.üîΩLike the trunk of the plantain tree,

original: chu shing gi sdong po bzhin du zhes bya ba ni chu shing gi sdong bu lta bur ro //
analyzed: chu shing gi sdong po bzhin du zhes bya ba ni chu shing gi sdong bu lta bur ro //
translated: means like the trunk of the plantain tree.üîΩWithout clinging

original: mngon par zhen pa med pa zhes bya ba ni rang gi grub pa'i mtha'i sgo nas chos can la sogs pa la brten pa med pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: mngon par zhen pa med pa zhes bya ba ni rang gi grub pa'i mtha'i sgo nas chos can la sogs pa la brten pa med pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: means without depending on the subject, etc., from the point of view of one‚Äôs own philosophical tenets.üîΩAs it is said

original: ji skad du zhes bya ba ni sngon gyi slob dpon rnams kyis so //
analyzed: ji skad du zhes bya ba ni sngon gyi slob dpon rnams kyis so //
translated: means as it is said by the former masters.

original: 'dzin pa stug po ni grub pa'i mtha' la grags pa pa'i chos can la sogs pa yongs su 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: 'dzin pa stug po ni grub pa'i mtha' la grags pa pa'i chos can la sogs pa yongs su 'dzin pa'o //
translated: Thick grasping is the grasping of the subject and so on, which are renowned in philosophical tenets.

original: tha snyad rnams la zhes bya ba ni bsgrub par bya ba dang sgrub pa'i tha snyad rnams la'o //
analyzed: tha snyad rnams la zhes bya ba ni bsgrub par bya ba dang sgrub pa'i tha snyad rnams la'o //
translated: With regard to conventions means with regard to the conventions of the probandum and the proof.

original: don dam pa'i tshul la sdang bas dbang bsgyur ba gang dag ces bya ba ni bye brag tu smra ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: don dam pa'i tshul la sdang bas dbang bsgyur ba gang dag ces bya ba ni bye brag tu smra ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: Those who are controlled by hostility toward the mode of ultimate reality are the VaibhƒÅ·π£ikas and so on.

original: de dag ni rang bzhin med pa nyid du smra ba na /
analyzed: de dag ni rang bzhin med pa nyid du smra ba na /
translated: When they propound the absence of intrinsic existence,

original: 'jig rten pha rol la sogs pa khas blangs pa nyams par thal bar 'gyur bas dam bcas pa la khas blangs pas gnod do snyam du sems shing gleng bar byed do zhes grag go //
analyzed: 'jig rten pha rol la sogs pa khas blangs pa nyams par thal bar 'gyur bas dam bcas pa la khas blangs pas gnod do snyam du sems shing gleng bar byed do zhes grag go //
translated: they think that it contradicts their beliefs because it would follow that what they accept would be destroyed, and they speak in this way.

original: spyi bo nas dbang bskur ba zhes bya ba ni dngos po thams cad 'gog pa'i phyir mchog tu gyur pa yin no //
analyzed: spyi bo nas dbang bskur ba zhes bya ba ni dngos po thams cad 'gog pa'i phyir mchog tu gyur pa yin no //
translated: The one who is anointed on the crown of the head is supreme because he stops all things.

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu la skur pa 'debs pa nyid log lta yin te /
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu la skur pa 'debs pa nyid log lta yin te /
translated: Denial of cause and effect is wrong view.

original: gang dag gis des dkar phyogs las /
analyzed: gang dag gis des dkar phyogs las /
translated: Those who do not do so will be reborn in the higher realms.üîΩ

original: dge ba drungs @124a * //
analyzed: dge ba drungs @124a * //
translated: Those who, by that, uproot the wholesome from the side of virtue

original: 'byin pa de dag la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: 'byin pa de dag la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: are called ‚Äúuprooters of the wholesome.‚Äù

original: dam chos kyi lo tog ser ba zhes bya ba ni de'i don la skur pa 'debs pa nyid kyis de rlag par byed pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dam chos kyi lo tog ser ba zhes bya ba ni de'i don la skur pa 'debs pa nyid kyis de rlag par byed pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: ‚ÄúHail to the crop of the true Dharma‚Äù means that, by the very denial of its meaning, it is the cause of its destruction.

original: nam mkha'i me tog ces bya ba ni chos thams cad la skur pa 'debs pas bdag nyid kyang med pa'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir nam mkha'i me tog dang 'dra zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: nam mkha'i me tog ces bya ba ni chos thams cad la skur pa 'debs pas bdag nyid kyang med pa'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir nam mkha'i me tog dang 'dra zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: ‚ÄúSky-flowers‚Äù means that, by denying all dharmas, it is like a sky-flower, having the nature of non-existence.

original: de'i phyir zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir dngos po la sogs pa don med pa dag la 'jug pa la goms pa ma gtogs pa de dag gi rgyu gzhan yang yod pa ma yin pa de'i phyir thog ma med pa'i rigs mthun pa pa'i sa bon rjesüîΩsu dpag pa'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir dngos po la sogs pa don med pa dag la 'jug pa la goms pa ma gtogs pa de dag gi rgyu gzhan yang yod pa ma yin pa de'i phyir thog ma med pa'i rigs mthun pa pa'i sa bon rjesüîΩsu dpag pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúTherefore‚Äù means that, because there is no other cause for engaging in meaningless things like entities except for habituation, therefore, the seed of beginningless similar type is inferred to be the cause of engaging in meaningless things like entities.

original: rigs mthun pa'i sa bon gang la thog med srid rgyud yod pa de la de skad ces bya ste /
analyzed: rigs mthun pa'i sa bon gang la thog med srid rgyud yod pa de la de skad ces bya ste /
translated: That seed of a homogeneous type which has existed in beginningless cyclic existence is called ‚Äúbeginningless.‚Äù

original: gang dag la thog ma med pa'i srid pa'i rgyud can rigs mthun pa pa'i sa bon yod pa de dag la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: gang dag la thog ma med pa'i srid pa'i rgyud can rigs mthun pa pa'i sa bon yod pa de dag la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: Those which have a seed of a homogeneous type in beginningless cyclic existence are called ‚Äúbeginningless.‚Äù

original: de'i dngos po ni de nyid do //
analyzed: de'i dngos po ni de nyid do //
translated: That thing is just that.

original: de'i phyir dngos po la sogs par rnam par rtog pa chos can kun rdzob tu grub pa thog ma med pa'i rigs mthun pa pa'i sa bon las rab tu skye ba tsam du grub na 'jig rten pha rol 'grub bo zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de'i phyir dngos po la sogs par rnam par rtog pa chos can kun rdzob tu grub pa thog ma med pa'i rigs mthun pa pa'i sa bon las rab tu skye ba tsam du grub na 'jig rten pha rol 'grub bo zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Therefore, if the subject, the conceptual thought of a thing, etc., is established as merely arising from a seed of a homogeneous type in beginningless cyclic existence, then the existence of another world is established. This is the meaning.

original: sbyor ba ni gang dang gang dngos po la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa yin pa de ni rigs mthun pa pa'i sa bon las rab tu skye ba yin te /
analyzed: sbyor ba ni gang dang gang dngos po la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa yin pa de ni rigs mthun pa pa'i sa bon las rab tu skye ba yin te /
translated: The syllogism is: Whatever is a conceptual thought of a thing, etc., is produced from a seed of a homogeneous type,

original: dper na dus phyis khong du chud pa rnams kyi lta bu yin no //
analyzed: dper na dus phyis khong du chud pa rnams kyi lta bu yin no //
translated: like, for example, the later understanding.

original: skye ba dang po byung ba'i rnam par rtog pa 'di yang dngos po la sogs par rnam par rtog pa yin pas 'di ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs yin no //
analyzed: skye ba dang po byung ba'i rnam par rtog pa 'di yang dngos po la sogs par rnam par rtog pa yin pas 'di ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs yin no //
translated: This conception of the first arising is also a conception of entity, etc. Therefore, this is a natural inference.

original: 'di'i ma nges pa nyid yongs su spang ba'i phyir /
analyzed: 'di'i ma nges pa nyid yongs su spang ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to completely eliminate the uncertainty of this, he says,

original: 'di ni dngos po'i mthu stobs kyis 'byung ba ma yin zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: 'di ni dngos po'i mthu stobs kyis 'byung ba ma yin zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: ‚ÄúThis is not produced by the power of the thing.‚Äù

original: dngos po'i mthu stobs kyis zhes bya ba ni phyi rol gyi dmigs pa'i dngos po'i mthu stobs kyis te phyi rol gyi dngos po de ni gsal zin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos po'i mthu stobs kyis zhes bya ba ni phyi rol gyi dmigs pa'i dngos po'i mthu stobs kyis te phyi rol gyi dngos po de ni gsal zin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: ‚ÄúBy the power of the thing‚Äù means by the power of the external objective thing, because that external thing is already clear.

original: nang gi dngos po rnam par shes pa'i bdag nyid don dam par bkag tu zin kyang /
analyzed: nang gi dngos po rnam par shes pa'i bdag nyid don dam par bkag tu zin kyang /
translated: The internal thing, which is consciousness by nature, is ultimately refuted.

original: de ni kun rdzob tu gsal ba'i bdag nyid du rang gis grub pa'i phyir la /
analyzed: de ni kun rdzob tu gsal ba'i bdag nyid du rang gis grub pa'i phyir la /
translated: However, it is established by itself as the nature of clarity conventionally.

original: phyi rol gyi ni bems po'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir rang gis grub pa yang ma yin la /
analyzed: phyi rol gyi ni bems po'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir rang gis grub pa yang ma yin la /
translated: The external is not established by itself because it is an insentient entity.

original: rnam par shes pas 'dzin par mi rung ba'i phyir gzhan las kyang grub pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: rnam par shes pas 'dzin par mi rung ba'i phyir gzhan las kyang grub pa yang ma yin te /
translated: It is not established from another, because consciousness cannot apprehend it.

original: de'i phyir rtag tu ma grub pa nyid pas bye brag yod do //
analyzed: de'i phyir rtag tu ma grub pa nyid pas bye brag yod do //
translated: Therefore, it is always non-established, and thus there is a difference.

original: yang na dngos po la rnam pa med pa kho na las sgro btags nas rnam par rtog pa 'jug pas des na yul med pa'i phyir dngos po'i mthu @124b stobs kyis byung ba ma yin no snyam du bsams pa'o //
analyzed: yang na dngos po la rnam pa med pa kho na las sgro btags nas rnam par rtog pa 'jug pas des na yul med pa'i phyir dngos po'i mthu @124b stobs kyis byung ba ma yin no snyam du bsams pa'o //
translated: Or else, it is thought that conceptualization operates by superimposing aspects that are non-existent in things, and therefore it does not arise by the power of things because there is no object.

original: rim gyis snang ba'i phyir glo bur nyid la sogs pa'i chos yin par yang mi srid de /
analyzed: rim gyis snang ba'i phyir glo bur nyid la sogs pa'i chos yin par yang mi srid de /
translated: It is also impossible to be a property of things such as being adventitious, because it appears gradually.

original: ltos pa med pa rim gyis 'byung ba 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ltos pa med pa rim gyis 'byung ba 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is contradictory for that which is independent to arise gradually.

original: de bas na zhes bya ba ni tshad ma'i don ston par byed do //
analyzed: de bas na zhes bya ba ni tshad ma'i don ston par byed do //
translated: Therefore indicates the meaning of valid cognition.

original: goms 'dra zhes bya ba ni dpe'o //
analyzed: goms 'dra zhes bya ba ni dpe'o //
translated: Similarity to familiarity is the example.

original: de nyid phyir zhes bya ba ni dngos po la sogs pa rnam par rtog pa yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: de nyid phyir zhes bya ba ni dngos po la sogs pa rnam par rtog pa yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: Therefore means because of conceptualization of things and so on.

original: 'di ni gtan tshigs bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni gtan tshigs bstan pa yin no //
translated: This is the teaching of the reason.

original: dang po zhes bya ba ni bsgrub par bya ba'i chos can bstan pa'o //
analyzed: dang po zhes bya ba ni bsgrub par bya ba'i chos can bstan pa'o //
translated: The first is the statement of the subject to be established.

original: rang gi rigs las zhes bya ba ni bsgrub par bya ba chos bstan pa'o //
analyzed: rang gi rigs las zhes bya ba ni bsgrub par bya ba chos bstan pa'o //
translated: One‚Äôs own class is the statement of the property to be established.

original: 'di ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni rnam par 'grel par byed de /
analyzed: 'di ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni rnam par 'grel par byed de /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúin this way‚Äù and so on is the explanation.

original: 'di ni dngos po'i mthu stobs kyis 'byung ba ma yin zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i rnam par 'grel pa ni de dag ni dmigs pa'i stobs kyis 'byung ba yang ma yin te zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni dngos po'i mthu stobs kyis 'byung ba ma yin zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i rnam par 'grel pa ni de dag ni dmigs pa'i stobs kyis 'byung ba yang ma yin te zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin no //
translated: The explanation of the phrase ‚Äúit is not the case that they arise by the power of things‚Äù and so on is ‚Äúit is not the case that they arise by the power of their objects.‚Äù

original: glo bur min zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i rnam par 'grel pa ni skye ba'i rgyu med pa'am zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin no //
analyzed: glo bur min zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i rnam par 'grel pa ni skye ba'i rgyu med pa'am zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin no //
translated: The explanation of the phrase ‚Äúthey are not adventitious‚Äù and so on is ‚Äúthey do not arise without a cause.‚Äù

original: shes pa yod pa rtag ces khas len pa ni rgyal dpog pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: shes pa yod pa rtag ces khas len pa ni rgyal dpog pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The assertion that consciousness exists and is permanent is that of the LokƒÅyatas.

original: rgyu la mi ltos pa ni rgyu med par smra ba rnams kyi lta ba'o //
analyzed: rgyu la mi ltos pa ni rgyu med par smra ba rnams kyi lta ba'o //
translated: The view that it does not depend on a cause is that of the Nihilists.

original: gang dag la rtag tu nye bar gnas pa'i rgyu dang rang bzhin yod pa zhes bya bar tshig rnam par sbyar te /
analyzed: gang dag la rtag tu nye bar gnas pa'i rgyu dang rang bzhin yod pa zhes bya bar tshig rnam par sbyar te /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthat which always exists‚Äù should be supplied to each of the above terms.

original: 'di ni go rims bzhin du rgyu med rtag pa nyid du smra ba rnams dang shes pa yod pa rtag par smra ba rnams kyi lta ba bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni go rims bzhin du rgyu med rtag pa nyid du smra ba rnams dang shes pa yod pa rtag par smra ba rnams kyi lta ba bstan pa yin no //
translated: These two views, respectively, are those of the proponents of causelessness and of the proponents of the eternal nature of consciousness.

original: 'o na ma 'ongs pa'i skye ba ji ltar 'grub snyam pa la /
analyzed: 'o na ma 'ongs pa'i skye ba ji ltar 'grub snyam pa la /
translated: If the cause of future existence is consciousness, how can future birth be established?

original: 'dis ni ma 'ongs pa'i srid pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: 'dis ni ma 'ongs pa'i srid pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: In response to this question, the root text states, ‚ÄúThis consciousness is the cause of future existence.‚Äù

original: 'dis ni zhes bya ba ni sems gzhan gyi rgyu nyid ni phyin ci log gi bag chags dang rjes su 'brel pa'i sems tsam yin par bstan pa ste ;
analyzed: 'dis ni zhes bya ba ni sems gzhan gyi rgyu nyid ni phyin ci log gi bag chags dang rjes su 'brel pa'i sems tsam yin par bstan pa ste ;
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthis consciousness‚Äù refers to the mere mind that is associated with the habitual tendencies of error and is the cause of another mind.

original: ma 'ongs pa rgyu ma tshang ba med pa yang skye bar rjes su dpag go //
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa rgyu ma tshang ba med pa yang skye bar rjes su dpag go //
translated: The existence of future birth is inferred from the fact that the cause of future existence is not incomplete.

original: 'di ltar zhes bya ba ni tshad ma ston par byed do //
analyzed: 'di ltar zhes bya ba ni tshad ma ston par byed do //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúin this way‚Äù indicates that this is a valid form of reasoning.

original: 'di ni don tsam ston par zad kyi /
analyzed: 'di ni don tsam ston par zad kyi /
translated: The above statement merely presents the meaning of the syllogism.

original: sbyor ba ni 'di ltar bya ste /
analyzed: sbyor ba ni 'di ltar bya ste /
translated: The syllogism itself should be stated as follows:

original: bdag dang bdag gir chags pa phyin ci log gi bag chags dang 'brel ba'i sems gang yin pa de ni sems gzhan gyis mtshams sbyor bar nus te /
analyzed: bdag dang bdag gir chags pa phyin ci log gi bag chags dang 'brel ba'i sems gang yin pa de ni sems gzhan gyis mtshams sbyor bar nus te /
translated: The mind that is associated with the instinct for error, attachment to ‚ÄúI‚Äù and ‚Äúmine,‚Äù is capable of linking up with another mind.

original: dper na sngon gyi gnas skabs na nyal po byed pa la sogs pa'i sems lta bu yin no //
analyzed: dper na sngon gyi gnas skabs na nyal po byed pa la sogs pa'i sems lta bu yin no //
translated: For example, it is like the mind that engages in sexual intercourse in a dream.

original: mi 'dod chags dang ma bral ba'i 'chi ka ma'i sems kyang de dang 'dra bas rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs yin no //
analyzed: mi 'dod chags dang ma bral ba'i 'chi ka ma'i sems kyang de dang 'dra bas rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs yin no //
translated: The mind at the death moment of one who is not free from attachment is similar to that, so this is a natural reason.

original: gtan tshigs ma grub pa nyid kyang ma yin te /üîΩ'dod chags dang bcas @125a * //
analyzed: gtan tshigs ma grub pa nyid kyang ma yin te / 'dod chags dang bcas @125a * //
translated: Nor is the reason unestablished.

original: ba'i 'chi ka ma'i sems gnyen po med pa phyogs su byas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ba'i 'chi ka ma'i sems gnyen po med pa phyogs su byas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the mind at the death moment of one with attachment is posited as the subject devoid of antidote.

original: rgyu gzhan bkag pas rgyu'i rgyu ma tshang ba med pa nyid 'di tsam du zad par grub pa'i phyir ma nges pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: rgyu gzhan bkag pas rgyu'i rgyu ma tshang ba med pa nyid 'di tsam du zad par grub pa'i phyir ma nges pa yang ma yin te /
translated: Nor is it indefinite, because it is established that the mere absence of a cause is the non-exhaustion of the cause.

original: de lta bu la yang mi skye na /
analyzed: de lta bu la yang mi skye na /
translated: If it does not arise in that way,

original: de'i rgyu ma yin pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i rgyu ma yin pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: then it follows that it is not the cause of that.

original: mthun pa'i phyogs la yod pas 'gal ba yang ma yin pas ma 'ongs pa'i skye ba yang grub po //
analyzed: mthun pa'i phyogs la yod pas 'gal ba yang ma yin pas ma 'ongs pa'i skye ba yang grub po //
translated: Since it exists in a compatible state, it is not contradictory. Therefore, future arising is also established.

original: de nyid kyi phyir kun rdzob tu yang rtag pa dang / chad pa med par yang 'grub bo zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
