analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir kun rdzob tu yang rtag pa dang / chad pa med par yang 'grub bo zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate that, on the basis of this, one also establishes the absence of eternalism and nihilism even in the conventional sense, he says:

original: de phyir rtag chad lta ba rnams //
analyzed: de phyir rtag chad lta ba rnams //
translated: Therefore, the views of eternalism and nihilism

original: zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: are not tenable.

original: dngos po thams cad skad cig snga ma ldog ste /
analyzed: dngos po thams cad skad cig snga ma ldog ste /
translated: Since all entities cease in the previous moment,

original: de'i phyir rtag par lta ba yang ma yin la /
analyzed: de'i phyir rtag par lta ba yang ma yin la /
translated: therefore, the view of eternalism is not tenable.

original: skad cig gzhan dang gzhan rjes su 'gro ba ste skye ba'i phyir chad par lta ba yang ma yin no //
analyzed: skad cig gzhan dang gzhan rjes su 'gro ba ste skye ba'i phyir chad par lta ba yang ma yin no //
translated: Since they are followed by other and other moments, i.e., since they arise, the view of nihilism is not tenable.

original: de nyid ni dngos po la brten pa yin pas zhes bya ba ni rtag pa dang chad pa dag ste /
analyzed: de nyid ni dngos po la brten pa yin pas zhes bya ba ni rtag pa dang chad pa dag ste /
translated: Since this is the case, the views of eternalism and nihilismüîΩare not tenable.

original: 'di ltar dngos po rtag tu yod par mngon par zhen pa 'di ni rtag par lta ba yin la /
analyzed: 'di ltar dngos po rtag tu yod par mngon par zhen pa 'di ni rtag par lta ba yin la /
translated: Thus, the adherence to the eternal existence of entities is the view of eternalism.

original: de nyid ldog par mngon par zhen pa'i phyir chad par lta ba yin pas de gnyis ni dngos po la brten pa yin no //
analyzed: de nyid ldog par mngon par zhen pa'i phyir chad par lta ba yin pas de gnyis ni dngos po la brten pa yin no //
translated: Since one is attached to the reversal of that, one has the view of annihilation. Thus, these two views are based on entities.

original: 'di ni rnam par 'grel ba tsam du zad kyi /
analyzed: 'di ni rnam par 'grel ba tsam du zad kyi /
translated: This is merely an explanation.

original: skye ba ldog pa dang rjes su 'gro ba dag gis kyang rtag pa dang chad pa dag mi srid par sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: skye ba ldog pa dang rjes su 'gro ba dag gis kyang rtag pa dang chad pa dag mi srid par sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: One should also apply the impossibility of eternalism and annihilationism to the reversal and the subsequent occurrence of origination.

original: 'dir gsungs pa zhes bya ba ni sngon gyi slob dpon rnams kyis so //
analyzed: 'dir gsungs pa zhes bya ba ni sngon gyi slob dpon rnams kyis so //
translated: Here, ‚Äúit is said‚Äù refers to the former masters.

original: gnyi gar 'gyur zhes bya ba ni rtag pa dang chad pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: gnyi gar 'gyur zhes bya ba ni rtag pa dang chad pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: ‚ÄúBoth‚Äù refers to the characteristics of eternalism and annihilationism.

original: yod na zhes bya ba ni don dam par yod pas phyis med par 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yod na zhes bya ba ni don dam par yod pas phyis med par 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: ‚ÄúIf it exists‚Äù means that it is ultimately existent, because it is contradictory that it would not exist later.

original: 'di ni 'phags pa klu sgrub kyi zhal snga nas kyis gsungs so //
analyzed: 'di ni 'phags pa klu sgrub kyi zhal snga nas kyis gsungs so //
translated: This is stated by the venerable NƒÅgƒÅrjuna.

original: tshigs su bcad pa gnyis pa ni 'phags pa lha'i yin no //
analyzed: tshigs su bcad pa gnyis pa ni 'phags pa lha'i yin no //
translated: The second verse is by ƒÄryadeva.

original: lus dang ngag dang yid rnams kyis med pa pa'i chos spyod na med pa par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lus dang ngag dang yid rnams kyis med pa pa'i chos spyod na med pa par 'gyur ro //
translated: If one practices non-Dharma with body, speech, and mind, one becomes a nihilist.

original: kun rdzob tu yod par lta ba bzhin rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po yang khas len na /
analyzed: kun rdzob tu yod par lta ba bzhin rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po yang khas len na /
translated: If one accepts the existence of things as cause and effect, just as one accepts the view that they exist conventionally,

original: lus la sogs pa'i las byed pa yang mi 'gal na ji ltar med pa pa nyid yin zhes rin po che'i phreng ba las bstan pa'i tshigs su bcad pa 'dis ston par byed do //
analyzed: lus la sogs pa'i las byed pa yang mi 'gal na ji ltar med pa pa nyid yin zhes rin po che'i phreng ba las bstan pa'i tshigs su bcad pa 'dis ston par byed do //
translated: then it is not contradictory to perform the actions of body and so on. So how can one be an nihilist? This is taught by the verse from the Ratnavali.

original: de la kha cig na re 'jig rten pha rol la sogs pa med do zhes khas len pa ni dam bca' ba yin na /
analyzed: de la kha cig na re 'jig rten pha rol la sogs pa med do zhes khas len pa ni dam bca' ba yin na /
translated: Here, some say: ‚ÄúThe assertion that there is no other world and so on is a thesis.

original: de yang thams cad tha snyad du khas len pa rnams la med do //
analyzed: de yang thams cad tha snyad du khas len pa rnams la med do //
translated: But this does not exist for those who accept everything conventionally.

original: ji ste 'jig rten gyis brnyes kyis 'jigs pas khas len par mi byed do zhe na /
analyzed: ji ste 'jig rten gyis brnyes kyis 'jigs pas khas len par mi byed do zhe na /
translated: If one does not accept it out of fear of being ridiculed by the world,

original: 'o na ni de'i tshe lus kyis nyes par spyod @125b pa'i mtshan nyid kyi spyod par 'gyur ba zhig na /
analyzed: 'o na ni de'i tshe lus kyis nyes par spyod @125b pa'i mtshan nyid kyi spyod par 'gyur ba zhig na /
translated: then at that time one would be engaging in the conduct characterized by physical misconduct.

original: de yang tshangs par spyod pa la sogs pa spyod pa rnams la med do //
analyzed: de yang tshangs par spyod pa la sogs pa spyod pa rnams la med do //
translated: But this does not exist for those who engage in the conduct of pure action and so on.

original: gal te rnyed pa dang bkur sti chad kyis dogs pas de lta bu mi byed do zhe na /
analyzed: gal te rnyed pa dang bkur sti chad kyis dogs pas de lta bu mi byed do zhe na /
translated: If you say that you do not act in that way because you fear the loss of gain and honor,

original: 'o na ni sems yin grang na de lta bu'i sems ji snyed pa yang med do //
analyzed: 'o na ni sems yin grang na de lta bu'i sems ji snyed pa yang med do //
translated: then it is the mind that does not act in that way. But there is no such mind.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?

original: byang chub rten pa'i phyir te byang chub kyi ched du zhugs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: byang chub rten pa'i phyir te byang chub kyi ched du zhugs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Because it is based on enlightenment, i.e., because it is engaged in enlightenment.

original: des na don gyi stobs kyis med pa nyid du bsgrub par bya ba la /
analyzed: des na don gyi stobs kyis med pa nyid du bsgrub par bya ba la /
translated: Thus, in the proof of non-existence by the power of fact,

original: ji ltar gtan tshigs gang gis na 'di dag med par 'dod ces de skad du 'chad do //
analyzed: ji ltar gtan tshigs gang gis na 'di dag med par 'dod ces de skad du 'chad do //
translated: it is explained that the reason is ‚Äúbecause of the non-existence of that.‚Äù

original: yang na byang chub kyi phyir rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes la gnas pa rnams la yod par 'dzin pa log na yod par 'dzin pa sngon du 'gro ba can yin pa'i phyir med do zhes 'dzin pa 'di yang shugs kyis log pa'i phyir gang dag la
analyzed: yang na byang chub kyi phyir rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes la gnas pa rnams la yod par 'dzin pa log na yod par 'dzin pa sngon du 'gro ba can yin pa'i phyir med do zhes 'dzin pa 'di yang shugs kyis log pa'i phyir gang dag la
translated: Or else, if the non-conceptual intuition of those who abide in enlightenment for the sake of enlightenment is apprehended as existent, then this apprehension of non-existence is also reversed by implication, since the apprehension of existence precedes it.

original: dam 'cha' ba la sogs pa'i nyes pa ji skad bshad pa mi srid pa de dag ji ltar med par 'dod ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: dam 'cha' ba la sogs pa'i nyes pa ji skad bshad pa mi srid pa de dag ji ltar med par 'dod ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: How can you claim that the faults of making promises, etc., explained above are impossible?

original: rgyu de dang rkyen de dang gzhi des chad par lta bar yang mi ltung zhes bya ba ni rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po kun rdzob tu rnam par gnas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu de dang rkyen de dang gzhi des chad par lta bar yang mi ltung zhes bya ba ni rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po kun rdzob tu rnam par gnas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: ‚ÄúBy that cause, by that condition, by that reason, one does not fall into the view of annihilation‚Äù because the fact of cause and effect is well established on the covering level.

original: rgyu de zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni rnam grangs yin no //
analyzed: rgyu de zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni rnam grangs yin no //
translated: ‚ÄúBy that cause,‚Äù etc., are synonyms.

original: gang la skye ba med pa la spyod pa'i ngang tshul yod pa zhes tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
analyzed: gang la skye ba med pa la spyod pa'i ngang tshul yod pa zhes tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
translated: ‚ÄúOne who has the nature of practicing non-production‚Äù is the analysis of the words.

original: rnam par grol ba la yang gzhung 'di la sla ba nyid de zhes bya ba ni dngos po la mngon par zhen pa yod na /
analyzed: rnam par grol ba la yang gzhung 'di la sla ba nyid de zhes bya ba ni dngos po la mngon par zhen pa yod na /
translated: ‚ÄúLiberation is also easy in this system‚Äù means that if one has attachment to things, one will not be liberated.

original: res 'ga' kun nas nyon mongs pa 'byung ba'i phyir dngos por 'dzin pa log na gang gis na grol bar mi 'gyur ba dngos por 'dzin pa'i rtsa ba can kun nas nyon mongs pa lta zhig ga la yod snyam du bsams pa'o //
analyzed: res 'ga' kun nas nyon mongs pa 'byung ba'i phyir dngos por 'dzin pa log na gang gis na grol bar mi 'gyur ba dngos por 'dzin pa'i rtsa ba can kun nas nyon mongs pa lta zhig ga la yod snyam du bsams pa'o //
translated: Sometimes, because of the arising of defilement, when one turns away from the apprehension of entity, how could there be any defilement whatsoever that has the root of the apprehension of entity, by means of which one would not be liberated?

original: gang chags pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: gang chags pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: As for ‚Äúwhatever attachment,‚Äù and so on,

original: gang la zhes bya ba ni dmigs pa la'o //
analyzed: gang la zhes bya ba ni dmigs pa la'o //
translated: ‚Äúwhatever‚Äù refers to the object.

original: gang gis zhes bya ba ni sdug pa'i mtshan mas so //
analyzed: gang gis zhes bya ba ni sdug pa'i mtshan mas so //
translated: ‚ÄúBy whatever‚Äù refers to the signs of beauty.

original: 'dir yang gsungs zhes bya ba ni 'phags pa klu sgrub kyis te 'di ni rigs pa drug cu pa las gsungs so //
analyzed: 'dir yang gsungs zhes bya ba ni 'phags pa klu sgrub kyis te 'di ni rigs pa drug cu pa las gsungs so //
translated: Here, it is also said by the noble NƒÅgƒÅrjuna. This is stated in the Yukti·π£a·π£·π≠ikƒÅ.

original: ci'i phyir dngos por khas len pa yod na 'dod chags la sogs pa skyon rnams 'byung bar 'gyur snyam pa la /üîΩ'di ni lta ba kun gyi rgyu //
analyzed: ci'i phyir dngos por khas len pa yod na 'dod chags la sogs pa skyon rnams 'byung bar 'gyur snyam pa la / 'di ni lta ba kun gyi rgyu //
translated: Why, when one accepts entity, do faults such as attachment arise?

original: zhes bya ba smos te /üîΩde zhes bya ba ni dngos por khas len pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba smos te / de zhes bya ba ni dngos por khas len pa'o //
translated: It is said, ‚ÄúThis is the cause of all views.‚ÄùüîΩ‚ÄúThis‚Äù refers to the acceptance of entity.

original: de ni zhes bya ba ni dngos po'o //
analyzed: de ni zhes bya ba ni dngos po'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThat‚Äù refers to entity.

original: yongs shes na zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin med par ro //
analyzed: yongs shes na zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin med par ro //
translated: ‚ÄúIf it is fully understood‚Äù means that it is understood to be essenceless.

original: de zhes bya ba ni dngos po'o //üîΩji ltar na rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba bstan @126a * //
analyzed: de zhes bya ba ni dngos po'o // ji ltar na rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba bstan @126a * //
translated: ‚ÄúThat‚Äù refers to things.

original: pas rang bzhin med par rtogs par 'gyur snyam pa la /
analyzed: pas rang bzhin med par rtogs par 'gyur snyam pa la /
translated: How does the teaching of dependent origination lead to the understanding of essencelessness?

original: brten nas skyes pa zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: brten nas skyes pa zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: In response, [NƒÅgƒÅrjuna] says, ‚ÄúThat which arises in dependence on . . .‚Äù

original: ma skyes zhes bya ba ni don dam par zhes bya ba lhag ma yin te /
analyzed: ma skyes zhes bya ba ni don dam par zhes bya ba lhag ma yin te /
translated: ‚ÄúIt is not arisen‚Äù means that it is not ultimately arisen.
